Это уже культ, некоторый эталон IPA. Не самое хмельное, не самое горькое, но очень сбалансированное.

On tap. Cloudy yellow colour with medium lasting white head. Aroma: Fruity, pine and soft citrus notes. Taste: Has a balanced malty/fruity start with a decent hoppy/bitter mouthfeel. Medium body with fizzy carbonation. Lasting bitter finish.

Off white frothy head stayed on a hazy dark golden body.
Hops, grapefruit & pith aroma.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation & a clean back.
Bitter citrus, grapefruit, sweet citrus & a hoppy finish.

Bottle. Pours clear gold with a white head. Aroma of lemon,lychee,grass,pine and sulphur . Taste of lychee,grass,light biscuit & sulphur . Light bodied ,the finish is sweetish with a little lychee & biscuit & not much else . Nasty rip off ipa !!! !
plechovka z onlineshopu vdaka petovi. vona jemna horkastocitrusova. medova farba. chut horkasta vyrazna miernedrevita. na konci ostava. skvele
Vycap craftbeer. Vona citrusova. Farba zlatista. Chut taktiez citrusova. Jemne horkasta.

De lo mejor que e probado de Escocia 
Una Ipa no demasiado fuerte  pero con un sabor espectacular

If I'm in a strange town, with no time to suss the beer scene, and see a Brewdog pub, it's a relief because I know I can go in and have a pint of this. I like to vary my drinks, but this is getting close to a standby drink for me. It is quite highly carbonated, so that it reminds of some of the old keg beers of the past, though I'm sure it is far superior (no wish to go back to those times). That carbonation is very welcome when you have been working and want a beer that feels as if it is pepping you up. Punk IPA has quite a standard pale ale taste, with an extra citrusy hoppy buzz to it, but nothing too demanding. For me, a highly satisfying pint that you don't have to think too much about.

5/18 Bottle. Hazy Amber color, White head. Citrusy aroma. Hoppy, citrusy, pineapple and grapefruit taste.

9/20  330 ml bottle. Pours hazy deep golden with small head. A: Bold, oranges, watermelon, citrusy, T: higher carbonated, medium body, background bready malt, citrusy, forward herbal and floral hops, bitter finish
light citrus aromas. gold and crystal clear in color with huge long lasting head. taste is of moderate citrus including grapefruit, tangerine, and lime. light pine, and faint resin notes.

Fra fat på Mi2 Cardinal april-18: lett uklar gylden med fint skum som varer. Frisk, balansert og fruktig med stor munnfylde. Kompleks smak takket være den omfattende humlekomboen som er brukt - citrus, furunål, tropiske frukter, appelsiner osv. Lekker, og med tørr bitterhet i avslutningen.

On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy light amber with off-white head. Aroma of citrus, pine needles, some notes of tropical fruits, some notes of pine needles. Tastes bitter with some sweetness Thin to medium bodied, bitter finish.
Genial, excelente cerveza de color dorado. Sabor espectacular y estética perfecta.
Goldgelb mit leichter Krone. Duft nach Citrusfrüchten mit etwas Banane. Gutes fruchtiges IPA.
Bottle. Hazy yellow with an off white head. Hoppy citrussy aroma with notes of pineapple and grain. Fresh, fruity sweet with a decent bitter finish.

(bottle 0,33l from BrewDog online) Overall: Very nice hoppy. Well balanced taste.

Aroma: Strong hoppy, light grapefruit, tropical fruits.

Appearance: Clear golden color. Medium, white head.

Taste: Medium sweet, malty, medium bitter, hoppy, grapefruit, tropical fruits.

Palate: Medium body. Bitter finish.

The smell is hoppy, Floral , citrucy,
The taste is hoppy but with  bitter at the end, it's a good one witch I'm buying often because avaible almost cold in a small location near me, but it's not my favorite IPA,  a little too bitter for me , but again very decent one

Bouteille 33 cl. Couleur orange clair, avec un léger voile diffus. Bulles fines qui remontent en colonnes. Mousse blanche nappante à 1 mm. 

Arômes de houblon fleuri et d'agrumes, fruits exotiques, notamment ananas. En bouche, on retrouve des notes de houblon, d'ananas, et de citron vert, notes herbeuses. Globalement, elle est bonne mais assez légère, acqueuse, on est dans de la bière de soif. Arrière-bouche à l’amertume harmonieuse mais discrète. J'apprécie cette IPA sans prétention mais maîtrisée, pour du tout-venant ils savent brasser ces Brewdogs!

Solides, klassisches, wenn auch eindimensionales IPA. Primär wurde offensichtlich der Schwerpunkt auf die wertige, wenn auch andere Aromen erdrückend deutliche Bitternote gelegt. Leider ein Stück zu dominant.

330ml dark bottle, filtered, from Tesco. Same name as the classic Punk IPA, but a very different beer. Hardly anything in common. I found the 2007 Punk IPA way too hot and burning for me, but the 2009 version was very drinkable and gradually got my attention. I don't know if BrewDog had started to soften the beer by 2009, becoming more commercial, and then completed that move in 2010 with this very soft version, or if I just had a bad moment in 2007, or had by 2009 become more accustomed to aggressive hops. Anyway, I ended up liking Punk IPA, and what I liked wasn't this. The malt here is quite flabby and a bit like vegetable water. The hops, for me, are a mish-mash. Smells like veg and plastic and watery cheap marmalade and flowers and raw bread dough and smoked haddock. Gee - yep - those hops throw up a smell, but it simple doesn't meld together for me - mostly what I'm getting is unpleasant. I don't mean lambic or real cider unpleasant, which is also astonishingly compelling and attractive, this is simply off, dull, wrong unpleasant. Each to their own, but this is not for me.

White weak head. Light amber colour.  Aroma is hoppy, fruity (pineapple, tangerine grapefruit) and resinous notes. Flavor is hoppy too with tropical fruits tones, ending in a bitter finish. Light to medium bodied.

Fresh, on the fruity side but just enough body and bitterness to round off a mouthful in style. Best from the bottle but great on draught although some places (JDW) serve it up too cold. Seems to be stronger than it says.

A self-proclaimed classic, and a landmark in the UK’s slow conversion to craft beer. Beautiful gold colour, thinning head. Interesting aroma, with citrus fruits not normally associated with beer to the fore. This carries through in the taste. This is either exciting in the nature and range of flavours available, or too fizzy, lacking balance and hence one dimensional. Try it and decide.

leaves, pale, clear, minimal head, thin feel, flat, astringent.

My friend like its smell but hate the bitter taste. It's like drink some Chinese herb medicine.

I am not fun of IPA but in this version, I am starting to love both IPA and a punk. It is really nice and light in taste beer. With its low IBU and light colour, it is close to typical lager but with a complexity of classical IPA. Truly interesting beer...

12 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 7/28/2017. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy deep golden amber color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of tangerine, lemon, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, white grape, passion fruit, mango, melon, berry, citrus peel/rind, light pepper, pine, light caramel, toasted biscuit, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance and complexity of citrus/fruity/earthy hops and moderate bready malt notes; with solid strength. Taste of tangerine, lemon, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, white grape, passion fruit, mango, melon, berry, citrus peel/rind, light pepper, pine, light caramel, toasted biscuit, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate pine, citrus peel, herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of tangerine, lemon, grapefruit, peach, pear, pineapple, white grape, passion fruit, mango, melon, berry, citrus peel/rind, pepper, pine, toasted biscuit, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/fruity/earthy hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero lingering hop astringency after the finish. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy/sticky, and slightly resinous balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol for 5.6%. Overall this is a very good IPA. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/fruity/earthy hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and refreshing to drink with the mellowly bitter/drying finish, never aggressive. Nice balanced mix of juicy, vibrant, and dank/earthy hop complexity; nice bready malt backbone, mild residual sweetness. A very enjoyable offering.

Esta cerveza ha cambiado mucho desde que empecé a probarla. O mi paladar ha cambiado. Fue una de las cervezas, junto con la Tripel Karmeliet, que me hizo ganar interés en probar cosas nuevas. Por la Karmeliet siento una pasión especial y, creo que, objetiva. Con la Punk IPA no siento nada similar. No sé si la receta de la cerveza varió, si mi paladar varió o si en algún momento me autosugestioné y empecé a creer que la Punk IPA no merececía la pena. De color dorado, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de tres dedos de grosor y buena retención. Carbonatación media. Textura acuosa. Aroma a hierba húmeda, grano, cítricos, ligera fruta tropical. Se echa en falta más precisión en aroma y en boca y, desde luego, un mínimo de amargor o algo que interese al paladar. Es demasiado fácil como para entusiasmar.

Punk IPA...je ne suis pas certain que le nom soit bien choisi. Il s'agit pour sûr d'une IPA agréable mais de là à être Punk, il ne faut pas pousser. Côté houblon, BrewDog a sorti l'artillerie lourde : Chinook, Ahtanum, Amarillo, Cascade, Simcoe, Nelson Sauvin. Si le Nelson Sauvin ne se fait pas réellement ressentir, l'alliance de ces différents houblons est vraiment réussi avec une belle complexité. Que manque t il donc à cette bière? Des arômes un peu plus puissant, un final plus long et plus travaillé et un alcool un peu plus affirmé qui à 5,6 % Abv est un peu faible pour la structure de la bière (6,5 % serait plus adéquat je pense). En verre, blond doré soutenu parfaitement lipide (EBC aux environs de 23). L'effervescence est peu poussée (je l'apprécie légèrement plus soutenue) avec une quasi absence de mousse). Beau nez, à la fois fleur et fruité, contenant des agrumes, des fruits exotiques, du miel et une pointe de résineux. L'attaque est fraîche, convenablement houblonnée sur des arômes agréable de pêche, d'agrumes de mangue et de miel. Belle progression en seconde bouche de l'amertume, bien dosée avec 35 d'IBU (ressenti identique) avec des arômes fins présentant du litchi, de la rose et du pamplemousse. L'arrière bouche, plus complexe, avec des fruits exotiques et des agrumes en complément manque cependant d'ampleur. 
La troisième bouche par contre est un peu plus profonde, sur les fruits exotiques, la mangue et la pêche, bien complétée par une point de résineux (subtile). Le final quant à lui est moins intéressant et trop court sur l'amertume et des arômes de pamplemousse. Gentils le punk tout de même

Bottle of 33cl, in a Tulip glass; from the fridge.

Visual: (cellared for 2 years). Pours almost clear marmalade orange, not much head, a half layer of micro retention, scattered loose streams.



Nose: toffee biscuity barley malt, hints of hops. (lvl-5)-pungency



Attack: medium crisp, dull CO2,



Mid-palate: (lvl-4-sweetness), sligtht tingly, light grainy-light biscuity barley malt, gentle stealth orange citrus notes,



Finish: super stealth soft hop bitter, grainy barley exhale



Summary: Very smooth without much lingering hop bitterness unlike North American IPAs. It seems to lack punch and depth characteristic of the other Brewdog brews I've had. Perhaps its due to the 2 year cellaring.

BB June 2017 (over 14 months old). Bought 13 cans for cheap, most were gross but there were 4 decent ones to review.
Appearance: Hazy golden. Quickly dissapitating head, almost lifeless.
Aroma: Tropical fruit, caramel, oxidation (as overripe cardboard fruit). 
Taste: Tropical/citrus fruitiness and sweetness, then lasting pale malt. Moderate bitterness. 
Palate: Low carbonation (good), viscous body.

seems to catch a lot of flak these days off beer hipsters. yeah, i get it - brewdog is going mainstream in the UK but there is no need to turn your back on this brew. for a lot of my friends, punk IPA introduced them to a whole new world of craft ale, and "gateway" brews like this should be encouraged, not demonized. the first time i tried this in 2008 i hated it... came back a few years later and tried again - the rest is history, as they say. fantastic brew with a trademark explosion of hops and citrus notes. there really is nothing else quite like a punk IPA (well, except maybe a few other brewdog beers...). cannot forget long summer nights with bags of these chilling in iced water, or taking my dad into a brewdog bar for a pint of it, or even having a can of this on an easyjet flight to amsterdam! yes, it is everywhere, but who cares!??

Belle couleur or claire avec des reflets très légèrement cuivrés et une mousse fine blanc cassé. Le nez est une ode aux houblons avec pas moins de 6 variétés qui nous donnent un bouquet superbe de fleurs et de fruits (rose, litchi, jasmin, bergamote, thé, violette, orange, pamplemousse, citron vert...) et nous donne aussi de belles notes de malts blonds avec leur charge de caramel, de céréales, de noix et de miel. En bouche, texture souple presque soyeuse qui fait honneur aux sucres résiduels, assez nombreux et surprenants sur ce produit. L’alcool est probant avec ses 5.6% et soutient bien les arômes. La carbonatation est sobre, les levures très douces avec de belles petites notes boisées et terreuses tandis que l’amertume, très American IPA dans l’esprit, est assez douce avec une belle longueur. Le final va s’orienter sur les notes de noix, de céréales et de végétaux tandis que les sucres continuent d’œuvrer et d’apporter une grande douceur, peut être même un peu trop pour s’arroger le terme Punk qui laissait augurer un peu plus de sauvagerie à la manière d’un Beat The Bastards de The Exploited (et non de ces bouffons édulcorés des Sex Pistols qui sont au Punk ce que le skaï est au cuir, mais je m’égare, je m’égare...). Une bonne IPA, consensuelle, très aromatisée, d’une belle élégance et très féminine. Elle manque juste un peu de punch et son nom est un peu un trompe l’œil dans le but de flatter le consommateur moyen qui veut s’encanailler (étant donné qu’on trouve même des packs de ce breuvage en grandes surfaces). Cela reste une excellente bière comme sait si bien les faire BrewDog... Bouteille 33cl, Boissons du Monde, Saint-Egrève.

W aromacie zdecydowanie cytrusowo-trawiaste, poza tym trochę lasu, w smaku dość wyraźnie słodowe, choć i chmiel nadal obecny, bez fajerwerków, takie dość proste i jednowymiarowe piwo. Do pubu, do wypicia bez wąchania szkła przez godzinę - jak znalazł.

From the tap at The Roundabout, Plymouth. 

Aroma: Smells great! Pine-y, citrus-y goodness... Just what you’d expect from an IPA. 
Appearance: Decent. A bright white head of about an inch that fades to a constant head throughout; A fairly substantial lacing of foam coats the glass. Marked down here because the body was slightly more cloudy than previous pints, and the carbonation seemed lacking. 
Taste: Follows through on the aroma, with pine and citrus flavours abundant, plus a nice whack of hops. Blew my mind on first taste circa 2010, hence the high score. 
Palate: Perhaps not the best pour as the pint seemed lacking in carbonation and ’depth’. Passable. 
Overall: Brewdog Punk IPA was one of my favourite beers when I was new to the Craft movement, and it’s still my go-to supermarket beer if in doubt, but other beers have since surpassed it. A great choice if you’re new to craft beer!

Explosion de saveurs fruités (passion, pêche, agrumes ...) qui s’accorde parfaitement avec l’amertume propre aux IPA. Ce cocktail étonnant se maintient parfaitement en bouche et reste très équilibré. Douce au palais. Robe dorée trouble, sans mousse.

This IPA poured a medium yellow colour with a bright white, soapy head. Minimal lacing. Scents include cooked veggies, hay and a little honey. First swig was delicious with a slightly thin mouthfeel. Flavours of citrus hops and honey. Finish is a little bitter with those hops lingering on.

Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Perfectly decent IPA. Nothing particularly exciting or noteworthy. Perhaps been overtaken by more and more breweries to fade this into the background. Quite refreshing and not overly bitter. Would drink again, gladly, but in no rush to.

Hazy, golden colour in the glass with a short, white head. Toasty malt on the nose with a hint of hint of tropical fruit. Similar story in the taste - unusually malt/hop balanced for an IPA with not much hop bite or bitterness at all. Medium carbonation.
Bottle from Tesco Portobello. Good, solid IPA. Hoppy, fruity and well balanced flavors.

Goud kleurig bier met een witte schuimkraag.

Aroma: wit brood, fruitig, wat zeepsop en wat dennen.

Smaak: wit brood, fruitig, gist en een bittere afdronk.

Now this is nice! Smells like lychee from the can, and initial taste of fruit before it settles into a caramel honey midseason with a nice sharp end.... Very well balanced. Lovely carbonation (almost creamy), and a nice head and clear body (not that I mind haze!).. very very good..
Postmodern? No. Punk? Definitely no. But this is the reason lots of people drink craft beer now. So that’s good. The beer is perfectly fine.
660 ml bottle. Pours a clear golden with a modest white head. Strong and wonderful aroma of citrus and passion fruit. Taste is a little weak with a low bitterness and a short aftertaste. Lovely IPA.

Zeltaina krāsa, nenoturīgas putas. Aromāts viegli citrusīgs un ar tropiskajiem augļiem. Garšā arī citrusi un tropikāņi. Kaut gan jāatzīst, ka aromāts un garša ir diezgan neizteikti - varbūt gadījies kāds vecāks eksemplārs.
Possibly a pretty old bottle as the hops don’t seem too prominent for an IPA. Other than that, tropical fruits.
Flot lyseorange ale. Duft af citrusfrugt, passionsfrugt, humle og en anelse krydderig. Dejlig frisk med frugtige noter af citrusfrugt og med en god sødme.

S: Passion fruit, citrus, hops A: orange, clear, creamy head T: med/high bitterness, low sweetness P: refreshing 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not much aroma, looks like an IPA does. Not very tasteful, but I can’t complain about anything. Basically an everyday IPA.

From tap, can, bottle, more than one time. Last time 330 ml can from Tesco, London, UK. Colour is clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is peach, citrus, orange zest, tangerine, malts, grass, hops. Medium sweetness and light bitterness. Body is medium with soft carbonation. Must drink when in UK. Easy available in almost every supermarket and in most of pubs.
Canned. A bloody good IPA! Lovely clean golden colour, nice white head. Good body, packed with citrus/malty flavours, long lingering finish...I like it!

Bottle, pours clear golden with high but fast falling head. Well balanced malt and hop aroma with toast, hay, grass, tropical fruits and resin. Taste with light sweetness and high, long lasting but not overhelming bitterness. Body could be slightly fuller but all in all a good IPA.
Goldgelb, intensiv nach Zitrusatomen riechend, Mandarine, Grapefruit, im Geschmack bitter, aber genau richtig.

Poured from a can. Nice head and average foam retention. Golden in color, nice malt aroma and caramel taste in mouth. Good bitterness for an IPA. Citrus aftertaste is discernable. Very well balanced body.

Novembre 2017: 4.1
Ibu de 35 en fait, malt extra pale, houblons chinook ahtanum amarillo cascade simcoe nelson sauvin.
Belle couleur, nez très fruité, gout très fruité, assez légère, belle amerture, très belle ipa!
Aout 2020 : 4.1
Encore très bonne.

Pours golden orange from the bottle and leaves a moderate, foamy head. Aroma is maracuja, mandarine, mango. Taste is bittersweet with a tart note, with the bitter tones increasingly dominant as we move into the finish. The body stays fairly light, but (just!) keeps itself above from any watery notes. A pleasant diversion.
33cl bottle purchased @ Casino. Un grand classique de chez Brewdog. L’amertume est parfaitement équilibrée, avec une bonne longueur.

Can. Dark golden coloured with a shade of orange. Beautiful head. Aroma of tropical and citrus fruits. Piney. Taste follows aroma plus mangos, grapefruits and a little bit of honey. Fruit juice. Bitter hoppy finish. Balanced. Medium carbonation. Refreshing and super süffig. Very nice.
Ez egy remek ivósör. De nem is ez a lényeg, hanem az, hogy dobozos kivitelben kapható az EasyJet fedélzetén! (2017. március végén saját magam tapasztaltam). Yuppijé!!! :)

Very good beer, reasonable level of alcohol (you may have more than one in a good/sunny day!) medium sweetness and bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish. A very enjoyable beer.

Berlin, BrewdogPub, kran. Ar: Swiezo, chmielowo, ameryka, doskonala lesna zywicznosc, sosna, bardzo swiezo i soczyscie. Wzorowo. Wyg. Raczej przejrzyste, ladne zolto-zlote, swietna drobnoziarnista piana, swietny lacing. Sm: Swietna ipa, bardzo intensywny chmiel, ameryka, swiezo, bardzo soczyscie, solidna bardzo przyjemna goryczka chmielowa, dluga. Cudowna lesna zywicznosc, wysycenie raczej niskie. Pos: intensywna, mila chmielowa goryczka, dluga, ale nie zalegajaca. Ov: doskonala ipa, im bardziej rozgrzana tym lepsza.

Bottle from Pezinská pivná pumpa. 
Classics. My favorite piece from Brewdog. Looks good, great aroma full of citruses. Very refreshing, so you have to pay attention to number of bottles you drink. It’s also very easy drinking. Maybe a grapefruit in it? Still it remains at low levels same as the bitterness. Still I like.
One of the better IPA I ever drink. To low biterness but ohter factors are really good.

Bottle 0.33L.
Hazy, deep golden-to-amber body with an average, frothy, off-white head, mostly diminishing with some lacing, though.
Moderate-to-heavy hoppy (grapefruit, flowers) and light malty (caramel) aroma with fruity notes.
Moderate-to-heavy bitter and light sweet flavour; average-to-long-lasting bitter finish.
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.
floral, herbs, citrus-y aroma, highly aromatic, pale, clear, minimal or lacking head, medium to medium heavy bitterness, medium carbonation felt on tongue, no hop harshness, bitter finish,

Bière blonde dorée sans trop de mousse, très fruitée, un arôme de fruits exotiques, un goût assez prononcé sur le fruit, l’amertume que l’on garde au palais, on ne sent pas trop l’alcool, une bonne bière d?une bonne brasserie, hâte de goûter les autres produits de la brasserie

Jasno złote piwo z ładną pianą. Aromat cytrusów i tropików- wyraźny i zachęcający do spróbowania. Smak lekko słodowy z szybką kontrą goryczkową, fajnie skomponowaną, niezbyt agresywną, ale konkretną i utrzymującą się. Dobra IPA.

Bottle 0.33
Вкусно, в меру горько - хороший баланс. Но нет эффекта "вау"
à la maison . La référence IPA pour moi , délicate , aromatisée sans tomber dans l’excès, une merveille.

33 cl. bottle (purchased from Zero Cafe Bar, Kos). Slightly hazy golden-coloured with a very thin head. Good lacing though. Aroma is grapefruit, tropical fruits, citrus, some spices. Taste is superb. Very refreshing. Light to medium bitterness with citrus flavour (I was expecting a more bitter beer, but I like it better this way). Peach flavour gives sweetness. Body is medium, texture is super oily. Very smooth! A velvet touch. A bit watery though. Carbonation is quite lively. Finish is dry and somewhat bitter. Very enjoyable everyday drink.
Birra unica che si differenzia da tutte quelle del suo genere, aroma estremizzato dalla luppolatura, beverina e rinfrescante.
Clean fresh ipa. Nice bitterness with hoppy notes. Does the job perfectly, well done, cheers!!
Deliciosa IPA. Corpo médio, com alto sabor frutado. Não resinosa e de baixa carbonatação. Dentre as minhas Top 10.
Złote klarowne. Piana niezbyt trwała. Delikatne cytrusowe aromaty. W smaku dosyć wytrawne z umiarkowaną goryczką. Bardziej depesz inż Punk.
Botella de 33cl. Muy aromática, mango, frutas tropicales, Cuerpo medio, refrescante, frutal. Final amargo y seco, persistente.Una gran cerveza
Piana ładna, zbita. Fajny zapach, cytrusowy, słodki, taniniczny. W smaku wytrawne, ze słodkawa nuta, lekko cytrusowe, z fajna goryczka.

66cl bottle, slightly hazy, dar golden colour, average lacing and moderate whitehead. aroma of hoppines and floral accents, same in flavour, lacking more intense bitterness. carbonation on a good level

On tap at Craft Beer Gallery. Clear golden colour with thick white head, aroma of hops, citruses, raspberries, grass. Taste of grapefruit, peaches, bit sweet, low on bitterness, quite mild, light body, thin texture, short sweet finish. It is very drinkable, but not an amazing IPA.

Birra di colore giallo chiaro. Schiuma abbondante e persistente. All’olfatto sentori di frutta tropicale come ananas, mango, maracuja e lievemente erbacei Al palato corpo leggero con note di biscotto, caramello controbilanciato da sentori fruttati, finendo con l’amaro erbaceo e vegetale del luppolo. Una birra che rimane asciutta e pulita. Eccezionalmente beverina.
Lekko zmętnione, ciemnozłote, z obfitą białą pianą. W zapachu chmiele. W smaku mocno chmielowe, lekko karmelowe, kwiatowe i cytrusowe.

330ml bottle from Brewdog website Mystery Box. Pours light amber, fairly fizzing. Aroma more subtle than I remember - fresh hops and a little caramel. First mouthful is all about the carbonation - improves with a little time to air. Light of body with a touch of oiliness, good mouthfeel. A floral, fresh hoppy flavour passes to a reassuringly solid and lasting bitter finish, particularly once the fridge chill has been shaken off. Overall a little underwhelming and not quite moreish enough for a session beer, but as a gateway beer it does the job.

Bottle at Swan, Farnborough. Hadn’t had this for some time and it was less in yer face than I dismembered. Hazy sweet grapefruit aroma. Bright gold. Decent white head. Extremely bubbly. Medium bitter, which is a surprise, expected more. Grapefruit as expected but not strong. Some sweet caramel. Light bodied. However the palate is all about the carbonation, which dominates proceedings. Drinkable but quite tame?

Look: Very slightly hazy light gold.
Head: Sparkly and bubbly white head quickly dissipating.
Aroma/smell: Berries, esp raspberry, with some sweetness that I think is a bit too overwhelming and reminds me of the blueberry/raspberry jam that my mom used to make (drottningsylt). Some pine and grass/hops as well and notes of caramel. Smells pretty good.
Taste: again berry jam-like qualities which are a bit too sweet at first but quickly transcends to that perfect bitterness that made me love IPA:s. The aftertaste is bitter and dry and is still there for a good minute or two. The aforementioned overly sweet taste almost disappears completely after a few sips and is replaced by predominantly malty dry/medium sweetness. At this point it almost tastes like a dry hopped lager.
Mouthfeel: medium body, smooth, a bit tingling in the end.
Overall a great everyday beer.
Another clinically well made IPA. Very tasty and went very well with food. The hops are forward, but that is what you would expect from Brewdog. Nice mouthfeel.
0.33 can from Brewdog?s online shop.Almost no head, unless forced, gone in seconds. Clear, golden colour. Medium bitterness. Quite drinkable.

Butelka 0,33l. Średnio obfita, średniopęcherzykowa piana, klarowne złoto. Aromat bardzo przyjemny, cytrusowy, delikatnie żywiczny. Po ogrzaniu wychodzi jakaś średnio przyjemna nuta, coś w kierunku szmaty. W smaku chmiel, delikatna podbudowa słodowa. Goryczka umiarkowana.

Can’t believe that I never rated this one.
Well here it is and it’s good.
Tropical smell. Sweet palate with light bitter finish.
 Very drinkable, nice!

Light-ish orange-yellow with moderate white head. Aroma is mostly citrus hops with a little bit of pine. And taste is mostly pine with a little citrus. Go figure! Extremely sessionable, zesty, fresh IPA. Ultimate crowd pleaser, no too offensive with hops. I understand why this beer is so popular and widespread, a good sign for the future.

Bottle at home. Was actually shocked how good this is given how common it has become, a good sign I suppose. Hoppy, citrusy, not too bitter, yum. 
------
Rerated, can from systembolaget. One point down on appearance, otherwise same. Delightful floral flavours off the hops which feel fresh citrusy fresh and new whilst also displaying some age. Slight sherry aftertaste.
-----
Bottle from somewhere. This was super dissapointing. Does it really taste better in sweden? Or it really loses it over time as this was a wee bit out of date. 4.2 to 3.7 (22/12/18) 
----
Rerated on tap at the Bishops Arms Östersund. mixed hop aroma but a little flat. Bit of a messy ending - lots of milk, bit of macro. 3.7 to 3.4 (28/9/19)
------
Rerated at Ernestos Restaurant, kalmar. back to being great. lovely strong bitter grassy ending.  3.4 to 3.9. 
----

Butelka 0,33l, ważne do 10.2017.
Aromat średnio intensywny, trawiasto-cytrusowy. Piana średnia, kolor trochę ciemniejszego złota. W smaku wyczuwalne cytrusy, jakaś lekka żywiczność, mało ciała i wrażenie wodnistości. Jak na IPA mało goryczkowe. Ogólnie przyzwoite piwo, dobre na koncert w plenerze albo w trakcie przerwy podczas spacerów po lesie.
Labai kvapnus, gaivus spiniu ir vaisi? aromatas. Gera i?vaizda. ?velnaus, kiek saldaus kart?lio skonio.
Sárgaréz szín. Hihetetlen jó illat. Ízében a komló, grapefruit és némi virágos esszencia keveredik. Kiváló sör. Ha már tudsz ilyet főzni, akkor próbálkozz mással.
Dobra ipa, choć charakter chmielowy mógłby być mniej trawiasty, a bardziej w stronę owoców. Poza tym ok.

Mnogo sam više očekivao. Velika očekivanja su redovno veliki problem. Pivo je lagano, pivo je čisto i tanko... skoro lager. Sa brdom američkog citrusnog hmelja.

Rezultat je pivo koje da je čovjeku dovoljno para - možeš popiti u hektolitrima. 

Pivo je naravno iz flaše i starije je od godine dana. Obzirom na značaj svježine i datuma proizvodnje za pivo sa visokim sadržajem i uticajem hmelja - potražiću Punk IPA sa mladjim datumom. U ovom definitivno dominira aroma soka od zove. Citrusi tek u najavama.
Piana obfita, aromat cytrusowy, w smaku równie?, na ko?cu ?yka wyra?na, fajna goryczka.
Golden coloured beer with a medium white head . Aroma with notes of citrus and heavy cascade hops. Sweetish flavor, citrus and herbal hops. Bitter, herbal and very dry finish.

AIPA w klasycznym wydaniu. Bardzo przyjemny aromat, głównie cytrusy. W smaku podobnie cytrusowe nuty smakowe od amerykańskich chmieli. Koniecznie trzeba je pić jak najświeższe, bo wtedy pokazuje co ma do zaoferowania. Świetne piwo.
Keg. Fruity flavour in aroma and taste. Biterness short and medium. Nice IPA.
Well build IPA, very easy and soft on the palet. The consistency is very impressive.

Aromat bardzo czysty, wyraźnie cytrusowy, rześki, najmocniej czuć grapefruit i czerwoną pomarańczę, poza tym kwiaty, dzika róża. Barwa złota, piwo jest klarowne. Piana obfita, drobna, kolorem zachodząca lekko w szary. W smaku owoce, ponownie grapefruit i czerwona pomarańcza, gdzieś w tle lekko sosna. Goryczka zadowalająca, wyraźna dopiero przy 2-3 łyku, w goryczce tez czuć nuty cytrusowe. bardzo pijalne

I believe this to be the beer that started my passion for IPAs. Not my first IPA and not my current favourite, but it was my ’Gate-Way Beer’, and my standard of beers has not been the same since. Poured from a 33cl bottle at home. Pale amber-copper. Slightly hazy. Tropical fruit with passion fruit clearly dominating aroma and flavour with pineapple and other tropical fruits following and a nice pine tinge. Medium-low bitterness - balanced out by the fruity sweetness. Malt flavours kept to a minimum (a very balanced IPA - arguably a bad thing).  Carbonation is moderate and body is medium to medium-light. A great all rounder.

Bouteille 33 trouvée dans une grande surface wallonne: tiens les bières de style arrivent aussi dans le grand commerce. Sa couleur est jaune avec une mousse moyenne. Son nez est très axé sur les agrumes, les fruits exotiques. Son goût est typique d’une bonne IPA en rapport avec le fruit (par exemple : ananas), les houblons et l’essence de pin avec une belle amertume. Bonne.
helder zon gele kleur met ivoor witte plakkende bubbeltjes schuim een stevige zesty citrus geur en smaak van pompelmoes limoen en een vage hint perzik en een zuur droge nasmaak

Bottle. Pours light yellow and clear, lightly opalescent. Aroma is very good - hoppy, a lot of citrus and white fruits. Nice foam quickly reduces to a thin layer on the top.Beer has a strong fruity flavour with a note of grass. Biterness is short, medium to strong. Really good beer. Enjoy!

Bottle. A truly excellent beer. Pours a clear yellow with a medium sized frothy head. Smells are fresh and that of tropical fruit. Taste is pineapple and citrus, with a good balance between bitterness and sweetness. One of the best beers I have had!

Bought at bonpreu in Spain for 3.5€. Pours a orange golden color with small-medium head and little carbonation. The aroma is great, fresh and citrus. The body is medium-low. The taste is citrus, sweet and malt. The aftertaste has some bitterness and lasts a long time. A beer that I would love to drink again.

Clear golden beer, standard to low carbonation, with a small head, the aroma is quite fruity in fact some apple and orange notes are felt, the flavour is extremely hoppy which is expected for an IPA, but there is not too much from the malt flavours in here. The aftertaste is slightly bitter and persistent.

BrewDog Punk IPA (5.6%)
Brewed by BrewDog
Ellon, Aberdeenshire, Scotland 
5.6% India Pale Ale (IPA)

Just realised I’v never rated this, been drinking it for a year ! Imo this is much better out a can. Pours a slightly hazy, honey amber with a white head. Nose is tropical, pineapple, gooseberry, grapefruit and caramel. Medium mouth feel with slight carbonation. Taste is a perfect balance of sweet caramel malt, bit of grain and tropical fruit, mainly pineapple, grapefruit, mango and gooseberry. Bitter, but not crazy bitter like some Ipa’s. This is possibly my favourite all round beer of all time, certainly in the price range. Outstanding. Originally rated 1/23/2017 *4.8

It's been inconsistent for a while in it's appearance, clear like a lager sometimes and occasionally like it used to look. Still tastes good though. I've decided to change my rating
Clear amber - big white head. Fruity, nice hoppy nose, bitterness, zesty, medium malty, dryness, citrus, abricot, grassy, piney, grape fruits. Nice.

Pours clear gold with a moderate white head. Aroma is citrusy. Taste is sweet with some tropical fruit and bubblegum. Almost no bitterness. My first experience was when a friend bought a round of "brewdog" and I thought it was a hefeweizen. After the second tasting I’m still not sure how this is an IPA. It’s pretty tasty but not beery enough for me.
Overall a really great beer. This is my first taste of Brewdog that I intent to rectify.
Assez douce mais parfumée tout de même ! Moins forte que sa cousine la hardcore, elle se boit très bien !
Nearly clear golden with a small white head. Aroma and taste are light citrus. Not bitter at all. Easy to drink. Light feel and perfect carbonation.cooked vegetables,
The best ipa. Amazing golden colour, malty and fruity aroma, well balanced bitterness with tropical fruits and citrus taste. Must have beer!!

Bottle. Clear golden to orange colour, small white head. Piney-resiny aroma with light citrus. Light sweet taste of citrus, light to medium resiny bitterness. Light to medium body, thin texture, average carbonation. OK, but very light IPA.
drank quite a few of these in Korea. definitely a classic British IPA. it wasn’t bad tasting, but i don’t think it was ever quite fresh.
Bottle. Fruity, citrusy flavours with light malty body, moderate bitterness. Light and crisp with great drinkability. Very enjoyable brew.
Lahev, skvělé pivo, krásná barva, svěží chut.. Perfektní ipa asi těžce překonatená..
Bue un premier janvier... histoire de commencer l’année avec une spécialité. Robe jaune fade. Attaque un peu acide. Goût fruité et floral. Moyennement appréciée.

Bu au Brewdog café à Brussels.
Pression de 25cl.
Verre Brewdog.
Au nez : c’est fruitée , fruit tropical et le houblon frais !
explosion d’arômes au nez !
En bouche : l’amertume domine ! dans cette amertume ce cache des notes fruitées très intéressant type fruit tropical qui donne un peu de sucre , ananas et tout les fruit en grappe (raisin et aussi des baies comme des cranberry et des mures).
l’amertume donne un fin plutôt moelleuse au premier abord mais c’est juste l’apparence car c’est une fin sèche qui provoque ! 
à boire sans modération que du bon !
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Aroma is dank hops, tons of citrus and tropical fruits. Pours a clear deep gold with a thin dissipating head. Taste follows the nose, tropical fruits and pine and a reasonable dose of pleasant bitterness. Fairly carbonated. For me, this is fantastic for something you find on every shop corner. My go to beer.
Can from Manchester Airport. Banana and orange on the nose. Clear Amber pour with non-existent white head. Heavily carbonated, banana and citrus taste with mellow hoppy taste. Excellent IPA.
(can) hazy orange colour with a small beige head; aroma of fruit, jam; balanced, rather subdued flavour with a long, light bitter finish; average, on the ’session ipa’ side
Half pint at Southside Pub, Stockholm. Pleasant IPA, refreshing, not too hoppy.
Good taste!!! Aroma intensa a llúpol, una IPA a tenir en compte. No apta per a paladars delicats
Warm yellow orange with a medium head. Very fruity nose. Mango, grapefruit but also some earth and wooden notes. Mineral and dry fruity in the finish. Very enjoyable
A well balenced quite fruity IPA melts well into a nicely balanced sweet finish.
Bottle. Fantastic India Pale Ale. Much more than a swim in hoppy alcohol. Has round and fruity beginning and a sharp and bitter finish. Love it!

On tapped. Pours in golden yellow colour with medoim size white head. Intense aroma of spruce, grapefruit, mango. High bitterness, medium sweetness, no sourness. Light body, watery feel, medium lasting bitter aftertast.

On tap. Pours clear golden color with high white, mostly lasting head. Sweet aroma of tropical fruits, candies, malt. Flavor is medium sweet, light bitter. Finish is smooth and medium bitter. Balanced. Very light body, soft carbonation.

Tap @ BD Turku. Clear golden with pure white head. Fresh crisp nose of anise and fruit. Malty with anise, herbs, hay and fruit. A lovely balanced palate that’s just right. This keg is a bit old but the beer is one of my all-time go tos. A wonder I haven’t rated this before.

Butelka do 14.08.2017.
Wygląd jasnosłomkowe, średnio wysycone, piana średnia, szybko się redukująca. Aromat dojrzałych tropikalnych, owoców mango i ananasa. W odczuciu głównie mango, trochę jakby kwiatowe lecz wszystko to mało intensywne. Goryczka średnio-niska. Wysycenie jak dla mnie za wysokie. Poprawna, lecz niezbyt wyraźna ta session ipa.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.

Very nicely drinkable classic IPA with a lot of citrus and resin in both aroma and taste. The bitterness is medium.
A bit light for an IPA.. Very clear and pale not so tasty... Like a mix between classic brittish ale and actual ipa...
Aroma 8. Appearance 3. Taste 9. Palate 4. Overall 16. Bitter but fruity, a very good beer.

Pretty label on a 330ml can. Taste not really punk, more conventional summer pale ale but still very pleasant. Similar fashion to 4 Pines Indian Summer Ale, Australian Pale Ale, Mountain Goat Summer ale and Little Creatures Dog Days Summer beer, etc. Pours straw with a developing pineapple, peach fruit aroma. Pineapple dominates the initial melon and malt combination taste. Slight interesting malt background and a mild bitterness which lingers. A refreshing ale.

Strasznie przereklamowane piwo. Przyjemnie owocowe, sesyjne i dość mocno karmelowo-słodkie. Niska, dość tępa goryczka. Bardzo pijalne, ale to naprawdę nic specjalnego. Plusem jest ogromna dostępność na każdym kroku w Wielkiej Brytanii.
Gezapft bei BrewDog in Berlin. Gold, klar. Aroma Mango, Apfelsine, Holunder. Geschmack Mango, helle Weintraube, Grapefruit im Nachgang, fruchtig-bitter, angenehm
I love this beer. My go to after a long & hard night shift. Its not overly hoppy but still a good beer
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
Lekkere grapefruitneus. Mooi uitgebalanceerde IPA, met heel veel smaak en in verhouding weinig alcohol.
A surprising match between bitter and fruity taste. Usuall, I don’t like fruity taste. But this beer is really different. One of my favourite IPA. (And 5,6% makes you allowed to drink many bottles !)
Fresh and fruity without bring sour. Perfect balanced. For me, amongst the better choices of IPA. Thumbs up!
Very mild fruit smells, lovely but very mild taste, thin watery, juicy, mild but lovely hops. Pleasant but extra mild ipa, and it’s everywhere.
Ipa redonda, esta en mi top sin duda, suave, lupulada, redonda, exquisita, para tener una despensa repleta de esta maravilla que ademas gustará a casi todos los públicos.
Clear amber, small white head fastly diminishing. Peach and pineapple aroma. Bitterness of a grapefruit. Classic beer.

Aroma of super bright lychee, fruit pastels, tropical, fantastic. Very distinct aroma. Medium to low carbonation, medium to thin palette. Taste is a slightly muted version of aroma, clean straightforward malt, bright lychee tropical flavour, but doesnt linger ling and not overly bitter. Not dank or hop aggressive flavour as aroma suggests, so might disappoint some hop-heads but an excellent session beer, superbly balanced

Aroma: floral, citrus, lichee, grapefruit ; Appearance: clear golden, minimal head; Taste: medium bitterness ; Palate: light body, thin feel, average carbonation, slightly bitter finish. A good refreshing beer for all occasions, and also a good entry point in the craft beer world. Available in some supermarkets in France (Carrefour and sometimes Casino).
Bottle at home. Golden color. Aroma is very fresh and pinneapple-ish. Body is very refreshing. Very easy drinkable. Deserves its hype!

Copenhagen 4/11 2016. 66 cl bottle from Kvickly. The usual pretty cool label design with a lot of graphic fonts telling me it’s a "Post Modern Classic" and a howling Brew Dog. Pours slightly hazy with big white head. Settles as thin but creamy layer of foam. Lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is pretty citric with light notes of exotic fruit. Quite tart. Medium carbonation and slightly thick palate. Flavor is medium sweet followed by more pronounced bitterness. A little watery. Fine IPA even if I really do not know if I think this qualifies as a Post Modern Classic.

Rich citrus aroma with lots, and lots of tropical fruits, pineapple, passion, lychee, peach and resin. Hops underneath the fruity sensation. Flavour follows the nose. Tropical fruity and with lots of citrusy, bitter refreshing taste. Bit of delightful fat caramel malts.

Can’t believe I haven’t reviewed this before. Pint in a hotel. Which tells you what’s changed. I first drank this at a London beer festival in 2008 and it was a floral hoppy monster. Led to me giving them quite a bit of dosh when they first looked for crowdfunds. There have been repeated consistency issues, now solved. At the cost of some loss of character. The flora citrus nose remains, but on taste it’s lost some bite and oomph. It’s still beating the crap of most draught beers but I kinda miss the random process that sometimes produced a random outstanding batch.

Piwo barwy złotej z niewielką białą pianką. Jeśli chodzi o aromat to czuć przede wszystkim owoce tropikalne i nuty miodowe. W smaku czuć grejpfrutową wyraźną goryczkę, delikatne cytrusy, oraz cherbatę z miodem. Dobre IPA.

I have had this beer a few times and it never disappoints. Appearance is cloudy and not very strongly carbonated. A more easy going IPA than most with citrusy after tones. At 5.6% ABV it makes it somewhat sessionable.

Tap at Pub Graali, took one sip from a friend but have had it before myself. Pours hazy golden with white head. Aroma and taste have citrus, caramel, spices and fruits. Sweet, fruity, hoppy and bitter. Very good IPA!

A scottish, amber IPA with white head. Aroma is hops, citrus, pineapple, pink grape. Taste is bitter.

I drank this at several parties, once it was during a metal festival in Vidy, Lausanne. In my opinion, it is a delicious and classical IPA, on the American way. drank this beer again from one bottle of Amstein, one thing that I like is the aromas at the nose that you havr with the hop, I drank it on saturday with my wife at Lausanne, a classical IPA, not so bitter that we could expect but it is fair. I don't know, if it is a wrong impression, but the can version is better than the bottle version, the hop is more fruity and aromatic in the can, instead of the bottle more dry and mineral.

08.10.2016 - Tropical friuts in nose and mouth. Some piney nice hop aromas paired with a medium body and a fresh bitter finish.

can. Poured hazy yellow with a frothy white head. Big citrus hop aroma, a hint sulphury. Medium bodied, a bit watery mouthfeel. Flavour of oranges with bitter pith, herbal hops, slight peppery note, bready pale malt, sticky tart finish.

2015 BJCP Category: 21A American IPA


AROMA: West Coast style of citrus and tropical fruit. Clean and bright nose. Low grainy malt background. A hint of grass. 10/12

APPEARANCE: Pale orange hue; slightly hazy body (chill haze). Small, white foam mostly dissipates leaving little lacing. 2/3

FLAVOR: Mostly citrusy hops throughout; especially orange and pink grapefruit. Slight grass or tea-like flavor in the background. Bitterness is too low for the style (seems like a pale ale). Clean, unobstructive, grainy malt presence. 12/20

MOUTHFEEL: Medium-light body with matching carbonation level (closer to light than medium). Texture is smooth and approaching watery. Aftertaste is almost completely clean. Seems much lighter than even 5.6% ABV. 3/5

OVERALL IMPRESSION: While it smells good and tastes fine; this is better approached as a pale ale than an IPA. 6/10

TOTAL SCORE: 32/50

DISCLAIMER: The author is a rank-pending BJCP judge.

La Punk IPA est loin d’être la meilleure IPA que j’ai eu l’occasion de boire. Il faut cependant reconnaitre que parmi le panel de bières facilement accessible en France, la Punk est la seule IPA décente que l’on peut trouver dans un bar dit "bar à bières" où l’on retrouve majoritairement des bières belges, allemandes et les autres grosses productions française (Kronembourg) et quasiment aucune IPA. Avec un peu de chance, on peut la trouver à la pression et bénéficier de l’Happy Hour. 
D’un point de vie gustatif, elle est légère et très désaltérante, une pointe d’amertume qui en fait une bière assez accessible des néophytes. Des arômes et un très léger goût de fruits tropicaux vient égayer les papilles.

Cloudy golden color with strong subtle activity. Creamy beige 2 finger head, lasting around 10-15 minutes, with a very good amount of legs.

Inviting aromas of fresh floral hops and gentle pine. Flavors of citrus like orange and lemon with a soft pine taste. Floral notes with a grassy herbal feel. Ester and tropical fruits with a dash of caramel. Slight roasted grains. Well balanced between the sugar and sharpness.

Thick smooth oily body with the perfect amount of carbonation. Well intensified medium strength finish, ending with a nice fresh fruity hops sweetness, a floral spicy tongue coat, some faint sharp piney hops, and a hint of smoky malt.

Overall an excellent craft having tender and delicious flavors with great freshness. Nicely balanced and complex offering pleasant citrus flavors, a soft piney feel, still with a perceptible malt feel. Highly recommended!
