Classic IPA. One of the groundbreaking ones. Well balanced. Used to be 6%, but is now 5,6%. Good citrus, and some exotic fruits in the finish. A must in a good IPA.

Barwa złocista, lekko zamglona. Piana średnio obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, bardzo trwała i zostawia ładny lacing. W aromacie dominują owoce tropikalne, a przede wszystkim mango. W tle czuć lekką naftę i trawę. W smaku jest wytrawne, słodyczy nie ma praktycznie żadnej. Jest trochę mniej rześkie i owocowe niż zapowiadał aromat, ale nadal bardzo przyjemne. Goryczka jest średnia, trochę ziołowa, czuć też lekką metaliczność.
Really good ipa. Beautifully clear with a lovely, piny, hoppy aroma and a strong bitter aftertaste.
330ml can, pours nice and gold while very clear. Nice white head, great piney hop aroma, smooth balance of bitterness. Damn good IPA
En frisk IPA som ikke er av de bitreste man får tak i. God balanse selv om jeg lot meg friste til å drikke den kald.

W aromacie intensywne, cytrusowo - tropikalne, rześkie. Z wyglądu klarowne z niezłą białą pianą, kolor słomkowy. W smaku wytrawne, cytrusowe, chmielowe, tropikalne, owocowe. Pijalne, lekkie. Bardzo solidne ipa

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with a large, frothy, long lasting,
off-white head that laces nicely. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, grapefruit, tropical fruit, stone fruit and grass. Sweet flavour of caramel malt, grapefruit, tropical fruit, peach and pine needles with a dry, bitter, hop resin finish. Medium body with an oily texture and average carbonation. Very tasty.

Tap @ Keller, Tartu. Pours golden with white head. Aroma is strong fruits, flowers, some sweetness, hops. Taste is light hops, fruits, grass, light metal. After taste is long and bitter sweet. Nice beer!

On tap. Color : clear golden ale with thin white head. Nose : citrus, resin, tropical fruits. Aromas : resin and pinus, citrus, floral hops. Dry to medium texture, low carbonation, very nice bitterness.
Bottle. A bit disappointing for Brewdog. The taste is a bit off, and it’s somewhat flat. Not much head.
Escocia. Junio 2016. Buenísima IPA. Sabor muy intenso y muy afrutado. De lo mejor que he probado

The first thing that hits you is the intense aroma of berries and tropical fruits. I’m not usually one for sweet beverages. My first impression is "too sweet." The taste is a nice blend of berries and tropical fruits but balanced by biscuits and hops. Overall I’m impressed and I’m suprised it’s 5.6% because it tastes like less.
Flaske 0.33L på Verdensteatret. Delvis klar strågul med tynt hvitt skum. Lukt humle, sitrus. Smak sitrus, humle, fruktig markert fin bitterhet. Veldig god IPA

bottle: a friend introduced me to punk some years ago and started me on my craft beer journey.....it still stands out in my mind....I love the pale colour and the amazing punch of tropical fruit in the aroma that gives way to more subtle floral and pine notes ...think of a tropical fruit and its got it ...I live in Greece and we have a lot of loquats and I kind of think punk smells of loquats....maltiness present....great mouth feel ...and a brilliant strong but rounded bitter finish...perfect for beach ...after a swim when you got that saltiness in your mouth

On tap @ Brew Dog / Florence Italy --- Clear light / medium amber, white head that drops to a full cover, waves of lace. Taste is malt with sweet citrus that adds carbonation and an odd assortment of hops. Works just like an IPA, but I’m not a fan of the odd hop thing. Wouldn’t have again.

Avec une robe blonde orangé évoquant les pêches, elle se coiffe d'une belle tête de mousse crémeuse et persistante de couleur blanche.
Elle offre au nez des arômes légers de foin, de fruit et d'herbe. Elle réveille sur la langue des saveurs fruitées évoquant la pêche et les fruits tropicaux, suivit d'une amertume relativement puissante et sèche qui perdure longuement en bouche. Celle-ci cède ensuite sa place à un bel arrière goût fruité. Encore une belle bière fortement houblonnée de la brasserie Brewdog.

Pours light golden with slight haze and decent white head. Aroma of fruity hops balanced with malt, slightly sweet, almost honey. Taste is malty with hints of floral and juicy hops, not overly hoppy, quite a nice balance but not one for the hop heads
Excelente ipa, amargor consistente, muy aromática ligeramente turbia de espuma resistente

Aroma: Fruity
 Appearance : Golden Orange Amber thin white head
 Taste : Fruity mango jamon pineapple hoppy citrus
 Palate : light body
from British Brewdog Pub
Kevés hab, alig átlátszó homályos borostyán szín. Nagyon erős, citrusos illat, némi fűszeres beütéssel. Íze közepesen kesernyés, fűszeres jegyekkel, némi citrusos beütéssel. Testes sör.
Had it from a bottle. Good beer. Easy drinkability and perfect amount of bitterness.

Pours a clear golden orange from the bottle with fluffy off-white head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma of fruity stone fruit hop notes and a hint of malty sweetness. Taste follows, more balanced than the nose with a clean, easy bitterness. Solid IPA.
Bottle. Pours in nice golden colour. Fresh floral citrus aroma, fruity. Gentle taste, slightly sweet. Interesting finish. Very well balanced beer.

Très blonde et limpide, collet blanc rapidement disparu. Au nez c’est très agréable, puissants arômes de houblons américains : résineux, agrumés, mais surtout fruitropicalisé (fruit de la passion, mangue, ananas). Carbonation légère, corps moyen avec une quasi absence d’arômes maltés, mais à quoi s’attendre d’une IPA américaine aussi fortement houblonnée. Finale sèche en bouche, longue au nez, très aromatique. Excellente IPA, dommage qu’elle soit pratiquement impossible à trouver au Québec.

Great start, ring pull snapped, but always the optimist, my associate remedied with pliers and a blowtorch. A high pour, wafts of passion flowers, sticky candy canes and honey. Creamy head that could withstand a spoon. Small bubbles defy gravity inside a hazy yellow storm. First sip brings out stronger honey, flavour is full with lingering bouquet of hops, lacing waves cling to the glass, enjoying the zing and buzz of this slow sipper
Bottle 33cl, goudkleurig citrusfris ruikend bier, sporen van ananas, beetje bitter in de mond, langzaam wegebbende droge lichtbittere nasmaak. Non-existente schuimkraag. Foeilelijk etiket trouwens.

Dourada, clara, com espuma média, de boa duração. Aroma cítrico: maracujá e lima. Amarga, com ótimo equilíbrio. Pequena quantidade de malte no sabor. Corpo média, ótima drinkabilidade, refrescante, uma delícia de cerveja
Una IPA bastant acceptable y con una personalitad pròpia de las de su família recomanable.
On tap at brew dog. Pours a cloudy golden. High hop aroma. High hop taste with a citrus finish. Really nice clean finish. 3.5
From bottle at Folken 27.05.16. Hazy pale orange. Aroma of bitter tropical fruits, papaya and peach. Similar taste, also with pine and dried papaya. Medium bitterness.

Clear deep gold/honey color with small white foam. Aromas sweet of fruity hops that remind of pineapple and grapefruit and light touch of passionfruit. Palate, medium too full body with thick-ish texture leaving nice hoppy finish. Taste is light hoppy bitter sweet of pineapple and grapefruit mix simple but nice. Overall nice! More so would call it a session IPA, nice full flavour, easy going, not too complex quite simple but nice!
Did not notice the pineaplle incthe past. From tap maybe it comes fresher. Extra refreshing and balanced ipa.

Best seller of brewdog and always a delight to taste. Good hop profile very refreshing. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle 330 ml. Hazy yellow with a hint of straw. Medium lacing from a white head. Aroma is fresh and citrusy and grassy. Bitter taste with some mouthwarming notes and slightly malty sweetness. More of hoppy resin. In total, this is for me the typical Brewdog house style.
Bière jaune, mousse blanche. Très fleurie au nez. Au goût goût elle est douce et houblonné. Bon moment.

An earthy hop, floral, and pine aroma. Foamy, white head that lasts to the first sip and a nice light amber color. Slightly uninteresting flavour and not much body - all I really taste is the bitterness. Not amazing, but a dependable, simple, nicely bitter IPA.

Złociste, praktycznie klarowne piwo, z przeciętną pianą. Intensywny aromat cytrusów (grejpfrut, mandarynka) i owoców tropikalnych. W smaku również cytrusy przyjemnie wyczuwalne. Piwo bardzo rześkie, pijalne, z średnio wysoką goryczką.

330 ml bottle. Pours golden with an average white head. Strong floral and citric fruity aroma. Medium body with lively carbonation. Starts with balanced bitterness and a fruity flavor (peach) and a little malty (straw,hay). Average bitter finish. Overall a very balanced and nice IPA.
This a great IPA. It is not too alcoholic, just 5,6%, but it has a good but soft aroma, great dinkability and good hops balance

Bouteille 33 cl - couleur dorée sans bulles mousse trés éphémère, odeur de litchi, goût: amertume directe présente laissant place à un goût de litchi légérement sucré, agrumes, finale assez longue sur le goût de litchi
Mousse blanche, couleur paille dorée, belle carbonatation, arôme agrumes, goût houblonné avec amertume moyenne qui reste légèrement, finale légèrement sèche. Belle IPA. 33 Cl Simply Market

Tap at Edinburgh location
Pours bright orange hue with a nice soapy white head and some lacing. Nose is big floral slightly dank. Flavors are big white grapes lots of tangerine. Very lite carbonation and low bitterness. Body is lite and crisp. Better than expected.

Appearance: yellow-amber clear color. frothy white head.
Aroma: pear, pine, passion, orange, mandarin, citrus, lime, mint, strawberry.
Taste: medium to high bitterness.
Palate: medium body. thin texture. lively carbonation. short bitter finish.
Overall: very tropical notes. I wouldent concider this a good representation of ipa. its more like the perfect bridge between apa and a lager. feels taylored for introducing lager-peopoe to the ale-tree.

A nice IPA. Well balanced, and creamy. Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Smells of candied pineapples. Taste is smooth, not very hoppy, with more pineapple and a nice finish. Had on tap at Craft Bangkok.

33cl bottle at home (13 II 2016), shared with the Meetjeslandse Bierproevers. Yellow to lemon coloured brew with white collar. The hops are omnipresent, although they are not that citrus or fruity - resulting in a medium bitterness. The texture is quite thin, and makes up for a medium body and medium carbonation, with a hoppy finish. Within the taste one can notice various fruits, passiflora fruits, pêche. Pretty solid IPA, perfect quencher, very enjoyable.
Lovely tropical fruity aroma, straw yellow colour and a good balance of sweetness and hop bitterness. A really good modern IPA.

Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a medium creamy white head. Nowe of malty caramel, floral hops with a bit of mango citrus. Medium sweetness on the mouth. A little creamy. Body is llight to medium. Preety smooth. Little carbonation.Small to medium hoppy finish you also get a bit of zest finish. Not bad but a little underwhelming.

De la cervecera artesanal escocesa Brew Dog(UK) esta "Punk IPA" una American IPA bastante sesionable de 5.6% ABV y una cantidad moderada de amargor con apenas 45 IBU’s, a pesar de sus origenes europeos esta cerveceria es conocida por reproducir cervezas con influencia americana, generalmente muy lupuladas y algunas experimentales, como homenaje a estos estilos sus fundadores mostraban zonas icónicas cerveceras de los Estados Unidos en un programa de televisión del canal de la revista Squire titulado "Brew Dogs" en donde ademas daban consejos sobre metodos de producción casero no olvidando sus inicios.
Esta IPA directo de barril cuenta con una corona ligeramente mediana, de perlas compactas y muy buena retención, el color es amarillo siguiendo la tendencia de las IPA’s sumamente claras, de aspecto semiturbio y cuerpo ligeramente mediano.
En aromas predominan lúpulos de carácter cítricos, de notas a cascara de naranja, frutos tropicales, mucho dulzor y ligera maltosisdad.
Ya en el paladar se muestra un sabor muy sesionable, principalmente predominando el carácter americano de los lúpulos, con tonos cítricos, sumo de naranja, toronja, durazno, aunque es una IPA no tan marcada a el amargor es totalmente perceptible el balance distintivo hacia el lúpulo seguido de dulzor y notas ligeras a grano, un muy buen retrogusto de corta temporalidad. En general cumple pero no es de mis favoritas, algo sobre estimada esta cerveza por algunos.
0,33l Flasche. Orangenes Bier mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Tolles Aroma nach blumigen Hopfen und reifer Mango. Schmeckt leicht malzig, der Hopfen mit den Komponenten nach Citrus überwiegt.

W nosie na początku cytrusy i owoce tropikalne, ale szybko ulatują i na pierwszym planie pojawaia się solidna ziołowość. Barwa złota, klarowne, drobna, długo utrzymująca się piana. W smaku dość wytrawnie, zioła, żywica i grejpfrut. Goryczka średnia w kirunku niskiej, mega pijalne. Klasyk gatunku. Kran w Brewdog Warsaw.

Draft. Really hits the spot. A tad boring on the malt side of things but it lets the big amounts of hop flavour and aromas really stand out. A big blend of grassy and fruity hops. Fairly easy drinking with a light lively carb.

Pours nice in straw gold with white head. Nose is rich malty with hoppy citric notes. Taste is expression of the nose. You get the expected. Lots of nice hops in a good variety and still leaving malty notes.
Pours a golden amber color. Aromas of floral hops, some sweetness, and a touch of fruit. Flavors of hops, pine and citrus. Light body with a bittersweet finish and long aftertaste.

Tap @BrewDog Bristol.
Medium white head, gold colour, clear, good lacing. Strong hoppy aroma, grapefruit, lemon, pine, spruce. Strong bitter taste, long finish, light to medium body, average carbonation. Very good!
Helder blond bier met weinig wit schuim. Geur: Fruitig, citrus, moutzoetig. Smaak: grassig, hop, bitter, droog. Weinig koolzuurprikkel. Weinig volmondig. Afdronk: droog, licht bitterig

Veramente buona, ottima gradazione media carbonatura e schiuma bianca di media persistenza. Profumo fresco di agrumi e amaro non invadente. L’aroma e persistente e di buona compagnia con note di sauvignon.
Nice IPA, everything is well rounded here, no surprises. Golden yellow with white head. Flavors of malt & citrus, bitterness is well balanced.
Très bonne IPA, sur l’agrume (citron et orange), amertume légère, équilibrée par un sucre léger. Carbonatation agréable, bulle légère. Alcool peu présent . Jolie bière équilibrée.

330ml bottle: Pours a cloudy pale straw with a small white head. Lacing. Aromas of citrus and passion fruit. Tastes of passion fruit and guava. High hop bitterness, medium light body with medium carbonation.
330ml bottle at The Bank House. Pours a pale amber with a small white head. Aroma is hoppy and citrus. Taste is citrus, malt, hops, a little bitter, but mostly dry.
Deep golden pour with small white head and pleasent carbonation. Malty and dry with tropical fruit notes and a wonderful balanced bitterness. Complex and interesting. A great IPA.

Nagazowanie średnie. Barwa ciemno-złota, przeźroczysta. Piana niska, średnio-gęsta, szybko opadająca, z małym lacingiem. Aromat: intensywny, żywiczny, cytrusowy, lekko mandarynkowy. W smaku średnio-pełne, z bardzo przyjemną, wyraźną, średnio-długą, cytrusową goryczką. W smaku przewijają się również nuty chlebowe stanowiące fajną kontrę dla wszechogarniającej chmielowości. Lekkie, sesyjne, dobrze zbalansowane. Na końcu leciutkie masło.

A golden medium-bodied ale, with a citrus and grape hop aroma and flavour. Lightly malty and somewhat dry taste, with light/medium bitterness. Overall, a fairly decent and quite drinkable modern IPA, but nothing outstanding.

Great beer! Pine and tropical fruit that is bold, but not overpowering. Full of flavour, bitterness balances the malt without being harsh. Fairly low carbonation. This one is one month past its used by date, so would love to try a fresh one. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
The very nice IPA with a refreshing citrus taste. A very pleasant aroma which is quite hoppy but again the is a hint of citrus fruit. I will certainly buy this again.

(Brewed May 2015)
Appearance: Light golden, almost light copper orange colour. 
Nose: Hoppy, with light pine and grass notes and quite a bit of citrus.
Palate: Rather light body. Quite rich and well integrated carbonation. Rounded bitterness, citrusy fruitiness with elements of pine resin. Rather long and more hops-bitter finish.
Nice, medium light IPA which has bottle matured for a year, lost some freshness and hoppiness but still retained a lot of fruitiness. It probably lost a few points on this in my book, although it was still within the "best before" date (May 2016).

Arômes de houblon, robe orange pâle et très clair, comme du jus de pomme. Petite mousse blanche éphémère.En bouche, houblonné, amère, pamplemousse et beaucoup de corps. Le tout bien équilibré, facilement buvable et très goûteux.

At last ...
Aroma: herbs and citrus notes, mango.
Appearance: clear golden color and thin white head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, weak citrus notes, herbs, pine, mango, quite dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: An icon in a good shape.

Bottle. Orange with frothy white head. Medium strong aromas of tropical fruits with a background of pine cone what gives a rough feeling. Do like it. Medium body with medium carbonation. Taste is bitter with some notes of orange, pine and little herbal, good bitterness. Good one!

Butelka 330 ml. Klarowny zloty kolor, piana biala mala. W zapachu uderzaja nuty sosnowe ananasow pomaranczy. W smaku wyrazne dobrze zbalansowane . Wyrazny posmak cytrusow lekko ukryte chmiele , lekko goryczkowy finisz ktory jednak nie przeszkadza. Udane. 

 Marcin G

Hazy golden with shortlasting white head. Aroma is honey, fruits, orange, passion fruit, pine cone, also a malty note in direction toast or bread. Taste is surprisingly bitter, (maybe from the alcohol?) and also an orangy sourness. Feels like flour on the tongue, and the body is only thin. More fruits after swallowing. Overall a good fruit explosion. But the bitterness didn’t fit so well in this picture for me.

Sample from can @ Sur & Bitter, Sandnes. Pours very slightly hazy golden, with a small creamy head. Aroma is hoppy notes of citrus, tropical fruits and floral notes, as well as sweet roasted malts. Medium to full body, with average carbonation. Flavour is bitter, with hoppy citrusy orange peel, pine and floral notes, as well as some malty notes of bread and honey. Lingering herbal, bitter finish.

F: creamy, white, average lasting.	
C: deep gold to orange, light hazy.
A: a lot of different tropical fruits, grapefruit, tangerine, caramel, malt, yeast, pine.
T: malty, herbal, citrus, tangerine, grapefruit, caramel, toast, interesting bitterness, hint of pine resin, medium body, good carbonation, 0,33l can from AH supermarket in Amsterdam.

Bottle into tulip. Brassy yellow, small white head. Nose of pine hops and sweet malt. Think in the mouth, but interesting suggestion of kiwi maybe? Finishes fast. I think the bottle was 4 years old, so probably past it’s prime.
Blonde de chez blonde, assez sèche en bouche, malt peu présent, amertume due au houblon, certes, mais peu aromatique. Sans plus.

Heard a lot about it. Finally got a pint. Did not quite live up to expectations. But with that said, it was a fine IPA. It ha d nice mouthfeel and definitely hop forward, but finished a bit mild compared to initial taste. Would gladly have again.

Appearance: hazy orange with a frothy white head

Aroma: a lot of citrus fruit. Grapefruit, mandarins and mango all come to mind. 

Taste: loads more citrus on the flavour, same fruits as the aroma with a hint of lemon in the bitterness and a very subtle malt finish. 

Palate: medium carbonation sits well with this beer.

Overall: for its availability and price, this is a great go yo IPA that still stands the test of time with new breweries emerging.

Flaska från SB. På tiden att rate:a en sån här klassiker... Ljusorange klar vätska med fingerhögt fluffigt vitt skum som lämnar en del rester. Rejält med fruktiga toner i doften; mango, ananas, persika, passionsfrukt, mandarin. Lätt kropp. Frisk i smaken, något tunn. Fruktighet som i doften tillsammans med en del granskott och klibbigare beska. På det hela taget väldigt lätt. Besk avslutning.

33cl bottle at home. Pours a clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of flowers, pine, grapefruit, herbal hops, resin, citrus. Taste is medium sweet, soft bitter for an ipa with a fruity dry finish. Notes of citrus, caramel, herbal hops, resin, slight spicy, pine, grapefruit. Texture is slightly watery with soft carbonation

Pours hazy pale amber with medium white head. Amazing hoppy nose of white flowers and tropical fruits. Aromas are tropical fruits (mainly lychee), herbal gops, citrusy hints. Average carbonation, medium body. Medium bitter and fruity finish. Very nice job for this balanced and tasty IPA! One of my favorite.
Slightly hazey amber color. Light head but laces well. Medium aroma of sweet elderflower and subtle pine. The hops are pronounced but not overpowering. Mild bitterness. Quite good all round.
Bottle. Golden color. Aroma of pine and grapefruit. Flavor profile balanced and citrusy but way to tamed down. I’d call it more of a session pale ale.
On tap in Beerbar, Moscow. Carbs... Nice. Golden color. Smells grass and herbs. Great aftertaste. Some pine in the taste. Highly recommend to try and then switch to BD Jack Hammer.
Muy aromatica de olor fuerte a flores y cítricos. Muy suave de sabor 5.6% para una IPA es poca cosa, las Indian Pale Ale se inventaron para tener alta graduación!!

12oz bottle from Tesco. Best by 04/03/17. So, UK format, assuming a 1year best by (for an IPA?!?) this would be about 3 weeks old. Pours light golden brown with an off white head. Aroma is grapefruit hop. Strangely, not as much hop aroma as Nanny State. Tastes a bit more like a real beer. Caramel and grapefruit hop in good balance. Decent.
Espectacular!!!! Llena de aroma. En boca muy agradable. Llena de matices. Amarga como se esperaba. Característica IPA.

Flasche 0,33l: Kräftiges Gold, klar, kräftiger stabiler grobporiger Schaum; frische Nase, sehr fruchtig, fruchtige Süße, kräftige frische Hopfennoten, Grapefruit, Papaya; im Körper sehr frisch, kräftige frische Hopfennoten, fruchtige Grapefruit, cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, angenehme Bitterkeit, Grapefruit-Zest; angenehmer trocken-bitterer Nachgang mit mehr Grapefruit-Zest
Drinked from bottle. Lovely aroma, amazing taste. Really good IPA, tried it again after some time and I think it’s even better.

Der Antrunk leicht wässrig, dann leicht säuerlich, hoppy & fruchtig. Der Nachtrunk dann schön trocken und weissweinlastig ( Nelson Sauvin!!! ). GUT!!!! Diverse Schlücke aus Michas Pint (6,30Euro) im CAFE DE KOFFER, Groningen.
Cette bière est devenu selon moi un classique, ce n’est certes pas la meilleure ipa mais elle reste sympa, que l’on trouve assez facilement en France.

Olfactif tout à fait fruité avec ananas, mandarine et mangue, mais tout aussi floral avec des roses et des fleurs sauvages. Tout à fait complexe. Une mousse de dimension hors norme et bien crémeuse couronne un liquide doré légèrement voilé à l’effervescence volcanique. Entrée de bouche légèrement fruitée se développant ensuite en une panoplie de saveurs houblonnées allant du terreux au feuillu en passant par le floral et l’herbacé tout en laissant une longue trainée amère et astringente en fin de bouche. On y goute de l’eau de rose, de la mandarine, du melon au miel, de la terre, des feuilles mortes ainsi que des herbes fraiches bien persillées en finale. De corps moyennement léger, son effervescence est une vraie bombe. Cette bière est d’une complexité gustative remarquable et réunit à peu près toutes les saveurs que l’on peut retrouver dans les houblons Européens. Houblonnage exceptionnel. Appréciation moyenne – supérieure.
a la única cerveza que le puedo poner un 10 en todo, tan sólo por ser el buque insignia de la cerveza artesana en Europa! gran momento aquel que pasé bebiéndola por primera vez

Truly a great IPA. Great flavor; not overly hopped but hits the mark. Have often. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of citrus, flowers and grass. Light golden and hazy, very little head. Lovely citrusy flavour, quite short after taste. Very pleasant palate. This is a nice beer, but it doesn’t challenge my taste buds.

Aromas cítricos y pino
Buen aspecto y carbónatacion con espuma persistente
Sabores cítricos y pino con final amargo y seco

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle@Salling, Aarhus. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma and taste is hops, tropical fruits, orange, lemon, citrus. Full body. Soft carbonation. Nice bittersweet finish.
Bottle to shaker.Big frothy white head. Nose is light citrus hops. Palate is clean, amber resin. Very well balanced against the grain. Finish is a pleasing dance. Yum.
Tap at Brewdog Turku. Citrus, tropical fruits, caramel, gemrass and herbs. Moderate to high sweetness and moderate bitterness. Dry and bitter finish.

Sehr fruchtiges India Pale Ale.
Man merkt, dass das Bier mit viel Sorgfalt hergestellt wurde.

Fantastic aroma. I have a hard time decriping it all; Hops; citrus, floral. Pale and slightly cloudy. Minimal/no head. Nice bitterness. Long lasting bitter finish. Overall, super delighted. I had heard the beer would be great, but it far exceeded expectations :) I’m very happy right now

Helder en goudgeel. Witte schuimkraag die wel vlot verdwijnt. Medium koolzuur. Hoppig en fruitige geur....tropisch. In de smaak een fruitig zoetje met grapefruit/citrus/ananas. Bitter is nog redelijk mild voor een IPA. In de nasmaak proef je vooral de grapefruit bitter. Een lekker frisse IPA. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Botella. Presencia palida con buena corona blanca persistente. Carbonatacion media alta. Aroma citrico y floral pero no muy acentuado. Sabor citrico y pino con cuerpo medio
A hoppy, full bodied pale ale with hints of grapefruit. Perfect craft beer to cut your teeth on.

Did not pour it aggressively but it had 3 inch head with good retention. The head was of golden color of creamy beige head. Floral and piny were dominant aroma. It was followed by citrusy hop flavors of orange and lemon. It felt fresh because of its piny notes that was balanced with floral notes. It has a fairly noticeble malt backbone. Sweet and roasty. While floral and piny taste is still there, hop’s bitterness is very forward here with lots of tropical fruits with a dash of esteryness. Slight roasted grains. Well balanced between the sugar and sharpness.I liked the amount of carbonation. Not too strong. It was a good balance with the beer’s medium-body.
Sufficienza risicata per una birra che ho amato ma che è andata via via scemando nel tempo...peccato era tanto buona

33 cl bottle. Pours golden hazy - white foam - ok retention. Nose is fruity - grape / citrus. Taste is fresh, fruity and a bit tart. Surprising low bitterness. Taste notes - grape, citrus and melon, few malty notes

Had it from both tap and bottle lots of times. Golden with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, peach, grapefruit, citrus. Medium bitterness, medium sweetness, refreshing, very drinkable, medium bodied. Great beer for a beginner. Average carbonation.

Bière sympathique.
Goût bien équilibré et houblonné pour une IPA. Elle mérite sa notoriété.

Dark gold hazy body with a short white head. Aroma of citrus, grapes and a bit of alcohol. Taste is citrus, grapes, slightly malty. Fairly rich in flavor. Soft bitter aftertaste. Lower-middle body, lively carbonation and recognizable alcohol. A refreshing IPA.

Blonde and quite clear for an IPA, but the white head disappear in half a minute.
Strong hops aroma. Very tropical and sweet, with a little biscuit from the malt adding some complexity.
Taste present a sort of light sweetness. There is a strong domination of the hops, but the biscuity and malty notes comes more evident now than in the aroma.
The body is from light to medium, the carbonation is soft and the finish quite short and moderatly bitter.
To me is a little to simple in taste and weak in bitterness to be properly called an IPA, but the hop flavour is clean and wonderful, and the extreme drinkability makes the Punk IPA one of my favourite beer of all.

Licsis és mazsolás illatú és ízű, rendkívül száraz és határozottan keserű IPA. Őszibarack, kevés mangó.  Egy új világ tárult fel előttem. Gazdag és felejthetetlen gyantás, dohányos és fenyős komló bontakozik ki mint utóíz. Miles Davis + könyv + ez = jól telik az este!
33cl bottle from not too detailed notes. Fairly good, fairly standard IPA. Aroma was quite nice.

On tap in Whetherspoons. Thin head. Golden color. Lots of carb. Smells grass, herbs, cats :) rich flavor, good body. Iron aftertaste. Some pine in the taste. All goes away fairly quickly. Like a table beer almost. Good for mass consumption

Spina 500 ml. Peggiorata negli anni (probabilmente per renderla accessibile un pò a tutti i "palati") non ha più le caratteristiche tipiche di quella che dovrebbe essere una Ipa, per di più scozzese. Dorata limpida, schiuma bianca, al naso pochi frutti tropicali e malto, in bocca poco luppolo, poco amaro, poco tutto. Gradevole sì, ma c’è di molto meglio.
Pours clear gold. Nose of grass, citrus and green apple. More fruit on the palate, orange zest, apricot and biscuits.
Golden color. Good foam, good lacing. Aroma: Lot of tropical fruits. Taste: hops, hoppy bitternes. Medium body.
Bardzo średnio, lekki aromat tropików i cytrusów. W smaku podobnie. Bez wad ale nic szczególnego.
Aroma of tropical, caramel and malt. Taste of the same but with more peach notes. Some pine as well. Low body and medium bitterness.
On tap at hopaholic. Strawyellow color with a small white head. Nose of hay and grass. Taste is low bitterness with some lemongrass and citrus. Nice light beer for starters.
A love/hate beer. Hazy amber/gold pour. Very hop forward, pine, resin, weed, citrus rinds. Little malt character. Medium body. Catch me at the right moment and I’d probably drink a gallon.

Todo un referente de hoy y de siempre de la cerveza artesana. Es una IPA rompedora con la que engancharse al mundo artesano. Amarga, lupulada con mucho sabor frutal que recuerda al melocotón más sabroso.
0.33 l can poured to a shaker. Golden color with thin head. Fruity, hoppy aroma and extremely bitter hoppy taste with a long finishing. Medium bodied, moderately carbonated. Excellent.
Uma ipa muito equilibrada, aroma cítrico com amargor levemente persistente, ideal para os dias mais quentes.
Piwo pite przed założeniem konta, aczkolwiek pamiętam że dobre było.

Farbe: ocker, trüb
Schaum: naja mir hats erst mal die halbe Flasche auf den Tresen gesprudelt. Sonst mittelgrober Schaum, bleibt immer was da.
Nase: intensiv, Hopfen a la Orange, Grapefruit, Blumenwiese.
Geschmack: ordentlich sauer und bitter, sogar für ein IPA. Abgang natürlich auch orangig, da kommt noch Getreide dazu, aber jetzt nicht so toll wie die Nase erhoffen lässt. Kohlensäure da aber nicht zu viel. Bitterer Orange-Nachgeschmack. Nicht übel, mir ein bisschen zu bitter und orangig.

I remember this beer drunk fresh in the UK and it was marvellous. However, yesterday I had a batch dated 30/09/2016 here in Poland. Aroma is of old hops with some faint citrus overtones. In taste it is nicely refreshing and a bit hoppy, but it was much more than that. Unfortunately, this bottle was a disaster - comparing to what I had drunk before. It was just another faint pale ale without any character.
golden, cloudy, white foam, herbs, grass, floral, full body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, very bitter,

bottle from BeerLovers. pours with a nicht white head, clear golden-orange colour, some citrus aroma, fruity, slighty stale and oxidised. malty medium sweetness, medium bitterness, the malty flavour is almost more present as the hops. Not so punk.
Good strong alcoholic tasting beer, very strong characteristic taste, makes it stand out from the crowd

Aroma dominated by pineapple, followed by orange and mango. Juicy. 
Pours golden, slighty cloudy, one-finger white head. 
Taste is medium bitterness and low sweetness. 
Medium-light body, pretty slick, average carbonation and medium finish. 
Overall a juicy, tropical IPA that has good drinkability.

Pours a clear orange color with small, short lasting white head. Wonderful smell of grapefruit and mango.

Medium body with somewhat high but subtle carbonation. Full and creamy mouthfeel. Taste is hops, grapefruit, orange peel, herbs and spices. Some caramel notes as it warms up. I really love the grassy, herbal aftertaste. Very refreshing. Finish is dry and slightly bitter. It really wraps this one up quite nicely.

Overall, great example of the style. Recommended!
330ml bottle. Big hoppy aromas. Tastes of mango, pineapple, citrus. A really good example of the modern IPA type and widely available in UK supermarkets and bars. Well worth a try.
Bardzo dobre IPA. Zapach cytrusowy w smaku słodowo/żywiczne. Lekko goryczkowe

Bottle from everywhere! Mostly Sainsbury's 660 bottles for £2.50. Making this the best value hop head beer I can find. Hence I've drunk so much of it but never taken the time to rate!
It's wonderfully hoppy yet always distinctive. All the US hop tropical aroma you love. They use a very unobtrusive yeast so all flavours are exposed. I suppose it's more of an APA than an IPA. But the UK market has grown and awareness improved. BrewDog were early pioneers and this is a legacy product.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Le Senk. First, the beer is not in good condition, sorry for the worse rating.Aroma is citrusy, piney, malty, some tropical fruits. Taste of cotrus hops, little bit spicy, good malty base. Minimum carbonation, watery - bad condition.

Bottles, unsure of date, drunk 1/22/16 at the Druid.
Soft, light haziness and a peachy-golden body are topped by a foamy, white head with moderate to strong retention.
Plentiful light citrus and tropical fruit characteristics are overshadowed slightly by a dank, green, nearly earthy character that adds subtle spiciness. Almost a woodiness to it, with no pine or heavy grapefruit and light bready/biscuity malts. No alcohol, flaw or off/old hop notes at all.
Wow, this is a hell of a lot different from the older versions. Where those were full of caramel and heavy bitterness, this is a tightly carbonated, malty, but well-attenuated, balanced, juicy and dank IPA. Bravo to Brewdog. Was not expecting this at all. Nelson hops definitely notable, adding plentiful pear, apple, herbs and lemon, without any real aggressiveness from the simcoe or boring, heavy orange rind from the cascade. Dextrinous, yet still very drinkable body and no alcohol or flaws noted. Perhaps a touch too bitter with warming, but a minor complaint.

Brew Dog punked IPA bra ingångsipa. Fruktig och fyllig. Rekommenderas som ett första steg

Dorato carico con riflessi arancio ed evanescente schiuma bianca. Al naso di esprime in tutta la sua vigoria: i sentori spaziano dal pompelmo rosa ai frutti tropicali fini al resinoso. In bocca è naturalmente agile con un buon maltate che tiene a bada un amaro che solo nel finale riesce a fare capolino senza mai prendere realmente il sopravvento.
Fresh hoppy aroma. Hazy pale liquid. White head. Medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Average soft carbonation. Fine IPA. The old edition was better.
Tap at dobre casy. Hazy orangr colour with white head. Aroma of citrus fruits,apples, refreshing. Taste of peach,lemon,apples, light bitterness.

Acobreada, parece que está emitindo um brilho em tons de laranja. Finamente carbonatada, de boa formação de espuma, com média duração, em tons de bege. As bolhas são finas, com aspecto cremoso. No nariz lembra manga, maracujá e erva-cidreira. O lúpulo agrega uma característica herbácea, e chega primeiro nas células olfativas. Paladar lupulado, fresco e complexo. Lembra manga madura, macaúva e tem o paladar levemente salgado. Uma das minhas preferidas.

Simplesmente a melhor IPA que tomei até o momento, mas verdade seja dita: não sou muito fã das IPA. Sabor suave como nenhuma outra IPA que conheço. Se gosta de cervejas muito amargas, é melhor procurar outra (como a Brewdog Jack Hummer)
This beer is already legendary before you have tasted it as so many spoke about it. The beer however does not disappoint. A really good speciman of how craft beer should be. Great.
33cl bottle, drank straight from the bottle. Hoppy and bitter taste, with notes of tropical fruit, citrus, a bit of pine resin and honey. Very refreshing.

Pale golden, crystal clear, low pillowy head. Aroma grapefruit, lemon zest and light herbal notes. Palate watery, carbonation medium. Taste tropical fruit, green apples, grapes. Balanced bitter finish. No long lasting or characteristic bitterness. Balanced. Pretty mild, pretty decent.

Bottle. Wonderful fruity aroma pine tropical fruit mango and fresh orange. Initial malt and fruity hops quickly fade into water and even an unappetizing empty malt flavor. What happened to this beer?? It used to be much better, or did I just remember it differently? The finish is so abrupt and watery that Im actually kinda stunned. Promising bouquet of fruity pebbles and appearance of a winner but underneath it all it’s nothing special.

Real great IPA, suitable for enjoying beer at night.

Smell citrus sweet, not bitter but smooth sweet citrus flavor with great aftertaste.

Helder geel bier met snelzakkende witte schuimkraag.
Aroma is den en terpentijn met wat citrus en tropisch fruit. 
Smaak is fruit met enige bitterheid en zoetheid. 
Mondgevoel is licht met weinig koolzuur en korte bittere afdronk.
0,33 bottle. Pours hazy dark yellow color with small white head. Aroma of citrus, mostly grapefruit, with both sweetness and bitterness. Hoppy aftertaste. Great beer.
330 ml bottle. Pours golden with small white head. Aroma of pines and citrus. Medium body with average carbonation with bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow. Aroma is quite piny with some citrus and tropical fruits. Taste is fruit with some bitterness and sweetness. You can’t argue with the quality of this beer considering it is available in most supermarkets in the uk. A decent go to beer if you can’t get your hands on something better.
De couleur Or ambré, avec une odeur de citron, orange et d’épices, goût citronné avec un soupçon de miel et d’épices! Une finale assez sèche en bouche

33cl bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured a hazy golden yellow with a small white head that disappeared quickly. Nice medium carbonation. Aromas of hops, citrus, lots of freshly cut grass, mint, grapefruit, mango, cloves, coriander. Taste is pretty much a continuation of the aroma, very fruity and hoppy. Medium body with a nice grasshoppy bittersweet finish. Overall a very refreshing good tasting brew.
bitter taste short lasting aroma, dont like so much. smell good. it is medium level beer. diappointment.
Muy fresca. Cítrica. Con mucho aroma. Se bebe muy bien. Muy equilibrada para mi gusto.

Pale yellow colour. Nice white medium head. Refreshing fruity aroma. Citruses in first taste. Tropical fruits and sweetness in the middle. Bitter, hoppy aftertaste. Light bodied, medium carbonated, easy to drink IPA.

0.33 bottle found at Valentin Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
One of my favourites....Great bitter taste, easy to drink especially with something to bite....

Overrated, I think. Pleasant, but no mirracle.

floral, grass, citrus, herbs. For me the most prominent is elderberry. Some caramel as well, although very gentle. 
pale, golden, clear, white foam, minimal head, ok retention. 
medium bitterness, very light sweetness from malt, some caramel again, citrus, elderberry again. Light to medium body, slick, lively, long bitter finish that is smooth and gentle.

citrus, grass, caramel, cereal, toast, pale, hazy, white foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, when you get a good Bottle like this, IT is hard to name a better beer with this avavibility and this quality. (500ml can) 5.6% Opaque golden colour, with creamy white head. Slight fruit, and hop flavours, with a slightly bitter aftertaste. It?s not bad, but maybe the flavour isn?t distinctive enough to stick in the memory.
herbs, and something undefinable, pale, clear, white foam, lightly sour, lightly bitter, medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation,

Glass, 16-ounce, at Bier Markt, savoured on August 13 2015; eye: amber, lightly hazy, no head, no lacing; nose: orange, citrusy, resinous hops, slight malt, fresh; mouth: orange, citrusy, resinous hops, slight malt, fresh, citrusy finale with presence of resinous hops, medium-full body, good carbonation, mildly bitter, slightly sweet, lightly harsh texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 16 onces, en fût, chez Bier Markt, savourée le 13 août 2015; œil : ambrée, légèrement voilée, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : orange, citrique, houblon résineux, très léger malt, frais; bouche : orange, citrique, houblon résineux, très léger malt, frais, finale citrique avec présence de houblon résineux, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, moyennement amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien
2.50€, Carrefour. Belle IPA, très forts parfums d’agrumes avec une certaine amertume. Vraiment bien.
Bottle. Aroma of citrus hops and pine. Body is light and texture is watery. High carbonation . Taste is lime, tropical fruits, grapefruit - finish light bitter and dry. Mild and refreshing.
I had it on tap at Hair of the Dog in Bangkok. It’s really a nice beer with no bitterness after you drink it. I quite like it. The smell is really nice too that’s the plus. :)

Appearance: Pours a hazy yellow with more head than I’ve seen on a beer. Retention is quite long. Moderate lacing.


Aroma:
Pine, yeast.

Pine, grapefruit, mango, apricot.

473 ml can from the LCBO. Pours a golden colour with a large white head. Aroma is citrus, floral. Taste is citrus, fruits, floral, biscuit. Excellent beer.

golden, clear, with big white head,

Pours yellow to amber with medium carbonation and a slight head and lacing.

Aroma is complex with the amount of hops and individual varieties they throw at this. Fruits galore with lemon, orange, lime, kiwi, lychee, marmalade, complemented by background biscuit malt.

Nice balance of sweetness and bitterness, but only a short finish despite the promising aromas. A touch thin for the ABV.

Have had a few duff ones of these, but the good ones are pretty impressive. This stuff is everywhere these days - even found some in obscure local supermarkets in Holland and Spain this year.
Beautiful golden IPA. Extraordinary flavour of citrus, flowers and tropical fruits. Nice bitter in the aftertaste. Very drinkable. Very suggestable.

Appearance-Pale gold, lager like. Great lacing

Weedy, hoppy, fruity, fresh, dry and bitter speeddrinker with a bit of a stale aftertaste. Backlog from 2014/09/09.

Taste. As per marketing deScription, with a nice piney bitterness throughout.

Overall. Quite a decent beer, and probaly the only reason i didn’t rate higher is i tend to prefer citrus dominated flavours to tropical flavours.

Pours goldenrod with a thin white head. Hop taste changes as you drink it. Starts with a citrus hop then middle of a pine hop. Finishes with a mild citrus hop. But doesn't kill your tastebuds.

Pale golden, crystal clear, low pillowy head.
Aroma grapefruit, lemon zest and light herbal notes. Palate watery, carbonation medium. Taste tropical fruit, green apples, grapes. Balanced bitter finish. No long lasting or characteristic bitterness.
Balanced. Pretty mild, pretty decent. Like 5 am, aroma is richer than taste.

Pours an apricot-color from a bottle. Aroma of mango, starfruit. Flavor of soapy pine, tropical fruits. Ends with a rush of bitterness. Kind of takes you on a trip of IPA styles in one beer. Very good beer.

33 cl bottle from City Center One, served in a tulip. Clear golden, with medium white stable head. Aroma is expansive, intense hoppy, floral, fruity, citrus, mild malty. Body is medium, carbonation is soft. Taste is medium sweet, with medium bitterness, balanced, texture is oily.

Gylden ufiltreret skotsk IPA med mindre offwhite skumkrone på 1-2 cm. Rolig i glasset og toppen svinder til et par mm. 
Fin elegant aroma af mandariner, lette noter af grapefrugt og en smule citrus. 
Smagen er ganske mild og let bitter, men frugtrig. Elegant og meget lækker blød mundfølelse. Meget let drikkelig. 
Let til middel bitter og let sød. 
Kroppen er let og fin, karboneringen på et middel niveau og konsistensen olieret. Eftersmagen er mild, let bitter og kort. 
Denne IPA kan i nogens øjne fremstå svag, men jeg finder den let og elegant. Skal prøves af på nogle humle-hadere. 
Perfekt til, når lysten er til "en-mere-humlet-øl-end-noget-pilsner-snot".

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very drinkable for an IPA.Aromas are classic I ’d say and the taste is absolutely great.This is a beer that everyone loves.

"Post modern classic" z dobrym tropikalnym słodkim aromatem. Wątpliwości może być trochę jeśli chodzi o goryczkę bo wydaje się być przytłumiona słodyczą tak jakby słodem karmelowym. Poza tym piana drobna kolor jasny Klarowność bez zastrzeżeń.
Klasyk jednak z małym ale...

La bière est prometteuse: bien mousseuse, dorée et appétissante. Au moment de l’ouverture de la cannette, une explosion de pamplemousse annonce une IPA très orientée sur l’agrume. Plus le liquide demeure dans mon verre et plus celui-ci patiente, plus l’agrume se fait rare et intéressant. En bouche les saveurs sont minces et mal définies. J’aimerais pouvoir parler de grain fous et de houblons démesurés mais ce serait mentir. L’alcool est présent et ce même pour une bière à 5,6%. Le reste n’est qu’amertume légère et agrume oublié.
Bottle 330 ml. Great tropical and citrus aroma, surprisingly week in bitterness for an IPA, nevertheless very drinkable and enjoyable beer.

Bottle, stable creamy slightly dense head, lightly cloudy light orange color, aroma of flowers citrus and soap, flavor of almond with a strong shrubby bitterness, light malty hint and a buttery sensation, completely dry, stingy carbonation, light to medium body. Nice and interesting.
Bottle. This a solid IPA, which makes you very happy, if you like that style. Fruity, but not overly diverse, clean bitter finish. More!
From tap @ Tipsy Toad. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Aroma of light hay, citrus, a bit grainy. Thin body, light bitter, light grainy taste, very light citrus.

Pours hazy brown orange with a short open off-white head. Aroma is citrus hops with a touch of pine. Very hop forward in the palate and a bit short on the backend. Nice varied tropical citrus hop flavors - tangerine, orange and grapefruit. Just juicy. Good balance against the caramel malt backbone. Not overly bitter. Really very pleasant. Punk juice.

Bottle from Waitrose. Pours yellow-orange with small fizzy white head. Appetising aroma of pine, grapefruit and coriander. Taste hop-heavy with a real explosion of hop flavours - mandarin, resin, pineapple and a light pepperiness, all beautifully balanced but without compromise on strength of character. One of the best beers you can easily grab at the supermarket.
Draft at Epcot food and wine 2015 Scotland stand. Paired with glenfiddich 18 year. Light, clean, hoppy, floral, citrus, bitter. Good stuff.

330 ml bottle in Derby, UK.  Clean and crisp, well balanced, hop-forward beer. Nice citrus hop aroma, clean malt backbone, and moderate lingering hop bitterness. Not too over the top, so easy drinking.

Can from NB liquor. Cloudy medium amber with a small lingering off white head that leaves nice lace. Big citrus and dank hop nose with light toffee backing. Very light sweet under a big bitter body of citrus, grass and tropical fruit. Body is medium- with average carbonation and a long dry finish. Quite complex.
Ipa is sowieso al een bier dat ik niet zo lekker vind en dit is niet anders. Precies een flesje parfum dat je opdringt

Solid complex and really balanced. Malt flavors are very pleasing. Had this about 6 years ago and forgot about it was happy to see it pop up at build your own. Not overly hoppy but overly enjoyable super drinkable with a crisp clean finish.

330ml bottle. This was my introduction to craft beer.

Crystal clear pale golden amber colour, one-finger white head. Lovely aroma, fruity, citrus, orange, pine, tropical fruit. Flavour is orange, grapefruit, tropical fruits, some sweetness from malt, caramel, with a pleasant fruity bitter finish.  Medium body and carbonation, well balanced. Really nice IPA and much better than the original recipe which I finally got to try on 11/04/2017 when it was rebrewed for the AGM.

33 cl bottle. Hazy, light golden, one-finger white head, pleasant rolling carbonation in the glass. Very fruity and piny aroma. Dry and sticky mouthfeel, lots of bittering hops. Taste is a firework of hop flavours, fruit, citrus, grapefruit, maybe some tangerine because it has some sweetness in all the bitter notes. Most excellent IPA, A+, world class.
Ottima birra ipa, buono il sapore del luppolo ma quello che più sorprende è il retrogusto fruttato, si sente il pompelmo e altri agrumi
Meget spændende Indian Pale Ale. Tilpas med humle og bitterhed. Rimelig frisk i smagen.

Quite a cloudy orange-yellow colored beer with a firm, compact layer of foam. The aroma is citrus-sour, with touches of mango and peach. A nice, bitter taste, and the fruity parts stay in the background. The aftertaste is a bit bitter, and the palate is dry.

Een vrij troebel oranje-geel gekleurd bier met een stevige, compacte laag schuim. Het aroma is citrus-zuur, met de toetsen van mango en perzik. Een mooie, lekkere bittere smaak en de fruit toetsen blijven op de achtergrond. De nasmaak is iets bitter, en de afdronk is droog.

Looks golden colored, nice and clear appearance. Pleasant fruity aroma uprising from the glass. Ten points for the hop profile, very refreshing and easy to drink. Grapefruits, lime and some spicyness. Bitterness quite well leveled and not so aggressive. Overall- an IPA that never disappoints and always good to have.

On tap @ Csakajósör - Clear golden colour, medium white head with good retention and lacing. Vigorous tropical fruit aromas with fresh grass and lemon zest. Taste of grapefruit, mango, grapes, passion fruit, lemon zest and a bit biscuity malt taste. Light body, medium carbonation, crispy and refreshing mouthfeel. Simple malt base, exciting hops, easy bitter finish, balanced beer. Very nice everyday IPA.
Draft. Slightly hazy golden color, fluffy white head. Aroma of tangerine, mango, pineapple. Taste is bittersweet tropical fruit. Nice.
Kolor jasny zloty, klarowne. W zapachu slodkie, jakies owoce. W smaku rowniez slodkie, bardzo pijalne.
A hazy dark golden beer with a huge yellowish head. The aroma has notes of fruits, lots of spices, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, limes, straw, and malt. A bit too sweet.

Solid head with aroma notes of pineapple, grapefruit, pine, and biscuit. Tasting notes of grapefruit, lime, resin, and long citrus bitter finish. Great IPA! Very automatic, and not outrageously bitter.

Spare head with flat yellow body. Perfume, celery and grapefruit hops. Medium oily body with average carbonation and metallic touch. Average duration flavor moderately sweet and acidic and of course bitter!

Canned in Canada. Hazy light honey color, large white head. The aroma is honey and herbs, the flavor spicy. Nice fruity finish.

L: pours a bright hazy gold with a huge pillowy head, nice lacing. 
S: the aroma is a big bright mix of pine, tropical and citrus fruits. Really inviting. 
T: along the lines of the nose, not as huge, but a full flavour. 
F: a reasonably light and easy feel, a lower bitterness and malt backbone to many recent IPAs.
O: after all these years it takes on a quintessential classic vibe. Many IPAs do more now, and some better, but this is a winning introduction to the style. A stayer worth visiting time and time again.

0.33 l bottle from local Albert Heijn, best before 4/8/2016. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Fruity-resiny aroma of mango, tangerine, orange, honey and pine. Sweetish, fruity-resiny taste of mango, tangerine, honey and pine, followed by a short, slightly to medium bitter, grapefruity finish. Thin to medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Pleasant, highly drinkable and refreshing but not as intense as expected. Still good.
Godt humlet øl, der helt klart er en favorit blandt IPA’er. Der er meget aromahumle i med den gode lugt.

After having the original one at 6% many years ago, lets see if this version is better. Light golden, mildly hazy, big white-yellow cap, long lasting with good creamy-patchy lacing. Fresh hop scent with citrus, grass notes and a little sweetness. The mouthfeel is a little dry, but not full, so the wetness that remains makes it go down nicely. The bitterness as well is not really crazy. The citrus taste blends well with the malts. A nice classic IPA that is refreshing and easy-going. Not sure if this has changed that much.

Hazy golden color. Fruity aroma, tropical fruits like grapefruit and mango, citrus as well. Medium body, some sweetness. Not perfectly sessionable. Lots of everything, kind of too much. Enjoyable though

Bottle from local off licence, not exactly my first time. Lovely aroma as ever, desert island hop bill, but it all just feels watery and subdued from there. Pineapple, lime, grapefruit, biscuit. Great refresher though, good go-to, just not really what others seem to think it is. If you think this is a great IPA you need to drink more IPA.

Golden with very light amber tints, opaque with medium white head, medium lasting and lacing. Aroma is full on hops, light stone fruits, citrus forward in general, some pineapple. Flavor is ballanced, quite piney this can, tropical fruits(mango) and some stone fruits. Finish is bitter and continues to a long hoppy/piney aftertaste. Low carbonation, dry, medium bodied, oily texture.

Glad to come across this beer fresh from the GABF. From bottle; this is a citrus, fruit, hop forward IPA. Crisp clean finish with a light body overall. I did not find the finish to be all that bitter either. Easy drinking and a happy find.

Aroma:


Medium aroma of malts, caramel, orange, tropical fruit, pineapple, hops and citrus.




Appearance:


Hazy/turbid golden/amber beer with a slight/medium white/off-white head.




Taste/Palate:


Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, orange, tropical fruit and pineapple; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops and citrus.




Overall:


This beer is rather intense and balanced, but misses some much needed hop complexity. All the different hops blended together a little bit too well. This is an IPA that every beer drinker, even plebs, will probably enjoy.

355ml enjoyed at home. B/b 27/8/16. Very big pine nose with peach/nectarine underneath. Like it. Must be the big American hops. Citrus (pink grapefruit?) and pine with biscuit malt on second sniff. Pours not quite crystal clear pale gold. Gentle carbonation with thin white head dissipating gradually. Soft mouth feel and lovely fruity/hop bitterness flavour. A winner. Doesn’t drink like 5.6.
Very light 2-3 EBC with small head. Nice hoppy taste with not that much of bitterness. Pretty dry. Very good beer.

330 ml bottle. Bought it in a Monoprix next to place Kleber in Strasbourg. Usuall great fruit, lemon, peach smell of any well made ipa. Look is deep golden with low white head, nothing special. Much softer than other ipas, but with a complex ending. Fantastic, the only better ipa iIremember is the Sculpin, and the double ipas, but, what the hell, is not that i have tried that many neither. This is a great beer. First encounter with Brew Dog and i wasn’t dissapointed.
Easy drinking IPA, not too hoppy with biscuity and earthy hints. Slight citrus notes.

Canned sample from MLCC. Pours straw colour. Lots of citrus. Crisp. Refreshing. Very tasty

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 0,33 l. Clear golden colour with small white head. Nice lacing. Average carbonation. Aroma is fruity, citrusy. Taste is citrusy and hoppy with nice bitter aftertaste. Overall drinkable and enjoyable IPA.
Cloudy, minimal head. Aroma: tropical fruits from bottle, caramel, malts. Heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter.

Pour is cloudy pale gold with a small, persistent white cap. Nose is tropical fruit/floral hops, fruity pale malt, light citrus. Taste is refreshingly, lightly fruity, with fresh cereal and floral hops. A touch watery, and lightly bitter on the finish. Definitely drinkable.

Amazing citrus and pineapple fruity smell. Golden blonde with a white head which recedes quickly. Lightly carbonated. A really well balanced flavour between fruit, sweet and bitter. It really works.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle. Amazing smell al soon as I opened it, citrus tropical smell, juicy lychee aroma, little bit of bitternes, the amount of bitternes and this tropical sweetness is amazing, malty, well carbonated, pale color, really nice

Pours golden with a gorgeous head, this beer (the pride of me father’s hometown) smells of citrus and tropical fruit. There’s more tropical fruit and light citrus on the tongue. It’s nicely balanced but a little underwhelming.
Beer with very nice tropical fruits aroma, dry in taste with not strong bitterness in palate. Pale colour with weak foamy. Overall very good beer!

New Rating: Stable medium white head on a clear golden body. Cantaloupe, grapefruit, toast, pine, a bit floral. Lightly sweet and fruity start, dries up nicely, offers a decent amount of bitterness in the finish. Quite slender but full enough body with fitting natural carbonation. Is it exciting and the new sh*t? Definitely not. But going back to this - my second rating! - I can see how I couldn't do this justice, expecting something intense and wild and a little crazy. It's not. It's actually very balanced and pleasant. Old me would have loved unbalanced, thick IPAs. Aged me likes a good balanced staple.

Old rating - Oct 2015, 5/3/6/2/12: I'm a little underwhelmed with this. It has a nice, light golden colour, a quick fading head of light foam that doesn't have a lot of its own taste, and quite a bit of carbonation. It smells of tropical fruit, like some maracuya whey drinks. Nice and fruity taste that changes into head-on bitter notes. Its body is kind of light though, which dashed my hopes for this to be really good. Not that special.

Bottle @ Café Zilt, Amsterdam.
The brewdog classic; the bit more malty, bit less hoppy. Still nice and balanced. Pleasant 5,6% ABV.
Golden color, medium white head. Very nice aroma, floral hops, citrus, grass. Taste bitter, medium body, dry finish.

From the can... Wtf?! Pours hazy yellow with white head. Intense aroma of pineapple and citric fruit, some mango too very floral and nice smell. Taste is refreshing and crisp. Some bitterness and above mentioned Aroma. Finish is warming and fruity. Great Ipa
Papaya ioghurt aroma.ripe papaya and passion fruit taste.orange,golden colour.33cl can.xpcing more
Tap at Saon piva in Bratislava,flavor is mild and soft malty,citrus fruity slightly spicy and moderate bitter.

Can from the LCBO. Light straw-gold with a faint haze and good sized white head. Aroma of pineapple, mango, bit of tangerine, some lightly sweet cereal. Flavour of a tropical fruit punch - pineapple, peach, mango and papaya all pop up in there - with a citrus bitterness in the finish that starts mild, but builds into a nicely lingering aftertaste. Nice stuff.

Poured real light yellow nt much head, lack of carbonation kept the hops from coming through. Hop aroma was nice, flavor was bitter and some hops. Mouthfeel was prett lean and no malt to speak of. Overall crisp clean brew but lacking in hop terms.

Schönes BrewDog IPA, verglichen mit Jackhammer aber weniger vielfältig. Schmeckt ein wenig Hopfiger mit leichten Eisen-Anklängen. Fruchtig ist es, herb und lang anhaltend. Der Schaum ist toll! Steht ewig und ist leicht Off-white!

Can. Nice pour with decent head fading quickly. Wonderful aroma. Good, solid IPA flavor.

Golden with a small white head. Aroma is biscuit, caramel, passion fruit, oranges, grapefruit, pineapple, lemongrass, pine. Same in taste with some mango and apricot, very complex and tasty. Bittersweet aftertaste.

Clear yellow golden. Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, apricot, maybe passion fruit and some tropical fruits, maybe mango? Taste is moderately bitter with grapefruit, citrus and a certain dried apricot sweetness. Medium carbonation, medium mouthfeel.

Tropical aroma (passion fruit IMO) Pours a nice clear golden colour with an off white fluffly head. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, Slightly bitter finish. An incredibly drinkable and enjoyable session IPA.

Can. Mild copper with an off white head. A nicely balanced tropical forward hop aroma with a crisp malt presence, moderate+ carbonation and a moderate body, dry with a bitter finish that brings out mango skin and some lemon with hints of resin. Tasty.

0,33l Flasche. Hopfen und Citrus Duft. Goldgeld, fester Schaum. Angenehm reduzierte Kohlensäure. Kräftige Grapefruit und Chiccore Aromen. Sehr runder Geschmack. Sehr langer schön bitterer Abgang. Vom Fass habe ich es noch süffiger in Erinnerung, aber auch aus der Flasche klasse!
Pours amber with a white head. Aroma of Malts, citrus, fruit and grass. Taste is caramel and citrus.

500ml can. Pours a slightly hazy pale gold with a two finger creamy off-white head. Smells fantastic! Resinous hops, grapefruit, pineapple, and lemon candies. As for taste, mineral notes up front with resinous hops, papaya notes, grapefruit and an odd faint black licorice taste that isn’t unpleasant or out of place. That leads into straw-like malt notes and a slightly watery fruit forward finish. This is a rock solid session IPA!

Aroma: alcohol is mot detectable, just fruity floral elements of hops.
Flavor is bread like malty and like basket of tropical fruits sweet, slightly bitter, with dry finish.
Malt sweetness is medium, hop bitterness also, body is sticky, carbonation is low.
Several times from bottle/can/keg. Very pale ale-ish ipa. Overall score from 3.3 to 3.7.

Bouteille, 33cl, à domicile. Belle couleur, belle mousse peu persistante, peu pétillante. Jolie puissance des houblons, notes fruitées type fruits d’été (abricot, melon), et agrumes. Finale sèche et longueur en bouche suffisante.
Had it after a kleffe blond. Recreshing, Nice hoptaste. No bizarre cheesy side taste or whatever brewproblems possible

nice golden appearance, with a fruity aroma, perfectly carbonated. Very easy to drink. This is definitely the best beer that was made my BrewDog. The interesting story behind the brewery makes it that extra special

Red orange body with a light white quickly dissipating head. Aroma is light and hoppy. Taste of caramel wood and hops.

Bottle from Albert Heijn Belgium. This is the Equity for punks bottle. Pours clear golden with very small head. Medium bitterness with a clear influence of the more exotic types of hop that were added in this beer. This beer has become more watery over the years.

Nice golden a bit hazy color with almost unnoticable head. Aroma tropical fruits, mosty lychee and mango; pine and spruce resin and citrus. Taste citrus, lychee and resin, mosty spruce resin. IT has a strange aftertaste some kind of anise but it could be just spruce resin. Bitterness is very light but it has nice resiny finish. Medium/soft carbonated, flat bod. IT is quite dry.

Bottle 330ml. Clear golden-yellow with small white head. The aroma has notes of tropical fruits and citrus with some graininess. The flavor has medium hoppy bitterness, notes of citrus and some tropical fruits, piney and grassy with some graininess, quite clean. Light to medium-bodied. Nice.

Le liquide est assez opaque, avec une couleur jaune-orangée et une mousse éphémère d’apparence savonneuse. Du point de vue olfactif, on se situe dans les fruits tropicaux et le sapin. En bouche, elle est un brin aqueuse mais les saveurs typiques de Simcoe et de Cascade ressortent rapidement. Les malts soutiennent bien toute l’affaire, en restant bien sûr bien en retrait. L’amertume est de faible à moyenne. Une IPA correcte, bien faite, mais qui ne mérite pas d’éloges particulières.

Clear golden color, minimal white head. Aroma of hops, exotic fruits and grapefruits. Taste is very fruity with thin aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Easy to drink. Very nice, fruity IPA. Needs more hops for my liking

330ml can poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is hazy orange with a medium sized frothy beige head that reduced quickly, leaving a little lacing behind on the glass. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation. BrewDog Punk is overall a good solid IPA.

330ml bottle. Love punk ipa - tropical/peachy flavour. so glad that it’s so readily available nowadays.

Can’t help thinking of Lux Interior of The Cramps singing "You ain’t no punk, you punk" when drinking & thinking about this beer. Not sure I’d call this version of the IPA punk, but I do like it. Comes on stronger than a last call pickup line at the local bar on the nose & you have to love the tropical fruit punch from the hops. Distinct in the current Ontario, Canada market where we are in drowning in clone session IPAs & the same-old-same-old hop cpmbo IPAs. Reminds me of a soft rock version of one of my favourite IPAs from New Zealand, Hopwired.
Bottle. Grassy, hoppy, nice lingering modest ibu bitterness. Enjoyed it more with each sip. Would recommend
This was a great introduction to the IPA style. When at a pub, it’s always a great brew to fall back on towards the end of the night, after having tasted various other beers.
Bottle. Pours clear amber with medium head. Aroma is resin, peach, citrus. Body is medium dry and oily. Taste is flowers.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, opalizujące. Piana średniej wysokości, drobna. 

AROMAT: Intensywny. Bogactwo cytrusów i owoców tropikalnych. W tle delikatne nuty słodowe.

Très beau produit.
Le nez annonce une belle complexité aromatique : abricot, agrumes, arrière légèrement boisé.
En bouche, le houblon amarillo se fait la part belle et est bien complété par le simcoe comme l’annonçait le nez.
En plus de tout cela, le boisé s’exprime dans des notes de pin.
On trouve une curieuse première sensation de rondeur appuyée par un fond acide qui agace le bout de la langue. La fin est plutôt amère mais laisse une longueur assez florale.
On ne cherche pas l’équilibre dans ce genre de bière mais plutôt le feu d’artifice d’arômes qui changent d’une gorgée à l’autre.

Looooool. No Ratey for this new pretender. Neat clean golden, visible carbonation and a soft filmy cap with specks of lacing. Nose is punchy grapefruit, brushes of pine and an odd woody/hobnobby follow through if you dig deep enough. Blueberry and grapiness is more noticeable after the first couple of bangs. Has a decent, clean daub of clementine steeliness from a lot of bottled Brewdog efforts over the last few years. Solid carbonation throughout and a decent gumminess from the mouthfeel. Plods of bitterness, not quite as stifling as IT USED TO BE OBVIOUSLY with a fair dunt of sweetness here. It’s improved vastly recently, a few massive cans have been crushed and it’s best that my Sainsbros don’t stock the bombers - drinkability is clean, grassy brush of a mouthfeel. Finishes a bit more piney and grapey with an earnest sweet breadiness and linger is a lot dryer than things have been over the last while. Sumptous orange and lemon peel linger after things settle in. 
I’ve had many bottles of this from a crap Spoons or Maclays Inn recently, paying about three quid more in the latter than the former, but it’s great to see this as such a prevalent option nowadays. 

Bottle, Batch 336, Bottled 26/06

Solid, fruity IPA. Blonde body. Big tropical and grapefruit taste. Slight sweetness and mild bitterness. Fruit definitely dominates. Good summer IPA.
Amber colour, white nice head. Sweet, malty aroma with lot of citrus fruits, flowers and grass. Taste is also quite sweet with hops and medium bitterness.

Piwo ma biala piane,sredniopecherzykowa,dosc wolno opadajaca,kolor jasno slomkowy,zapach jak to w piwach od BrewDoga GENIALNY,czuc owoce,truskawki,w tle przebija sie poziomka,banan,smak rowniez bardzo w porzadku,choc moglo by miec wiecej goryczki,w sumie bardzo dobre i bardzo pijalne piwo

Draught @ Taphouse w the CEO. Appearance: pours slightly hazy amber with ok white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, hints of toffee, lots of citrus, oranges and tropical fruits. palette: strong aroma, average carbonation, medium body, average malt sweetness, average to distinct bitterness, medium duration and an oily texture. Overall: nice "fruity" ipa

Bottle from Coop. Pours clear golden with a little head. Grassy hops and bitterness dominate this beer, but it is still easily drinkable through its dryness. Through its availability and price, this is a very good craft beer for every day usage.
330ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours light orange with a white head. Aroma is pineapple, mango. Smooth and drinkable, with a great finish.

06,06,2015
Kolor jasno bursztynowy, klarowny.
Piana koloru białego, zbudowana z drobnych i niewielkiej ilości średnich pęcherzyków, średnio trwała.
Aromat to eksplozja mango i intensywna słodowość z niewielką dawką chmielowej trawiastości. Już otwarciu butelki towarzyszył intensywny zapach owoców.
Smak Punk IPA to po prostu mango, słodkie, lekko marchewkowe z odrobiną nut pomarańczy i limonki, również w smaku występuje chmielowa, sucha trawiastość, jest rewelacyjnie.
Goryczka jest dość długa, ale nie zalegająca, sucha, przyjemna, taka, jaka być powinna.
Wysycenie w "Punku" jest niskie, alkoholu w ogóle nie czuć.
Brewdog Punk IPA jest lekko tłustawe i jednocześnie lekkie, rewelacyjnie pijalne. Po wypiciu jednego chce się sięgnąć po następne i następne i następne i ...

14.08.2021
Kolor ciemnego złota, klarowny. Piana biała, wysoka i trwała, zdobienia niezbyt efektowne (brak krążkowania) ale i tak nie jest źle.
Aromat nie jest bardzo intensywny, jest raczej stonowany. Są oczywiście chmielowe nuty owocowe (cytrusy) i słodkie akcenty słodowe.
Smak wytrawny, goryczka ma tutaj charakter zestu grapefruitowego i jest umiarkowanie wysoka.
Wysycenie wysokie. Ciało raczej średnie. Tekstura gładka. Posmak średnio długi, chmielowy.
Wygląd 4, Aromat 7, Smak 7, Podniebienie 3, Razem 16, Ocena: 3,7/5

Finally rating this one. Clear golden-orange color with white head. Aroma is huge tropical fruits, mango, passionfruit, some apricot and grapefruit. Taste is straightforward fruity, little malt body, some spruce, low refreshing bitterness for an IPA. Carbonation is kicky, but not too high. A very refreshing and clean IPA with low residual sweetness. Nothing much to criticize, but not edgy enough to be a real winner. Still a perfect thirst-quencher. Wow, given the high availability and low price, why do I have this so rarely?

Hazy golden body, capped my a moderate white head. More complex than the first few sips let on. Has some bitterness, then tasted fruity, tropical sweet, than finishes with some piney bitterness on the swallow. Extremely quaffable. Really quite a good IPA that I would definitely stock up on if available in my area.

Poured into a taster showing cloudy mango orange with very light to light filtration. 

A lot of apricot, mango, passion fruit, and guava with hints of pineapple on the nose. Mostly tropical fruit forward aromas at a very good intensity. 

The palate is medium bodied with an almost gritty/chewable malt, very little bitterness, drinking more like a pale ale than an IPA.
Another great IPA by Brewdog. Great fruity aroma, gold appearance with white head. One of the best!
Pours a clear yellow with a somewhat substantial white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, spruce and some peaches. Taste is citrus, pine with some mild bitterness in the background.

Poured from a 12oz bottle.

Aroma - definite caramel tones from this one - with some hints of tropics.

Appearance - Hazy yellow coloring...almost appears as if there are partials floating. 

Taste - Decent flavor for a 5.6% beer. Some nice lingering aftertastes.
330ml Flasche. Golden mit leichter Trübung. Kleine Schaumkrone. Angenehmes Hopfenaroma. Leicht bitter mit mildem, erfrischenden Abgang. Sehr gut trinkbar.

On tap at The Bridge House, Belfast (Wetherspoons). Pours sort of hazy golden color with a huge white head. Aroma is sort of malty hop Aroma. Both are quite prominent. Flavor is very creamy hop citrus with tons of caramel malt. Bitter finish. Overall quite malty up front and hoppy bitter finish in the back. Very much English IPA. We
Aroma: fresh citrus. Appearance: hazy gold. Aroma: fruity like the nose, very drinkable. A great IPA.

Dorata pallida, limpida, schiuma bianca di media persistenza.
Aroma molto forte di passion fruit e lieve pompelmo, leggero maltato.
Al palato molto meglio che a naso, attacca dolce con passion fruit e malti chiari, successivamente bella nota di frumento, un po' di crosta di pane ed amaro erbaceo discretamente lungo unito ad una coda amara citrica.
Corpo leggero, molto carbonata, anche se non ne risente la sua bevibilità, molto buona.
Passion fruit anche nel retrolfatto.
Ottima IPA.
Uma IPA bem amarga, porém sem comprometer seu sabor. Aroma discreto e aparência dourada.

En copa Teku. De Hipercor. Nueva etiqueta. Botella. Leyendo C++20 for Programmers Ch5. Sigue siendo de lo mejorcito de Brewdog, por lo menos de lo que venden en los supermercados. Ligera pero con amargor muy agradable y largo retrogusto
Bitter with grapefruit aroma and aftertaste. Always a wonderful experience.
bottle. Intense citrus aroma. Balanced taste and long bitter after flavor. too much aroma and flavor of nz nelson hops which lowers the points a bit.

12oz bottle from 16.99 4p. Pours a hazy orange with a small white head quick to dissipate. Smells lightly of brett to me not much going on in the nose. Has a very smooth yet carbonated body and is very easily drinkable, a+ mouthfeel. Taste is rather easy going, light brett balance with hops. Good but not worth the price point
Bottle. Orange, citrus, spruce smell and taste. Higher bitterness and sweetness. Orange, hazy look with firm head. Very nice IPA. Note: Keg version is not that good.

Dorada clara anaranjada con no mucha espuma. Brutal aroma a hierbabuena y naranja. Lo continua en un sabor altamante aromático, manteniendo los mismos tonos, en un conjunto muy agradable y bebible, de cuerpo medio y baja carbontacación. Una gran Ipa de graduación contenida.

Excelente aroma de herbal, com um fundo de maracujá, espuma farta e persistente, coloração dourada ligeiramente opaca. Na boca, lupulo mostra à que veio, herbal, lembrando a grama fresca, o malte faz fundo coadjuvando perfeitamente, final amargo, curto e seco.

Ipa « post modern classic » de 5,6 % abv, à l’étiquette au nouveau style hachuré.
Couleur orangé clair abricoté, au très léger voile diffus.
Bulles fines en colonnes droites, assez vives.
Mousse blanche à flocons moyens, nappante à 1 mm.
Arômes de houblon fleuri, agrumes, fruit de la passion, ananas.
1ère bouche souple sur du houblon bien ciselé, fleurs de haie vive, aubépine, pointe de citron vert délicate.
Arrière-bouche très équilibrée malt/houblon, avec une amertume complexe.
2ème sur des agrumes, houblon, malt clair.
Arrière-bouche à l’amertume incisive et très longue.
3ème avec les fruits en avant, le malt qui suit, et le tout en rétro-nez.
Arrière-bouche complexe, très harmonieuse.
Longueur au nez merveilleux, et avec les saveurs qui se fondent et ouvrent de nouvelles portes.
Jambes groupées, finement marquées.
Levure ample, fleurie, très grande ligne.
Alcool qui accomplit son travail sans rechigner, et semble se complaire dans cette ambiance.
Finale vaste, avec de nouvelles découvertes.
CONCLUSION : une vraie ipa, même si elle est punk, et plus encore « post modern classic » …
Nous ne lui en voulons pas pour si peu !!! Au contraire, on en reprendra … poil au rat !!

Golden hazy color. Nice initial head, that kept a small lace till the end. Medium to soft carbonation. Medium body and oily texture. Aroma is citrus (orange), passion-fruit, peach, grass and hops. Taste is light sweet, moderate bitter and spicy. Aftertaste is semi-dry and astringent.

Bottle. Slightly hazy orange color, nice white lacing head. Very fresh, citrus, mandarine, ginger and peach flavour. Well balanced taste, starts light sweet, goes over to a decent bitterness, lightly salty. Medium mouthfeel, average to low carbonation, good. Citrus aftertaste with pine resin, bitterness coming thu, sweet malt balance. 

Great IPA, very diversified, enjoyed it!

Butelka. Barwa złota, klarowna. Piana bardzo niska, drobno pęcherzykowa. Aromat grejpfruta, nektarynki. Smak podobnie. Goryczka na średnim poziomie, niezalegająca. Wysycenie średnie, średnio pełne. Bardzo pijalne, przyjemne. 


                                                                    Brewdog, Warszawa. Punk IPA kegged 14.07 klarowne bez piany. Aromat delikatny chmielowy, delikatnie słodowy.  Smak nie urywa. Średnia do niskiej goryczka. Wysycenie wysokie punktowe. Swierzości zbytniej nie czuć.

Pours a slightly hazy, dark straw color with an off-white head. Lots of fruity hops in the aroma filled with tropical fruits, peaches and orange peel. Has a light and slick mouth feel, and a solid but balanced bitterness. A fresh and well-balanced IPA.
Flavor is citrus, specifically a bright, orange flavor to start, which fades into a pine bitterness. This is the first memorable IPA I’ve had in quite a while. Very good.
Out of the bottle from Ashfield mall, great balanced hoppy stuff. Nice partner getting me thru Frozen again.

Обрадован данным панком, особенно был, когда вскрыл бутылку. Немного разочаровало смазанное послевкусие.

golden, sparkling, minimal head, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, average carbonation, slick feel, medium body,

Bottle from Systembolaget. White, bubbly head. Copper body. Smells of grass and citrus. Tastes bitter with a splash of fruits (orange, grapefruit, lemon, pineapple) bringing out a lot of sweetness. Simple but very well balanced.
One of my favorites. Truly hoppy. Aroma is strong and taste is full. Just as IPA should be.
Enorm fruitig bier die makkelijk weg drinkt. Lekkere IPA met een heerlijke nasmaak.
Copper orange, light head and citrus aroma. Definitely tastes fruity rather than hoppy. I would drink a few of these quite happily.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours slightly hazy orange with small white head. Aroma is sweet and hoppy, malty, citrus, pine. Taste is malty, slightly bitter, slightly sweet, citrus, oranges-peaches, fruity. Medium body. Smooth bitter finish.

Good citrus aroma. Perfect color. Very little hop flavor compared to West Coast IPA. It taste like one of the few IPAs I could drink a 6 pack of.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
