On tap @Pulp Pub. One of my most favorite IPA ever. Full body, creamy lasting white head, clear amber color, grain+straw malts, citrus, orange, grapefruit aromas, notes of pineapple, peach and exotic fruits, very refreshing. A hop-head’s delight and most definitely a classic. Bottoms up, PUNK!
Espuma fina, aroma de maracujá. Gosto lembra o maracujá com algo citrico. Amargor presente. Retrogosto frutado.

Bottle at Bagpiper’s inn.
Hazy, pale golden, white heavy head.
Fruity hops aroma.
Ordinary taste. Fresh
Ok for ipa

330ml bottle, pours a clear gold, with decent staying thin white head. Fabulous fruit bowl aroma- mango, pineapple, peach, melon and some citrussy, sweet grapefruit coming through. Taste is tropical fruit held up by some biscuity malt. Great mouth feel with a moderate bitter finish. Delicious and hard to fault.

Tap (ZUP, Wroclaw). Piwo klarowne o zlocistej barwie z biala piana, niezbyt trwala. Aromat grapefruitowy, intensywny, przyjemny. Goryczka wyrazna, cytrusowa skontrowana slodycza owocow tropikalnych. Piwo pijalne, lekkie w odczuciu, bardzo przyjemne.

Une des mes IPA préférées
Les notes d’agrumes sont présentés, l’amertume bien maîtrisée
Une top beer à avoir dans son frigo!

First ever brewdog to see what all the hype is about and its not to my style but can see what all the fuss is about tastes grapefruit mandarins grass nice on the tongue Tarty bitter finish will have to route out some more obscure brews of theirs , bottle from Morrison’s.
pint at Vultures Lane, Ak City poured gold & lacy leaving fine rings all the way through tastes really good full of subtle spicy pineapple citrus hoppy earthy flavours

Pours hazy lemon yellow. White head.
Intense aromas of lemon yogurt, banana, citrus drop, grass, passion fruit...
Fresh sourness, subtle bitterness. A bit on the watery side, but nice.
An India Pale Ale from Scotland. That’s a cool thought. Tastes a bit spicy on the aftertaste.
Tap. Good head. Good lacing. Good balance of hops and malts. Earthy. Should pair well with food

This is one of my favourite IPAs ever. 
Pours a clear golden bewerage. Looks like an average lager, but is so much more. 
Tickles my nose with grapefruit, honey, bread and blossoms. A taste that reminds me of sweet summerloving with a bittersweet taste of eternal love. More grapefruit!
Drink it, enjoy it, love it!
Golden, little foam. Very fruity aroma, mango, pineapple. Taste is about similar, pine. Medium bitterness for an ipa. Nice but body is a bit thin and finish a bit short.

Kullankeltainen olut vaahtoaa hieman vaisunpuoleisesti ja vaahto myös kutistuu nopeasti jääden kuitenkin hyvin ohueksi pinnaksi oluen päälle. Tuoksu onneksi kompensoi hieman tylsää ulkonäköä. Se on todella voimakas ja havaittavissa on ainakin mangoa, hedelmällisyyttä, sitrusta ja kevyttä ruohoisuutta,joka ei kuitenkaan ole pistävää vaan pikemminkin todella lempeää. Suuntautuma on keskitäyteläinen, mutta kestää suussa pitkään. Mausta löytyy runsas sitrushedelmien puraisu, jota tasapainottaa mukavasti vahva, mutta tasapainoinen katkerointi. Jälkimaku on varsin kevyt, ehkä hieman tahmainen. Kokonaisuuteena kuitenkin todella hyvä olut, johon ei kyllästy ja jota aina haluaa.

Big frothy open head. Golden colour. Grassy nose and big grassy bitter bite. Nice balanced and subtle sour edge which had me checking the label for wheat, but there is none. I would say new world Ipa in style - it doesn’t the have up front fruit but it’s bitter and sour gives it a pleasing pamplemousse quality.
Clear golden beer with a thin white head and a sharp hoppy aroma. Flavour is likewise, with a bit of grapefruit in there. Crisp, refreshing.
Aan de geur van het bier moet ik even wennen, maar ik vind het een lekker bier. Goed doordrinkbaar, lekker fris, superhop zorgt voor pittig bittertje.

Bottle from Sainsbury’s, Crossgate Moor, £1.90/330ml

Middle amber in colour. The aroma is strong but pleasant, damp leaves and ripe fruits. First taste is bitter, giving way to very pleasant tropical fruitiness with Amarillo flavour coming through. Very smooth drinking. A fashionable beer but justifiably so.

Still ’New’ Punk to me, this is a well ramped down version which is more emancipated with more malt and an almost gingery spiciness. Civilised and decent but such a pale imitation of once was. As punk as Rick Astley.
2015-05-03 - A very special bottle, highly original. The beer is good as well, but not as outstanding.

330ml can (BB 18/8/15) from Dan Murphys. Hazy orange body with a stable frothy white head providing a decent lace. Nose offers plenty of citrus fruits with oranges and grapefruit to the fore, pine needles and a decent biscuity malt bill. Flavour is similar with a good balance of malt and hops and a firm but not overpowering bitterness to the finish. Palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated with an oily texture and easy drinkabiliity. Overall very nice though I suspect the hop freshness suffers a little bit in the long journey from Scotland.
Bottle at home. Aroma is fresh and pleasant: tropical fruit and grassy. Taste is more of the same. Body is fairly light and drinkable. Good sessionable IPA, highly drinkable with light bitter finish.

The beer is very cloudy and has a yellow/orange color. The beer pours a white foam, after seconds almost none if it is left. The smell is nice and sweet. It has citrusy hop flavors and a ’green’ aroma. Really fruity. The taste has some more IPA bitterness in it. The fruity aroma’s in smell are also present in the taste. The fruit aroma’s in the smell could have been a little stronger. Nice beer.

Appearance: pours with a very small beige head, the beer is a very hazy golden color, you can see tiny particles throughout 
Aroma: grain, grass, pine, very subtle but I like it
Taste: citrus, flowers, mildly bitter for an ipa, has something that reminds me of Scotland, 
Palate: gentle bitter aftertaste, light mouthfeel, lively carbonation 
Overall: I like this, it's even better when you realize it's practically a session ipa, not very bitter but has a good taste to it

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Colore biondo, carbonazione non ecccessiva.
Aroma agrumato, pompelmo, molto intenso, anche resinoso ed erbaceo.
Buon bilanciamento tra le note maltate dolci e l’amaro lungo, agrumato.
Buena combinación de maltas y lúpulos, color amarillo pálido, bastante turbia y espuma abundante y persistente.

11.2 oz bottle. Aroma is bready malt, perfumy; smells pretty old, although it says it’s good until 7/8/14...wait, it’s 2015 isn’t it? Shit! Pours cloudy orange with a collapsing white head. Tastes old, smells old...I screwed up here. I’m going to give it the benefit of the doubt and give it a higher score than it deserves. I will re-rate when I get a fresher bottle.

From tap. Very nice citrus and grapefruit aroma with spruce note. Gold, clear color. Good foam with nice lacing. Medium carbonized. American hops in taste with malt behind. Medium, grapefruit bitterness, quickly disappears. Nice hoppy aftertaste. Very good IPA.
Orangish, slightly hazy with thin white head. Aroma is floral and a little citrusy. Flavor is similar bitter and citrus. Good.
Nice orange color with a white head. Smell is very fruity, exotic, reminds me grapefruit. Taste too, with a balanced bitterness. Light body and very drinkable, very nice.
Has a really tropical aroma and slightly in the taste. Grew on me as I drank it. Really good.

0,33l bottle from beerbottle.eu. Very fine and well-balanced IPA. Excellent drinkability.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

6 oz pour from refrigerated bottle into Spiegelau IPA glass. Fairly clear, yellow, with a large white head. Mouthfeel is between creamy and smooth. Nose is citrus and weak pine. Taste is not too impressive-- piney, wheaty, and grassy. Alright. Wouldn’t buy, but wouldn’t turn down.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy orange colored brew with an fruity bitter taste with hints of citrus and pine.

Pours clear gold with frothy white head. Great aroma of passionfruit, citrus, mango and a bit herbal aswell. Taste is medium bitter with light sweet. Bitter aftertaste, light body, quite strong carbonation for an IPA. Great beer, easy drinking, refreshing, aromatic.

Poured from bottle, hazy gold with medium white head. Aroma with notes of bread, some caramel, citrus, flowers and pine. Taste is nicely bitter with a medium malt body and a long refreshing after taste.
Uma IPA equilibrada, espuma de média formação, sabor suave, uma das melhores do estilo que já provei!

Pours hazy golden with a thick, creamy head. Some beautiful lacing left on the glass. Fruity aroma of clear citrus notes, oranges, some yellow fruits as well. Very hoppy as well. Bit grassy if you ask me. Nice aroma, not the most astonishing ever, but enjoyable if you ask me. Taste is moderately sweet with the fruity notes hanging around pretty long. The ending has a nice hopbitter which feels a bit dry, yet the sweetness remains in a nice, mild and extremely refreshing manner. This is actually pretty good. Fairly decently balanced, tasty, drinkable, and easy to drink and to get. More than enjoyable thirst quencher on the sunnier days of the year. A bit on the thinnish side (slightly watery), but that’s a minor point. Good brew.
Nice floral nose, good appearance but disappointing head. Decent bitterness, could have been a bit better balanced. Pleasant, full mouthfeel.
Bottle. Yellow color with small head. Aroma of grapefruit, tropical fruits. Taste is medium bitter. Texture is watery. Drinkable, sessionable beer. Finish is rather short for IPA. Nice easy-one IPA.
Sabores citricos con espuma blanquecina y cuerpo medio. Olores frutales citricos. Muy refrescante.
Floral aroma of hops and grape, cloudy caramel color with a medium lasting white well laced head. Dry feel with a floral hops taste with a hint of grape. Dry floral finish.
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden, with a white head. Taste grapefruit, hops, Fruits, watery finish. Sticky mouthfeel, decent ipa.

Brown bottle, co-op, Edinburgh. 33cl. Pours medium amber with a medium white head, subsiding at an average rate. Scent is a full-bodied hoppy IPA, hints of lemon zest, and notes of grass. Taste is easy drinking, has a perfectly earthy center, and soft carbonation that resonates with the complexion. Finish is clean but leaves a bit burpy. Great.

330 ml bottle. Clear dark golden orange with white head. Smell is fruity mango and tropical fruit, pine and floral. Taste is light grain sweetness with tropical fruit, caramel, flowers, resin, grapefruit and pine. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Poured into an ipa-glass. Almost clear golden hue with a creamy head that leaves nice looking lacing. The nose features some pine and tropical fruits. Flavour is mango, passionfruit, some sweetness, bit of light bread. Meduim bitterness and a short and clean aftertaste. Good but nothing extraordinary

Strong pine scents and floral.Pours clear golden with a tight bubble white head with plentiful lacing. Nice big hops with a sweet balancing note to the astringent but not sour hops dominance. pleasantly fizzed mouthfeel with a medium length finish that builds longer as you drink it. I like it
This is my first IPA (can),  any way, comfortable bitterness and flaver like tropical fruit. Not much unique, but can be star in the classroom. I love him.

Warka: 005 BBAA 06.01.16. Szkło: Teku. Barwa złota lekko opalizująca, wysycenie śrenie ku niskiemu. Piana ładna drobno i sredniopęcherzykowa, dosc szybko opada. W aromacie żywica, cytrusy i owoce tropikalne. W smaku goryczka średnia, przyjemna z wyraźną podbudową słodową. Piwo sprawia wrażenie lekko wodnistego a co za tym idzie, jest ekstremalnie pijalne. Sesyjne IPA.
0,33 l bottle. Murky pale red golden in the glass, small head. Very fruity on the nose. Starts smooth fruity, mango and grapefruit in the first row, followed by a decent bitterness. Sweet aftertaste.
Hazy golden colour with a light creamy medium white head. Tropical fruits, pineapple and some floral-herbal notes. Bit fruity light oily texture and medium body. Bitterness develops. Lasting finish.

Bottle. Excellent. If ever I need something reliable, something that’s going to hit the spot, then this is the one I reach for. Punk’s like an old friend now. Good complexity. Bitter, tropical then bitter again. (It’s also handy as a bad beer saver - many’s the crap beer I’ve made drinkable by adding a soupÃ§on of Punk to it!) Aberdeenshire’s finest export. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Origin: Tap. Vessel: Pint Glass. Locale: Za Za Bazaar (Bristol). Citrus bite with bitter aftertaste.
0,33 bottle... amber color,,, limited head... a little bit too bitter for my taste...

Bottle (0.33), bb 1.10.15. Golden, cloudy beer. Aromas of tropical fruits and a hint of toffee. Taste of mango and citrus fruits, medium bitterness. Extremely drinkable and refreshing. A very good IPA.
pours cloudy amber with a thick off-white head and a fruity aroma. There is a full-bodied toffee and citrus flavor with a bitter finish.

Shared 660ml bottle. Pours clear and coppery with a foamy white head. Strong tropical fruit aroma, matched in the flavour with grapefruit and heavy bitterness. The creamy mouthfeel rounds off a great beer

Bière directe droite dans ses bottes sûre de ces effets, expressive dans le fruité, l’acidulé et l’amer piquant ... Désaltérante aussi.
Un classique efficace et une bière que l’on trouve facilement à un prix acceptable !

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy, dark straw color with an off-white head. Lots of fruity hops in the aroma filled with peaches, tropical fruits, orange peel, dry hay and mowed grass. Pretty straight forward. The flavor follows up with more grassy hops, pale malt and hay. A little dry in the aftertaste. Has a light and slick mouth feel, and a solid but balanced bitterness. A fresh, fruity and well-balanced IPA.

Zapach z butelki to silne uderzenie mango, a jednocześnie zapowiedź czegoś co lubię najbardziej – amerykańskiego chmielu. Piwo jest w kolorze jasnobursztynowe, lekko zamglone. Piana biała, dosyć drobne, niska. Aromat ze szkła to zniewalające dawka limonki, pomarańczy, grejpfruta i mango – jest po prostu genialny! Czas na pierwszy łyk… W smaku nadal dominują nuty z chmielenia na zimno – przede wszystkim mango. Słodowość jest bardzo delikatna, niemal niezauważalna. Goryczka bardzo przyjemna, dosyć krótka. Piwo jest świeże, lekkie, niezamulające – w porównaniu z innymi IPA bardzo pijalne. Dosyć wysoko wysycone w stosunku do tego, czego można by się spodziewać po pianie. Ekstrakt jak na styl jest niski – to podwyższa pijalność, ale przez to piwu brakuje podbudowy słodowej. Ma zadziwiająco czysty charakter, więc albo było fermentowane w niskiej temperaturze – czyżby było fermentowane w niskiej temperaturze? To piwo to dla mnie zagadka

330ml bottle. Hazy golden yellow with a white small head. Fruity and sweet aroma, mango, pineapple, kiwi, lime. The taste is dry and sweet, grapefruit, caramel, honey, citrus, low bitterness. The aftertaste is a bit of over-ripe peach and pineapple.
Draft at Standing Goose Brewing in Guangzhou, China. Big on aroma, big on flavour, without doubt the best IPA I have ever tried. Definitely a top 5 beer of all time!

+++ OCENA Z NOTATEK, KTÓRE SPORZĄDZAŁEM PRZED PRZEJŚCIEM NA RATEBEER.COM - PIWA NIEDOSTĘPNE LUB TAKIE, KTÓRYCH NIE PLANUJĘ DEGUSTOWAĆ PONOWNIE +++

Data degustacji: 2014-11-08
Data przydatności: 20104-22

Wyraźne lychee

Pours a half finger of head on a hazy medium straw body.
The aroma is big. Lots of mango, pineapple and orange. 
The taste is big on the bitterness, but the malt is always lurking in the background making is very drinkable.
The texture is crisp.
Great aroma and flavor.

0,33 bottle. Golden color with thin medium head. Stays for few seconds. Aroma of Citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit. Nice. Taste: nice bitter kick, grapefruit , leaves little dry taste in the mouth. Very good beer.
33cl @ bottle. Ormai Ipa classica, questa punk di Brewdog. Aroma floreale e di agrumi, amaro ben bilanciato. Beverina.

Bottle BBE 19/01/16. Well-chilled. Clear copper body with small white head. Intense, hop-forward herbal aromas. Some banana/clove and a little grapefruit citrus. Medium sweetness with only a creeping light-medium bitterness and perceptible sourness, this is perhaps surprisingly well-balanced. Medium body with a slightly oily texture, Low to medium carbonation and a bitter finish. A defining modern IPA, Punk isn’t overly complex, but has plenty of character and is a highly enjoyable expression.
Golden color with a thin white head. Amazing citrus aromas. One of my favorite beer!
Golden colour. Little hazy. Little to no head. Tastes of citrus, pine and fresh hops. A good IPA. Have had many of these, will have more.
Promissising fruity aroma very interestting. Cloudy appearance. Distinct flowery fruity taste balanced with good bitter and sweet palate. An absolute favourite.

10.6.2014. Refreshing aroma with pine, lots of grapefruit and citrus. Taste of malts, pine, grapefruit. Unfortunately it used to be better but I still like it, also cause it was The IPA for me to get all this started.

I had this few times before, bottled and tapped. This time it was a bottle. Clear light amber with medium white head. Aroma of hops, citrusy, tropical fruit, mango. Taste is medium bitter, nice hoppy kick that lasts for a while. light sweet. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Long bitter finish. This is a superb IPA, perfectly balanced and very drinkable.

Bottle @ Viru Keskus, Tallinn.
Very solid beer with herbal aroma, strong bitterness and long finish. Like it. It is first IPA I tried and still one of my favorites.
Hoppy herbal spice aroma. Murky Amber colour fair head and lacing. Malt herbal hop spice flavour. Smooth lingering palate. Wonderful beer!
Aroma has rich citrus flavor. Nice golden color, little hazy, no head. Taste is complex, it has heavy bitter taste, finish is astringent and long. Very drinkable.
Can at home. Had this numerous times. Very nice oranges, citrus, nice round bitterness, good stuff.

Bottle. Amber, medium white head, good retention. Medium carbonation. Aroma pines, grapefruit, taste similar with a nice hoppy finish. Good IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pours golden yellow with a white head. Fruity aromas like pine. Taste is moderately hoppy. Nice beer with a somewhat thin mouthfeel though.
Bottle. Clear, orange, frothy, white foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.

Brightly golden colour with a medium white head, with good duration.
Aroma is lighlty malty, citrus, and herbal and floral hops.
Taste is so nice. Pale malty base, citrus, and medium/hoght fresh hops bitterness.
Light/medium body but tasty. Very easy to drink.
Textbook modern IPA. Aromas of citrus & tropical fruits, Flavours of citrus fruits, creamy caramel malt... just enough carbonation and bitterness. Nothing mind blowing these days, but very drinkable.
En fût au brother. Blonde. Beau collet. Belle mousse. Fruité. Légèrement malté. Un peu épicé. Florale. Résineuse. Sèche et désaltérante. Miam.
One of my favorit IPAs. Hoppy bit not too bitter with a great smell and I just love those punks

Po otwarciu butelki uderza w nas chmiel. Orzeźwiające cytrusy, po chwili pojawiają się słodkie białe owoce, a po ogrzaniu na pierwszy plan wychodzą aromaty trawiaste i tytoniowe.
W smaku też chmiel gra główna rolę, choć goryczka sama w sobie jest raczej średnio-niska (jak na IPA oczywiście). Dominują smaki tytoniowo-żywiczne. Słody są ledwo wyczuwalne. Piwo jest bardzo lekkie i wytrawne. Orzeźwiające i ekstremalnie pijalne, znika w szybkim tempie.

330ml can into glass. Beautiful grapefruit/melon nose. Cloudy golden beer with thin white head. Very little carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel followed by developing bitterness. Not as intense as some IPA’s but VERY drinkable.
33cl can, Geers. Floral & exotic hoparoma. Not super pungent. Bit watery. Very drinkable and quenching.
Bottle, aroma is combo of pine and fruit (mango and citrus), clear sweetnes of MO malt, medium body, nice flavor and long aftertaste with light bitterness for an IPA. Nice beer in general.
On tap at Brewdog Barcelona. Golden colour with white head. Citric, fruity aroma. Sweet, citric, tropical fruits, malt taste. Medium body.

Can from a local shop near Kyoto. Pours out a golden topped with a creamy white head. Nose is a total tropical fruit bowl rich malts and a nice sweetness. Taste is as the nose with a great tropical fruit hop and a nice sweet caramel malt. This is pretty tasty.

Sehr fruchtiges IPA 

Farbe: orange bis golden
Schaum: wenig, recht schnell zerfallend
Geruch: Zitrusfrucht-Weingummi, Mango, Maracuja 
Geschmack: ebenso intensiv fruchtig, angenehm bitter

Can from cellarbrations superstore in hami hill. Pours golden with a creamy head, medium
Body and medium carbonation. Nose is sticky hops tropical and citrus with sweet malty notes that also come through. Taste begins quite bitter but mellows out and becomes slightly sweet. There are some grassy notes and a bit of citrus but is very well balanced making a very approachable easy drinking IPA.

330ml bottle bought from fuel station refrigerator. Poured well into a stemmed beer glass. Poured a clear, orangey colour. Held a large white head (Probably due to the glass) which cleared quickly. Floral, fruity aroma. Taste was fresh and crisp with bitter, hoppy developments. Beer improved on drinking. Enjoyable and recommended.

Love the aroma of this beer. Very fresh and strong cirtus.
Bottle, pours hazy golden with slight foam. Medium bodied and crisp.

Una de las mejores IPA que he probado, aunque no han sido todas las que desearía hasta el momento. Sobre todo diría que es una cerveza muy equilibrada, entra muy muy bien, es muy fresca con sabor bastante afrutado, pero no empalaga nada en absoluto, de algo que suelen pecar muchas cervezas de su estilo. Muy recomendable.

Tap. Golden with orange hues colour and white and persistent head. Nice and appetizing aroma, floral hop, resin, eucalyptus and some fruit; balanced and very expressive. Taste is floral, citric, resin and strongly hoppy with bitter aftertaste. Fresh and aromatic bitter finish.
Bottle at Brewhouse and Kitchen. Tropical fruity. Hoppy. Perfectly sweet and bitter. Medium body. Moderate bitter finish. Awesome.
Één van m’n favoriete IPA’s, vol met citrus en hopbitters. Goed doordrinkbaar en smaakvol.
Poured medium orange amber with a healthy off white head. Aroma of sweet citrus and floral hops, soft malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter.
This is fresh IPA beer with good availability nearly everywhere, full flavour natural beer is tribute to the classic IPAs
This beer has been overhyped. It’s alright, but nothing special. Hazy orange with 1-finger head and lacing. Some hops spices, muddled tropical fruits, and some other undiscernible aromas.
Cerveja com arora e sabor caracteristicos mt boa e nao é uma ipa muito amarga aparencia caramelo
Espuma compacta y duradera. Aroma frutal y cítrico. Cuerpo medio, carbonatación media. El sabor es similar al aroma, muy agradable. Final amargo y seco. Muy refrescante.

On tap at Solijca in Belgrade/Serbia. Addio Franjo! Pours a semi-filtered (hazy) pale orange, tick medium white cap. Nose: tropical fruits blast, predominance of mango, also peach. Malty hidden personality. Mouth: medium carbonation, juicy citrus palate, bitterness is well distributed. World class IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Warka 377. 
Jest dobrze, klasycznie na styl. Przyjemne dla nosa, goryczka w balansie - cytrusowa.

Tropical fruits, citrus, pine and some faint sweet caramel malt notes in the aroma. Golden with a white head. Medium sweet and medium to heavy bitter. Medium body with a average carbonation. Dry and bitter in the finish. Overall quite a nice IPA, an refreshing and enjoyable drink.

La Punk IPA è una IPA estremizzata. La voglia dei punkettoni di Brewdog di violare ogni regola portano alla creazione di una birra con sentore complesso di gusti tropicali, agrumi e luppolo. Al palato è penetrante con note di agrumi, biscotti ed un finale aggressivo di luppolo amaro. Per gli intenditori di IPA un must rivolto al futuro.

Strong fruity - orange aroma, clear yellow golden colour with half inch white head. Similar strong fruity taste - lasting. Medium carbonation.
Brewdog - pale golden, little yo no head, clear. Pine citrus aroma and taste,  good finish. Good mouthfeel.  Upped rating.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 14A). Bottle 33 cl - batch 349 CEAA. AROMA: nice moderate hop aromas, with a fruity character (passionfruit, some peach and sweet orange). sweet malt background. APPEARANCE: golden amber and slightly hazy. almost white average head with average retention. TASTE: flavours similar to the aromas (passionfruit, swet oranges, some peach), and some floral notes. sweet malt background. balanced medium bitterness that lingers into a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium-light body with medium carbonation. no hop derived astringency. OVERALL: a very nice and perfumy english IPA, maybe with less malt presence.

12oz can from Masuyo Liquor in Asagaya, Tokyo. Poured into a shaker pint. Strong citrus, grapefruit and pineapple aroma present. Nice on the palate with an amazing balance between the crisp bite of the fruit with the hops. Really drinkable IPA.

On tap at Brewdog Barcelona...Pours a clear, rich gold color with an off-white head. The smell is tropical fruit, citrusand a bit of caramel backing it...juicy. The taste is as it smells ending crisp and a touch dry yet juicy. Light+ in body with average carbonation.
Pours golden amber, aromas of pineapple (tinned in syrup) and fresh pine tree freshener thingy. Tastes like sweet, thick hoppy caramel with a short lived bitterness that is ’deep’.
Silky smooth IPA with big bite. Tropical nose and earthy hop taste. Love the can too! Wicked
Hazy orange body. White fizzy head. Nose of oranges, flowers, citrus, melon, ... Heavily bitter flavour, well balanced. Bit watery mouthfeel. Lovely for its ABV.

By far one of the best beers I have drunk. Its not something that you would want to drink for an entire night but makes an excellent starter. It has an amazing apricot taste and makes for a very strong aroma and flavour. It stays cold very well, compared to many other IPA’s especially compares to a pint of Hooky that my friend was drinking at the time. It’s in my top two favourite beers, alongside old speckled hen. I would defi etley reccomend it to anyone. Although I’m pretty sure I’m not gonna see it for awhile :(. The only downside was that it made me feel very bloated compared to other beers.

Bottle. You can feel the attention needed in order to create a unique recipe like this. Not particularly beautiful at sight, its tropical fruitness and its hoppiness are really well balanced, while the beer is easily drinkable.
Buonissima beva, sapore tropicale molto presente, magari non un sapore eccellente ma la facilità di beva e l’equilibrio sono notevoli. Liscia e bevibile
A whole different animal than your average American IPA. Very fruity and rather sweet up front. Not much happening after the middle but nonetheless quite enjoyable.
Uma excelente IPA com aromas e sabores muito frutados. Muito saborosa e equilibrada. Excelente IPA!

Ottima questa IPA della Brew Dog. Colore paglierino, schiuma bianca appena presente, bassa carbonazione come da aspettativa, direi tendente al secco sul finale, dopo un bel ingresso di luppolo cui segue un fantastico equilibrio di agrodolce tra erbe e agrumi. Al naso agrumata e floreale. Buona.

33 cl. bottle at home. Batch 045 and drunk almost a year after best before date. Forgot it in my cellar plainly. However this additional ageing did not seem to deteriorate from this fresh, fruity IPA which is very drinkable with its fine white head, plenty of carbonation (perhaps a little too much?) and in this case slightly foggy appearance. The latter phenomenon could be due to the "over age". Though enjoyed on a winters day, it reminded me of how great this will be once summer comes along again. And then it has the additional advantage of lots of taste without too much alcohol....good craftsmanship and a delicious IPA.

Bottle from the Albert Heijn in Holland. The beer is blonde colored with a nice large white head and a lot of carbonation. The aroma is rich palate of different fruits like citrus and mango, a lot of hops and spring flowers. Really nicely done. The beer is light bodied with tones with a boost of tropical flavours to end in a nice bitter ending. The finish is dry and very hoppy. A really good IPA, not too bitter and very refreshing.

No es una IPA pero es perfecta porque gusta a todos. El formato craft (bien) llevado al mainstream. Intenso aroma de frutas tropicales como maracuya, guayaba y pomelo en una boca fresca y levemente dulce, con un amargor presente pero suave y equilibrado.

Bottle at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) Pours a clear deep golden colour with a thin white head. Aromas of pineapple, grapefruit, some mango, slight caramel and subtle floral hops. Taste of pineapple, grapefruit, some orange, slight pine, a little caramel and subtle floral hops. Light to medium bodied and moderate carbonation. A lingering, bittersweet, citrus hop bitterness in the finish. A classic IPA, nothing wrong with this.
Golden colour. Good strond aroma, lots of chinook and nelson s. Nice body for low alcohol. A very good low alcohol iPA.
Large bottle from sainsburys. Off white head. Clear golden colour. Grapefruity aroma and taste.

Colour: Pale gold with a thin head.
Nose: overwhelms with fruitiness; mango, banana, mandarin. Undertones of hoppy bitterness and spices.
Flavours: Bitter, crisp-dry with only hints of the fruitiness appear. Fresh and floral.
Finish: medium long, refreshing, with bitterness from the hops.
Verdict: fine IPA, but not special.

Komt uit een blikje. Schuim middelmatig.
Er kwam een geur explosie uit het blikje toen ik hem opende maar toen hij in het glas zat was het nog steeds een geur explosie. Heerlijk fris, zoet en bloemen. Heeft ook iets weg van een goede shampoo.
Niet zoet van smaak maar wel heel erg fruitig en bloemerig. Komt ook meerdere keren terug in je mond. Lichte bitter maar niet veel. De bitter neemt niet de overhand waardoor het een lekker fris biertje blijft. Ik mis toch iets scherps. Ik mis net 1 smaak. Voor de rest vind ik het een goed biertje.
33 cl bottle. Super good ipa. Citrus. Big head. Bittersweet. Super good ipa.
Tap. Pi?kne aromaty cytrusów, ?ywicy i bia?ych owoców. Bardzo dobrze zgrana goryczka i s?odko??. Bardzo pijalne piwo.

As an experiment I tried this 2 years after B.B. Date. A small head but a lacing that stays all the way down. The hop aroma as completely gone and replaced by a vinous character, dried fruit and malt with some hint of yeast. The taste is barleywineish with a sweet bottom line. Berries, fruit, bread and still a decent carbonation level. I enjoied the experiment.
On tap at Super Whatnot 240115. Dark honey colour with an aroma that reminds me of fruit salad. Tastes good and finishes with a hint of malt.

Drunk many times. New label, batch 465 bb 20/11/15. Clear Amber, big fluffy white head that dissipates. Grapefruit, citrus nose (not too much pine). Medium light body, fruity and dry with malty tones. Bitter finish. The flagship that (mostly) delivers.

Pours clear amber with a thick eggshell head. Aroma is not strong, but promises hops and fruit. Flavor, fortunately, is far bolder than the wan aroma, hoppy but not bitter, tropical fruit note almost as strong as the hops. Texture is firm and quite lively. Get punked!

Brewdog Punk IPA, uitgeschonken in tulp bierglas. De geur is gras, citrus grapefruit. Mooie goudgele licht mistige kleur met stevige witte schuimkraag die snel wegzakt. De smaak is droog en fruitig. Veel hop, tonen van gras, groene kruiden en grapefruit. De afdronk is droog en zacht bitter. Lekker biertje, nog eens proberen op een warme zomerdag.
A simple golden ipa with a small head.notes of citric american hops.dry bitterness.frizzy and flat
muy buena birra que me he tomao con mi colega el carlos! anda que no cohone, servecita guena guena.
Une belle IPA, un peu trouble mais pétillante a souhait, un gout de pamplemousse en fond de palais. Délicieuse.

Barwa głęboko pomarańczowa, jednolicie zmętniona. Piana średnio obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa. Mogłoby lepiej koronkować. Aromaty chmielowe, grejpfrutowe, ziołowe, lekko trawiaste, żywiczne. W smaku lekkie, mocno goryczkowe, równoważone słodem i cytrusami. Na języku szerokie, gorycz ściągająca. Wysycenie średnie.
One of my favorite IPA's starts sweet with orange and grapefruit then slight bitterness the smooth finish.

Crisp and light, hop forward pale ale. Very clear with grassy and floral hop notes, clean grapefruit and hop aroma. A bit watery, but very drinkable, a bit soapy bitterness, but otherwise okay, but nothing special.

BB 07/08/15. Poured a hazy amber colour with a one-finger off-white frothy head that retained very well and laced well. Carbonation moderate and medium sized. Aroma strongly fruity, tropical and citrus fruits. Taste initially sweet caramel, then tropical fruits followed by a grapefruit-like bitterness; quite typical IPA. Light body. Crisp, refreshing with a soft bitterness. Nice but milder than many other IPAs.

Couleur jaune-orangé, translucide et effervescence moyenne. Au nez, on remarque principalement le houblons qui s’exprime par ses fortes notes fruitées citronnées. En bouche, c’est naturellement le houblon qui domine, mais un houblon résineux: le citron est plus subtile que l’arôme ne le laisse imaginé. L’amertume est présente en entrée mais se dissimile rapidement et donne une finale plus sèche, sans suite de goût. Avec son corps assez léger, on en conclura que c’est une IPA fortement rafraîchissante.
How: Bottle. Appearance: Golden, medium white head. Aroma: Grapefruit, lemon, floral, light syrup Palate: Medium body, fizzy carbonation.
Pours clear amber with thin head. Very present but subtle citrus,grapefruit aroma. Citrus upfront in the mouth with subtle malt undertone. Light fruity/floral finish. Very pleasant when chilled.

On tap at Monks Table:

Aroma: soldi hop forward - C hops with bit of pungency from Nelson Sauvin. Pleasantly rounded. Milder than expected 

Look; pored clear amber gold with medium plus white cap. Sparse rings on glass. 3+ 

Body/Palate/Taste: good well rounded bitterness. Refreshing feel, nicely balanced for IPA. Milder than most. Pleasant ale.

Nice golden/orange coloured beer with a thick white head. The aroma reminds me of fruits, hops and resin. The tase is dominated by the fruits. Starts out very sweet and finishes slightly bitter. An amazing beer. Deserves all the hype.
Saveur très fruitée , on notera une touche resineuse type pin . On regrettera l’amertume de la finale qui vient perturber l’équilibre de cette bière et camoufle son arome

Had this in London at the end of 2014 and it summed up the best experiences of the year I felt (a great year for beer btw). Although light it packs quite a punch and reminded me of the old unfiltered Ratsherrn pale Ale, Riedenburgers Dolden Sud, Crews PAs... modern classics if you wish (I live in Hamburg, so from a German perspective). It is a great beer. I can’t believe this is only 35 IBUs; being low in sugar and alcohol it comes across way sharper and fresher (well it says 45 IBU elsewhere I see now). In the midst of a rainy London December, this made me think of summer again. Shows the essence of an IPA; perhaps less post modern, than prototypical.
Orangey, zingy marmalade aroma with bright fruit and a subtle hint of honey. Tastes like dry fruit / stonefruit, a bit of dustiness and nectarous honey. It’s BrewDog’s Punk IPA

Piwo po Bardzo ciekawy aromat. Po otworzeniu butelki faktycznie aromaty w takiej kolejności : liczi potem ananas oraz grejpfrut im dluzej sie wdycha, grejpfrut silniej wyczuwalny .Piana srednia ,nasycenie niskie ,kolor bursztyowy ,piwo zmętnione. Smak głeboki moze nie tak głeboki jak Innis &gunn Toasted Oak IPA ale przyjemny z poziomem goryczki dlugo utrzymujacej sie jak na 45 ibu . Po odejsciu goryczki aftertaste owocu Liczi zwanej także śliwką chińską . Dobre piwo
0.33l Hazy golden, white thin head. Aroma: fruits, pine, nicely hopsy. Taste is smooth caramel and citrus. Aftertaste of hops at the end. Medium body and carbonisation. Drinkable one after one.
Grassy and pine aroma. Not much head. Very bitter pine flavour and also green grass. Strong taste and aftertaste but pretty straight forward
slightly hazy golden with a fine, tall head. nice aroma of grapefruit and slight caramel notes. well-balanced taste. good finish. but not as good as expected.
660ml bottle. What a beauty. Almost perfect in appearance, aroma and palate. One for the hop fans of which I am most definitely one.

I really like this beer. The fruity citrus aroma gives a wow factor and is very appealing to me. The appearance is avg- standard honey color, nothing exciting there. The taste is the predictable mix of grspefruit and hops, and surprisingly with a very complete finish that is not too bitter. Palate i find average, a but bittery abs spicy for my taste but not bad for this style of IPA
Pleasant aroma. Saturation is not enough in taste, a little fruit, and bitterness. Not bad, but not more than

Classic Brewdog beer, tasted from tap at De Gollem in Antwerp, also tasted from bottle (from Albert Heijn). Bears a thick and dense, stable, lacing, cream white head and misty golden robe with somewhat greenish hue. Powerful and very herbal hops aroma, pink grapefruit, dried lemon peel, hemp, nettles, hay, wormwood, sour green apple, bitter honey, dried apricot, gooseberry, celery salt. Dry fruity taste, green apple, some peach, slight salty accent; lemony acid touch, minerally, smooth with subtle honeyish sweet touch, strong hop bitter finish, peppery and spicy, dried citrus peel, dry, spicy and long but well in balance with the other flavours. In that respect, this is well accomplished as a tribute to the original British IPA style, which was (and often still is) much more restrained in the hops department than the modern American IPAs most of us got more used to.
Whooo Hooo. Get to rerate this at 0.4% less abv. Dry. Straw on the flavor. Scratchy. The hop flavor comes through, but has to fight. Overall, a sad hopbomb that has 1/4 the needed hops.
Zolotysto-oranshevyj, shapka ne vusoka bila, aromat hmelu, cytrusovyh, persykiv.Smak cytryn,travy, girkogo hmeliu, pid kinec solodkuvatuj. Pislijasmak dovguj ta pryjemnyj. Klas.
This beer is amazing! Aroma: citrus tropical fruits and some honey. Nice golden colour. Taste: caramel maslts, soft bitterness and strong carbonation. Nice beer!
Misty yellow, almost instantly disappearing white head. Passionfruit, hint of honey. Very refreshing. Light bitter on a tongue, strong carbonation.

Nice hazy gold with small head. Strong aromas of grapefruit, tangerine, paw paw/papaya, mango, passionfruit and honey. The taste is just as suggested by the smell, very tropical fruity and good balance of bitterness and sweetness. Refreshing and enjoyable.
Clear golden color with tall persistent white head, hoppy aromas with notes of citrus and herbs, oily texture, dry and slightly bitter finish, not bad

Bottle
Aroma: citrus hops / Appearance: amber cloudy, head minimal white / Taste: medium bitter hobs, light sweetness malt / Palate: light bitter, dry
A light beer with a nice touch of tropical fruit in both aroma and taste.
Very enjoyable.
Aroma: hops, citrus tropical fruits, pleasant. Nice appearance, golden to amber colour, clear. Taste: malt feel, thin body, medium bitterness, average carbonation, dry. Very drinkable!

In bottle. White, rocky head, persistent enough. Golden yellow, cloudy. Intense at nose. Citrus, grapefuit, ananas, tropical smells, herbal. Medium body. Intense and persistent in the mouth. Beautiful malty and citrus-like entry. The bitter expands all around the mouth and a pleasant astringency asks for another sip. Balanced and armonic.

Slightly hazy light gold colour, lasting large white head 
Lacing disappears quite quickly
Aromas of grilled pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest, mango
Taste of grapefruit, overriding bitterness with a hop aftertaste
Light and crisp mouthfeel 
Not too much carbonation.
Hoppy surprise. Very bitter, nearly no sweetness. A bit pale in color and taste. Taste like a strongly hopped, bodyless pale ale. (Which doesn’t need to be a bad thing)

Bottle. Nice hoppy aroma. Amber almost clear, head vanished quickly, nice lacing. Light sweet, light bitter. Light bodied, low/medium carbo. Only bit bitter finish, pretty short. Overall I expected something better. Aroma is best part of this beer.

Draught. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Hoppy aroma. Taste is of malt, grape, grapes, citrus, floral notes, hay and hops. Above average body and carbonation. Dry. Quite good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

3/4 glass (12 oz I assume) on draft at Pig & Whistle in Kyoto with a 200 yen discount for foreigners. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral, bitter hops, light citrus. Tastes of floral, caramel, citrus. Medium body with a dry finish.
Nebliges hellorange, ganz kurzer Schaum. Hopfig , fruchtiges Aroma, Südfrüchte. Leicht Co2, angenehme, gut eingebundende Bitterkeit, ganz wenig malzig-süss, fruchtig. Bitter-fruchtiger Abgang.
I really dig this beer. The tropical fruit is really present in this one and complements the other, more typical traits of an IPA quite well.
Aromas of fruits, good smell. The taste is very good, and we can feel the hops a lot!

15/XI/14 - 33cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 7/VIII/15 (2014-1337) 


Clear orange beer, irregular creamy yellowish head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet exotic fruits, piny, resinous, citrus, little soapy. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: some grapefruit, caramel malts, some dairy, soft bitterness, pineapple, bit soapy. Aftertaste: bitter, grapefruit, some citrus.

Flesje 33cl 7 graden C tht sept 2015. Mooi compact schuim op een net niet helder goudkleurig bier. Aroma heeft veel citrus, grapefruit. Bij de smaak komt wat komkommer en groene paprika voorbij maar vooral de citrus en een volle fruitige bitterheid. De smaak gaat perfect over in een mooie bittere afdrink waar zo nu en dan de citrus tonen nog even voorbij komen.
Flaska på Tybble pizzeria. Dimmigt gul med vitt skum. Kryddig humledoft med inslag av grape. Lätt och frisk med blommighet och beska.

Very tasty, but also very expensive for me. Good for a one try. 
But great beer for a people who’s never trying anything more than cheap lagger.

33cl flesje via Gall en Gall, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 5,6%
Uitgeschonken in Kaapse Brouwers glas

Uiterlijk: goudblond met mooie witte kraag

Aroma en smaak: ruikt heerlijk hoppig (amarillo?), bloemig, fruitig als perzik/abrikoos, redelijk bitter in de nadronk

Conclusie: echt een goede IPA, erg smaakvol

Quite disappointed by this beer because I was really looking forward to try it... The colour is a very nice golden orange, there’s no head at all though which is a bit frustrating... The nose is great, a lot of fruits, pineapple, peach. A beautiful hoppy smell. But then the taste doesn’t follow, it’s not complex and quite flat... There’s no fizzyness at all, maybe it’s too "British style for me" type of carbonisation.
Bottle. Small white head lasts not long. Definitely not clear. Aroma of tropical fruits and caramel. Great taste and palate. Unfortunately appearance spoils the experience.

12 oz bottle, best before 07-02-15.
 Hazy golden with a thick lasting head, and sticky lace.
 Aroma is tangerine, tropical fruit and grass. Flavor is sweet, citrus fruit, grapefruit , and pine hops. Tangerine and grapefruit on the finish.
 Balanced, easy drinking IPA.
Flaska Bishops arms örebro. Fruktig höig doft. Maltig smak med citrus och barr. Bra beska

i love this beer this was one of my first craft beers that i ever had i just love it i love the smell, the taste the finish and generally everything about the beer. if anyone wanted to start drinking craft beers then i would tell them to start here.
Very strong grassy and pine aroma. Not much head. Very bitter pine flavour and also green grass. Strong taste and aftertaste but pretty straight forward.
IPA accessible, pas mal fruitée - un peu trop -, sympa. Bouteille achetée au bar La Tête à l’envers, Vincennes, France, première dégustation le 29/08/2013.
Probably my favourite beer. The aroma is like nothing else I’ve tried, beautiful fruity hop aroma, well balanced and lively on the palate. Just a perfect beer.

Pours to a thin head that leaves slight lacing and the colour is perfectly pale ipa. The aroma hits powerfully with summer citrus and summer with straw. Lovely. The taste is cinzano, peppery, fruity, refreshingly alive. The finish is dry. Too many of these and you will be drinking yogurt for a week. Rhubarb tanin means slightly too many salts in this water profile. The ABV is right but something is just out of kilter.

Robe orangée, limpide. Fine mousse blanche assez persistante. Arômes écorce d'orange/pamplemousse. Goût agrume, herbal et légèrement mentholé. L'arrière goût est plus doux, avec des saveurs de pêche. Une classique

Thin white head over golden beer. Good aroma intensity of very fresh hops, tropical and piney, some faint buttery sweetness. Medium carbonation, medium body, medium bitter attack, sort of hollow mid palate where the body falls through, finish becomes faintly fruity and medium bitter. It’s certainly ok but a let down from the aroma and doesn’t feel very "punk".

Citrus and hops to the fore. Easy drinking but a wee bitty too fruity for me. Light amber with foamy headwhen poured into straight glass.Lemon zest - wow.Orange marmalade too. Strength hidden in flavour. Bit too pricey for me compared to other beers of same ilk.
A very good introduction for IPAs, aroma is citrus and hoppy, thin white foam, médium body, golden color and a little bitter at the end. it’s just a fine beer.
Nästintill klar, guld gul med ett lätt färgat skum. Doft: Humle, humle, grape, omogen mango och ananas, malt, jäst. Smak: Som doft + frukt kola. Enkel och okomplicerad IPA.
One of the best IPA ever! One of the best IPA ever!One of the best IPA ever!One of the best IPA ever!One of the best IPA ever!One of the best IPA ever!

Keg half-pint in Ye Olde Fighting Cocks, Oakengates on 19th Nov 2014. 
Poured a golden colour, with a full white head. Hops rule the nose and taste, citrus and floral with the citrus notes pushing the flowery hints to the rear. Fizzy and lemony, too highly carbonated for me and my palate. Did not really enjoy. Fizzy Toilet Duck!

light, white foam. golden / amber color. very nice and intense smell. very fruity in the nose, especially tropical fruits like mango and grapefruit are apparent. medium body, average bitterness. after the great smell i was a bit unsatisfied with the taste.

Head is creamy, white and fully diminishing. Body is clear yellow orange, sparkles are visible.

Aroma contains mainly hops with loads of (tropical and citrus) fruits (both sweet and sour).

Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light sweet, followed by light acidic, sweet and light bitter, Light acidic and light butter and finishing in bitter.

Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.

Balanced and complex in the fruits. I quite liked it, the bitterness was not too harsh or overpowering.

Bevuta in lattina, al naso esplodono i frutti tropicali (mango soprattutto) che danno lidea che al palato sia molto dolce, quando in realtà, apparte l’ingresso, si mantiene giustamente amara e beverina! Forse me l aspettavo un attimo meno watery (che però aiuta a mandarla facilmente in gola)
East of Everything ontap 9.0%(20-Nov-2014)Sweet passion spice biscuit malt aroma.Amber red colour,spice herbal sweet resin spirit flavour.Bitter resin spice finish biscuit aftertaste.

33cl can teku. Pours a white small to medium head, bit hazy orange to golden colour. Smells fruity, lemon, pineapple, nice aromatic exotic hoppiness, delicate not pungent. Tastes honey malt, caramel, biscuity, bit citrusy and grass/resin; low sweetness, moderate but very smooth and almost vanishing bitterness. Medium bodied, slick texture, quite soft carbonation, extremly drinkable and balanced, refreshing. ALso tried on tap but wasn’t that awesome. I would say I maybe prefer a fresh can/bottle, nicely poured. Nice one, would drink tones

Im Glas hellgolden, stabiler, fluffiger Schaum, schaut gut aus. In der Nase wahnsinnig fruchtig, citrus. Geschmacklich erst fruchtig, dann kommt eine leichte Bitterkeit durch, im Abgang wird die dominant und im langen Nachgang dann trocken. Wow. Äußerst lecker, jeder Schluck macht es noch intensiver.

Butelka 0,33 l. Wyraźny aromat cytrusowy, mandarynkowy, pamelo. Piana jasna, średnio pęcherzykowa i średnio trwała niezbyt obfita. Barwa: piwo jest jasne, złote. W smaku lekko słodkie z przyjemną goryczka, która nie zalega zbyt długo w mocnej formie początkowej. Nasycenie niskie do średniego.

Hot damn, this came outta nowhere....well, outta me fridge I s’pose, but wowie! Sometimes in a beer-era (bera? beera?) of strong IPAs, DIPAs, IBUs in the 90’s-100’s, you forget that a lil’ fella can be just what you need. Along comes this punk, surfer-dude golden blonde with white sea foam on his noggin. Guy must have been playing around some oranges, grapefruits, pineapples, rolling around in sweet cereal covered in honey and not showering since I detect a wee dankness off’m. This cat leaves me with a bitter taste in my mouth, in a good way though. Crazy man, crazy. Oh yeah, good mouthfeel and all that jazz.

Pours golden yellow with a white head. Hop, citrus, floral, caramel and malt aroma. Citrus, floral, honey, hop, pine and malt flavors. Medium light body and average carbonation. Modest bitterness and a clean citrus finish.

Muito boa ipa. Vale muito a pena tomar, mas a green cow é mais gostosa. O cheiro dela é muito bom. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours golden with a long lasting small white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruits. Tastes of citrus and cut grass.
Erg fijne volle bloemige geur. das ook gelijk het beste punt van het bier. Geen hoogvlieger.
Pours light amber, hazy. Head dissipates quickly. Aroma is piney and floral, but not citrus. Full body, slick/velvety/round mouthfeel. Not a bad West Coast-style IPA.

Clear amber-lemon; not much head but a film of irridescent bubbles of various sizes. Aroma of "bathroom floral": a hint of rosewater, a hint of PineSol. Fresh spicy flavor followed by bitterness, and then by rosewater. Will be good with our pizza, but on its own, a bit too bitter for my taste.
Opaque gold, strong white head. Light Simcoe on the nose - fruity, but very vague. Noticeably bitter with a hint of sour - definite tropical fruit notes. Dry and bitter finish. Good.
From draft at Taps KL. Hazy blonde with a thin white head. Very light aroma of hops and malts. Flavors of hops, caramel malts, herbs. Not well balanced, quite sweet for an hoppy ale. A bit queamish.

Interesting take on the modern American-style IPA - the blend of hops gives it a unique taste that distinguishes it from other beers of this style, which can too often be a bit samey. The aroma is very fresh, and has fruity notes as well as the usual citrus and resin. However, it seems to lack some malt balance as is common for this type of beer, and by the end of the bottle, nothing but hops can get a little monotonous. Still, overall a good refreshing beer, and a very welcome addition to the usual supermarket bottle choices.

Pint - did not intentionally order a pint. This is actually better from a bottle as it when it’s a little warmer it can be a little sickening by the end of the pint. That said, this is a tasty IPA with lots of flavour. Limited head. Will sample again - but definitely in a smaller measure than a pint

the aroma of pine needles, citrus and mango with some herbal notes... the taste of grapefruit, pine needles, tropical fruits - mango and passionfruit, some spices... bright hoppy bitterness... bitter spicy aftertaste... nice IPA...

Amber colored beer with a small white head, high carbonation.
Smells like hops.
Taste is bitter hoppy, fruity, cirtrus and little sweetness
Aftertaste is slightly bitter.
Good beer, easy to drink.

No retention and no lacing. Smells of mandarin, grapefruit and tropical fruits. Tastes of grapefruit and tropical fruits. Light bitter aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bevuta alla spina e in bottiglia. Meglio alla spina. Sprigiona tutti i sentori tropicali e agrumati di cui si compone, corpo medio, gusto equilibrato, amaro lungo e persistente

DAA; Bottle 330 ml. Batch: 175. Pours hazy gold with a large frothy, lacing, off-white, lasting head. Nose is heavy malt, tropic, sweet mandarin, citrus grapefruit and spice. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter, still balancing with a lasting finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is soft to average.
Straw colour, small white head. Tropical fruit and grapefruit. Nice mouthfeel with a bit of creaminess. Nice.
Niezła IPA, zasługa dobrych chmieli i co ważne, przynajmniej dla mnie, że goryczka nie dominuje nad całą resztą.
One finger head, pale hoppy aroma. Sweet with a little bit of bitter balance. Exceptional

0.33L bottle. Pours hazy golden with a rocky white head. Aroma is dominated by hops: tropical fruit, floral, grass, some overripe fruit. Flavor begins with tropical fruits: lychee, pineapple. Quickly goes to citrusy and fruity hops. Not a very pronounced malt character to this beer. Long, dry, citrusy hop linger. Medium body with a thick mouthfeel and average (albeit sharp) carbonation. Overall, some unique character to this IPA in the aroma and flavor profile, although not totally balanced.
Aromas of funk, pine, sweet lemon. Bright golden yellow color with white head. Bright, spritzy, refreshing, funky almost saison like ipa. Could stand more hops.

Poured an amber colour with a thick fluffy head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy. Flavor is the same fruity hop tastes(grapefruit, lemon, other citrus) with a moderate bitterness and light malt notes. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Great session beer with well balanced flavors.

Ah, that’s nice! While it’s not as crazy hoppy as some beers, this one is very hop forward. Loads of fruity hop derived goodness here. Nice bitter aftertaste which sticks around for a while. Malt sneaks in an appearance, but this one is all about the hops.
Minha cerveja predileta. Extremamente aromática, amargor no ponto, espuma densa... Divina!
Un grand classique toujours aussi bon. Un style inimitable et unique. Le meilleurs rapport qualité/prix de loin!!
Geel bier zonder schuim. Gedronken in Singapore. Smaak is licht bitter met bitter fruit, lijkt erg op zwarte thee. Bijzonder bier, blijft gemiddeld hangen.

30/10/14 - 330 ml bottle (cooled) from Malt Attacks - Brussels, waiting for the train. Overwhelming smell of exotic fruit. Taste : overwhelming exotic fruit again, little sweetness, bitterness, Aftertaste was the best I ever had for an IPA, Again the exotics, bitterness, little sweetness. Great stuff and drinkable for a lot of people
Una de mis primeras IPAS, al principio su amargor y aromas característicos no me gustaron pero cada vez que tomaba una me gustaba más.

Ah, Punk my old friend, it’s good to see you again. Even now that there are other, bigger, more aromatic yet reasonably priced craft beers, the sight of you gladdens my heart. Your sessionability, your fruity new world hops, your refreshingly bitter finish. Long may you be stocked in otherwise craft-beer-free establishments. Like Guiness, you offer hope to a thirsty-yet-discerning man. I salute you!

God, enkel och väldigt lättdrucken ipa. Guldfärgad med vitt skum. Doften är väldigt fruktig med inslag av bla blommor och en viss sötma. Riktigt bra och balanserad smak med lagom maltighet och beska. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Robe blonde légèrement trouble, mousse blanc-cassé peu persistante.Nez très houblonné et aromatique aux notes de fruits tropicaux, fruit de la passion/passiflore, ananas et agrumes..Au goût on retrouve les mêmes choses, parfaitement équilibrées.Le malt est peu présent ce qui en fait une bière légère sans être trop sèche (houblonnage plus dans le fruité moelleux que dans les tons herbacés, boisés, résineux et astringent qui dominent souvent chez les américaines).Je me répète mais : parfait équilibre.Bière DE SOIF ET DE DÉGUSTATION, ce qui est une chose rare.La bière parfaite !
Birra molto luppolata stile pale ale importante. Profumi fruttati agrumi pompelmo. Resina. Amaro finale appagante.

This is what I’d call a starters IPA, it smells fruity and nice, it has a good taste and the palate is fine. It’s just a really easy beer to enjoy, nothing too complicated. 

Enjoyable!

Botella de 33cl. Cerveza de color naranja nublado que forma una mediana cabeza blanca . El aroma es suave lúpulos florales y cítricas, muy afrutados . El sabor es ligeramente al pino , aunque también hay recuerdos florales y a frutas.

Smmells of exotic fruits, slightly tart but exhilarating roundness. Beautiful golden pulling fisheries reflections. After exotic fruit, notes of jasmine appears. Nice length of mouth, coupled with a slight bitterness
Не знаю почему, но меня оно успокаивает и действует как вкусное мягкое нежное снотворное, после которого снятся красивые сны ;)

"punk ika" uit de fles, geur dennenappel met mango, en citrusvruchten. Uitnodigend, smaak is alles behalve dat. Van zoet gaat het in ineens naar zuur en dan naar behoorlijk bitter. Geen aanrader maar wel "appart" te noemen
Smells like a pinetree with tropical fruit, tastes like a pinetree with tropical fruit.  Edit: definitely better on a second taste. Will I ever become an IPA fan? That’s the question.

I was surprised to see the new punk is rated higher than the original - just who are these people?? It’s not bad, not by a long way, but it’s a shadow of its former self. the bitterness is gone, the mouthfeel is gone, the big juicy tropical flavour is gone. What’s left is a so-so strong blonde beer, vaguely hoppy, a bit sweet, really now there’s no need for it to be more than about 4.5% for all the flavour it gives

Poured from 11.2 oz from a Trader Joe’s 4 pack, best by 7-2-15. which is a long way off in the future! Cloudy golden with a huge dirty off white head, flowery nose, on the sweet side. Taste is mostly bitter, with a bit of sweetness. Not super fresh, would be curious to see when it was actually bottled, and then TJ’s is not known for proper storage. Medium-light bodied, a bit slick and oily in the mouth. Not too bad, but not as good as I like in my IPA’s.

Cloudy gold. Fruity hops on the nose. Taste- luscious fruits and light floral hops.  Mango, apple and pineapple. Light biscuity malt.  Refreshing. Very low hops for an IPA. Surprised how much I liked this. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Re-rate 2017: I liked it a lot better than last time, more balanced, not overly bitter, and clear yeasty notes. Pleasant brew. Original rate (3.0): Bottled from local supermarket. Clear golden colored, small head. Beautiful hoppy nose, very fruity (tropical), pine. Pretty one-dimensional hopbitter flavor, no malts, hardly any restsugars. When tasted blind i would have probably thought this was a session IPA, it’s very watery and simple.

330 ml bottle bought at CitySuper in Harbour City, Tsim Sha Tsui during October’s “Beer Festival” promotion.



Translucent dull amber honey with no yeast particles; Razor-thin head and residual soapy off-white foam which fades in 10 seconds; Minimal sticky lacing with barely detectable slight carbonation; Fragrant and sweet aroma of Ale malt, with light grapefruit, light pineapple, passion fruits, light jackfruits, strong floral nectar, strong molasses, light pine light lime and grass; Light sweet taste of light Ale malt, with light grapefruit and lemon zest, light molasses, strong pine, resin, strong earth, biscuits, lime, quite strong bitter hops and very sharp grass; Light body, thin and slightly slick palate; Mouth feel is quite thin Ale malt base. Low sweetness with quite strong hop elements - not light on citrus zest but strong on pine, resin, and earth. Quite a treat, not bad… Hoppiness is taste as above, plus expressive floral nectar, sweet passion fruits, pineapple and tropical fruits in aroma. Bitterness is, ironically, not as sharp nor potent as the Dead Pony Club I had yesterday. Perhaps only the Simcoe stands up for a rather timid mid-level bitterness for a lasting, close to middle astringent finish. Not very impressive; Slightly dry after taste. Hoppy and piney to mouth.



Comments: The best I can say about this one is the rather flowery and tropical fruity aroma, and for that I have to sniff pretty hard for it. Taste-wise the various hops are in short supplies and the overall palate is passable but not something longlasting. Seems like BrewDog is stoogey with the hops and while it’s easily drinkable and sessionable, this ain’t top stuff.

One of my favourite beers whether from bottle or the local BrewDog bar in Nottingham. Just an amazing explosion of floral, citrus, piney hops with a lovely bitter and dry finish.

Nose and taste both full and flavoursome. Malt definitely takes a back seat to the hops but such a tasty, easy-drinking beer. Not quite up there with Jack Hammer (or Libertine for that matter) but there are very few beers out there with the flavour, aroma and punch of this in the same price range. Makes me smile every time I crack open a bottle and take a sniff.
33 cl bottle. Hazy blond, frothy white head. Really strong fruity aroma, malty hop flavour, salty grapefruit. Dry finish

Stupenda IPA inglese moderna dal colore oro antico con schiuma pannosa consistente. Al naso intensamente profumata di luppolo fresco, erbacea e floreale. In bocca corpo medio con un punto di carbonazione giusto. Bilanciatura da maestri con il giusto amaro equilibrato dalla dolcezza del malto. Nel palato affiorano sentori floreali, erbacei, resina e un lontano toco di vaniglia e miele molto piaceboli che finiscono con freschezza in bocca. Un’icona del famoso birrificio che non delude mai (se è fresca). Consigliata

330ml bottle served in a pint glass.
A: Pours a golden yellow to orange color. Clear. Forms a big bubbled and aired white head. Some lacings left
S: Flowery hops, mainly. Very pine and pineapple in the nose. Sweet malts and caramel 
T: Sweet upfront. Sweet malts and American hops. Hops are very piny and citrus, probably Centennial and Chinook. Quite good overall bitterness 
M: Medium body and carbonation. Quite stingy hops bitter aftertaste 
O: Good drinkability. A Scott IPA with a very American accent. Great IPA
[ BA Review @ 6/25/2010 ]

Confesso che non sono assolutamente amante dello stile, e questo la penalizza un bel po’. Ma tutto sommato devo dire che l’ho apprezzata. Colore ambrato leggermente torbido. Schiuma un po’ grossolana e un po’ fine, poco spessa e non molto persistente. L’aroma e’ forte, decisamente luppolato, erbaceo e floreale (giglio e gelsomino). Gradevole e pungente allo stesso tempo, ti invita a berla. In bocca, l’inizio del sorso e’ inaspettatamente mieloso, ma dura poco, per lasciare spazio improvvisamente ad un erbaceo gradevole. Il luppolato non e’ molto pungente, ma avvolge tutta la bocca, lasciando un retrogusto amaro e abbastanza persistente. Corpo leggero, carbonizzazione giusta.

Translucent golden with watery off-white head that dissipates. Amazing aroma - fruity floral hops, spicy malt, honey, caramel, cinnamon, banana, butterscotch, doughy yeast. Tastes very bitter and crisp, slight spice. Nice resinous hoppiness but flavour doesn’t last long. Palate is quite thin with light carbonation. Overall very enjoyable.

Julie say She gives a.  1/5. There is hop hay and grassiness it is watery stick to here tongue

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fin fylde. Himlenes skinner godt. Moderne smak. Den er nå en del av standardsortimentet.

12 oz. bottle from Trader Joe’s. Recent shipment. Best by date says 5/16/15. I’m hoping it isn’t a year from bottling… It pours a nice clear golden color with a white head. The aroma is big citrus fruit, toasted and caramel malt. Light florals in the background. Smells a bit aged. The flavor is strong with citrus and floral hops, but it has a flabby maltiness that screams old and stale. It finishes pretty dry and moderately bitter with more stale malt. It’s pretty telling that this beer just arrived in the store and already is suffering from age. I guess I should only buy fresh and local when I’m jonesing for an IPA.
Kiedyś to było coś wielkiego. Teraz - wciąż dobre. Niskie wysycenie, trochę smrodków z początku. Ogólnie - lekkie, niewymagające. Jest OK.

This is probably the best beer in the world for everyday drink!
Highly recommended!

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 28/07/15 Pours slightly cloudy, nice rich golden liquid, minimal to none white head, Aroma: very hopy, straightforward, litchi, grapefruit, flowers, pine, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, hopy, grapefruit, flowers, Palate: light body, slick texture, average carbonation, long bitter finish, Overall: very drinkable, moderate bitterness, light body, good, enjoyed.

Licht oranje-geel bier met een witte schuimkraag. Sterke geur van hop, bloemen en mandarijn. Smaak is bitter, beetje zoetig, hoppig, bloemig, zelfs wat dennen. De afdronk is licht bitterzoet. Lekkere IPA!
A cloudy orange beer with a medium white head. The aroma is soft floral and citrus hops, very fruity. The flavor is slightly piney, floral, and fruity.

Aroma: intense citrus, resin, grass; Appearance: golden pale, small vanishing head; Taste: medium bitterness, slight sweetness, medium sourness; Palate: soft carbonation, slick texture, light body, bitter finish

Well-rounded, well-hidden alcohol, a bit thin, significantly dry. Could be more malty, it has a lot of properties of an English bitter.
"a sweet and spice forward ipa. bitter, but not very floral. an ok ipa, but not for the price. darker than usual, and maybe a little time on it. just ok."
birra eccezionale!!! sapori di pompelmo.rinfrescante,un piacere per il palato.a mio parere una delle migliori ipa in commercio!!!!!
Not impressed really, head dissipated almost immediately left a Bitter aftertaste, wouldn’t really recommend it.

Bottle. Pours cloudy, yellow and orange, with a white head that disappates quickly. Light bodied, high carbonation, medium bubbles. Aroma is very strong mango and grapefruit. Taste is grapefruit, pine and lemon. Palate is light. Finish is dry and floral. A bitter aftertaste.

On tap at BrewDog pub in Florence, Italy. Great pour with a nice medium head. Aroma of grapefruit, pine and other citrus. Taste is crisp, refreshing, with lots of balanced hops, pine, citrus, and just the right amount of carbonation. Really refreshing balance of hops and a hint of malt in the palate. Truly a staple of the IPA class....

330 ml bottle. Hazy honey gold color. Small creamy white head. Fragrant hop nose redolent of pine and citrus. Flavor is tropical fruit malt, with notes of mango and peach. Hops are subtle, yet present in finish, with notes of citrus and pine needles. Nice balance and subtlety.
Dourado, turvo, com pouca espuma. Aroma de maracujá. Boa acidez e carbonatação, leve amargor e equilibrada.

Nice easy to drink ipa. Clear orange with a small soapy head. Carbonation is soft. Very fresh and floral citrussy flavor. Slightly sweet.  The hop bitterness appears only in the aftertaste. A mild ipa. If you?re looking for extreme bitterness, this is not it. If you want a tasty sessionable ipa, give it a try.
Poured a dark golden color with a fluffy white head. Aroma was notes of citrus, matching malt character. Flavor had a lot of pine notes in it, citrus, floral character was enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours a hazy amber/brown with light head. Aromas of dried orange/lemon rinds and toasted malts. Flavors of dusty/dry caramel and light tropical fruit.

Flowery, earthy, citric hops over a light Euro base.
This beer gets more flowery and bakery as it opens up. Give the beer it’s due, it’s offering a very pleasant and rich arc that is clean, refreshing, and yet fully textured and flowery. Clean. Orange zest, orchids, lillies, flower store. Yet never cloying.
One of the best beers I’ve tried.

Fresh on draught at Le Trappiste, Brugge. Clear golden with a pale head. Aroma is fresh orange juice, passionfruit, ruby grapefruit, hint of mint, lychee, tangerine. Best smelling IPA ever. Light-medium bodied, subtly syrupy mouthfeel, somewhat dry and floral on the finish. Taste is citrus peel, passionfruit, floral herbs, orange blossom honey, dry white wine. Awesome.
Light amber body with minimal wjote head. Fruity and floral aroma, a bit citrusy. Taste is bitter with hints of sweetness. Nice.

from Erzbierschof - clear dark blond beer with a poor head retention; solid fruity hoppy aroma of grapefruit and mango; hints of cheese; a good malt backbone; lively and pretty tasty; a decent bitterness, quite dry and long grapefruity hoppy finish with notes of star fruit
kupljeno u interspara u kastelima ...razocaran zbog skupe cijene za nesto ovako ..miris vocni ..okus nikakav..biljni ..herbal okus ..u dvije rijeci "govno pasije" ....
Pour from can. White fluffy head, tropical fruit, pinaple and distint resin. Medium body "short taste" ends with nice long bitterness

bottle, pours golden, slightly hazy with white, quite stable head. Intense aroma of tropical fruits and some herbs. Medium bitterness, bit citric and grapefruit taste, delicate grainy note. Bit astringent bitter finish. Medium body, soft carbonation. Not bad, but bit boring.

Pours a hazy orange amber with a quickly dissipating soda like head. Aroma is sweet fruity floral notes. Taste is fruity up front with a kind of mild strange herbal hops bitterness. Palate is a medium body with a very mild carbonation. Finish improves somewhat as it warms up some, fruity floral some malt, some mild herbal medicinal hops bitterness. I am not sure what I am missing here but I did not enjoy this IPA at all. date on the bottle by 08/22/14. Would not buy this again.

Marketing robi swoje, piwo niezłe, za to w tej cenie (a nawet i sporo taniej) można kupić już naprawdę wielkie piwa. To jest po prostu średnia IPA wywindowana do ekstraklasy, przez przemyślaną strategię marketingową. I żeby nie było - to nie jest złe, tylko ,absolutnie przeciętne piwo.

Draught in Ljubljana. Bright yellow-orange colour, small white head. The aroma is punchy, juicy hops, orange and other citrus. The flavour is sweet, toffee-like, and very citrus forward. Grapefruit and peachy. Very dry.
The rose aroma is thick but the bitterness was a bit too much. Whatever, I really liked it, it’s very refreshing and a great taste.

Profumo tropicale da paura sembra il Solero arancione! Gusto manca un pochino se proprio si vuol dire qualcosa, retrogusto amaro BBUONO. 
Consigliata.

Cloudy straw colour, dense well lacing head. Aroma of dozens of tropical fruit, berries, honey, some piny hops. Medium body. Well-balanced bittersweet taste. Medium bitterness. Notes of honey, raisin, herbs. Long finish with complex feel. Very good.
Una IPA fácil de beber con mucho aroma (frutas, cítricos, flores...) y un amargor limpio, suave y agradable.
Cerveza muy aromática con un intenso sabor. Amargor equilibrado y limpio. Muy buena IPA.

Bottle. Light clear golden pour with a thick sticky white head, plenty of good lacing. Huge tropical fruit in the nose, grapefruit is biggest. Also some various hop aromas, pine. Taste is great, similar fruit and hop tastes with a great bitter finish. Just an awesome IPA
0.33l bottle. Hazy golden color with small white head. Very strong smell of rotten fruits. Aroma of fruits, spice and smoke. Sharp bitter finish with some sourness.

0,33l bottle. Nice golden not quiet clear colour. Makes a nice 1 cm white head. Aroma of fresh tropical fruits, very nicely balaced. Nice medium body. Average carbonation. In flavoure is a nice mixture of sweet malt and medium bittery hops, that stays in mouth after drinking. Lovely beer!

Drinking this at King’s Café, Rijeka. Posred 0.33 bottle in a proper glass, clear golden with small white quickly diminishing head. Strong aroma of a kitchen spice, laurel or basil, I think, not sure. Very pleasant, with some fruits, orange and peach. Light hoppy bitterness, some fruity sweetness behind this. Very aromatic, but light with a lingering aftertaste. A classic!
gran cerveza, ideal para entrar dentro del mundo de las IPA, aroma muy interesante. cerveza artesana rozando ya a industrial, pero muy bien hecha eso si!
Smooth and fresh IPA. Quite hoppy even though it doesn’t is especially strong.

finally a keg version at Alaus studija. beautifull combination of tropical fruit from hops and sweetness of malts. copper in colour, clear with white small head. medium body with average carbonation and bitter finish. a must!
Very specific aroma of tropical fruit,allmost like a cocktail Taste of grapefruit also very recognisable Strong flavours, very refreshing

Delicious! Nice fruity IPA aromas with tangerine and grapefruit, maybe some resin. Feel is just slick enough but not cloying. Taste is not killer bitter. A really well balanced American IPA which I didn’t expect. Great beer

5.6% ABV. IPA

Light foamy tan head. Sticks around long enough to be noticed but not long enough to claim the title of a proper head.

Nose is clean and lightly scented with lemon peel and passionfruit, ethereal hints of pine.

Very complex first mouhtful. The mouthfeel is clean, moderately carbonated and inviting.
There are immediately a host of fruity flavors: passionfruit, orange and some plum. These give way almost immediately to an interesting foreground flavor of what I can only describe as reminiscent of bacon fat, candle wax, cheese rinds and maybe even barbecued pork. I actually had a whole bottle and am still chasing that last elusive flavor note. Anise maybe? It finishes clean but has a bit of a sour palate all the way to the end. 

A well crafted IPA. Some love and thought went into it. Nice amount of mystery surrounding it. At the end of the day not enough to make it to my favorites list.

Best before 8/22/14 bottle into tulip glass, so about 2 weeks "late". Cloudy amber-hued golden color with off-white head. Aroma of fruity/floral hops and faint caramel malt sweetness. Taste adds notes of tropical fruit hops (mango, pineapple, grapefruit) and some pine/resin notes. Light-medium body, low carbonation, dry with some lingering citrus finish. Probably because of BrewDog hype I was expecting more intensity but a nice almost sessionable IPA.

Cor amarelo escuro, com espuma creme com pouca persistencia.

Aroma forte de maracujá e frutas cítricas.

Tem inicio doce, que vai se transformando em amargor com persistencia média. Corpo leve e sensação final seca.
Love the fruityness and the well balanced bitterness. Carbonation is exactly right. In my opinion this is an IPA benchmark.

Pours a hazy gold with one finger of ivory head diminishing gradually to a thin skim, well-defined lacing. Nose is bright citrusy and floral hops and very little malt. Taste is similar, pine resin and pineapple, grapefruit and mango, with a moderate but not overwhelming pale malt background. Body is light to medium, with medium carbonation and a lingering bitter finish.

I’d love to try this fresher, this being three months past its best before, but the fact is, the hops are still reasonably bright even so. Pleasantly hoppy, without being a palate wrecker.

Not the review: What better choice for my no 100 here on RB than the one that took my ’virginity’ - admittedly, not very long ago - at NoKu club in Tallinn. I guess I was at the time gulping my *insert random ubiquitous bland lager name* and we were probably talking some shallow beer-talk, when a friend raised his eyebrows in surprise, asking, "have you really not tried this yet? It’s quite good actually." OK I must have said, and got myself one too. I literally spat my first sip on the table, probably mumbling a mousy ’WTF’ (or ’wtf’ for that matter). Not sure if I ever finished it, but some time later I somehow felt a certain irresistible urge to try it again... There was no way back since then.



Review: It pours a slightly hazy pale amber with an off-white, frothy, retaining head. There’s also some considerable lacing. Aroma is a myriad of fruity and floral hops, there’s also a fair deal of maltiness, and a hint of spiciness, and the vinuous Nelson is there as well. Taste is fruity and light at first, then after a few seconds the thick, citrusy-piney-resiny hop bitterness kicks in. Light to medium body, palate a bit watery, medium carbonation; finish is long and fairly bitter. Definitely not among the greatest IPA’s I’ve had but it’s still very enjoyable. It’s also good to drink straight from the bottle (while watching a film at Sõprus for example).



The bottle I’m rating here maybe deserves a 13-14 overall (Batch 210, BB 25/06/15) - I’ve had way fresher and way more enjoyable ones than this, so the review is more like a combination of all the times I’ve had it.

Clear golden pour with a decent white head. Very fruity aroma full of tropical fruits. Mango, peach, lychee, pineapple with pine and grapefruit. A strong sweet malt base balances this perfectly. Excellent mouthfeel and not too dry on the back palate. Strong flavours but still sessionable.
Drukket på Tamburen i gamlebyen i Fredrikstad. Herlig fruktig både smak og lukt. Delikat bitter ettersmak.

At last, a BrewDog ale! These beers have proven to be difficult to find in my neck of the woods, but I must say this particular brew was well worth the wait. Punk IPA has a rocky head and an aroma that’s tropical and floral. Taste is predominantly fruity (mango, peach, grapefruit) with some bitter pine at the finish. I loved this brew’s creamy mouthfeel and crisp final impression. I like that the label cheekily describes this ale as a "post modern classic pale ale." Not only does that showcase the brewers’ quirky sense of humor, it’s also a fairly good way to summarize this brew. Punk has the hop profile of an IPA but the ABV of a pale ale. In this case, that’s not a bad thing at all.

Hazy orange body with a thick beige head. Aroma is strong citrus fruit, grapefruit, caramel, orange, some pine, some spice, some tropical fruit. Taste is sweet with medium bitterness. Very nice and refreshing.

Bottle.

A- Tropical fruits, citrus, hoppy.

A- Orange color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Mangoes, peaches, oranges, tangerines, bitter, slightly sweet, smooth.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, sweet bitter finish.

O- My first BrewDogs brew while watching a BrewDogs episode. What a good combination. This beer was filled to the brim with citrus and fruits, espercially mango. The aftertaste was a little off, but overall, it was a decent IPA.
33cl bottle. Drinking in shanghai brewery (china). Yellow colour. White head. First impression: citrus, bubbles. A nice IPA
Clear golden colour, medium head. Aroma is orange and passion fruit, really nice. Taste is fruity and malty. Good bitterness, long and dry finish. Very well balanced. Great IPA!
