Ambrée légèrement orangée, translucide. Mousse blanche se dissipant rapidement, petite dentelle persitant. 
Arôme fruité pêche, légèrement citrus, résineux avec léger maltage caramel.
En bouche pareil avec une bonne amertume durable. En toute fin légère sensation de sucré caramel.
Bonne carbonatation.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with a medium white head. Aromas of fresh grassy hops,orange peel, slight pineapple, citrus. Taste is quite the same but has alot more grass and hops to it. Very smooth.

330 ML can

Hazy golden yellow color. Soapy white head. Holds its best at a thin layer. 
Nose is a lot of citrus. Quite a hop, citrus, and acid forward nose. 
Quite thin in the taste but packs a good punch. Highly bitter for the IBU level. Very dry and clean finish. Quite a good IPA.
Absolutly fantastic beer. Nice aroma and good alc rate. Draft better the bottled. One of my best. A must for ipa lovers
Bottle. Pours clean golden with a medium white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus. In taste dry, fruity and slightly watery. Medium bodied, high carbonated. Very good and refreshing IPA.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with medium white head. Nice hoppy aroma, citrus, tropical fruits, maybe white fruits as well. Some kind of emptiness in taste... Bitterness isn’t more as at medium level, it’s quite dry, there’s also lack of hoppy notes. A little bit disappointed.

Nice, solid aroma of citrus, grapefruit, mangoes and gooseberries with a slight bready note from the malt. The flavor is full on hops with a nice balanced bitterness. The malt balances out the bitterness well. Really good. One of my go-to beers!

Hier j'ai goûté la Hardcore IPA, aujourd'hui c'est donc la Punk IPA... Je préfère la Hardcore. Élevé à la bière belge et forte, 5,6% c'est un peu léger pour moi, ça manque de corps ! Belle prestation néanmoins, jolie couleur dorée, tête de mousse absente. Arôme d'agrume remarquable pour une amertume maîtrisée malgré la sécheresse de la bière. 

--- Dirty Google traduction :)

Yesterday I tasted the Hardcore IPA today so this is the Punk IPA ... I prefer Hardcore. Raised in the Belgian and strong beer, 5.6% is a bit light for me, it lacks body! Good performance nevertheless nice golden color, head of moss missing. Aroma of citrus for a remarkable bitterness control despite drought beer.

Bottle from "cerveteca" bar in Lisbon. Pour is pale gold with a moderate white head. Aroma is a mixture of sweet caramel with apricot and with some hint of passion fruit. Full of citrus flavor and some malt with a very light bitter aftertaste. It is moderately carbonated with a medium light body. Not as hoppy as you might expect from an IPA, but very refreshing and easy drinking, specially on a hot summer day.
Copper color with small head. Floral hops and honey in the aroma. Taste of ftuits and hops with notes of caramel. Slightly bitter aftertaste with rish hops aroma

Bottle @ home. I know I might be overrating this beer a bit, but it seems I return ever so often, that it has to count for something. Fresh, immense citrusy hop aroma. Taste is sweet malt, lemon, grapefruit and biscuit. Light mouthfeel and medium to high carbonation. Love it, love it, love it. 

- with thirst, Niklas

There have been many surprises when looking up beers only to find I haven't rated them. None more so than this! God know how much I've imbibed over the years. Anyway, having a pint at the newly opened Brewdog Clapham. Hopefully the fresh paint smell won't overpower the beer too much. Pours gold with a white head. Light aroma actually - lightly hoppy with a little lemon. Light to medium body, medium carbonation. Lemon, light caramel, a little orange, white toast, light pine, and a hint of funky veg at the finish... Easy drinking and tasty.

Pour is pale gold with moderate soapy white head. Aroma is sweet caramel and apricot. Not much hop on the nose but it’s a very pleasant and unique aroma for an IPA. Taste is crisp citrus hops. Very citrus. Some pine in the back with a grain, almost lager taste, unlike many IPAs I’ve tasted. The palate is very thin, body is medium light, finish is short with that later taste as well as some medium bitterness. If you’re looking for a hop bomb, this is not your beer. If you are looking for a more mild but interesting IPA, then give this a try.

Hoppy, but just the right balance for an ipa. Full of fruity citrus flavour with tinge of malt and a nice bitter aftertaste. Refreshing and easy drinking, it’s become my go to ipa.

Review day after drinking. I remember this being very pleasant and drinkable. Hop forward and highly carbonated, it was very tasty.

Golden color with white head. Floral hop aroma with tropical fruit aroma too. Not a balanced beer but who cares. Loads of grassy hops flavors some pine and some tropical fruits. Compared to and English bitter this Scottish IPA is a welcome punch in the face. Terrific linger bitter finish.
citrus aroma, fruity. pale, clear, golden. medium bitter, very nice taste. grapefruit is there. smooth. love it, nice and easy, refreshing.

Bottle, 330ml. A golden beer with a small white head. It has a strong floral aroma with grapefruit and citrics (especially lime). Taste is bitter and well balanced. There is some carbonation and astringency. Strong hop character . A good beer from my favorite brewery.
Really THE IPA on the market. Fruity, nHoppy, Round Body a mouthful of diffrent tastes while drinking. If you havent tried this one you havent tried any IPA.

On tap at the BrewDog in Sao Paulo. The hops does it’s job. The Punk IPA is full of fruity hop aroma - mainly maracuja as I would argue. Nice IPA, refreshing, fruity and bitter. Evereybody should add some in his life!

Bottle says best before 8-22-14. So assuming it is at least several months old and past it’s prime. Old floral hops.

Can pour. This is a classic interpretation of the IPA style. Stays true to a solid balance of hops, bitterness and a sweet malt to offset the bitter notes. Easy drinking, something of a gateway beer for entrants into craft brews, which I feel is the aim here.

Draft at the Sybarite Pig in Boca Raton, Fl. Tulip. Pours a mostly clear golden -amber with a thick white fluffy head. Decent lacing throughout. Aroma is very citrus fruits and mild pine. The overall flavor was heavy citrus and some mild pine bitterness. Nicely balanced and very flavorful. The finish was mild bitterness, but the overall theme is citrus. Good, mild, IPA.

THis beer had me laughing. First off, ITS AWESOME. However, it’s definitely NOT an IPA. It’s a Pale Ale and it certainly tastes like it. IMHO if this is scoring as an IPA it is WAY off the mark. As a PA though... well you have an awesome beer.

Can. Dark golden with bubbly white head. Lemon, grapefruit, dak bread, light roasted nuts, band aids. Starts fresh and pruity, then some pine and malts kick in and it finishes dry and bitter with again some fruits. Medium bodied, light fresh feel. Great balanced and complex stuff. Pretty good.
Keg at the George Abbot, Guildford. Pours pale golden with a thin white head. Aroma of pineapple and citrus. Short bitter finish.

A very enjoyable Indian Pale Ale, with a great combination of flavours and aromas.

Bottle at home. The problem with Punk, and indeed most other BD main range beers is that they all have the same harshness somewhere in their middle, and become slightly one-dimensional despite the surrounding promise. Stale bubblegum comes to mind. Dry.

bardzo dobry aromat, cytrusy, słodkie owoce tropikalne, lekkie słody. kolor bursztynowy, lekko zmętniony, piana niezbyt obfita ale dość trwała. w smaku pełne, słodowe z wyraźną, ale dość lekką jak na styl goryczką o przyjemnym grapefruitowym smaku. gryczka długa ale nie odkładająca się, przyjemna dość nisko wysycone. bardzo łatwo się pije.

Just awesome awesome beer. It tastes and smells exactly as it was written in description. It has load of unbelievable aromatic fruity hops, which just perfectly counters the bitterness. Perfectly carbonated. Amazing beer. Stone the crows! :)

Világos, enyhe rezes beütésű színben hagyja el üvegét egy elképesztő illatfelhőt árasztva magából: fenyőgyanta keveredik egy virágos, leginkább szegfűre hasonlító aromával, valamint némi grapefruit héj, egy kevés gyógynövény, illetve mentolos feketeribizli adta kavalkáddal. Ezek az illatjegyek aztán tökéletesen formálódnak át ízekké, kezdetben szinte követhetetlen gazdagságban. Idővel egyre behatárolhatóbbá válik a sör karaktere és a keserű íz viszonylag rövid, ámde határozott lefolyása is egyre hangsúlyosabb lesz, sokoldalúságát azonban mindvégig megőrzi.

11.2oz bottle. Dark golden color with little head. Citrus aroma. Taste is underwhelming compared to the aroma. More earthy taste.

330 ml bottle served in a nonic half pint glass. Pale sunrise orange, slightly hazy, with a tiny white head which dissipated almost immediately leaving a thin ring of foam. Tropical and sweet nose, pretty pleasent and fresh. Peach, mango, papaya, some citrus, pine needles and just a hint of caramel/toffee. High level of bitterness upfront, but much more malty than usual. Quite dry and palate cleansing, moderately hoppy and fruity. The aftertaste could be longer and more persistent, but it’s pretty clean. Average carbonation, light to medium body, creamy texture. Tasty and easy to drink. Good.

Pół-przejrzysty jasny kolor, troszeczkę mętny. Malutka, drobno-pęcherzykowa biała piana. Aromat chmielu czuć zaraz po otwarciu.Grejpfruty, gorzkie aromaty chmielu, są również nuty świerkowe. Smak: ciekawa goryczka, najbardziej widoczna na poczatku picia, znika szybko, nie zalega. Świeży smak żywiczny, kwiatowy, to jedna z tych IPA, które nie atakują cytrusami, a smakami leśnymi, kwiatowymi, ’trawiastymi’. Delikatne i w goryczy i w smaku (jak na IPA oczywiście). Bardzo pijalne, odpowiednio nasycone, 5,6% alkoholu nie czuć zupełnie. Bardzo grzeczna i ułożona IPA, jednak smaczna i pijalna zarazem.

Drinking from tab.
A hoppy aroma, no doubt this is an IPA. Citrus, grapefruit.
It’s an unclear, orange beer with asmall white head.
A fruity taste, apricot, tropical fruits.
Medium carbonation.
Just a good IPA.

Bottle 330 ml from Gall&Gall Eindhoven, poured into a tulip glass at home. ABV 5.6%
Clean pour, deep oranhe colour on the body, small slighty off-white head, with good retention. Light lacing on the glass.
Very nice aroma, full of citrus and grapefruit, caramel malts and some light floral notes.
Nice taste too, less citrus now but more of a fruity taste, passion fruit, lyche. Bitterness is not extreme and at first almost non existent, but it hits all of a sudden with good force and good duration as well.
Medium thin body, good soft carbonation.
Overall a very nice IPA, quite unique.
Gold pour, white head. Light tropical fruit tones, dank pot notes, very easy to drink, just not spectacular.
Bottle: nice orange color. Smell is very fruity of maracuja and apricot. Taste has maracuja, apricot and citrus. The beer is quite thin, body is missing. Some unpleasant bitterness in the middle.
from bottle, beautiful floral hoppy aroma. well rounded and full bodied, refreshing its only let down is its maybe a bit watery.

Amber color with low carbonation. Tropical and citrus fruits on the aroma, also resins.

Hoppy taste, floral and refreshing. As on the aroma, tropical fruits are very present, together with coriander, orange peel, peach and honey.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. An orange hazy beer with yellow hues at the bottom of my glass. Exotic fruity aroma, lemon, floral, herbs, resin. What a fruity aroma ?! Pretty intense. Heavy refreshing dry bitter. Medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation, lasting dry bitter finish. Overall, an IPA with a delicious exotic aroma. Intense bitter but just 1-dimensional if you understand me.
Draft at Soljica coffee place in Belgrade.Pour it bright light yellow color woth small white head.Taste great balance of tropical fruits, fruity hops but still 5 a.m. from Brewdog is the best :)

Recenzja z 27.11.2013. Kolor ciemnozloty, lekkie jednolite zmetnienie (pewnie od chmielenia na zimno). Piana wysoka, powoli opada, zostawia gruba warstwe i troche oblepia szklo. W zapachu owocowe estry, sporo mango, slodkie landrynki, cytrusy z dominujaca cytryna, troche mandarynki, lekka herbata. W smaku wytrawne i lekkie. Goryczka srednia, ale genialnie aromatyczna, bardzo bogate i zlozone aromaty chmielowe. Wysycenie srednie. Bardzo dobre i bardzo pijalne.
Flaska från systembolaget. Mycket frisk och lätt smak. Någon bismak som är svår att sätta fingret på.. Välbalanserad. Känns som en grillad!
My first IPA, and a great start - it has a bitter grapefruit aftertaste, which I would ordinarily not be a fan of, but it works nicely. It’s a real ’drinking in a sunny field’ ale.

As it says on the label: lots of fresh exotic fruits and finishing with a sharp bitterness. Very nice American style IPA

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Şişe, istanbul. Portakal rengi bulanık bir görüntü ve dolgun ancak kalıcı olmayan beyaz bir köpük. Kokuda şerbetçiotu, çimen ve meyve kokuları hakim. Tadım dengeli ve gövdeli, şerbetçiotu ipa olması dolayısı ile önde. Çok kompleks değil, oldukça başarılı ancak beklentimin altında..
Smell of hops, spruce. Lemon colour, white head. Aroma of spruce, hops, flower. Acidic, bitter taste.
Can from Strait and Narrow, Lincoln. Golden colour with small white head. Aroma and taste is hoppy with fruit notes. Really nice.

Bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy, orangey, light amber, with a half-finger white head. A few bubbles rising. Aroma- fresh hops, citrus notes, plenty of lemon, juicy, bitter fruit, zest, orange, grapefruit. Nice smelling. Taste- plenty of hop bitterness, quite a full mouthfeel, loads of fruit- zesty orange, grapefruit and lemon are all prominent. A good amount of carbonation, and the hop resins linger in the finish. Very nice.
Bottle. Pours dark golden with a frothy white head. Smells of tropical fruit. Tastes grassy, fruity with a touch of resin..

Couleur orange trouble, petite mousse blanche. Nez typique IPA, houblon fruité agrumes, citronné, note de malt. Gout leger et doux d’agrume, levure, forte amertume. Sans carbonation. Fin de bouche amère un peu astringente.
Aroma is bit lighter version of 5 A.M. Saint beer, with less grapefruit. Notes of fruits (citrus, mango), spices, bits of caramel. Taste is quite herbal. Aftertaste is dryish and pine bitterish.

Pint in Notts?s Brewdog, very nice aroma, range of hoppies in nose, the appearance is exceptional, very nice foggy light gold colour, the taste not very sharp and bitter, very much drinkable decent IPA! Basically it exactly does what it says on the tin "beer with a soul and a purpose". Always good- basically flagship from Brewdog!
My first IPA so not that much reference material. But it had a sweet and pleasant taste.

Nice yellow golden pour with a small fast dissipating white head. Great hops nose, pine and citrus fruits. Taste is also great hops right up front. Some nice grapefruit bitter on the back of the tongue. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great IPA!
Color dorado atractivo, cabeza lijera. Aroma floral delicioso, bergamota, durazno. Sabor amargo y al mismo tiempo dulzón. Equilibrada y buen cuerpo.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark golden/orange color with a moderate white head on there. Nose is fairly subtle, but has some nice floral elements coming off it. Taste is only lightly bitter, with the fresh floral elements coming through quite nicely. Very pleasant brew.

I really like the aroma of this beer, like smelling a nice bouquet of flowers. Pours a clear, dark yellow with a white head which disappeared a bit to fast for my taste. Taste is quite dry, citrus and pine, the bitterness lingers for a while. Carbonation a bit to high. A lovely beer, my glass was empty before I knew it.
Bottle. Pours a amber beer. Aroma is floral hoppy. Taste is a nice bitter with a bit of citrus. A good ipa.
Bottle. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of grapefruit, pines, floral hoppy. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet, grapefruit, tangerines, pines. Nice long bitter finish.
Espectacular. Me ha sorprendido mucho el aroma (a pub ingles). Sabor a lúpulo puro, no es para todos los paladares.

Bottle at home- this has been one of my Spring go tos of late. Pours clear, pale golden, dense creamy head that fades to a dense ring. Nose- floral citrus, orange rinds, grapefruit, mild yeast notes. Smells fresh. On the palate, lighter bodied with orange, grapefruit, biscuit malt sweetness that balances the dry bittering light finish. Really drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fat på BrewDog bar, Sthlm. 
Ganska trist utseende, ser ut som en lager. 
Doftar dock himmelskt av humlen! 
Mycket bra balans mellan sötma och beska i smaken. Fin efterton i munnen.
Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow with white head. Floral, citrus, and pine on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium-bodied, finishes clean.

Birra bionda con schiuma nella norma. Colpisce subito per i penetranti aromi di frutti tropicali al naso. In bocca, al primo approccio, si sente subito un piacevole caramellato ben bilanciato da un gradevole e lungo finale amaro erbaceo e fruttato allo stesso tempo.
Birra dall’invidiabile equilibrio e dal corpo leggero che la rendono incredibilmente piacevole e rinfrescante.

Apple-juice color, no head, no carbonation. Smell of grapefruits, oranges and flowers while missing the hops or malts. Tastes like grapefruit juice with a bitter after-taste. Real bitterness of eating grapefruits.

(Tap) Es hat eine goldgelbe Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist sehr fruchtig, mit Marille, Zitrusfrüchten, Stachelbeeren, süß und etwas Honigmelone. Der Geschmack ist schlank, eher langweiliger, süßlich, etwas würzig und kurz bitter. Im Abgang wird bitte Bittere kräutrig und etwas präsenter.

Une couleur assez typique, bien claire, et une mousse légère et discrète. Au niveau du nez, elle est vraiment typique ; le. litchi domine vraiment , presque trop forte. En bouche, on reconnaît tout de suite la levure Brew Dog. Une fois en bouche, on sent bien cet apport fruit de la passion et bien sûr le litchi, extrêmement présent. La fin de bouche est bien amère comme on l’espère, convaincante et rafraichissante

Aroma lekker fris grapefruit, ananas en kiwi. Smaak is een verlengde van tropisch fruit, maar met heerlijke bitters, die lekker blijft hangen, en doet verlangen naar een volgende slok. Slordige kraag, maar blijft aardig op.
#2 (Re rated naar de 5.6% versie!) Aroma deed me wat meer dan smaak, waar de body minder stevig is (-1). Daardoor volgen de slokken elkaar ook snel op, want smaak is prima.

On draft poured into a snifter. Aroma is slight grassy fruitiness. Appearance is a light golden amber with no head unless swirled. Taste is hoppy with fruit notes like peaches, mango, and orange. Palate is good with just right carbonation. Overall a good brew.

Lots of aroma with herbs, tropical fruits and smoke but unfortunately too much of alcohol. Very pale color and thin body. A bit too bitter, but with a nice mouthfeel. Feels like a mixture of light beer and whisky in a not entirely good way, but overall a money’s worth beer.

For just 15 Danish kroner (around 2 euros) this is simply brilliant. This beer is incredibly golden but a little to clear for my taste, I like my IPA’s a bit more murky. That is just a question of taste though and it does not change the overall impression of this beer. Aroma of flowers, tropical fruits, citrus and hops. The taste is equal to the aroma which I find pleasant. Very fine ballance between the fruit and flower notes and the bitterness in the end

A classic to me, since it was the first IPA I ever drank. I still like it quite a bit! Aroma of citrus hops, malt and tropical fruits. Taste is the same. Bittersweet finish. Well balanced and extremely fresh.

Bottle. Slightly hazy orange golden beer with a huge yellowish head. Strong hoppy aroma with peaches, mango, pine and citrus in the nose. Sweetish with a solid fruity and citric hops backbone, some caramel malts flavors,medium hoppy bitterness and dry finish. Medium-bodied, easy drinking and thirst-quenching. Pretty good.
citrus and pine aroma, clear, minima head, medium bitter. Very good session beer with low carbonation and perfect aroma.
Grapefruit und Orange in der Nase, minimal rauchig. Schöne Bitterkeit mit langem Nachhall.

Bona IPA, una de les que no hauria de faltar enlloc.
Buena IPA, una de las que no debería faltar en ningún sitio.

Beautiful fruity aroma. Ridiculously clear and clean appearance. Golden honey hue. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brewdog Punk was my first IPA when I wasn’t sure if I liked IPA’s. Anyway years later and it’s still one of my favorites which is always sitting in my cooler. First impressions: Floral, carbonated, fresh, bitter-ish and fruity. Clean finish, best to drink in and serve from a chilled environment.

Always had a points boost as it was a good beer I could buy in walking distance, I no longer live in a beerwilderness anymore though. Still a decent beer. It’s clean and drinkable. Ooh has Moyes been sacked???? Hang on...

Cloudy orange. Light aroma of citrus fruits. Very mild taste, on the lighter end of the bitterness spectrum. Lots of orange, guava, even some grapefruit to finish. Finishes a bit sticky, with pine needle bitterness. Interesting take. More like a complex pale ale than an IPA I suppose.
Nice fruity hop aroma. Very balanced for an IPA. On the border between a conventional pale and a traditional IPA. Finishes clean.

Keg in the Kings Head W2. Rather an oversight that I’d not reviewed this previously. Orange amber colour, white foam. Fruity hop nose, mango and passion fruit, hint of lemon. Tastes a bit sweeter, less austerely bitter and lighter of body than I remembered. A bit more mass market maybe??? Still nice, but kind of just nice.
Bottle at Kaffibarinn, Reykjavik, Iceland. amber/gold apperance, small sticky head, sweet smell of hops, grass, dough. little bitter taste that fits the aroma perfectly, great IPA!

Cloudy gold, thicker white head. Sour fruit notes, sweet. Very interesting, complex nose. Sweeter initially, some interesting sour and bitterness. Medium body. Decent amount of carbonation. Really good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pale cloudy yellow, white head. Wonderful tropical fruits and some citrus aromas, similar taste, not too bitter aftertaste, refreshing finish.
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours a transparent gold with a nice layer off cream colored head. Aroma of floral hops and citrus. Taste of oranges and floralness.

@ Röhällavägen. Flaska från Systembolaget (21:-). Fruktig och humlig, exotiska frukter, persika, citrus, grapefrukt och tallbarr, rejäl beska, medelsöt, medelfyllig. Avslutningen är torr, besk och humlig.

Poured from 330mL bottle. Slightly hazy, light orangey yellow with white head. Very fruity and citrusy hop aroma with a little bit of sweet funk. Taste has a bit of grass and mild funk yeast with a bit of citrus hops. Has a bit of an oily texture to start, then turns dry on the swallow.
Liquid is clear, yellowish orange color. Medium body. Medium bitterness, no sweetness. Clear scent but very light aroma of elderflower.
Within its best by date but unfortunately stale. These guys need to make a brewery in the US if they want to competer.

Finally pulled the trigger on buying a bottle of this. 12oz from Malloy’s. Pours a crystal clear light amber into the pint glass. Small white head that dissipates quickly some lacing on the glass. Big grapefruit and floral hop aroma, juicy hop cones, some bready malts. Taste is full and oily, fresh hops, grapefruit and floral notes again, some tropical fruit. Nice bitter finish.
Ipa de sesión para beber de seguido, ligera, aromática y con un sabor muy refrescante, Me encanta !!!
It’s all about the hops. The malt base is for the hops what bread is to marmite. Small white head. Hay transparent. Peachy. Powerful smell, passion fruit. Mango-citrus juice taste.

Une infusion de houblon! Petite bière sympa, de couleur dorée, limpide. Totalement axée sur le houblon, très fruité et résineux. Corps moyen et amertume modérée pour le style, ce qui n’est pas désagréable car bien équilibré. On ne s’en lasse pas!

Had this beer so many times. First time getting round to rating it. Aroma is punchy canned pineapple, tropical fruits and burnt grass. Golden yellow coloured with a thin film of white froth. Flavour is is clean dry crisp bircuity malt and juicy topical fruit hops and nice nelson sauvin hops. Palate is nice and dry, mineral, chalky carbonation. A uk craft beer classic. Sure, its had its ups and downs over the years, but it is tasting good now.

drunk cold, at home playing darksouls. great floral aroma. tropical fruits, passion fruit. nicest aroma experienced. taste is fruity and hoppy, slightly bitter. clean finish with a nice mouthfeel. great fizz to go with the bitterness to give the tongue a workout. fav ipa so far. will drink more over summer
Very nice hoppy and malty aroma . Biternes low like in Pale Ale not like IPA.

Pours golden with a foamy white head which fades to a ring and gradually to nothing. Aroma of grassy hops, tropical fruit, orange and some floral and alcohol hints. Taste of malts, sweetness and tropical fruit, followed by some light hops and earthy bitterness. Some spicy notes, medium carbonation. A fantastic beer.

Bottle, pours clear and bright with firm head. Smells very clear and bright. Hay, oranges and lemons. Tastes very hoppy with bitter,almost sour notes. A little cream through to the end to round off the citrus. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

FZrisk og spenstig sak fra brew dog. Litt for bitter for min smak men absolutt verdt å smake og nyte....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Csak a Jó Sör, Budapest. Pours hazy golden with nice lasting white head. Fruity, citrus aroma with some hops as well. Fruity hops flavor with some bitterness. Medium bodied. Drinkable.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je příjemné, chmelové s ovocným nádechem. Pěna je jasně bílá, jemná, středně vysoká a pomalu mizící. Barva samotného piva je zlatá. Chuť je velmi lahodná, svěží a šťavnatá, má velmi výrazný pomerančový nádech, finiš je příjemně hořký a držící. V ústech pivo působí lehce, je vysoké pitelnosti a má střední říz. Celkově se jedná o velmi příjemné pivo, které by se s klidem dalo pít celou noc.
Per essere una birra contro è oramai un classico. Cosa si può aggiungere? Tanto luppolo, tanto erbaceo, tanta roba. Anche troppa.

Can 33cl. Clear amber, large foamy white head, settles to a thin rim, nice lacing; at first smell of overripe fruity, aroma of apricot, orange, tangerine, citrus, marmalade, spruce, ginger, pungent hops; taste is moderate sweet and fruity (citrus, orange), slightly bitter; oily texture (a bit thin but not watery), medium body, lively carbonation; bitter hoppy finish with a little malty sweetness and touch of citrus.

Poured into a pint glass out of a 22oz bomber.

Pours a hazy medium gold with a very thin, fizzy white head that settles to just a thin ring around the edge of the glass. Not impressive.

Aroma has some overripe fruit character made up of oranges and tangerines. Maybe a touch of grapefruit thrown in there as well. A light touch of toasted malt.

Flavor is lacking in intensity unfortunately. Orange and tangerine dominate with some juiciness but it is a little too subdued. Bitterness is only moderate as well. Malt is in the background and props up the body but barely; just a bit of toast. The mouthfeel is probably the worst thing about this beer. Just watery all the way around.

Overall, I was expecting a bit more out of this beer. It just doesn’t really stand up to some of the great IPA’s being produced today. This might have been a standout beer in the U.K. years ago but I feel that probably isn’t the case any longer.
Absolut den bedste IPA på markedet i forhold til pris. Dejlig duft og nøddebrun farve. Genial øl!
Hazy orange, airy white head, some lacing. Hoppy aroma, some citrus. Clean, crisp taste, hops and delicate, slightly dry bitterness. Refreshing and very drinkable.
Flaske fra SB Sälen. Gyllen brun med tykt hvitt skum. Lukter humle og sitrus samt noe furu/skog. Smaker sitrus og humle, ganske bittert. Medium kullsyre. Kort, men god bitter ettersmak.
A gorgeous top class welcoming aroma, nice colour, great taste and lasting genuine taste
Bon d’accord c’est très bien fait et on peut apprécier le houblon sur cette IPA légendaire.
From tap at Beerstore Thessaloniki. Light hazy pale golden color with white head. Grassy and floral hoppy aroma. Taste is fruity hoppy again with bitter finish.
Beautiful color with a thick head. Nice fruity aroma accompanied with balanced taste.

Bottle - Pale Gold in colour. Hoppy; grassy and piney resinous hops. Fruity; grapefruit citrus and tropical fruit. Malty; biscuit malt, caramel. Hoppy fruity throughout with a dry bitter finish. More balanced, less astringent, less aggressively hopped than the original and earlier 6% version. Very Drinkable. Nice IPA!

Old rating was so old and inaccurate (8/3/8/3/16=3.8) for current condition of this brew so I'm gonna re-rate it with joy. Resinous aroma with some floral hops and mild fruit. Hazy yellow to golden color with small sized white head. Taste is nowhere near "explosion of tropical fruit flavours" as it says in description. More like mediocre Pale Ale, slightly fruity, moderate bitterness, some resin, grapefruit and grass with a hint of herbs. Thin body, average carbonation. Drinkability is it's best part. Other than that, nothing special. Not even a shadow of what once was Punk IPA. Too bad. //bottle from Aldi
Bottle from the thomas Sheraton, Stockton. Pours amber with almost no head. Massively piney and fresh in both aroma and taste. A good bitter finish. Refreshing and very good.
There is a light citrus floral aroma. Its a nice pale color with a little cloudyness to it. Has a light hop to it that lingers with a citrus taste.

0.33l bottle. Pours clear golden with medium creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, citrusy, hops.. one of the best aroma ever, if not the best! Taste is citrus, some other tropical fruits, caramel, biscuit, bready and grassy notes. Medium carbonation. One of best beers!

Cloudyish golden color, average sized white head. Medium to full body, soft to average carbonation. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, pineapple, pine, but there is also some sweet maltiness. Medium bitter, medium sweet taste. Excellent.
Pours a clear copper. Strong aroma of grapefruits. Taste is fruit with mild bitterness.
Cerveja IPA com drinkability diferenciado, por ser um pouco menos alcoólica. Coloração clara.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark yellow with orange hue and large whitehead. Soft and sweet aroma of pineapple (lots of it!), mango, some lime. Taste: tropical fruits and lots of orange zest, lime, some spicy notes. Not quite as sweet as the aroma, this is a nice dry ipa with a long bitter finish. I want more already!

Mas info en http://www.encopasabemejor.com/2013/09/brewdog-punk-ipa.html
El aroma es mas que envolvente, lo componen unos matices intensos y penetrantes espectacularmente florales, especiados y frutales con los frutos exóticos de protagonistas como el mango y el lychee que invita a deleitarse de nuevo con su olor una y otra vez (invitaría el agitar en movimientos circulares el vaso de servicio y probar a oler el mismo ya que muestra todo su potencial).
Su sabor es mas que delicioso y sabroso, con notas frutales pasando por un toque sutil especiado para acabar con el punto floral del lúpulo perfectamente integrado que nos invita a repetir el proceso de captación de sus matices.

Really liked this one, impressive on the nose with clean aromas of citrus and pineapple. I also smelled a touch of ginger. In the mouth it has a strong bitterness which lingers in the mouth and makes it especially good in the summer heat. 
Cloudy in the glass and medium body: definitively a good beer.
Nearly perfect beer. Ideal for both-drinking and degustating. Nothing else to say but this one is a must for every beer fan!

Bujna piana drobno pęcherzykowa choć nawet szybko rozbija się na większe bąble. Kolor jasny lagerowy złoty, idealnie klarowne. Aromaty od razu z butelki są idealne! Amerykańskie chmiele, grejpfrut trochę żywicy. Naprawdę jest dobrze, to piwo można tylko wąchać. Goryczka średnia. Wysycenie średnie ale idealnie skomponowane. Po prostu cudo.
Dunkelgelb, fruchtig grasiges aroma, ausgewogener malziger hintergrund , schöne passende hopfenbittere, im abgang abgerundet, anhaltende bittere aber nicht agressiv

Bottled. Brilliant. Ideal appearance - light amber color touched by some dark yellow tones, impressive white tense foam. Ideal aroma - overwhelming balance of hopps and herbs, just like IPA should smell. Ideal taste - medium bitterness with some interesting sweet notes. Body is somewhere between medium and full, texture is more thick, finish is long enough to understand that this is an ideal balanced IPA.
Backlog. Tried it a number of times both on tap and the bottled version. A decent IPA, but that’s about it.
Wowzers. If you want an IPA with a punch this is the beer for you! There’s a big hint of mango in the aftertaste that is very pleasant. Just as nice on tap as from a bottle. A beer to enjoy!
Pours clear dark yellow with minimal head. Aroma is fruity and herbal. Very soft bitterness with short bittersweet aftertaste.

Strong spices and hops come from a small white ale head. Body is clear orange or dark yellow. The taste is rich with hops and nice bitterness. Excellent balance and nice to have low alcohol.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
on tap. clear golden orange with small head. aroma is malty with fruity notes. taste is similar.
From bottle. On the nose is big and citrus. Taste is piney with Some citrus and a sweet biscuity malt

rich, almost overwhelming citrus. nice refreshing beer. a bit on the bitter side, but very nice none the less.

-- via beerbasher/winphone
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Cerveceria Internacional. Color amarillo anaranjado. Intenso sabor a lupulo, ligeramente amargo, citrico. Muy fresca y facil de beber. Una IPA extraordinaria.
Nice beer, some residual sweetness, well balanced, grassy, fruitiness, I like
This yellow beer has a very nice citrus and pine aroma. It hits your tongue hard with a hoppy bite.
Klar gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av fruktig humle. Smak av sitrus og grapefrukter. Bittersøt. Vinmonopolet.

Clear golden beer with a firm white head. Medium carbonation. Strong fruity citrus aroma. Taste starts out fruity than a mix of caramel and bitterness. Also a strong bitterness in the aftertaste. An IPA as an IPA should be. Excellent.

Pours a white head, that last for a decent amount of time. Golden colour without much carbonisation. Hints of citrus and caramel and an intense aroma of passion fruit. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Definitely worth tasting. Probably the best IPA ive ever tasted. (so far)

0,33L bottle, BB 30.10.2014. Pours very slightly hazy golden with white head. The head stays for a moment, lacing is decent. Aroma is intense fruits, pine, and citrus. Taste is sweet and bitter, caramel, fruits, and pine, slightly watery. Finish is intense pine and grapefruit bitter. Overall: had this many times over the years and it has gotten worse over the years. Used to be good, now it’s just OK brew, but nothing more.

660 ml bottle. Pours a nice hazy, sediment laden bright golden with a fair eggshell head that settles to a ring and leaves some foamy lace. Nose involves an initial blast of pineapple followed by some other tropical fruit, spice notes, some melon, some caramelized sugars, almost some banana esters, some kiwi, peaches and apricots, and some sweet grain. Fairly sweet flavor, but quite bitter. Medium to light bodied, quite oily, bright, a bit sticky, with a lengthy and refreshing fruity hoppy bitterness. Damn fine brew, really enjoying the aromatics.
One of most balanced ipa’s from the very, very intresting brewery. Aroma is pine, fruit and wine.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein orangegoldenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv malzig, fruchtig herb. Geschmack sehr mild fruchtig bitter nach exotischen Früchten.

11.2 oz bottle into a tulip.

A: Pours a hazy golden color. There’s a one finger white-colored head, but it has poor retention. Lacing is decent enough, though.

S: I’m not sure how fresh this is (because IPA from Scotland), but it still has a decent hop profile to it. Not an amazing one, though I can forgive that. It’s loaded with pine, grapefruit, and *maybe* some apricot. The malt backbone comes through quite strongly, loaded with caramel and toffee. Not bad.

T: I pick up some Nelson Sauvin-esque fruitness, especially on the opening. It’s weird, actually - it’s a combination of grape-y-ness and mint. The more I sip it, the more the mint comes through. And the more I sip it, the more the mint ruins the balance of everything. I even dare suggest it’s medicinal. While the general flavor isn’t very good, it’s not an undrinkable mess. That’s great, I suppose...

M: It’s pretty light on the palate, which is good. In spite of its age, it’s also pretty dry - and that’s also good too, I don’t want this mint bomb to linger on my palate any further. Carbonation is about medium.

O: This would be a lot better if it were fresh. Seeing as I’m a ’Merican who’s not in Scotland and don’t have access to this AFAP (as fresh as possible), I have to grade it as is, which means I can’t give it a good score. Come to think about it, is it really worth buying foreign IPAs? They’re always going to be more expensive, and likely won’t be fresh, either.
Catching up on some old ratings from Untappd -- First rated on 25 May 2011. Comments: "I like that. I really really like that."
Good easy to drink IPA. Very easy to drink, can be my everyday IPA. One can feel the hops softly, good to start the evening with it.

Sept 10 -15 - From the keg this is just a superior IPA, where others might go all hop forward and IBU in the sky numbers this is just brilliantly balanced and delightful in many way, aroma, appearance, tastes profile and moorishness. and being honest possibly session worth even if ends badly at some point when you wander off for a kebab and the bus home. 

Feb 28 -14 There is intention in the hops, but it’s not a roller coaster of a ride. It’s just a competent beer that shouldn’t frighten anyone away.

Excellent taste, really bitter, grass, pine flowers, some fruits. Bitter aftertaste, long ang dry. Light to medium body with low to medium carbonation. Excellent!!!!

Oh man this is a great one! Aroma of fruity citrusy hops. Tastes of all the usual citrus fruits associated with a great hoppy IPA: mango, passionfruit, tangerine, oranges, etc. A slightly bitter grassy finish ties it all together. Bottle from Ammersin, Vienna. Clear, golden, slightly amber body, with medium, creamy, white head. Aroma of flowers, passion fruit, mango, citrus, biscuit, grass. Tastes of citrus, some other tropical fruits and a nice, determined malt backbone, with caramel, biscuit, bready and grassy notes. Mouthfeel is medium, slick, medium carbonated and it finishes bitter/sweet, with citrus, candy and grass. A tasty, distinctive, greatly balanced IPA, where also multifarious malt notes get their room. The comparatively low ABV also makes this an easy to drink beer for every occasion. Simply a great job!

Ap: Hazy light orange - small white head with moderate retention, leaves some lacing and ridges of foam, with a thin, almost solid cap.
T: Clean bready malt - orange pith, grapefruit, lemon - zesty - high bitterness, very clean - pine and some malt sweetness with more lemon and grapefruit.
P: Medium-light body with high carbonation - finish is dry.
O: Full-flavored and easy-drinking IPA - very fresh, with a nice background malt profile - classic citrus and pine hops, a really well-made AIPA.

Pours a lazy golden orange and leaves the same colored body with a one finger white foamy head that rises a bit but then allows some leverage to level at a nice pace; moderate sticky lacing clings to the glass; the aroma has sweet citrus up front, some light malts enter in the background; the flavoring is sticky sweet and leaves a citrusy residue all around, sweet citrusy aftertaste, dry finish; its mostly easy on the palate, somewhat sessionable, carbonation - what carbonation - there is nothing smoother than this AIPA - no where close to the normal harshness of an AIPA, but honestly not bad, like I already said just plain weird to me; overall I like it for the most part - it just seems fairly different than most AIPA’s

Enjoying this one on Xmas Eve. Lovely citrus aroma coming through in the smell comparable to a glass of grapefruit juice you’d have with breakfast. The appearance is quite lager like with a fizzy yellow liquid and pale white head but that is where the similarities end. In the taste the hops are pronounced but not overly strong and again its the citrus notes in the flavor that really pull through. The mouth feel is actually quite thick and slightly chewy. This sets the standards for an IPA and is a must try.
A very good IPA with a malt body from the Marris Otter Malt. It's nice to taste a good IPA with more body than the dry biscuit Pale Ale Malts gives you after a solid and effective fermentation.

Appearence wise this beer is fine, golden and with a soapy head which dies off quick but stays clinging to the glass.

Smell: Citrus, pine and grapefruit. It smells crisp and inviting.

Taste: For me initially it’s grapefruit, citrus and a slight bit of sweetness before the sharpness of the hops properly kicks in. Nothing too complex but very nice.

Palate: Crisp and dry with medium carbonation.

Overall: I really like this beer and I look forward to drinking it out on a warm sunny day as I feel it will be even better. I have had better IPAs but there is nothing to complain about with this! I will buy again (especially as it is easy to get at a reasonable price here)

Snifter at Triangle Wine. Good aroma. Sweet. Fruity. Orange mango apricot. Tad hazer golden yellow color. Good lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body smooth creamy mouthfeel. Bitter finish. Nice stuff. Great flavor at it abv level
In bottiglia. Bevuta diverse volte, buona birra anche se non eccelsa. Facilmente reperibile e già è una buona notizia

Couleur : vieil or. Nez : litchi, citron, pêche, raisin blanc. A peine moins exotique que la précédente. Bouche : assez douce, très belle amertume bien maîtrisée là encore. Version soft de la Hardcore si on peut dire : mangue, ananas, litchi. Moins de caramel que dans les précédentes.
Finale : à peine moins longue que la Hardcore, manque un peu de punch.

Look: Pours with average sized off-white (light yellow hue) head consisting of medium/big bubbles. It has fast but ok looking retention, mostly diminishing, leaves a thin, pale but uniform top layer; a bit of random lacing when coming down. Clear with very light haze, pale gold, lots of chain bubbles. 




Smell: Fruity, sweet ripe lemon, pine and grapefruit - fresh but tangy. Light caramel, pale malt notes. The tangy part with time develops into a bit more herbal, dandelion leaves like notes. 




Taste: The citrus sweetness tuned down, pine and grapefruit most dominant, still a bit tangy. Goes into light sweet biscuit and lighter caramel middle. Some of the middle backbone is missing. Goes to pine, grapefruit pith, spiky medium bitterness. It lingers for a while, reminds me of eating older dandelion leaves. 




Mouthfeel: Medium body, medium, suiting carbonation, a bit of coating at the end. 




Overall: It’s suiting, not demanding, but nothing special. What it does, it does well enough to enjoy it, especially on a hot summer day.

Aroma: massive hops and indeed, some tropical fruit (mango and pineapple?). Appearance: gold, slight haziness, big white head. Taste: lightly sour and slightly bitter, very refreshing. Palate: lively, bitter. Overall: amazing IPA, refreshing. What a drink! Pint at the Chelsea Potter, London.

Taste follows the same sort of pattern, punchy hoppy taste, not too carbonated and a bitterness that doesn’t linger for too long at all. One of my favourite beers, finally getting around to rating, superb.

WOW! Hazy, shiny tangerine-orange color with small white good lacing yummy head.
Hello! How are you?! But as answer I took an amazing tropical fruit punch in my nose! This mix is just marvellous! First of all mango - tons of fresh cut mango, than comes pineapple and grapefruit. Going further to meet evergreen spruce with branches fully covered with candies and sweeties! Damn.. Amazing.. I wonder if its possible to find perfume like this)
The taste is reeeally electric! It party replicates the smell and its there is so much energy inside of every sip - it’s like swallowing sunbeams!! Ephasized bisquits from malts and a bit resinous from hops. Medium body, feels crispy. An orgazmic fresh and pleasantly bitter sharp aftertaste. Skilfully covered alcohol - should look after amount of drunk. Excellent choice for the first acquaintance with BrewDog.

Goud geel kleurig bier( Regina zei het lijkt wel pis) licht van smaak die lang blijft hangen met een klein bittertje.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Love the aroma of hops. Pours light amber with small head. Nice bitterness, like it!

Esta cerveza con 6% de alcohol, es influenciada por ambos lados del Atlántico, la fusión de la IPA es de color oro claro, con un aroma a frutas tropicales y caramelo que se queda en la nariz. El paladar pronto se convierte firme con el sabor a la resina de lúpulo de Nueva Zelanda, equilibrada por la galleta de la malta. El acabado es agresivo y el seco sabor del lúpulo va surgiendo durante el calentamiento del alcohol.


Este fresco, sabor natural de la cerveza es nuestro homenaje a los IPAs clásico del año viejo. El giro post-moderno es la adición del lúpulo afrutado, increíble dando una explosión de sabores de frutas tropicales y un final amargo agudo.
Hop dominant - very floral - good bitterness - lighter bodied with honey malt - sessionable pale.

Excellent brew. I had this one and was a bit dismayed by the low abv and I thought the lack of it would lessen the intensity of the taste. After all this is the brewery that put out the End of History, one of the brews with the highest abv. Man was I wrong. This is a fine brew. Amber hue. Darker than your typical IPA. Big head. Hoppy. A bit malty too. But it is not dry. The wash down is smooth. It tatstes better than other IPA’s with a higher abv. Fine brew. Me likes the Scottish. Rock your kilt with this bad boy!

Pours a clear yellow/golden with a white head. Aroma of grassy hops, citrus fruits, grapefruit. Not as bitter as you’ve come to expect from the style. Quite fond of this one, nice and easy to drink IPA. Over the years this become a bit of a middle of the road IPA to my tastebuds.

On tap at De Spuyt. Clear gold pour with small white head. Aroma of light buttery notes, peachy hops, very light citrusy/piney notes. Taste is biscuity, light fruity hop flavor, a bit soapy. Palate is light with medium carbonation. Definitely taste faded, still not too bad.

Color amarillo pálido, media capa de espuma que perdura unos mms, aromas marcados a cítricos, pomelo y flores, entrada muy suave con un toque cítrico, al principio no se aprecia amargor pero al rato te sorprende, alcohol moderado, notas herbales, una IPA más suave que las made in USA , muy refrescante , pos gusto herbal.
Zachter en fruitiger dan ik verwacht had. Met natuurlijk een mooie bitterheid om het af te sluiten. Een behoorlijke aanrader!

Bomber from La Primera. Pours an unclear orange with a bit of a white head that faded quickly. Little lacing. Aroma has -- I wanted to say "hullow, how are yuh" -- citrus and other fruits and pine and caramel. Taste is of bitter grapefruit and lemons, sweet caramel malts and mangoes and some resin. Medium bodied and sticky. Finishes to the bitter side of bittersweet. A solid IPA with some nice tastes, leaning bitter.

Bonne IPA assez équilibrée. Pas très longue en bouche. Couleur assez claire.
Ce n’est pas ma préférée de chez Brewdog mais c’est une très bonne façon de faire découvrir les IPA...

Classic US West Coast IPA taste despite the fact that Brewdog is Scotish. Love this IPA

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (660mL) from BrewDog Online Store. One of my all-time favourite beers, could drink it every day. Not one element really stands out, but it is just a well made, well balanced IPA. Piney, grapefruit hops, subtle malt sweetness, full body, great mouthfeel. Love it!

Orange hazy beer with a white medium longlasting head. Aroma is pure brewdog hoppiness, floral, fruity, piney, resinous, bubblegum. Almost artificial like. Taste is a somewhat short of the aroma, still nicely hopped, but not really kicking. Doesn't deliver what the aroma promises, but good and drinkable nevertheless.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brewdog really knows how to brew beer. And they made a really good ipa. The taste is full. Would definitely recommend
Can at the Dickens, nice IPA. Aromas of flowers and grain. Taste is quite bitter, and long lasting.
Almost clear yellow orange appearance with medium low head. Pine, grapefruit citric aroma. Medium low sweetness, medium towards high bitterness, light medium body. Satisfying and very good IPA.

Bottle. Clear golden pour with one inch thick white head. Intense aroma with pine and tropical fruit. Clear pine taste as well. Medium bitterness. Limited alcohol and all in all a very drinkable brew.

Rated the 21st May 2012.
Aroma: Grassy hops. 
App.: Yellow with small white head, not lasting.
Flavour: Nice bitterness from the hops, from start to finish.
Soft carbonation, dry body.

geel met oranje glans, minimale witte kraag

aroma: lekkere frisse ipa hoppigheid, citrus, grapefruit, frisse dennennaalden, gras

smaken:redelijk zoet, redelijk bitter, dennennaalden, citrus, mooi hoppig, fruit, smaken zijn goed gebalanceerd.
matig tot redelijke body, erg goede IPA. ben hier zéér tevreden over !
Cerveja punk. Aroma de frutas, fantÃ¡stico. Amargor marcante, desce fÃ¡cil. Retrogosto deixa um amargor nÃ£o tÃ£o agradÃ¡vel. PorÃ©m cerveja muito boa. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Santa Cruz, CA. Best by Nov. 26, 2013... Seeming to be on last leg of drinking window.. Definitely not the freshest. Hazy light amber/orange pour. Subtle aromas and flavors of sweet citrus, stone-fruit, honey and tropical fruit. Medium-medium-plus body, with pleasant, soft, creamy carbonation. A nice pale ale, which has its charm, though definitely no 'West Coast' hop monster, especially when considering it was best while still in shipment to USA months ago. Overall, easy drinking, with a pleasant mouthfeel, and subtle aromas and flavors. Would like to try a fresher bottle for contrast. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Bottle @ home. Color is golden with huge head that leaves lacing on the glass. Aroma is heavenly with loads of citrus and pine. Taste is packed with citrus, apple and bread. Not bitter at all,very close to a APA.

Slightly hazy body that is fairly light yellow in color. The white head disappears quickly but leaves some lacing on the glass. Nose has loads of pine accompanied by some tropical tones and honey. Taste is nice with a clean bitterness, followed by a piney dry finish. Carbonation is average and the palate is just right at medium. Overall a decent IPA.
Bij de balcken in den burg uit de fles in een fluit glas van de brouwerij, door get glas komen de geuren helaas niet helemaal tot zijn recht, ondanks dat mooie geur en snaak van fruitige hoppen
Zippie van rikkie. Goudgeel bier. Weinig smaak. Aroma is hoppig. Smaak is bitter, blijft goed hangen. Mooi bier.

Very hoppy on the nose. With grapefruit rushing at you. I can also get some more nebulous citrus and a floral note. Very bold aroma. Pours clear amber with a two finger head. Medium bodied, lovely and crisp. Juicy grapefruit up front with caramel malt backing it up. When it warms it does develop some piney credits. Fine example of a British-made West Coast IPA.

Pint in Oslo Bar, Galway. Grapefruit and hops. Very bitter and therefore not to everyone’s taste, but if IPA is your thing you’ll need to go a long way to beat this. Especially impressive as I’d been drinking Oslo Bar’s in-house IPA before which was itself an excellent brew but the Punk trumped it. I’d been waiting a long time to try this, was not disappointed.
Not sure about it, my high expectations may have affected the rating, but still. im pretty dissapointed with it, was hoping for something extraordinary, but its just standard ipa i’d say...

Bottle from Canal’s. Pours out an odd orangy color with a small white head. Aroma is of orange peel, floral/fruity hops and light bread crust. Taste is on the lighter bodied end, but a nice does of fruity/citrusy hop notes, orange peel, some floral flavors and grainy bread in the background among the bitterness. Solid.
This really is one of those beers. Looks great, smells wonderful, tastes intense. Heavy on hoppage and grapefruits. Superb.-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

En pression 25cl into tulip. Lille. 

Appearance: hazy pale golden color beautiful white head.

Aroma: strong citrus grapefruit, hops, wheat.

Taste: dry, not very bitter

Palate: on the thinner side, not especially long

Overall, not an ipa fan, but enjoyed this. Wasn’t bitter, dry. Nice.

Bought it at Auchan, because i liked the look of the bottle. I only discovered later what a famous brewery this comes from.
One of my favourite IPA, more than only bitter, but lots of fruit both when you smell and taste, grapefruit, orange. Bitter but well balanced finish. Also nice colour.

Pours slight hazy golden, finger white head

Smell floral hops, flowery.

Taste bitter, bit of veggies, malty but decent floral hops as well.

Light to mid body, sticky

ok

Very (VERY) easy to drink, a great IPA option for people not used to IPA, perfect session IPA also

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Immonde, la biere dégage une odeur de litchis, au gout c’est indescriptible une amertume agresse la langue et le palais et laisse un arrière goût atroce. 
Habitué aux bières belge forte, je n’ai pas réussi a finir celle-ci...

Härligt fruktig med perfekt beska. Vacker mörkgul färg med en fint fast skum. 
En riktig angenäm öl.

Loads of citrus aromas some floral too. Very large head and leather brown.

Draught
Aroma-citrus, grapefruits
Appearance-minimal head, clear, pale, 
Taste-very bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, slick feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-very good

Original bottle @BlåRock Tromsø 2013-10-25 at RateMeet-II with Rune.
Nice head on amber body. Aroma of hops, grapefruit, peaches, and very much of it and good. Tastes hops, bittermalts, fruits, some sweet malts too.
Mouthfeel okay, well balanced and somewhat dry on palate.
Ends with grapefruit, bitter hops, bread , dark bread, grapes in a burp.
Overall tasty dry herby.

I love BrewDog. Bottle @ home at the beginning of my holiday. Light gold, good white head. Aroma big hit of pineapple with grapefruit. Sweet, fresh, peppery. Taste surprisingly sweet and slightly tangy. Yum. A modern classic.

Degustada logo depois da Duvel Triple Hop...

Intensidade similar em aroma e sabor, porém a Duvel é um pouco mais doce.

Bottle from Öllepood Tartu. Tall lasting head. First citrus then Sweat full berry aroma. Bitterness. Bubbly.
