Didn’t really like the taste, but the aroma was pretty full on. I suppose this is as close you can get to a US IPA style over in the UK.

Bottiglia
Ottima IPA con un luppolato non troppo esagerato ma ben equilibrato
Bardzo ładny chmielowy aromat. W smaku wytrawne, ale takie trochę mało wyraźne, może nie wodniste, ale czegoś mu brakuje.

Bottle. Small off-white head atop lightly hazed amber body. Aroma is sweet, pine, some grapefruit, light lemon. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, pine and some lemon. Light-medium body, light effervescence. Enjoyable
Citrus hops aroma. Citrus flavor, slight-sweet fruit and very mild malt that’s way in the background. A rock solid IPA if you’re a fan of citrusy IPAs.

Ahhhhhhhhhhh la Punk IPA.
Je vais pas la noter comme je fais d’habitude en expliquant ses caractéristiques, c’est l’une des bières qui m’a fait découvrir ce qu’était la bière, c’est à dire pas une simple boisson à boire entre pote dans des bars de seconde zones. 
En plus de ça, avec la Tomahawk Mikkeler, elle m’a appris à aimer la richesse de l’amertume, l’intérêt du houblon...
Une sorte de madeleine de Proust.
Keg at Salt House, Galway. Golden beer with white head. Notably fruity flavour to go with the hoppiness expected from an IPA

Bouteille 33cl. Belle robe orangée claire, filtrée ? Petillance modérée. Col de mousse peu à moyennement persistant.Notes d?agrumes au nez. Amertume bien presente, l?ensemble est harmonieux. La finale est modérée à longue. Une réussite. (13/10/13)

Bottle. Hazy orangey/amber. Citrus aromas, along with pineapple and a touch of pine and malt. Grapefruit, lemon, pineapple and pine flavours with a well integrated malt background. Mid level, but long lasting bitterness. An enjoyable ipa which doesn't suck all the moisture from your mouth with cloying bitterness but makes you want to have another sip. Just my style.

660ml bottle, batch 177. 
Frothy white head, some lacing, clear golden body. Great nose of tropical fruit, mango, orange. Flavour is grapefruit, grass, a little pine, slightly sour apple. Some malty sweetness comes through in the middle. Solid full mouthfeel, a bit of chewiness with medium carbonation. Punk has been variable since the new brewery but this is decent, nose is a bit better than the flavour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Bottled, batch 161, BB 10/07/14, large sample. Hazy yellow color, short lasting white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, bit pine, hint of lychee, tropical fruit. Firm bitter taste, citrussy again, slight hint of malt. Wonderfully balanced. Lovely IPA.
On draft at Sabadell fest.Really in near than a pale ale style.Clean with a white head.Low body.Low flavor.Is not a intense IPA.I think is better at can.

Trübes, helles bersteinfarbenes IPA mit feinporigem Schaum. Fruchtiges Aroma nach Ananas, Grapefruit und Zitrone. Semitrockener Antrunk gefolgt von hoher Fruchtigkeit. Der Abgang ist leicht bitter mit holzigem Einschlag nach Kiefer, Tanne, Pinie etc. Weiß zu gefallen!

Bottle from Systemet. 
Light cloudy amber. Much citrus, pineapple and above all pine. Very nice, prominent bitterness, but with a bit to sour aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very nice, very fruity beer. Lots of pineapple and a bit of pine. Light looking, golden beer.

Bottle poured into tulip glass. Pours a hazy golden colour with a white head, which clings nicely to the glass. Aromas are of grapefruit and other tropical fruits, very hoppy. Flavour is similar, with a deeply bitter finish, really clings to your cheeks.

330 ml bottle. Little bit cloudy, light orange colour, short-life white small head, lively fizziness, orange and mandarin aroma, light body, light slight malty taste, tropical hoppy palate. In my point of view it isn’t a real IPA style beer, but well-balanced without off-tastes.

Flaske 0,33l fra polet. En av mine første IPAer tidligere i år. Fruktig liten sak som alltid leverer. Er vel den IPAn jeg stoler på dersom jeg skal konsumere mange på en kveld, pga dens ypperlige lettdrikkelighet. Lite skum, men ellers en gylden gulfarge. Nydelig fruktig citrusaroma og smak av humle, ananas og/eller grape? Ikke veldig bitter. Passet godt til gårsdagens taco... God!

I did it again! First IPA I ever tried.. not that love at first sight, but very interesting fruity and hoppy beer.. for that point. Actually I am tasting it now and I havent changed my mind - nothing extreme but really decent and enjoyable brew. Intense citrus, pine, decent bitterness. Bit dry

On tap. Copper/golden colour, with an average head that diminishes fairly quickly, leaving a good lace. Very nice tropical aroma. Medium bitter and medium sweet taste. Low to average carbonation, medium to full bodied, oily texture. The epitome of all IPA’s really.

12 oz bottle. The beer pours to a light copper slightly cloudy color with a small white head. The aroma is strong with citrus & stone fruit hop scent. The taste is light in body with a slight bitter finish. More like a session IPA to me. Overall a good IPA.

Die amerikanischen Hopfen kommen im Aroma super durch. Das Bier ist trocken, aber nicht astringierend. Ein bisschen zu viel nachhängend.


Edit: Die Nächhängende Bittere ist mittlerweile weg. SEHR GEIL, besser als in Erinnerung.
Citrus maar niet heel veel. Goede bite. In balans. Chinees bij eten. Dikkig in de mond
had this again, better than i remembered, classic new ipa aroma and taste, light and refreshing body but not watery.

Lovely pine and citrus aroma. Pours a nice hazy orange colour. Great crisp citrus taste, very refreshing, especially with the low alcohol, nice and hoppy without tasting like windex, with a bit of sweetness to balance it out. Has a very crisp finish to it, with a very floral aftertaste.
Had the great opportunity to drink in the brewdog bar in bristol. Lovely tropical crisp flavour.
A hardcore hoppy one. Full of flavour and a bright orange color. The normal alcohol quantity lets you enjoy more than one

Alluring tropical fruit aroma in a golden pour.  Restrained hop forward balance with a light body and clean finish.  A benchmark international IPA on account of it being widely available and definitely excellent.

Nose is papaya, pineapple and a touch of strawberry. Lovely.  Taste is grapefruit rind leading to light resin and a pineapple finish. Mouthfeel is a little thin. Good gateway IPA.

Edit 2017. Big bottle and it’s awful. Nose is banana and pineapple. Taste is malty, resin, slightly stale. Hope it’s just a bad batch but this is bland and has lost its cheerful breezy style.
Wonderful fresh tasting beer. Notes of elder flower, which give it a fruity, floral note. A bit of bitterness and a fresh aftertaste.

Aroma: Pine, Almonds, Hops and citrus with a hint of tobacco or another fairly astringent herb. Quite robust

Appearance: Fairly cloudy burnt orange with an average and steady white head.

Taste: Crisp and robust notes of sweet citrus with biter floral hops (which fallows in the Finnish) exceptionally complex and deep to the point that two beers may in fact vary despite being identical.

Palate: Lively and robust with a finish as good as it its to drink

Overall: 10/10 would buy again...as a keg.

Lovely pale and hazy color. Aroma is a great perfume of citrus, tropical fruit, pine, earth and fresh hops. Nice fruity and Round palate. Aftertaste is fruity hops with a well rounded fresh finish. Overall: excellent brew!

Aroma: The smell is citric and floral, grape-fruit with pine resin.
Appearance: This beer is slightly hazy, golden, an off-white head that leaves god lacing.
Taste: The brew has an initial caramel sweetness, then freshly squeezed grape-fruit juice, pine needles and resin.
Palate: Medium carbonation, small bubbles, soft and refreshing feeling, a medium body, a dry finish.
Overall: This is very clean and nice, well balanced but full flavors that really turns me on! (This is the new version, better than the can as I remember it)
Note: Bottle 330 ml. Reviewed 2011-06-06.

A hazy, orange-yellow beer with a medium and white head. The nose is strongly tropical, mangos, some papaiyas and fructose, enjoyable. Taste of tropical fruits, mangos, grapefruits, some pine needles. Medium bitterness, but enough and smoothly. The end is quite dry, piney and grapefruity. Medium bodied, nice carbonation. Enjoyable beer with nice tropical fruits.

Bottle. Powerfull hop aroma with intense grape and mango with some pine to be found beneath. The taste is mostly focused on fruity hop. The malt is just subtle in the background as it should. It could however have done with more bitterness. It is light in body and has lively carbonation just as an IPA should. The finish however is a bit dissapointing, not as bitter and powerfull as it could have been. There is even some disturbing yeast taste in the finish.
A really nice IPA. Its not extreme in anyway but it is good example of the style even if it could have been more bitter.
Golden color. Aroma is fruits, mostly pineapple and citrus. Taste is hoppy with fruits and citrus notes. Nice bitterness. It’s really great and tasty beer.

One of the first IPA’s that I’ve tried. Fair priced, always available and always tasty, even if it’s not the same beer anymore. It’s getting better though.
Good balance. Citrus, grass and bread in aroma. Some sweetness. Pretty big bitterness.
Hazy straw color, white head. Citrus nose, grapefruit, hint of bubblegum. Sweet taste, hint of peach. Hoppy and refreshing, moderate bitterness.
Kopparfärgad med fint skum! Mycket humle och bra smak! Som på flaska med lite mindre kolsyra

Bottle at home. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is fragrant grassy, citrus, and earthy hops with cracker malt and peach esters. Flavor is heavy hops and bitterness, supporting malt, light fruity esters and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

(Bottle): Pours a slightly hazy pale gold with a medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lemon zest, floral and slight tropical fruit juice character. Fruity hop flavour - lots of grapefruit, passionfruit with a nice subdued malty background. Just enough bitterness to make it a great session IPA.
Great IPA. Very drinkable for a brewdog IPA. I only expected more body and more bitterness. Still a great beer.

Golden colour with a fast fading light white head. Noses floral, of grapefruit citrus hops and lightly of pineapple. Light texture starting off lightly sweet with some bitter notes developing the body from light to medium. Finish is showing some fruity dryness, could last a wee bit longer. Nice overall though.

Appearance: Hazy yellow color with a fine white head that leaves a nice lacing.
Aroma: Citric hoppy and mild fruity.
Palate: Medium body. Tad sweet and a rich bitterness. Average carbonation.
Taste: Balanced citric hoppy, mild fruity and a fine malty back.
Overall impression: Tasty and refreshing IPA.
Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden.

Plenty of fruit aroma from the glass. Slightly hazy, pale golden hue. Very drinkable. A 'session' IPA, although more like a standard pale ale than an IPA. Recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.33l from P&M Bonn. Pours a hazy orange yellow with small white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma is grapefruit galore. Taste is also very fruity, grapefruit and citrus, grapefruit with a well balanced bitterness. This goes down so easy. Almost like a session beer. Very good.

Bouteille de 33cl @MaltingPot. Bière blonde au col très mince à faible effervescence. Au nez, d’abord des senteurs de malt, de houblon floral et puis une légère amertume aux éffluves d’agrumes. En bouche elle a tout d’une PL british : malt doux et légèrement grillé conférant sa rondeur habituelle. L’amertume est bien présente sans être trop prononcée. Le palais légèrement gras. La finale est rêche avec une pointe terreuse. C’est honnête comme boisson de tous les jours. Frais et désaltérant

Pours a hazy light orange. Has a nice strong pine and floral hop aroma with some citrus hops too. Taste starts light with some floral and citrus. Then it has a light bite at the end with the hops, but not overpowering. Also some citrus flavor.
@ the brewdog bar in Edinburgh. Awesome beer and awesome bar. Easily A favourite.
Nja, den har upplever jag som allt för tam och menlös i förhållande till sitt rebelliska namn. Mainstream ipa. BB kan bättre köp hellre BB Jack Hammer!

Nice, easy drinking for an IPA. A good session beer, just wish the price was cheaper here in NZ. Great hop aroma, very fruity and tropical, passionfruit and pineapple even. Lots of nice fruity hop flavours too. Palate could use a bit more complexity and depth on the palate. Great session beer but I prefer my IPA’s with more malt and bitterness.
Blonde dorée. Fruitée au nez et en bouche : citron, fruit de la passion. Belle amertume. Aussi bonne à la pression qu’en bouteille. Une désormais classique qui fait toujours plaisir !
Bottle->shaker. Cloudy gold with small white head. Loads of citrus hops in the nose and body. Straightforward and quite good.

Bottle. Dark gold colour with small white head. Strong hops and grapefruit on the nose. Fantastic taste of hops and tropical fruit, almost no hint of alcohol. Great session IPA. Makes me proud to be Scottish.

Bottle to snifter (shared by the roommate; thanks John). Best by date is 8/29/12 (bought from Sahara Mart in Bloomington the day before yesterday; who knows if the expired date is their fault or the distributor’s though). Looks good; a hazy vibrant orange with thin white lacing. Smells malty first and hoppy second, but that’s to be expected given that it’s well past the enjoy by date. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. A malt bomb, but okay.
Como todas as brewdogs que eu bebi, está Tbem eh maravilhosa. Linda aparência no copo e bem saborosa. No paladar lembra especiarias, e amarga na medida certa

Bottle from supermarket. Powerful hop aroma. Thick bubbly head, translucent amber honey. Fruity hops, very clean... slight bitterness. Much nicer than the Hardcore double. Flavour gets better it warmth. Lovely.
On tap at the Archive. Lovely aroma and good looking beer with tastes of citrus fruits and a nice bitter finish. Lasts long on the palate. Top shelf IPA. Very good beer.

On tap, hazy gold, herby hoppy nose, lots of pine and citrus on the palate, golden peachy malt, nice dry-sweet balance. Not sure it?s worth ?6 a half though. Re-rate from a can, lovely and aromatic, just bitter enough, very quaffable.

Light fruity IPA & worthy as the Brewdog flagship. Perfect, cold on a hot summer's day. Find it in unexpected places (my local, Makro, Sainsbury).

Rated by BrewTom
Bitter grapefruit nose. Citrus, floral hops, grapefruit peel, bitter finish. A bit simple for an IPA but a decent popular hoppy brew.

33cl bottle. Small off-white head atop lightly hazed amber body. Aroma is medium sweet, pine, some grapefruit, light lemon. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some lemon, pine, light grape, bread. Light-medium body, light effervescence.

One of Brewdog’s regulars. Great IPA with a delicious aroma of fruits and hops. Tastes like that as well, nice balance between the bitterness and the fruitiness. The Nelson Sauvin hop is great as always.

Drinking this on regular basis so I thought I would have rated this one.
Pours a orange/golden beer with a good white head. Smells fruity. 
Tastes very nice. Fruity with a good bitter finish.
Good average carbo. Thin body and a dry texture.
Clear gold with white foamy head. Aroma of loads of grapefruit, guava, fruity. Taste of more grassy than fruity hops, very nice and balanced, nice dry finish
Bottle. Hazy, pale gold. No head. Aroma of basil and cucumber? Peachy taste with a back of the throat dryness throughout. Good gear.
Yellow blonde colour, minimal head. Aroma has hops, soapy. Fresh taste, hoppym nice ipa with relatively low alcohol, that’s nice. Citrus also comes up. Nice beer.

Gul ifarven ned greit skum. Lukter masse humle, graefrukt og løvetann. 
Fruktig smak, noe grapefrukt. God bitterhet, men litt kort ettersmak. lettdrikkende..

Color ámbar claro, poca espuma. Aroma muy muy fresco y frutal, cítrico, no se va por las nubes. Sabor equilibrado, de entrada afrutado y ligeramente dulce y final amargo.  Perfecta en su estilo. Póngame otra.
Dun schuimlaagje, zurige geur. smaak is wel erg lekker, vooral ook dr nasmaak bevalt goed

Fruitige smaak, vol aroma, erg lekker en een fijne complexiteit die interessant blijft.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle bought at Waitrose in Rickmansworth, Herts. A golden coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, citrus fruit aroma. Tastes hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, hardly any bitterness unlike the original Punk which was way over the top. Easy drinking IPA.
Aroma muy intenso a cítricos, sabor seco y amargo en boca.huele mejor que sabe pero aún así una cerveza rica y fácil de beber

Very nice IPA. Peach and pine aromas. Bítter taste. Médium bodied. Really enjoyable.

Filip
0,33l bottle. Golden color. Aroma is fruits, mostly pineapple and citrus. Taste is hoppy with fruits and citrus notes. Nice bitterness. It’s really great and tasty beer.
Quality IPA with some burnt flavors midst of all the hops aroma. Full-bodied and crisp. Good summer beer.
once considered a great beer, now the process of industrialization transform the nearly a beer commercial

Flaske: Orangegul let diset øl med et fint skumhoved. Duften er citrus. Smagen er frisk citrus. Fin fin øl især til den meget overkommelige pris. I det hele taget et super alternativ til makro øl. Go to beer for hele familien og venner med.

Przyznam szczerze ze wiele oczekiwałem od tego piwa. Aromat już od pierwszej chwili zachwyca. Mocny zapach Amerykańskich chmieli wraz z owocami oraz delikatną nutą sosnową robi na prawdę duże wrażenie. Przyjemna puszysta piana oraz ładny złocisty kolor zachęcają do spróbowania. Niestety w smaku nie jest juz jak dobrze. Goryczka mogła by byc znacznie mocniejsza zważywszy na styl tego piwa. Smak owoców mało wyczuwalny znacznie bardziej sosnowy. Podsumowując nie jest to piwo złe jest po prostu zwyczajne. Po BrewDog-u spodziewałem się znacznie wiecej.
This is a nice balanced IPA. Nice and clear taste and balanced hops in the taste. A really good IPA.
Very nice very clean ipa. Dry and flavor falls somewhat flat on the finish. Nice very drinkable beer. Had at BrewDog Bristol. Great place.
fantastic, punchy, smooth, great taste. Good linger on the pallet and keeps you coming back for more. Lovely colour.

330ml bottle. Aroma is hops, citrus, orange and grapefruit. Appearance is light milky amber with a nice small white head. Taste is bitter and light sweet. A bit watery, but nice dryness. Overall a nice IPA.
Smell of attick and grapefruit. Golden yellow color with fast disappearing head. Tastes of grapefruit, a bit spicey. Oily texture, bitter finish.

2 week old bottle. Light gold pour, thin white head. Shedloads of passionfruit, mango and peach in the aroma - lovely dank tropical fruitiness. Taste gives mango, passionfruit, light grapefruit, orange juice, sweet digestive biscuit. Decent citric bitterness, lingering tropical notes. Crisp, dry and unbelievably moreish. Punk has been up and down over the past year, but this batch (161) has reaffirmed my love for it.

Pours a thick fairly cloudy golden colour. Really fruity and a nice sweet bitter balance, but with a fairly tart bitterness coming through that makes it bite. Full of strong flavours yet refreshing. Very zingy and sharp. Slips down a dream and packs a deceiving punch if you have a few. I prefer this to the hardcore IPA as its just more drinkable.
33 cl bottle. Pours clear gold with a medium head. Aroma of grapes fruits and some malts and citrus hops. Hints of caramel with mild bitterness in the finish. Great ipa! With not to much alcohol

Riquisima y refrescante cerveza de estilo IPA (aunque no me parecio excesiva frente a otras del estilo).
Estupendo aspecto, espuma bien marcada y el trdicional aroma a tropico!. Sin duda una gran creacion de estos escoces vanguardistas.

Bottle. Clear golden orange with a small, frothy, mostly lasting white head. Aroma is grapefruit, exotic fruits, citrus, pine needeles, hints of grapes and caramel. Flavor is moderate sweet and mild bitter, salty, quite fruity and sharp. Nice balance. Finish is slightly hoppy bitter.
Clear golden, small head. Flowery aroma. Fruity taste, mango, peach. Balanced bitterness, even better than previous.

5.6% 330ml bottle - White gold appearance, frothy white head which is quick to condense down. Slightly cloudy. With a beautiful fruity aroma with a strong scent of plum. This is surely the pinnacle of British (Scottish) IPA.
Mooie donkergele kleur, met een volle schuimkraag. Bittere frisse, citrus, bloemig, kruiden geur. frisse, bloemig, citrus smaak. Smaak is ietwat flauw. Prima maar niet bijzonder.

Pours hazy amber. Aroma is peach, bread, resin, pine. Taste is mango, peach, resin, hoppy bitterness. A very good standard IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear amber body, white head. Very nice hoppy aroma with grapefruit, honey, caramel, grass. Great fruity bitter flavour with mango, pineapple, grapefruit, caramel. Very easy drinking and enjoyable.

The single malt shines through with smells of sweet caramel and coffee beans followed by citrus hops composing a unique, exciting aroma for this golden brew. Light bodied, bright and fruity, still with hint of malt coffee, and overall dangerously drinkable. A pleasure to drink a punk ipa in the states.
Light fruity aroma of bitter fruits. Taste is citrus, grapes with a bitter finish. This beer is almost like a lager, but with allot of hops and fruity bitternes. Ok beer.

Golden coloured with thick but rather small head and leaves some lacing behind. Nose has lots of hops with mainly grapefruit but some sweetness as well. Taste offers citrus fruits and grape pops up again but there is some pine flavored bitterness too. Crispy mouth feel. Brewdog keeps the quality high.
Spacca. Niente da aggiungere. Un punto di partenza per la ipa e per il marchio. Forse troppo spinto il marketing.
Cracker of an IPA. Great floral, citrus hop profile with a good malt backbone to back it up.

The liquid equivalent of a colourful summer meadow; lots of fragrance, some spiked citrusy grapefruit to keep you on your toes, but generally a great tasting beer that really stands out. The quality control has been a bit hit and miss the past year, but on the whole this is a great doorway into the world of experimental beer.
Dark golden beer with a good sized head. Good grassy bitterness, and some nice fruits. A bit simple.

In 33cl CAN. One om my favourites. Almost clear, yellow to golden with nice white foam. Aroma is beautiful with honey, litchi and gooseberries. Nelson Sauvin all over this one. Great drinkabilty. Very solid IPA, could be a little higher on the bitter side?!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Copper with small head. Grassy hop aroma and similar taste. Mainly bitter hops, not much variation.
Draught in Madrid. Honey orange with a large head. Fruity aroma. Marmalade fruity flavour, medium bitterness on the palate, dry finish.

Aroma is fresh, hoppy, fruity, and sparkly. Appearance is nothing special, but nice, clear, golden, amber. Head is large but doesn’t last for too long. Taste is great. I imagine picking up pineapple, cucumber, orange, hops, other juicy stuff, and pine needles. Mouthfeel gives a medium body with an oily texture. Carbonation is fizzy, finish is fairly tangy. Overall a very nice beer, my favorite BrewDog after 5 AM Saint.
Bottle at home, Dark orange beer, aroma was citrus, taste was light bitter(in my opinion, my mother thought it was way too bitter :D) a very nice IPA in my opinion.

Light amber-orange with a short, off-white head.
Citrus hop scents, malt.
Taste is slightly funky, bold spicy hops...
Floral, citrus, peach.
A little cola and lively carbonation.
Very good.
Once again a great IPA from BrewDog. A fabulous hoppy aroma, though the flavour was not as pronounced. Nice beer.

From can 


Aroma: hops, bitters, slight yeast 

Taste: straight up nice bitterness level and funky malty flavour, accompanied with a flowery/slightly grassy flavour, end is dry, jummy !
Pours a pale orange with a light cloud. Very little head. Light citrus aroma. Not too hoppy but true to style. Quite light and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours clear amber liquid with inch white head. Aroma is mostly composed of citruses, grapefruits, passion fruits and some grassy notes, nicely hopped. Pleasurable bitterness in taste, with a little bit fruity sweet in background. Medium body with creamy texture and lively carbonation. Finishes bitter with passion fruit touch. Nice IPA with some punk in it, very pleasurable.
En av mine favoritter for tiden. Nydelig humlearoma, tydelig men balansert bitterhet. Noe flat.

Esta ipa realmente é um exemplar muito bom! Ela possui todas as características típicas de uma ipa mas sem exageras. O lúpulo é o protagonista, a carbonatação é ótima, o retrogosto é amargo e deixa um leve dulçor do malte... Enfim, é uma cereja muito boa e de ótima drinkability!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 33 CL.enjoyed at after Tuska in loosister bar. Pours copper golden. Notes of citrus, hops, very refreshing.
Very good beer. Not too heavy, great aftertaste, pleasant aroma. An east choice when on tap.

Buona birra, che però non riesce a convincermi fino in fondo, l’aroma non mi ha colpito particolarmente, buono il palato all’inizio, ma manca il retrogusto. Non mi invoglia a berne una seconda. Molto meglio la sorella maggiore: la Harcorde ipa.

When living in England for a few years I only just started drinking more craft beers and Ales. I first saw Punk IPA at a mega size Tesco’s in London. It blew my socks off and introduced me to the many great american style IPA’s out there. It has been few years since i last had a Punk IPA since i moved back to Canada so i can’t remember what it taste like now. Not sure if it will still taste as amazing as when i first started drinking it now that i have sampled many other IPA’s. Until i get a taste again to see if it is as good as I remember it gets a high score
At Bagpipers inn. Better than I remembered it, but not great. Body is a bit weak. Fruity and bitter.

For me it’s the best beer! :)
I taste some IPA but I’m always coming back to the Punk at the end
Botella. Presencia limpia dorada y con corona blanca espumosa persistente. Aroma intenso a hierbas y pino. Sabor entra dulce y poco a poco pasa a notas de pino con un retrogusto largo seco y herbal

Bottle @ Elfo’s Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a dark yellow color, with a quite large, white, frothy, medium to long lasting head.  Aroma has lots of citrus, especially grapefruit and lemon; and grass, too. Moderate to heavy hoppy. Quite bitter, even if it is slightly sweet, too. Average lasting, bitter finish. Medium body, medium carbonation.

Head is quickly gone, colour is somewhere between yellow and amber. Carbonization gives a vibrant mouth-feeling to the fresh tropical fruity flavours and exotic hops. Highly enjoyable beer for the summertime.

Punk IPA pours a cloudy apple juice amber with a thin head of small bubbles.  Nose is strong hops, primarily of cedar and pine needles.  Taste is same of the nose, pine needles and a bit of an acrid tang that is reminsicent of grapefruit.  Body is fizzy.  finish is long, but pleasant as hops slowly fade.  Nice beer.

Bottle. Light yellow, mid foggy. Little white head. Aroma is strongly fruity with a distinct piny flavor. 

Aroma is really strong from the start on. Pine, fruit, citrus. Lingering bitter hoppy aftertaste. Rather strong carbonation. Some alcohol creeps through. A really good solid IPA.
bottle. Amber with small head. This bottle is definitely past its prime, but I’m not holding that against this beer -- still quite tasty. Substantial malt base with plenty of hops. Well balanced.

Bottle from Marcus. Pours translucent golden amber with a creamy white head. Aroma has a mix, but there seems to be a lot of NS grapeiness. Med body. Flavor is  fruity, even tropical, with white grape and a low key caramel backbone. Finishes fresh, fruity and definitely bitter.
Dark amber colour with medium body. Aroma of hops and spices. Taste of hops.

Designen på flaskan är klockren. Guldaktig med kraftigt vitt skum. Kraftig arom och mycket god att dricka.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark amber, white steady top. Fruity aroma, fresh and bitter taste. Good beer.

33cl cans and bottles over 2 month period, BB 14/01/2014. Finally getting down to rating this leaner supermarket/party version of the pioneering UK IPA 2.0 that impressed me in its original 6% guise. Both aroma and taste are earthier than I had this down as, while still keeping the floral notes and subdominant pungent simcoe. Could it be the delicate exotic (lychee, maracuja) overtones disappeared with the Motueka? Leaner, almost crisp mf for an ale. Lingering layered bitter aftertaste. Remains a great party proselytiser for the unconverted...// Rerate rebranded 66cl bottle shared by oldmanriver: tangerine, pineapple mousse whipped underneath leafy bitters in an excellent sessioner ale. (Post)modern benchmark.

Clear deep dark amber colour with steady head and medium body. Wonderful nose of aromatic hops, coriander and spices. Taste of fresh sparkling hops, fresh coriander, white pepper, ginger and cloves. Flowery and spicy finish. Enjoyed this IPA a lot, it was very fresh, re-freshing and quaffable.

Dark amber with short lived clean white head. Citrus, herbal aroma. Slight bitterness, lightish body, honey and tropical fruit flavor. Very unique honey-like finish with a dry bitterness. Has some similarities (fruit flavors) to magic hat #9.
Amazing beer, nice fruity aroma ( citrus, piney ). Taste is the same as aroma. Easy drinkable, very refreshing

Citrus and hops as we know it. But behind this there is a strange aroma of an old mans foot. Still a nice, usual IPA with lots of freshness. Very drinkable, easy to go and quaffy. And the best about it: That strange bitterness of some other IPAs is missing.

Update: draught/wk-a. Catpee & gooseberries. Clear, clean caramel malty body. Really fresh and clean made hoppy IPA.

Draught, 5.4% it says. Yellow, super hazy. I think I got the very last of an unfiltered keg. But it has the cat-pee grapefruit hoppyness that I’ve learned to love, even though the doughy yeast present.  Thinking of all the punk ipa I’ve drunk earlier, they’ve been brewdoggy- clean, caramel malty. The one I’m looking at now is hefe-weiss cloudy, yeasty. My score will be somewhat based on earlier experiences therefore.

Light orange coloured beer with a nice amount of head. Aroma has sweet tropical fruits, gooseberry, grapefruit and lemongrass. Flavor is similar. Medium full palate with medium carbonation. Long bitter finish. Well balanced. Not the most extreme IPA but very drinkable and with a very unique flavor. This beer made me a hophead.

11.2oz bottle. Batch 117, best before 16-04-13. Fresh BrewDog is hard to find in Ohio... We sometimes receive them with just one month left on the sell by. Mostly hazy, golden yellow orange color. Good thin off-white head, leaves nice bits and rows of lace. Medium body. Smooth, soft carbonation of moderate strength. More dry finish. Unique texture from the crispness of most American IPAs that I usually love, but I don’t mind the soft and smooth body, here. Moderate bitter taste, little sweet. Some grassy, lightly citrusy, lightly soapy hops, but the bready, doughy malt profile seems a bit more dominant here. Decent light IPA (or hoppy pale ale).

Never judge a bear by it’s fur.. This pale ale blew my mind. I had somewhat low expectations, because 1. I got the beer cheap. 2. The label wasn’t exactly sexy and 3. Brewed in Scotland?

But I tell you, this is one mean hoppy motherfukker.. If you like a very hoppy, fresh and peachy beer, this should be your next affair. With smell of elderflower and hops you know you’re in for at treat. When in your mouth all your buds will arise from their slumber and work overtime. Overall it’s just a beautiful beer (had it in a shaker) with a smell of divinity. Medium body with good carbonation. One of the best beers I’ve had in a long time. Highly reccommended
A modern classic. Hazy orange. Perfumy aroma, slightly grassy. Taste is tropical fruits, grassy, little pine. Medium body with medium carbonation. Tasty stuff.
Bottle shared by oRos. Pours cloudy golden with a thick off-white head and a fruity aroma. There is a full-bodied pale malt flavor with  lots of fruit and a bitter spicy finish.
Bottle from citybeer store. Pours yellow gold with white head. Taste is fruit citrus hops and no malt.  Has a good sweet finish.
herlig lukt litt syrlig lukt av citrus, lite skum.  herlig myk søtlig smak, noe sødme.  et øl å bli glad i.  God langvarig ettersmak.  forfriskende.

Source : Private Import from Office des Grands Crus, 330ml bottle batch 045.
Appearance : Golden and a bit hazy, small head.
Aroma : Citrus, hoppy, strong smell of Chinook and pineapple.
Taste : Because of its aroma, I was expecting a stronger taste of Hops, the Chinook disappear and the Nelson Sauvin take the space. 
Palate : Medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall : Nice sunny day beer.
Fruity hop aroma with lots of apricots. All kinds of exotic fruits in the flavor, well balanced. Boring aftertaste. Re-rated 131221, rumor speaks about a new version? Lots of gooseberry added.

Nice creamy head. 
Aroma has grape, tropical fruit and pine. Taste is much the same, sweet and nicely bitter. A bit thin of course.

Pours a cloudy orange colour. Good head which holds well. Citrus smells. Nice bubbles on initial sip which accompanies the initial citrus system hoppy taste. Limited bitterness on aftertaste which craves more.

A - Pours a hazy golden orange with 1.5 finger white head. Stellar retention with loads of lacing from top to bottom.

S - Floral, buttery biscuits, cheesy sulphur yeast, lemon zest. Cheese dominates as it warms.

T - Floral hops with a buttery pale malt. Lemon zest starts opening up with a spicy bitterness. The buttery cracker pale malt is a strange mix with the lemon rind hops. Crisp finish with some lemon and leafy hop bitterness lingering.

M - Moderate carbonation, full side of medium body.

Great looking beer! A cracker based pale malt with lots of leafy and lemon zest hops. The light buttery flavor didn’t help. It almost has a lager yeast character. Different but the perfume/lemon hops seems forced on top of the simple pale malt.

Serving type: on-tap

11-20-2011

Gold, thin bubbly white head; lovely hoppy, tropical fruit aroma; hops dominate the flavour - some lemon, some grapefruit; dusty, dry finish; nice enough, but disappointing not to find the anticipated Jaipur-like amazingness from one of the seemingly touchstone beers of the British craft beer explosion.

Bottled 330ml. -from www.beershop.hr, Zagreb. Clear to darker golden coloured, medium sized off-white head, aromatic grapefruity nose. Moderate malty, fruity hoppy, mild caramel and some spices with mild bitterness in the finish. Pleasant brew.

330ml bottle. Pours amber with only a slight haze, moderate white head. Aroma is bready malt and pine and grapefruit hops. Taste is pretty much the same, maybe a little earthy in there too. Body was a little thinner than I was expecting, but not too light. Overall, this was pretty much text book IPA. Nothing especially unique, just hit all the right notes.
Bottle at home 20/5 2013. Opaque orange, with a big white head. Hoppy aroma, with some grapefruit, citrus, grass and some sweetness. A clear hoppy taste, that lingers. At the price it is amazing.

Blonde dorée légèrement trouble, quasi-asence de pétillance, mousse presque inexistante. Bien houblonnée et épicée, caramélisée, arrière-goût fruité, un rien de douceur, petite sécheresse sur la fin. Première IPA pour moi, merci au boss du Malting Pot de me l’avoir fait découvir.

Clear orange. Aroma: Citrus, grapefruit, caramel and grass. Taste: Bready, earthy, grapefruit, pomegranate, caramel and toast. Smooth palate, dry bitter finish. This is a solid and easily available IPA. Sessionable and inexpensive. Classic.
Clear amber - big white head. Fruity, nice hoppy nose, bitterness, zesty, medium malty, dryness, citrus, abricot, grassy, piney, grape fruits.

5.6% 330ml bottle into a tumbler. Pours a clear golden colour with light carbonation and a quickly dissipating head. Floral notes and citrus aroma after the pour with the suggestion of a hoppy punch forthcoming. Doesn’t deliver the kind of hoppiness I was anticipating; more light and crisp with a bit of a bitter back end. Quite pleasant!

Clear orange color with small and quickly dissappearing head. Powerful aroma of bunch of citrus: passionfruit, mango and grapefruit. Incredible! Taste is also citrus and completed by malty sweetness perfectly balanced strong bitterness. Finish is long and really bitter. Fantastic example of IPA.
Beautiful citrus and mango aroma. Quickly dissapearing head. Clear golden body. Great, strong, hoppy citrus taste, very well balanced with malt sweetness. Simply wonderfull.
De chez brewdog je préfére largement la 5am, celle-ci sympa au nez mais on en retrouve moins en bouche

Bottle at home. Bought in ’Geers’ Oostakker that day, so I suppose it was the 5,6% edition. Since the 6% edition is retired. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: clear blonde beer, small white stable head.
Nose: spices, apples, grapefruit, florar, amazing IPA nose, some mango.
Taste: a rather uni dimensional taste, bitterness is nice and long lasting, but I preferred the scent of this IPA. Very dry when drinking.
Updated the score after drinking it on several occasions, one of which fresh from tap

Draught  Very thick, dense, off-white to yellow head over orange-shot golden beer, collar hardly diminishing. Exotic fruit, lunaria, grapes and grapefruit, blocked a bit by the thick head; bit of solvent. Bitter, and mildly fruity flavours. Grapes, nashua pear, pitaya especially. Surprising secundary flavour, dominated by fresh pale malts. Hops arriving in the finish. Very spritzy, light body, slighly slick. Not necessarily better than bottled, but interesting.

A magnificent IPA, best from the tap as I have found that the bottle conveys a more metallic taste to the beer than I like. A lively, hoppy taste that goes down very well, but perhaps for a seasoned palate rather than a first time drinker since the slightly higher alcohol content than regular beers takes its toll after a few!
Fantastic beer, drink it as it is or combine with a brownie or similar. Delicious!
Looks great particularly on draught real hop aroma then lovely taste still one of the best ipa I have tested

A bit of a standard for me, in a positive way.  This is one of the most affordable and acquirable true IPA’s on the market.  Not the best aroma or appearance but the hop hit more than makes up for it.  A slight sweetness is balanced by a citrus hop note and a satisfying grin.  Normally have a few in the fridge.
Fast disappearing citrus aromas. The head is also disappearing quickly. The taste is lightly hopped citrus but nothing really else. They can do a lot better.

0,33 l bottle. BB 15-02-14 
floral, citrus, cereal, orange-gold color, hazy, frothy, white foam, very bitter, lightly sour, light sweetness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Very nicely balanced beer. Great elder aroma with a perfect amount of biterness. A beer that I can drink every day without getting tired of it.

Update: Still great but in the meantime I’ve drank several IPA’s that were better than this.
A very rich and fruity aroma. The flavor is complex and is actually good, however this kind of beer doesn’t fulfill my tastes.
330 ml bottle.  a bold ipa, taste of caramel, citrus and petrol,  bitter finish that does not last long.
Top tasting IPA. Best served well chilled. Great out the bottle, as on this occasion.

Colore ambrato pallido, poca schiuma ma persistente.
Al naso chiaramente frutta esotica, ananas, pompelmo, molto profumata.
Al palato un bel sapore fresco, sottofondo di ananas e pompelmo, retrogusto leggero di miele e malto, astringente ma neanche troppo.
Carbonazione media, corpo equilibrato.
Sicuramente rinfrescante, profumi meravigliosi, ottimo palato ma l’ultimo terzo si fa un pó fatica a finirlo, stanca.
Ciononostante una gran bella birra poco da dire, da consumare preferibilmente in estate

Light amber, off-white head. Aroma: big critrus (grapefruit, lemon) and pine notes, petrol. Taste: biting citrus hops, tropical fruit juice and the barest hint of caramel in the finish. Lovely oily palate. Bold, drinkable, just a little astringent for me.
Bottle. Golden color, medium white head. Strong hoppy aroma. Spicy and bitter flavor. Quite bitter . Nice. Sometimes on tap the smell change .

From Superbrugsen, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 050413.
Golden with with white head. Aroma of fruit and pine. Flavour with malt and hop spices.
Pours hazy bright orange with a white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit and caramel. Taste follows nose with some earthiness,

(bottle) pours a clear amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of heavy resin and herbal hops, with a hint of caramel, white grapes, some light orange peel and maracuja. flavour is mostly the same, light tropical fruit and herbs, a hint of caramel and pale malts, slightly sweet, with a light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation. easy drinking.
A goldenorange pour with an off-white head. Aroma is fruity, caramel and hay. Taste is sweet with citrusfruit, melon, mandarin...nice bitter ending. Okay beer.

Pours a hazy yellow with a fizzy white head with big bubbles that disappears almost instantaneously? This is not how I remember Punk...Aroma: grainy, caramel, almost no hops. Some vague citrus hops maybe..what is going on?...Taste: somegrapefruity hops, sweet malts, bisquit, very vague hop note. The juicy fruity hops I remember punk having is not there? I think I might have gotten a bad bottle? Will rerate once I have a good bottle.
Citrusy, bitter, modern American style ipa. Despite thier awful branding and approach to marketing this is a good beer. Reminds me of frozen orange juice lollies as a child. Some pine.

03-APR-2016. Clear golden-amber, white head. Medium intensity aroma of sweet citrus, biscuity malts, and some pine, that gets stronger. Taste: grapefruit, caramel and biscuit, moderate piney and zesty bitterness. The carbonation is a tad harsh, macro-lagerish. Other that that, quite a nice run off the mill „craft” IPA. 7-4-7-3-14=3,5.



05-APR-2013. Head: Off-white, medium, frothy, diminishing. Colour: amber, clear.

Aroma: Strong citric - ripe orange, some maltiness too - toffee? The taste has the fruitiness too along with some bitterness, but not as strong as expected. The body is not watery, but again, thinner than expected. Finishes mildly bitter. 8-3-7-3-14=3,5.
Pale gold with a fluffy white head. Aromas of pine, resin, fruit, Taste is resinous at first, marmalade, with good long bitter finish, but very nicely balanced
Smells and tastes of passion fruit, but it is not sweet at all, even a little bitter in end. It is strange but not bad. It is difficult to define. It has a dry end.

Can from Asahiya. Fruity, citrusy, pine -- some good mixed-up stink. Medium straw color. Grapefruit, cookies, tobacco / harsh hops in mid / maltiness comes out in final, and then we’re left with a healthy hop burn. Light-medium body. Hops do come on a bit strongly -- seems light bodied for all that. Still, very tasty.

Decent appearance, interesting aroma, strawberry-melon and hop but the sweetness is not what You’d expect in a beer. Taste is different, much less sweet and slight bitterness, an easy drink but different.

Can from Mane Liquor. Buttery resin, caramel and grapefruit aroma, lots of dominant nelson hop aromas. Big nelson hop profile, plenty of resin, pine, peach and grapefruit. Nice caramel malt, very well balanced. Re-rating after having it from a can, was a lot fresher and a lot better than bottled.

Color dorado pálido. Aroma ligero floral y cítrico. Sabor lupulado, pero con un amargor más bien ligero  y que no persiste demasiado en boca. Su textura es ligera, a pesar de no estar muy carbonada. En general, una IPA correcta sin mayores complicaciones. No obstante, siendo una cerveza bastante asequible, su relación calidad/precio es muy buena.

Can from Craft Beer Base. A great aroma of c-hops, pine, citrus & funk. It poured a clear orange-gold with a thin white head. The taste is pine at first, then citrus which is followed with a crisp bitter finish. Very easy to drink, a fantastic price makes it an excellent everyday IPA.
Can. Fruity. Love this beer that much that i ordered 48 cans in Scotland and i live in Austria.
Bottle. Fruity on the nose. Fresh and hoppy upfront with a bitter end. Had this beer a number of times and it never fails to please!

Love the attitude of the brewery, and reading their own description of their beer is hilarious! Not the best appearance, but with a really interesting taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank this 1 day before the best before date. First mouthful was a bit muted but it soon opened up into a delicious grapefruity bitter IPA. I could knock back a few of these. Well done.

Bottle. Golden color, white head. Fruity and hoppy with good balance. Refreshing taste. Medium body, medium carbonation. Curiously very different from the 6,0% version. Very nice and quite sessionable!
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts fruits citrus pineapple grapefruit and hops flavor  malts spicy fruits citrus pineapple grapefruit and hops in the finish

Bottle. A modern classic. Fruity tropical hops, pineapple, kiwi. Sweetness offset by mouthy malt, ever so slight bitterness and yeasty dryness. Sweet and refreshing. Goes down in numbers, but creeps up on you. Absolute favourite.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours golden with a small off white head. Smells of hops, citrus, and little yeast. Tastes of fruit (mango or orange) and hops with a nice bitterness on the back of the tongue. Well balanced and delicious beer.

11.2 oz. bottle, there is a best before spot printed right on the label, but no date, that really annoys me, just have to trust it is somewhat fresh.- Pours very hazy golden orange with a white head that reduces to a collar and decent lace. Aroma is citrusy hops with a firm malt backbone, thankfully no caramel malts. The taste is a more earthy IPA, it tastes like a European lager amped up to IPA status, hops, minerals and the such. Body is medium and carbonation is high. Overall good, but I like my PNW IPA’s.
0,33L bottle. Good citrus and specially grapefruit coming up. Completley normal beer :) Thanks.

Bottle from Sainsburys. This fine brew has now become my Sunday beer of choice now Sainsburys has stopped selling Leffe Brown (bastards) and Tescos only seems to sell it every now and again (double bastards). So whilst I’m cooking Sunday dinner and listening to Jarvis Cocker’s Sunday Service on BBC 6 Music, Punk IPA is the perfect substitute. Enough waffle, beer wise it pours a gold colour with a fluffy white head. Rich citrus aroma with strong hints of peach and apricot. Crisp citrus flavour with biscuit malt and hints of pear. Classic bitter mouthfeel, lashes the roof of the mouth (there’s bound to be an official name for that!). Bitter than a spring day in the UK finish. Lovely stuff!

Poor pale copper, slight haze. Small pale head, minimal lacing. Beautiful citrus/marmalade nose with sweet floral barley hint. Was surprised at the subtle flavor; very pleasing but not the robust IPA I have come accustomed to, especially New Zealand IPAs. Definite floral taste, small amount of bitterness at the end. Short finish. Seasionable.

Strong hoppy aroma. Bit weak in the flavour department - I felt similar to the hardcore IPA - great floral smell and then let down on the tastebuds. Almost lager-like flavour. Good head retention. Not awful, but not life-changing either.

A lovely beer - very fruity and with a flowery aroma. A hint of pineapple in the mouth and a lavender aftertaste. Bursting with flavour and very kind on the palate. On a personal level, I couldn’t drink too much of it. 5.6 is a tad too strong for my tastes for a heavy session.

May 2012 -  Bottle at home as 'BrewDog Punk IPA'.  Floral hoppiness, body seems light because of carbonation. (3.4) 


April 2013 - Another cold bottle at home.  Dark orange.  Pretty enduring head.  Good malty sweet base with a hoppy floral finish.  A little rose water.  Nice.  (3.6)


Feb 2015 - Keg at Tokenhouse, Bank.  Half pint.  Grapefruit vibe in aroma and taste.  Decent, but not quite as good as I remembered. (3.3)


Dec 2017 - Keg at BD Clapham following 5 cocktails, shots and 2 other beers - drinking with Irish people.  Flowery hop character - petals. (6-4-6-4-14=3.4)
One of my definite favorites alone and with food. Had it with steak and it was awesome. Deep taste and pleasant aroma

Nailed the aroma for me (Can into glass) floral, fruit, citus.
Golden colour, good carbination. Medium sweetness, bitterness depending on how long you leave it to sit on your palate.

long finish,

This beer smells amazing- herbally grapefruit aroma. Tastes citrusy, balanced hop bitterness. Low carbonation. It's nice, despite all the bollocks written on the label. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromatica a frutas y pino, algo resinosa. De color dorado con una espuma que deja una capa fina. De entrada dulce deja paso a un leve amargor que pasa a un gusto frutal.

Clear medium to dark yellow orange color, very pungent citrusy and even herbal hop aroma, little figs. Low carbonation, sweet fruitiness. Medium body, a the mouthfeel dry with a peculiar grass and hay, little strong bitternessbut without tropical fruits component.
Light heavy sweet and light moderate bitter with a average to long duration.
Very silky, smooth and easily drinkable IPA. Very good.
Floral, lots of hop-herb(?) flavour, Stabile IPA, bying regulary. But, had a few bottles which were flat with very little aroma, bad/ new botteling?

Rerated 29 March 2017 from a can. The aroma is grapefruit, peach, a little pine. The taste is light/medium sweet and light/medium bitter. Decent balance, could do with a little more malt, but pretty good anyway.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with small head. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Hoppy taste.
Bottle. Golden color, medium white head. Strong hoppy aroma with rhubarb  tones. Spicy and bitter flavor. Quite bitter aftertaste. Nice.

A thin light beer, with a slightly hazy, golden appearance. There is a delicate perfumed aroma of hops, tropical fruit, sweet ripe mango and pineapple juice. The taste is light and fruity, with some gentle berry, mango & tropical flavours. The head doesn’t stick around for long, but a thin layer of lacing remains, with medium/low carbonation. Its a nice refreshing mild IPA style beer, but the hardcore IPA is far superior.

Bottled 0,33L. Hazy yellow/orange color, nice bubbly aspect with an elegant foamy head of long duration. Rich nose, overpowering flowery notes, little winous and much fresch, rumors of grape, cellar, and much much hop. Very pleasant and good drinkable palate, little smooth, fresh lime and yeast notes, hop, caramel and a great flowery bouquet on the final. Little sweetish end with a very modest bitter content. Not arid final but refreshing and much hoppines.
Light in flavor and aroma, not the Hardcore by any means. Not worth the price in my opinion, stick with the Hardcore.
From a 33 cl bottle shared at home.  Pours a cloudy god with a white head.  Aroma of grapefruit.  Flavors of orange and bread dough.  Mildly bitter finish.

Tutti prendono la Punk Ipa... una specie di istituzione qui a Roma. A me mancava ancora, quindi l’ho presa e ho capito perchè se la prendono tutti.
Ambrata con poca schiuma. Aroma di frutti tropicali con qualche componente agrumata. Molto fresca e pulita al naso. Al palato più o meno la stessa cosa. Agrumi, ananas e frutti tropicali in generale finisce con una nota resinosa. Beverina, rinfrescante, equilibrata senza eccedere nell’amaro. Se c’è un aggettivo che può descriverla al meglio è senz’altro gradevole.

Bottle from Sainsbury’s, Team Valley, Gateshead. A hazy golden coloured beer with a strong floral citrus and tropical fruit flavour followed by orange marmalade, slight wood and pine on the finish. Excellent!
My wife bought me this as a valentine’s present.  for someone who hasn’t a clue about beer she picked a good one.

4.1
   AROMA 9/10   APPEARANCE 3/5   TASTE 8/10   PALATE 3/5   OVERALL 18/20allthebeer (2) - - FEB 22, 2013

from STERK deli in amsterdam bought a bottle and a can and i was in heaven, the taste the smell and the bitterness,great beer. they sell many IPA s in this place ,all nice but this one is now the one

12 oz can from the LCBO, served in a stem glass. Pours clear amber with a moderate off-white head that fades slowly and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. The aroma has fruity and citrusy notes that evoke the West Coast, along with a nice English-style caramelly malt profile. The flavour is well balanced and moderately sweet, with a delicate hoppy bitterness. Hops predominate towards the end, providing subtle resin and spiciness. The finish is moderately long and delicately bitter with a hint of grain. On the palate, it is light-medium in body with a dry texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a nice IPA with a beautiful west coast nose and English malts. It was a little too thin in the body for my taste; with a bit more substance, it would  be a truly great IPA. 2012-06-30
tap @ Tuulensuu. hazy orange, small white head. grapefrut aroma. grapefruit in the flavor too. nice cool refreshing.

Aroma: citrus, pine, peach?; Appearance: golden, clear, small white head; Taste: medium(+) bitterness (more in aftertaste), lightly to medium sweet; Palate: rather light body, thin but just a little bit oily feel, average carbonation, quite long bitter finish; Overall: good, not very bitter, a little waterish, very drinkable

Bottle. Pours clear golden with airy white head. Clear aroma of hops with a slight grassy and fruity note. Very pleasant, bitter taste of various kinds of hops, with fruity notes, ending in a bitter finish. A really good IPA.

Surprenante !
Les arômes de lychee et autres fruits exotiques se dégagent des que l’on verse ce breuvage jaune orangé dans le verre.
Fortement houblonnée, l’amertume de cette punkette restera longtemps en bouche.
Une belle découverte.

Found this in Brazil, SP. 33 cl bottle, 18R$. Clear amber color, ok white head. Was expecting a 7%+, but this is only 5.6%. Aroma is fruity, citrusy, crisp, aromatic indeed. Malts component are not overwhelming, good enough. Nicely hopped. Taste is balanced with a proper sweet-bitter curve. Finish is quite sharp but not as bitter as others, but aromatic. This is light bodied for an IPA but nice enough.


33 cl bottle, 5.6%. Dark yellow to orange color, hazy, thick fine white head. Hoppy nose. Aroma is moderately malty, very hoppy with fruity tones. As above, neat one.
pint at brewdog newcastle. pours a hazy gold with lingering white head. aroma is very fruity with hops coming after. very nice fruity and hoppy taste with lingering after taste.

Really good American style IPA. Sharp taste of hops with a healthy dose of citrus. A nice balance overall. On the strong side so not one to drink all day long but less sugary/easier to drink than many others.

Bottle (330 ml). Thanks to Sébastien F. Clear golden orange with a medium diminishing white head and some lacing. Aroma of tropical fruits, slight caramel and malt, slight spices.Taste is fruity (tropical fruits and citrus) with malt/caramel and a slight bitter finish. Palate is clean. Medium body. Good clean, refreshing and drinkable IPA. I like the hop bill. Fresher, I’m sure this beer would have easily been .1 or .2 higher. Still very good.
Bottled 330ml ; Devon :UK ; Malt,floral,fruit and great citrus aroma ; Golden color with proper lasting head ; Medium sweet and heavier bitter taste ; Full body ; Superb IPA.
I feel like this IPA lacked the bite of a typical IPA. Otherwise, very fruity. Not bad, but not great.

Pale orange color with 1 finger white head. Aroma of  tropical fruits, grape fruit, its quite refreshing. Taste is medium bitter with some nice fruity sweetness to it. Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Good IPA

Pours a slightly hazy straw-gold with a short-lived head and little to no lace. Strawberry & mango aroma. Very fruity taste - almost skunky, alcohol present in the finish but only slightly. Low carbonation, thin body. Mild and sessionable
Really nice taste and aroma, this is a good thing to drink. [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

Spina @ la locanda.
Chiara con bella schiuma 
Buona IPA.
Ha fatto scuola per certi versi.
Erbacea e secca
Botella de 33 Cl. Rica cerveza que parece que tiene mucha mas graduación alcoholica de la que tiene realmente

Pours a clear gold with good head retention. 

Aroma is Hoppy! There is a sweet caramel in the back of the aroma, but the hops are taking the front row. A dash of grassiness is included in the aroma.

Lots of hops in the flavor. Overall rounded, but the dryness makes me think that this beer will lead to many more. Great! The hops and the malt do tend to hide the maltiness, but the cracker/biscuit flavor occasionally shows.

The palate is perfect! Nice roundness, good carbonation. 

Overall; This is a good beer that I would drink LOADS of....
Can @ il pretesto. It pours golden with a huge white head on top. Great aroma and good taste. Great beer. Geat, great beer.
En lata 330 cl. No difiere mucho de la servida en botella. Buena apariencia y sabor. Ideal como IPA de diario.
330ml bottle. Amber with a medium white head. Fruit, hops, fudge and citrus. Hoppy end. Pretty light body which makes it enjoyable at all times.

Excelente IPA, amarga en entrada, no tanto en retrogusto pero deliciosamente equilibrada, sin estridencias. Leve corona de espuma, con buen aroma a lúpulo. Además no es excesivamente alcohólica por lo que puede repetirse una y otra vez :)

Tomada en botella de 33 cl

Pours clear pale amber color with medium white head. Strong and delicious aroma of tropical fruits like grapefruit and litchi, with some pine and floral notes. Taste is hoppy and fruity too, with hints of citrus, resin. A bit dry at beginning, pleasant medium bitter finish and long hoppy aftertaste. Medium body and carbonation. Very well made and enjoyable ale, one of my favorites.

Pours a clear golden amber colour with a slight orange tinge and sizeable white head leaving good amounts of lace up the glass. Aromas consist of tropical fruit, floral, a malty/fruity sweetness, and lemony citrus. Flavour is med bitterness, fruity, lemony citrus, malty sweetness, and light floral notes.
A very smooth and fruity ipa first one I have had from brew dog and I am impressed. Not super strong ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orangish amber colour, white and shortlasting head, nice lace. Floral and herbal aromas, also tropical fruits and medicine. Light bitter taste, balanced with pineapple and mango notes. Refreshing and easy to drink.
Batch 000. Really good nose & looks. Good frothy head & lacing. Finish a bit thin, but promising stuff from the new brewery.

bottle. pours pale amber, almost clear, with big soft head that quickly go away. intense aroma of tropical fruits and lemony hops, with some chemical notes. chemical sweetness dominates also the taste, something like medicine or mango... some bitterness of hops in the final. quitethin body, good carbonation, dry mouthfeel.

Re rated from batch 201: lively orange with intense tropical juice aroma. Sweet fruits again in the taste, but less mango-soap than last time. Pleasant bitterness that clean up the mouth at the end.
This is a very easy beer to drink - probably the easiest to drink ale labelled an IPA I have ever tried.  The ’alternative’ beer marketing is a bit over the top though probably effective.
A good and a light taste, the hops is great. When I drank this brew, it made me forget the mainstream beers ! Defiantly ditched the mainstream !

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear amber with a small frothy white head. Aroma is mainly hops, citrus, gooseberries, passionfruit, pineapple with a sweet caramel backbone. Taste is bitter with a fruity bitter finish that dies out fairly quickly. Medium body.
Cerveza tipo IPA muy buena. El sabor es ligeramente floral, amargor característico de las cervezas IPA. Ideal para empezar e incluso continuar.

Lovley flowery aroma. Sweet bitterness tingles my nose. Clear light honey coloured. Round sweet taste with a grapefruit aftertaste. Definitly one of my favourite IPAs:)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Never Grow Old, Oulu. Colour is orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours are citrus, fruits, grass and hops. Pretty casual IPA but nowadays rather dull.

On tap, golden color. The nose is tropical fruits and citrus. Mouthfeel is llight body, with a good structure that gives malt aromas of caramel and biscuit. Good balance between bitter and malt, tropical fruit, citrus, and passion fruit. Excellent ipa very drinkable.

Kaatuu lasiin vaalean kullankeltaisena ja kirkkaana, vaahto on muhkea ja isokuplainen. Haju on puumaisen humaloitu, muita hajuja on karamelli, sitrus (greippi etenkin), havu ja ruoho. Maku on havuisen ja sitruksisen humaloitu, ruohoinen ja puumainen. Suutuntuma on hieman kevyt IPAksi, mutta tasaisen katkera kuitenkin. Kokonaisuuutena tämä on perushyvä IPA, onneksi BrewDog jaksaa tehdä vielä tällaista perustavaraakin.
Entre PA et IPA. Litchi et agrume. Amertume présent mais pas trop. Pas trop sucré. IPA qui se boit facilement en rentrant du boulot. Une de mes préférées

On tap at Sunset Grill. No cap but a ridiculously cloudy deep-to-light orange gradient. Aroma is stuffy/earthy, bitter orange. Heavy white pepper (thx rachaal, for the spice that was filling my nose). Huge earthy/grassy taste, bright/sour fruit bitters. Massively long dry and bitter finish. Stupid good. A treat.

Bottle. Poured a clear pale color with an average white head that mostly lasted and produced good lacing. Moderate hop tropical citrus aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium hop bittersweet flavor with a medium smooth hop citrus bittersweet finish of average duration. Solid drinkable brew.

If you are able to look beyond the hipster facade of Brewdog - you’ll find a gem of an IPA. Loads of american citrus hops and a smooth malt base to back it up. A pleasant hop aroma both on the nose and palate. Not much after taste, but enough. Very good.

Fruity aroma, rich hoppy taste. Very light in colour, looks a bit lackluster, but tastes very rich. The flavour is sour, without becoming too much. Associations to lemon, champagne and brussel sprouts.

Bottle 33cl. Excellent mild IPA. Good balance of aromatic hops and delicious malt. Provides a very good alternative to pilsner and lager for people looking for more aroma and flavor but not necessarily the full-on package of a double or imperial IPA.

Bottle. Pours light opaque amber with small white head. Aroma is dried rose leaves, soap, banana, mango, papaya, peach, spruce, juniper. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet and light sour. Body is watery with good carbonation. Finish is medium long and light bitter with notes of pink grapefruit, butter, citrus, mango, papaya, peach, elderberry flowers, spruce/pine, walnuts. Complex yet easy to drink and like.
0.33 bottle. Pours light copper coloured with a decent head. Aroma is hoppy. Flavour very hoppy with good balance of malt. Lingering bitter aftertaste. One of the best IPAs I’ve tasted.
Draught at the Volunteer Arms in Dunbar with Dad.  Great bitter IPA with good hop to malt balance.
Une bière très originale, une amertume très justement équilibrée et un goût de litchi qui vous surprend tout à coup. A découvrir.

Pours dark and very carbonated. Nice head. Strong aroma. Has distinctive India Pale Ale nose and taste. Does finish bitter with elements of citrus. Hint of passionfruit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Canette 330ml. De couleur orangée-dorée et légèrement voilée. Nez de houblon herbeux, moyennement résineux, légèrement citrique et aux notes florales, de fruits (agrumes, léger de pêches et d’abricots), léger de caramel avec des notes de pain et des traces de butterscotch. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-doux ainsi qu’une texture légèrement huileuse et au notes crémeuses. Goût moyennement amer de houblon citrique et aux notes florales (une amertume présente toute la gorgée) et accompagné d’un goût fruité sucré (agrumes, léger de pêches, notes d’abricots, quelques traces d’ananas) lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût moyn goût de grains de malt, un moyen-léger goût de pain et des notes de caramel sucré puis en finale le houblon affiche un caractère plus herbeux, légèrement résineux et avec de faibles traces terreuses. Post-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux, moyennement citrique ainsi qu’aux notes florales et résineuses, avec un goût fruité (zeste d’agrumes, léger de pelures de pêches).

0.33 bottle. Golden color, small, white head, has quite the retention. Spruce, tropical fruits, extremely inviting, very similar to the one of 5 A.M Saint, probably due to the fact that 3 out of 4 hops strains used are the same. Taste is rather bitter but not excessively, easily detectable tropical fruits, but it’s their bitter side that is present. Medium body, slick texture and average carbonation. Finish is middle long, lightly bitter, finely balanced. All in all the beer is simply tasty, though it resembles a more dull cousin of 5 A.M Saint, due to very hop taste and overlapping of hop strains.
Tropisk aroma (Litchi). Tørr i munnen og null sødme. OK, humlesmak, men ettersmaken er litt metallisk.
Pours a hazy gold. Nice balance of crystal and massive us hops. Nice well rounded classic example of a us ipa if a little uneventful.

Golden body with a white head that had no real retention or lace.  Aroma had some nice floral hop notes, mild resin and some toasted malts.  Flavor had a good hop presence that was dominated by grapefruit hops.  Malts weren’t much of anything and the finish was moderate.

Golden / copper beer with a white foamy heaf. Excotic fruity aroma. Mediun to full body with a round and soft mouth feel. Some mild grape fruit and sweet fruit/caramel in the flavor. One of the best beers for all occasions. Yummy!

One of the better European IPAs that Ive had.  Pour was a bit flat and thin but the aroma is huge grapefruit and tropical fruit notes that really invites you to drink it.  The flavor however falls a bit short with tons of biscuity doughy malt flavor that competes a bit with the hops.  More carbonation would have done wonders for this but still good stuff.

[4758-20120902] Bottle. Fruity orange peel hops and grassy grains aroma. Clear, orange yellow body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Grainy citrus peel an grapefruit bitter hops flavour. Medium body has a bitter bite. Quite tasty and refreshing. (8/3/8/4/16) 3.9

(w/ jercraigs)



[6397B-20140628] Tap. Fragrant celery evergreen hops aroma has a bit of a sweaty base. Clear, bright orange body with a medium-lasting creamy white head. Bitter sweaty pine flavour. Medium body is quite bitter. Good. (7/3/8/4/16) 3.8

(@ BrewDog, Glasgow, Scotland)

330ml bottle. Aroma of toilet cleaner and lemon thyme. Colour pale gold. Head small and diminishing. First sip: an explosion of clementine oranges, with some lime too. The citrus taste remains throughout. Very crisp and easy going on the palate. Body thin despite abv content. Finish short and hoppy. Great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml can, chilled. Pours a pale gold with a thin white head. Lovely aroma with strong, sharp citrus, with hints of banana and coriander. Strong citrus burst on drinking, with light hops and a lovely bitter aftertaste. A very tasty IPA.

[660ml bottle from Sainsbury’s, shared with Jim - cheers!] Light amber with a moderate white head.  Pineapple, mango, lychee - a whole tropical fruit salad explosion in fact.  Plenty of pine comes through in the aftertaste.  It seems thankfully less bitter and less fizzy than the original Punk, and I’m very grateful for it - this is a much more balanced beer and a much better drinking experience as a result.  In fact it’s frighteningly drinkable, but no matter how much you drink every mouthfeel is a tasty as the first.  Truly fab stuff.

Bottle 24.12.2012
Visual: Pours clear golden amber colour, bubbly medium head.
Aroma: Hoppy, fruity (grapefruit/citrus).
Taste: As aroma, medium body. Finishes with a dry bitterness.


Visual:
Aroma:
Taste:

En esta cerveza la palabra que la define es -equilibrada-. Buen aroma y excepcional sabor. De lo mejorcito en relacion calidad precio. De hecho esta bastante mejor que muchas IPAs mas caras.
Cuanto mas la bebo mas me gusta. Una cerveza increiblemente buena y a muy buen precio. Yo la compro directamente por cajas. Para no es una cerveza, es LA CERVEZA.
Golden with white head. Sweet aroma. Taste of grapefruit. Perfectly balanced ! My favorite so far
From B and C. Nice all around IPA. Hoppy but not a totally hop bomb. Not too bubbly and smoothly malty. Serving:Bottle
Una buena IPA que no falla nunca. Con ese toque resinoso.... y que sabe practicamente igual en lata que en botella.

Pours hazy golden amber colour, bubbly medium head with good lacing. Strong hoppy aroma of grapefruit, passionfruit and cannabis (I must be going crazy). Thin to medium bodied. More orthodox taste, but finishes with a dry bitterness. Very strange, but interesting.

Keg at Brewdog Birmingham. I drank a whole pint of this and loved it. You just cannot deny the impact this beer has had on the UK beer scene. It’s been a while since I last sampled it, and I have to say, I don’t remember it being so good. Yes there is a little dry malt background, but the tropical hops are so squelchingly juicy, that this is irresistably tasty and addictive. So easy to slurp.
Gold pour, white head. Resin, intense grapefruit, summer fruit aroma. Taste follows the nose. Nice bitterness. Smooth mouth feel. Soft carbonation. Wonderful long bittersweet finish.
First time on tap, prefer the bottle for aroma but is a great beer. Citrus tropical flavours, easy to drink and a good go to beer.
Intense grapefruits and peaches aroma. Tastes pretty good too.  A bit like walking through a field of flowers.  I can see myself drinking gallons of this in the summer.
Bottle at salhojankadun pub, tampere. Clear dark golden color, big white head. Fresh hoppy citrus aroma. Nice hoppy taste, fruits citrus. I was hoping stronger body.

I’m starting to think I only choose to rate the most delicious beers I try! Another 4+!
Anyway, it has fresh aromas of grains and citrusy hops.
Nice flavors, very strong citrus fruits, excellent dry qualities in the mouth.
Finishes clean and dry. Excellent.

Bottle from Hennie Berendsen. Pours amber with a small white head witch doesn’t last long. At firts, there is an explosion of hop aromas. After that there are aromas of tropical fruits and pine. Taste is also very hoppy whit a bittersweet finish. Little carbonation. I realy love the hoppy character of this IPA.
Tipica ipa, amarga con olor agtadable y especiado. Facil de beber con un sabor clasico de ipa.

I would say that this is more of an APA in flavour if not appearance.  Sweet, hoppy aroma that follows through in the flavour.  Also some pine notes.  Finishes with quite aggressive hop bitterness.  Not particularly balanced but I like the obvious hopped flavour.  A bit of a favourite.

This beer has a very tropical aroma, much lighter appearance than I was expecting from an IPA. Also the taste is much more subtle than I expect from an IPA, but this isn’t dissapointing for me, I generally find an IPA a touch too bitter and much prefer an APA, which this seems to resemble more. Quite a pleasant refreshing beer.

Pours a cloudy light orange with a medium off-white head. Aroma is heavy pine, malts, & sweet syrup. Taste is pine up front with a sugary sweetness following. The finish is a beautiful blend of hoppy bitterness and smooth malts.
Lata. Presencia impecable limpia buena formacion de espuma y color dorado palido. Aroma a lupulos citricos y malta. En boca ligero toques citricos y final resinoso y seco, carbonatacion media alta.

Pours a murky orange color with a big white head that leaves a small ring. Smell is citrus & pine. Taste is citrus and grass up front with some grapefruit and a really smooth bitterness that balances perfectly with the malts.
Nice floral hops aroma but a bit more restrained than expected. Resin and light malt make up the flavor. Not really intense, easy drinking.

Bottle from a local bottle shop called Cheers In. Nice fruity aroma with some cloudiness. The taste is fairly balanced for an IPA but it’s still a nice beer to enjoy. More along the lines of APA. Well done and reasonably priced for imported craft beer in Shanghai.
33cl bottle - Sweet hops pine aroma, hints of peaches. Taste of herbs and pine slightly, hoppy, hints of grapefruit, bitter herbs. Lasting finish, but nothing special.

Sono un amante della punk ipa, questa birra per me è drasticamente cambiata. alcuni giorni fa apro una lattina prodotta circa due mesi prima e riscontro che la punk ipa non è più la stessa.
nel bicchiere si presenta quasi come sempre, colore giallo opaco con schiuma media e bianca.
al naso note di malto e non più di luppolo.......
PIATTA!!!
spero in un nuovo esperimento punk ipa da parte di brewdog
cheers..

Wonderfull beer. Complex aroma to me, but sweet malt with noble hoppy-dark fruitfulness, sugary is in vanguard, a bit oaky.  Pours pale golden with white top, lasting enough. Taste is pleasantly sweet start with hoppy bitter afterpath,  not dry. Medium to full bodied with creamy texture - this one is really difficult in flavor and very, very enjoyable. Smooth one.

Pour is amber with fizzy off-white head. Aroma is flowery, citrus, straw and toffee malt. Taste is herbal, citrus, dust,  sweet fruitiness with dusty hops. 
Medium body, medium carbonation,Texture is oily. Ends almost chalky and dry.

660ml bottle. Pours cloudy light copper. Smooth head that doesn’t last very long. Mild citrus aroma. Slightly sweet apple, followed by tart citrus, a little malt and a gentle but lasting bitter finish. This is very easy drinking and extremely nice.
Buenísima. Con olor a flores. Muy sabrosa para tan poco alcohol. Sabores cítricos y aromáticos. Poca espuma./Riquísima de tirador.

Pours a clear pale golden color with a medium fluffy white head that diminishes slowly. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of piney hops and malt. Light-bodied and crisp with flavors of floral hops, pine and bready malt. The finish is hoppy with a fruity aftertaste. Above average overall.

It’s taken me ages to get round to drinking this, goodness only knows why!  It is a great ale, no wonder BrewDog have met with such success.  Grown up flavours, lots of complicated bitterness.  Strong on hops, with some spicy resin and a little bit of cloves in the background. Tastes bitter, dry and sharp with a finish that leaves an interesting biscuit flavour and a desire for more!.

Delicious. Fruity notes merge beautifully with robust hops flavours. Pleasant bitterness all around. A winner.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fantastic. The bitterness of the hops is masked almost perfectly. Strong tropical aroma, wonderfully rounded taste. Delivers the fruitiness and the punch you expect, but without the heaviness of other IPAs. Not tiring at all. A masterfully balanced beer.

Bottle. Pours a golden color with a nice off-white head on top. Aroma is pine, citrus fruit, honey, peach, sweet biscuit malt. Flavor is pine upfront with honey, orange rind, and toasted breadiness. On the palate the beer starts with a nice hoppy bitterness with toasted bread malts and honey coming in too add a semi-sweetness. Medium body, medium carbonation.

.33l bottle in the aftermath of the elections as a gift to myself. A gorgeous, complex and overally incredibly tasty brew. Warm orange-yellow body with minor foam head. Aroma of glorious hops fill my heart with joy, especially the hint of dark dank juices Chinook and Simcoe provide. Smooth beer, shows off the hops in a flattering way. Makes me just want to drink more of these. Tasty, well balanced stronger IPA that i could session with any time I was so lucky to find myself in the room with a case of BrewDog beers. Another great, solid standout IPA. Grab some and enjoy them.

330ml bottle. Clear light amber colour, white foamy head and hoppy grapefruit aroma. Hits with immediate sharp dry fruity bitterness, very hoppy, warm mouth feel with some residual sweetness and a lingering bitterness. Quite drinkable.

33 cl. can @ home, bought @ Traverse, Utrecht. Golden with a tin white head. Hoppy citrussy fruity aroma. Mango, pineapple and more tropical fruits are all present also. Taste is bittersweet with a long hopbitter aftertaste. A beer to drink after a long hot summer day but on this rainy autumn night it also goes down really well.

Light golden color. White, fast falling head. Medium carbonation, watery, full body. Long, bitter hoppy finish. Aroma: Strong hoppy, grassy, citrus (grapefruit), bitter. Taste: Bitterness, hops, citrus (grapefruit)
On tap. Very flowery aroma, some citrus. Taste flowery but with a lot of earth/soil/basement tastes. Not very pleasant.

... And here’s me not even noticing they changed it.  Bottle.  Hugely hoppy nose with sprucey resin and some cloves.  Pours medium gold with a fluffy, white, persistant head.  Flavour is sweet, bitter, dry and sharp in equal measure with a excellent, back-of-the-throat finish that lingers and invites another sip.  A great staple from a great brewer.

33 cl bottle poured into a Pint glass

App/  light yellow colour with a white head (1 finger) 

S/   pine resin, malt and grapefruit. Strong smell, very nice.

T /  fresh and herbal sweetnes that ends in a bitterness very well balanced.
Long aftertaste.

M/  medium body and medium/light carbonation.

O /   personal IPA, very nice even for me (a fan of ‘classic UK IPA’) !!
To repeat.

Mellbevágóan citrusos/grapefruitos aroma, tökéletes keserűség. Abszolút kedvenc.
Re-rated after tasting in a Brewdog bar from tap it is much worse than it was; flat and ’empty’ now
Pours a clear gold with a one finger head. mango, pineapple, tropical fruit aromas. Some grapefruit as well. Strong hop flavor with a peanut note in the finish.

Il colore giallo carico non invoglia la bevuta, ricorda le lager da supermercato anche per la schiuma abbondante all’inizio ma evanescente. È però l’unica nota negativa: al naso tanta frutta tropicale che ti resta in memoria, easy-to-drink, poco carbonata e amaro persistente. Una buona birra

33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet, Storo. Pours clear, deep golden with a white head. Hoppy aroma wit citrus, tropical fruits, malt and caramel. Lighty sweet and malty with a pleasant fuity flavour. Well balanced with a pleasant bitterness in the finish. Decent and easy to drink IPA. (2012-10-27)
