On tap at the Thomas house in Dublin. Nice IPA really fruity but a strong bitter finish not everybody. Y
Bottle 33 cl. Orange, cloudy with a min white head. Fresh and nice fruity aroma, grape-plump-banana. Bitter taste with a nice fruity ending, liked this one
Where do i start one of my current favorite ipa’s. Crisp citrus zestiness and smooth with it. Winner.

Gold/copper coloured, clear. medium and unstable head. Intensive aroma of tropical fruits, oranges, citrus and lychee. At the beginning quite sweet and fruity taste, later a stronger bitterness balanced with a pleseant sweetness at the end. Full body, long bitter finish.

Aroma is yeast, citrus, tropical fruit/kiwi and a hint of malts.  The flavor is tropical fruit, orange, underlying malts and a long and bitter finish.  Very subtle compared to what I was expecting, a great IPA that wasn’t too blunt but still strong in flavor.

Bevuta presso la Pecora e il Luppolo di Mosciano S.Angelo (TE). Birra dorata con schiuma fine. L’aroma è di luppolo e agrumi. L’assaggio è caratterizzato dall’amaro equilibrato da note floreali e di frutta..Buona
Where the journey started. Massive aroma and flavor profile. Good body with light carbonization. Very drinkable, with a good level of sweetness and bitterness. Benchmark IPA

Definitely different if you're used to drinking Cali-style pale ales. Medium body, has a good hop bitterness that runs more to the floral than the citrus. Slight oiliness to the finish, but not too dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pouring light amber with full fluffy white head  aroma very prominent -all grapefruit and hops. Taste is a balanced mix of grapefruit  passion fruit and hop induced bitterness.  Medium carbonation. A good refreshing IPA.

Aroma is one of the strongest point in this beer: tropical fruits (pomelo, grapefruits) leave a wonderful sensation in nose. Generous white head, very good lacing. Golden color, sparking liquid. Very easy to have, complex and balanced taste, seemed more acid than bitter to me.
Tasted at Ale&Hop, Barcelona. Bright yellow colour with a nice but notlasting thick head. Aroma is something citric, maracuyá and other tropical fruits. Sweet and nice bitter finish.

pours a dark golden colour with about a finger of head. Lots of tropical fruits in the aroma, smells fresh and uplifting. Taste has a nice bitey bitterness up front that mellows quickly into mango, pineapple and then lime flavours, malt is well balanced in what is a hop driven pale. The medium body is somewhat creamier than a lot of pales ive had, with a lively carbonation, really nice! Fairly bitter, pleasant finish. good beer.
La quintessenza dell’IPA per me sinora. Speziata al punto giusto, schiuma corposa e persistente. Si sentono gli odori del luppolo dietro ai vari aromi fruttati, un vero gioiello.
I’m French. 66cl bottle from UK (thank bro). I’m very fond of :)

Tasted on tap @Brewdog Camden on xx/07/2012.
Taste is quite interesting, hard to define, but it's like a heap of malts mixed with a heap of hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color: Paja pálido.

Espuma: poco abundante y efímera, blanca con burbujas pequeñas en supèrficie

Intensidad aromática: media-alta

Aroma: lúpulo, floral, y cítricos (pomelo).

Entrada en boca/amargor: seca, con amargor acentuado, dulce pero muy leve al principio, pica la lengua, pero la sensación en boca es ligera.

Sabor: muy agradable, muy lupulizada que sirve de equilibrio entre las flores y los cítricos. Toques de piña y naranja
Pours a bright golden yellow with a big frothy white top.   Aroma is big citrus hop aromas and tropical fruits.  Taste is big citrus hops with a sweet and bitter finish.
What’s up brewdog?? Where is the incredible and explosive refreshing IPA?? Where?
As far as my tastebuds go this is as good as you’ll get for a refreshing IPA. Citrusy, hoppy, full of fruity flavours - it’s my current go-to beer. Lovely stuff!

Pours ever so slightly hazy. Gets chill haze very easily, had Batch 000 from BrewDogs new brewery recently. Great pale lager like colour. Aroma is mango, passion fruit, citrus. Taste is like sucking on a hop flavoured lemon and I mean that in a good way. Like a true US craft beer.

Personal favourite.

Bottle. Murky cooper-orange colour with small frothy beige head that goes to excellent crown. Strong aroma of grapefruit, elder and mango. Taste is bitter, aftertaste is heavy bitter and is real poetry for my tongue. Excellent beer!
Best every dat beer ever, you will never get bored of it!!! Beautiful taste of tropical fruits. Perfect balance of bitter and malted
33cl bottle. Clear orange color with a nice white head. Nice sweet fruity aroma, especialy mango. Flavor is also sweet, fruity also mango. Nice bitter finish. Absolute wonderful taste. Great beer

bottle at bateau de nuit, qc. pours clear bright golden with a decent white head, some retention. crisp, spicy malts, bread and biscuit, fruity tropicalness, strawberry-ish, light pine notes. average carbonation, some fizz, medium body - oily, very nice short to medium long citrusy, light piney finish.
Amazing aromatic IPA. More Southern hemishpere fruit punch than in its previous version, perhaps, but this is still a benchmark beer. Pineapple, euchaluptus, candied lemon peel. Dry finish.
Lighter style IPA with a wicked hit of flavor. Sweet, floral and nutty scent and flavor.

Well, what to say about this beer? I expected way much more from it. It looks like a simple lager, too much straight golden colored to me. It smells like a good IPA only for few seconds, then the magic disappears. Taste is light, only the bitterness can stand aginst better examples of this style. Overall, too watery and not enough flavorful.
A quite primitive IPA with little finesse. The term " Punk" is well-deserved. Disappointing in contrast to its fame . I was expecting a lot more..
Really enjoyable fresh, well-balanced citric IPA with good medium body. Excellent fruity aftertaste.
Herbs taste with orange nute. Somewhat bitter. White foam, disappearing quickly. Amber colour. Legendary status of this beer is not confirmed after tasting, but it’s still a good beer.

Enjoyed at home in a 12oz. Deep orange haze. No head. Loving the simcoe hops in this. Lots of pine and almonds. Decent malt backbone, weak bitterness but the nutty and bitterness of this is solid. It’s very drinkable. Light body. 



Re-rate in early 2015 in Belgium. I think this is much fresher than the version before. Thanks Bjorn. 
Pale yellow 2 finger off-white head. Aroma is good. floral, some pine notes, fruity like tropical fruits. Floral taste, overall nice bitterness. It’s a fairly crushable beer. tropical fruits galore. some nutty finish with sugar sweetness.

330 ml bottle purchased at the Westmere Beverage Center (Albany, New York) on September 18, 2012. Golden blond, little head. Sweet hops pine aroma, hints of peaches. Taste of herbs and pine slightly hoppy, hints of grapefruit, bitter herbs. My expectations were too high!

Bottle. What a nice IPA. Amber with dense white head. Aroma explodes out in the face, especially nelson sauvin are obvious, also some grape notes. Taste hoppy bitter and some malty body, very refreshing. Finish moderate bitter. A beer you could drink a lot of, and a reasonable price as well.

Bottle. Hazy amber colour washing up liquid head. Citrus aroma. Taste is typical of an IPA to me, grapefruit and refreshing. Tangy aftertaste and fizzy on the palate. A good IPA, just wish I could get it on cask, Imagine.....

Whilst I much prefer the punchier Hardcore IPA, this is a top brew! Pours a lovely pale dark gold body with a thin head, aroma is pretty strong with wild berries, quite a soft and smooth textured drink, tastes quite malty upfront leading on to a heavy fruit taste which finishes on a soft but bitter end.

330 ml bottle. The aroma is pretty good, and the taste is as expected - fruity and bitter at the same time - not too bitter, but well-balanced. It’s lively and has great characteristics, but not as "tasty" as I hoped for.

Good thin head that leaves rings while goes down the glass. Smell of fruit, flowers, like a meadow in a glass, also a hint of malt. Medium bitterness with everything that has the aroma in the taste. Good carbonation that shows the aromas. Long lasting mouth filling aftertaste.

I like this. Bit of a regular in my house. That’s because I’m a punk. And I like otters. They’re not my favourite. That would be tigers, monkeys/apes, and ducks. Otters smell a bit. But they look like fun. Can’t taste them in this drink though, marris or otherwise.
Superb pale ale from brewdog - super zesty, massive grapefruit undertones, crisp finish. World class pale ale
Pint at brewfellas. Grassy aroma hits you straight away. Has a beatiful  head with a citrus taste, slight bitterness, easy going. Excellent beer.

Bottle. Pours a haxzy golden with a white head. Fruity and hoppy aroma with citrus, orange, pine and resin notes. Fruity and hoppy flavour, with notes of pine and a cardboard overtone. 
Bitter, dry, hoppy finish, with notes of citrus and a lingering green apple note. Slightly too much carbonation. Overall okay, but nothing special really. Good for the price though. 16.09.12.

(330ml bottle Waitrose) Pours gold with a nice white head and good lacing. The passion fruit hop hit from the chinook, Nelson sauvin is gorgeous. A very easy drinking IPA, and such a good one. Lovely Going to try it on tap when the local Brew dog bar in Shoreditch, London opens next month.
Pours clear golden with medium head. Intensive aroma is fruity mixed with hops and citrus. Flavor is hops, fruits. Some bubblegum, great bitterness. Swell!

Fantastica birra IPA dal deciso profumo floreale e agrumato. Schiuma fine, aspetto chiaro, intensità olfattiva molto elevato ma molto attraente, frizzantezza scarna, corpo rotondo, amaro percettibile, persistenza retro olfattiva lunga.
Birra da collezione per intenditori del genere.

Bottle share with JF on Southampton beer up - 09/09/12.
Pale golden with a thin white head.
Grapefruit, pine, hops and citrus on the nose.
Tastes of pine, hops, mango, orange and grapefruit.
Medium bodied and carbonation with a bitter dry finish.
Great fresh tasting IPA.

Can from the LCBO. Pours a clear orange with a bit of white head that leaves a bit of nice lacing. Smell is nice with some sweet passionfruit and mango  with some pine and citrus hoppiness as a counterpoint. Palate is smooth and medium bodied though carbonation is lacking. Taste is kind of lacking, not much at first then a bit of bitterness that lingers for ages. A bit disappointing.

Thx. to Kraddel // 33 cl. bottle split // tried the first version way back // first IPA I had back then, wasn’t terribly impressed by it back then // pours almost clear orange with a bubbly white head // smell is watery pine, mango, papaya, rather bitter, plenty of orange peel, not much in the way of a sweet touch, lots of pine and watery aspects // bitter and watery with pine and mango + papaya, weak bitter herbal finish, floral touches, reasonable amount of hop bite in the back // too watery // rather weak and dull even for a supermarket beer, doesn’t particularly live up to being an IPA // why is this so watery? are they cutting costs to much? // not much difference with original version as far as I remember // this does feel bitterer // quafable

split with 77 ships, very light coloured, weak foam, bitter scent, taste more watery than i’m used to, kinda bitter, very few aftertaste. ok but not waaw-ish 3 / 5

Rerate after several times ( draft and bottle ) indeed a bit weak to me , even for abv ( compare this to thornbridge’s jaipur , for one ) but actualy pretty good for what it is . Floral , bit bitter , very balanced

12oz bottle from letpour.com.  Yellow-orange pour with a thin bright white head that leaves a ring.  Aroma is oily grass and citrus.  Tastes are grapefruit, floral, grapes, hay, sour orange peel vibe, bready.  Slightly watery thinish palate.  Ok.
Bottle from the Bieradviseur in Diepenbeek. Hazy blond beer with a small white head. Aroma and taste of citrus, green apples and notes of bubblegum. Nice hop bitterness.
Intense smell floral and citrusy. Biscuit and caramel taste with good bitterness but not intrusive.
Wonderful aroma, hoppy and perfect after a good meal, or before it. A great beer for every occasion.
2012-09-04 Bottle 33 cl. Nice and relative cheap IPA. Bought it now for the second time.

2014-06-28. Crisp dark yellow orange body with a small white head. Aroma of grassy straw hops, mild fruit. Flavour is pleasantly hoppy and bitter. Nice hoppy profile, grassy straw, tropical fruit makes appearances, Average plus  bodied palate, good carbonation. Very quaffable. 7/3+/7/3/15-16 On tap at BrewDog, Glasgow



2012-09-03. Lightly hazy dark yellow-orange body, nice foamy off-white head. 3+ Pleasantly hoppy aroma, modest citrus, light grass, orange, lemon, very mild resin. 7+ Flavour is similar, refreshingly pleasant hop character, modest citrus, sweet lemon and muted orange/tangerine, modest bitterness throughout. Average plus bodied palate is pleasantly effervescent. I would like it to be just a touch more full flavoured, though this can is a month or two old so perhaps that is part of it, but it is quite tasty and extremely quaffable as it is. 8/3/7/3/15 Can from the LCBO, Toronto
660ml bottle from Sainsburys; had numerous times and never fails,, quality ipa, bitter taste can’t go wrong.
33cl bottle. Clear orange color, small white to off white head. Smell malts, grapefruit, hops. Taste malts, hops, fruits, grapefruit, citrus, bitter. Medium body, medium carbo.

330 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a cloudy orange with small white cap.  Aroma is wheat, caramel with citrus and perfumey floral hops.  Flavour is sweet wheat, caramel, lemon, grapefruit and a floral note.  Modest bitterness in finish.  Nice.
Golden ale with strong fruity hops in the nose. Creamy head. Light body, soft carbonation, very bitter, typical american IPA, well made but not original.
Aromas of mandarin orange, grapefruit, a touch of spruce. I found the body to be grainy with flavours of grapefruit and spruce. Relatively bitter.
Pours amber with a white head. Aroma is caramel, grapefruit and citrus. Flavour is caramel, grapefruit, peach and citrus.

33cl bottle. This IPA is very good for smelling: flowers (rose?), tropical fruits. Taste is the other side, hoppy aroma snaking arounf, more gulp come the sweetness but foam isn’t OK, very fragile. Colour is amber but not clear, neither unfiltered. Nice work, but not the best.
Bottle. Golden/orange body with a nice white head. Hop oriented aroma, citrus, pine, and a taste of caramel, lemon and grapefruit. Nicely balanced, lovely bitterness and a lasting hoppy aftertaste.
Poured yellow-orange.  white head.  Hops and floral notes, not super powerfully bitter. Decent IPA.

Bottle.  Golden with a large white foam.  Aromas are wood and butter with pineapplejpineapple juice and dusty yeast.  Light, floral pine with spices.  Flavours are sweet tinned pineapple syrup with green, herbal pine and a bitter spruce finish.  Good but not as good as the heftier version.

Light copper color, soft carbonation, medium body, oily, long bitter finish but leaves small sweetness. White medium sized, medium slowly falling head. Nice fresh aroma: Aromatic hops, citrus(grapefriut), slightly resin. Taste: Medium to high bitterness, grapefruits.

I am always sceptical of IPAs and I don’t particularly like the West Coast take on the style. But this was very hoppy, very bitter and just superb. Nice pale ale, cloudy, with a persistent white head and that typical nose of Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine, which must be associated with one of the hops used (same aroma as on Renaissance Voyager IPA). Nice bitter flavor, well balanced with the roasted malt, which is very very sublte. Medium bodied, with a lingering bitterness that is floral and pleasant, begging you to have more of it. Great beer, even for an IPA.

Väldigt god och bra IPA med behaglig doft med snarkt inslag av aprikos, besk men ändå lätt att dricka. Rekomenderas starkt. Alkoholhalt 5,6 % Användning Serveras vid 10-12°C som sällskapsdryck, eller till smakrika rätter av lamm-eller nötkött.  Smak Humlearomatisk smak med tydlig beska, inslag av aprikos, apelsinmarmelad, ljust bröd och tallbarr.

Golden-orange body.  Moderate sized white head. Soapy lacing.  Nose is full of faint grapefruit, orange, resin, biscuit-like malts.  Flavor is similar with the fruity hop notes mellowing a bit and becoming more balanced and pleasant.  Medium bodied, a bit slick on the tongue, light bitterness in the finish. I prefer my IPAs to be a bit more assertive, but this was still decent.
Gigantic foamy head. Almost clear, light golden brown. Somewhat smoky citrus aroma, malt pastilles. Soft and smooth bitterness. "Malted milk with a twist", plenty of tastes at once.

Aroma is not very strong sweet with a little resin piny fruity. Appearance is orange white head that does not last not really any lacing either. Has mild carbonation and a little oily looking. Taste is citrus floral piny leaves a sweet citrus flavor on the tounge. Overall the appearance and aroma was not all that great but the taste is one of the best IPA’s I have ever had.

A really awesome beer. The aroma is so great, you smell the fruits and hops like they were put fresh into the beer.most of all you smell grapefruit and these fruits make also it?s unique taste. When I drank this,I felt like in heaven :)
Bottle. Golden colour with large creamy white mostly lasting head. Hoppy aroma with fruity notes. Sweet bitter flavor.  Creamy palate.

Hazy golden yellow with solid white foam head. Aroma is fresh, taste is full flavour natural beer with a good biiter taste. The post addition of amazing fruity hops giving an explosion of tropical fruit flavours and a sharp bitter finish. (Velp 201208)
Can shared at a tasting at kerenmk’s place. Pours yellow to golden with a medium head, aroma of pineapple, lemon, malt and mango, flavor of tangerine, orange nice bitterness, medium bodied

Draft at Taps Beer Bar, Kuala Lumpur. This is a beer I drink all the time in bottles, but the unfiltered cask version is so much better as one would expect. Lovely citrus aroma leads to a fruity, citrus, hoppy bitterness which is a joy to behold. One of my favourite IPA’s and great to drink here in Malaysia where it’s so well kept. I could easily be in Scotland! In fact, after a few more of these I can be anywhere I want to be :-)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear light copper coloured beer with a big white head. Light fruity-sweet aroma of light malts, lime, and plenty of hops. The taste is:slightly sweet fruity with and characteristically hoppy. Quite an ok beer but a tad to sweet for an ipa.
Birra dal profumo intenso, dal gusto mediamente luppolato ma non amaro, purtroppo si presenta senza corpo e senza schiuma e questo la rende, sì fresca e beverina,ma anche abbastanza slavata.

Pours a hazy light golden color with a nice white head.  Aroma of floral hops with a bit of a wheat aroma in the background.  Light citrus scents as well.  Lightly sweet and malty with some hop bitterness at the finish.  Nice fruit undertones throughout the mouth.  Note quite as crisp in the mouth as I would like, but still an enjoyable drink.
Bottle from Fakta. Hazy golden colour with a nice off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit and grassy notes.

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks zvikar. Pours hazy golden with white film. Grapefruit dominated aroma, delicate and a little flowery. Soft, very soft bitterness. Light body, lively carbonation, long citric finish.

fles 33cl
kleur: gouden kleur, kleine witte schuimkraag
geur: fruit, erg fruitig, lychees.
smaak: lychees, fruitig, zoet en licht bitter.

Bottle.  Pours clear golden orange with a medium white head.  Beautiful full tropical fruit and citrus hoppy aroma.  Flavour is medium sweet and bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.  One of my favorite easy drinking IPAs.

Bottle 33 cl, SB. Pours clear amber with a nice off white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is inte se piny grapefruits cat piss citric malty grassy and a bit soapy. Flavor is excellent, malty bitter hoppy citric resiny some caramel and dryer bitterness with sustained malts and fruits. One heck of an IPA.
BrewDog’s Punk is a solid IPA that makes for an enjoyable glass of beer, and is definitely worth checking out if you happen to see it on the shelves.
Golden colour with a white head. Aroma of hops with some citrus. Taste of hops with some grass.

Not as good as the original 6% but far more reliable. The old stuff could get a little astringent, like burnt rubber, if you got the wrong batch. This is far more palatable. Still quite sharp and dry in both aroma and taste but it is tasty and refreshing. A cut apart from most beers at this strength. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Love the Teal Can. Lots of really bubbly clingy head that’s taking a bit to fade. Lots and lots of citrus in that nose. A bit of spice as well. Wow is that ever pleasant! It’s got everything I expect from an IPA. Lots of hops and citrus and tartness. It’s all really well blended together though. There’s a sweetness that cancels out what I find to be a grapefruit taste in all IPAs, a taste I don’t really enjoy. I don’t mind this at all. This is perhaps the best IPAs I’ve had. Note though that I’m not really a fan of the style, so I’m sure IPA lovers may well feel differently.
Lovely pale ale aroma and this is evident in its taste giving it a nice bitter texture.

Clear orangish/golden color. No lacing left.
The aroma is just GREAT! A very welcome to IPA world. Pure citrus hops, oh my god thanks for this sensation (actually thanks for BrewDog)!

Taste is also good but a bit less superb than aroma. Orange, grapefruit and hops, hops and hops. Finishing is pronounced bitterness.

I had it with blue cheese and also a piece of apple tart. I can assure you will like it too.

Can sample at a tasting at kerenmk’s place. Thanks zvikar. Clear deep golden. Hoppy aroma of tropical fruits and citrus. Flavor has light grainy sweetness, fruity hops and a mildly bitter and citric finish. Medium-bodied. Too mild, I liked the old version better.

Bottle, drunk from a snifter. Really fantastic citrus hops aroma and flavour, bitterness low and pleasant when cold, almost indetectable having warmed up a bit. I attribute this to the snifter; I tried it from other glassware and the bitterness was much more prominent.

The hop character is the crowning glory of this beer. The appearance and palate were nice enough but nothing to write home about.

Pours golden and clear, with a finger of quickly fading eggshell white head. Aroma is intensely fruity and floral, with a bit of a tropical pineapple note. Strong bitterness up front, with some of the fruityness and tropical pineapple from the nose on the mid palate, and a lovely malt toastyness on the finish. Crisp finish. Really balanced flavour. Not too over the top, although this has been sitting in the fridge for a few weeks, so the hops may have faded. I really like this.
Bright clear gold with small head. Amazing tropical and bit fruity aroma is what makes this beer great. Average bitter taste. Beer that drag me into IPA’s.

the beer that got me started with brewdog. its a strange one in that it seems to vary a lot from batch to batch. sometimes its awesome, sometimes its a bit skunky. it does need to be a bit more balanced but maybe im just nitpicking. a good all round session beer, good on draught.
Basement aromas, skunky, raisin, smoke, cereal, bread, leather, alcohol, leaves, woody

A golden IPA with a thin off white head. In aroma, biscuit malt with nice floral and piney hops, light funk, nice and smooth. In mouth, biscuit malt with piney floral hops, citrus pulp, light fruity esters, quite nice. Bottle from LCBO, BB 12-05-12.
Easy to drink beer. Very nice bitterness and notes of grass. Yellow-amber colour.

Bomber enjoyed at the end of another trying day. Pouts golden with small white head. Lacing cap rings the glass. Lovely nose of pine, citrus... Mostly orange, tangerine, and faint grapefruit. Good malt base and enough bitterness to clean the palate but not nuke it. The scots prove they can make better beer than their english brethern.
0.33 l - Something I never thought I’d say: A well flavored, light bodied IPA. Go BrewDog.
Bottle. Dark orange in colour with a good white head. Strong fruity hop aromas. Nice malt flavours at first,then finishes with a good hop bitterness.

Bottle from mane liquor.. Aroma is quite fruity with passion fruit and citrus notes. Taste is even better with the hops and fruits combining to make a well balanced ipa. Bitterness develops more evidently towards the end of the beer. Overall pretty good but nothing exciting

33 cL bottle from Tesco into a Westvleteren glass at home.  Bubbly head over a golden amber beer.  Light, fruity hopped beer.  Well hopped, dry, tropical fruit, bitter and pleasant. Enjoyable session beer.

Can [330ml]. I was surprised to see that Punk IPA had two separate ratings, I’m glad I noticed. Pours a hazy golden-orange with a large semi-lasting fluffy white head and some lacing on the glass. Nice hoppy aroma, resiny, grassy and citrusy, along with some tropical fruit and a hint of spices & herbs. Pleasant, easy-to-drink flavour of those aforementioned hops along with bready malt, fruit and herbs. Also slightly sweet, and with a dry bitter finish. Average bodied. Good stuff, especially on a warm Summer day.
Bottle pour. Light golden. Lots of hops in the aroma. Tropical fruits. Nice crispness for an IPA. Probably would like this better on cask.
Blond colour with thick soapy head. Very strong aroma. Hop, pine, lychee, citrus. Flavour is hoppy at first then lots of sweet tropical fruit comes in.
podria estar bebiendo esta cerveza a todas horas. de barril es de li mejor q hay en ipas. economica y deliciosa

Medium hazy yellow-orange with a thick creamy lasting lacy off-white head. Smells of caramel malt, strong hoppy and herbal, citrus and orange and fruit Medium oily body with lively carbonation. Tastes of sweet malt with heavy citrus lemon, lime spicy hops with a bitter hop finish. Some tropical fruit. A great session beer that would be great with spicy food. Great but the Hardcore is better.
aroma: Berries, sweet fruits, grass. Taste: Refreshing. Palate: Easily drinkable, yet strong enough to feel like a proper beer. The best beer for summertime I’ve tasted!
A very good bear...Once you try this you want to try all brewdog beers.................

Cannette 330 ml. 5.6%. Couleur jaune un peu foncé, claire, mousse blanche. Arôme de houblon frais, herbes citrus et malt. En bouche, douce et fruitée au début, malt caramel qui suit et herbes, houblon ensuite. Finale en herbes et amertume assez présente. Bonne fraîche. Update 2016 cannette 473 ml.

Golden copper color. Deep nose with green hops and some 420. Medium bodied, nimble palate with clean, fresh flavors. Floral hops end with a touch of mint and basil. Not sure if IPA should be herbal, but this one is.
Bottled. What an awesome aroma! Full of hops, a delight! Tatse is well balanced, with some fruit notes. Not so bitter, which is pleasant. Awesome!

Bottle. Pours golden to orange color. Aroma is a lot of hops, very pleasant, and tropical fruits. Taste is again a lot of hops, but also a bit of sweet malt and tropical fruits. Overall very bitter, very dry finish.

Pours a mostly clear yellow with a nice head. Aroma is oh wow nice and hoppy. Flavor is hoppy as well, very delicious! Hooray for brew dog because this beer rules. Too bad I only have one. Hard to give this anything less than a 5.0, but I’ve only tried it once.
IPA con sabor a maracuyá. Demasiado amarga para mi gusto pero genial para el que le gusten este tipo de cervezas.
Great Ipa. Very aromatic. Medium body. Notes of herbs, caramel, tropical fruits and citrus.

330ml can. A clear yellow-orange body, small white head, poor retention. Nice piney aroma, caramel, orange peel, floral. Taste is dominated by the bitter herbal hops, pine, caramel. Biscuit aftertaste.
Beautiful mandarin flavour, which may be my favourite profile of hops. The malt base doesn’t have much going on, I guess I’m just used to the 2 row instead of Marris Otter for this type.
Bottle. Pours light amber with a medium, white, frothy head. Aroma is pine, juniper, pith. Taste is pith, slight juniper, piney, caramel. Palate is alright.

Color : nice blond beer with an amber touche, normal carbonation and white no head. Smell : herbs and floral (spring sensation) hops and dry. Taste : hops and flowers with a litchi taste. Aftertaste : dry bitter and hops.
Really easy to drink, I recommended it if you want to taste IPA beer style.

Fantastic flowery nose with citrus

Light orange color and small white head.

Full bodied with lots of malts balancing the malt.

Light golden pour, big rocky white head. 
Very citrucy aroma, loads of gapefruit, and some grass. The malts are dry any biscuity. Good mouthfeel, medium carb. Finish is dry, and a medium bitterness leave a great hop bite. Much better than the previous version.

3 finger head,golden lager look. XCarbinated some. Smell is light reye/bread mabye. Taste is some oddness,agressive hops a little n fruity hops like pineapple,ect. An odd fruity ipa. Extremly drinkable. Yrs ago single bottles where here now this one is back & a summer seasonal here but in 330ml 11.2oz cans

11.2oz bottle (batch 057) - pours clear orange with white head and thin lacing.  Nose is citrus and pine.  Flavor adds caramel and grapefruit.  Finishes dry with sticky mouthfeel.  A little sweet on the front end but mainly bitter for the rest of the duration.  A nice way to celebrate father’s day.

Bottle at home. Pours golden, amber, Thin foam, rather high carbonation. The smell is mostly citrusy and yeasty, while the flavour is dominated by the chinook and nelson sauvignon hops, which give a fantastic grapefruit flavour and a light bitter finish. A truly pleasant IPA, quite high drinkabiltiy for the style.

On tap and from the bottle. A quality IPA. Massively fruity. Lots of citrus. Big, bold and tasty. Thirst quenching. Easily sessionable. Great golden colour, lovely white head, wonderful bitterness and a great after taste. A top beer. 

An update for October 2012: This beer often varies in quality. When it’s good, it’s good, when it’s bad, it’s down right terrible.

It pours an odd colour for an IPA, it’s a blonde colour with a slight reddish hue (looks more like a lager); the head was soapy and off-white. The aroma has notes of: grapefruit, candied-apricots, pine-needles, alcohol, pumpkin-seeds, a nutty note (indistinguishable), and hay. The taste is light medium bitterness that finishes very nutty and dry; there are notes of: grapefruit, orange-zest, lime, alcohol, hazelnut, a sweet malt, and soft-pretzel (finish). The palate is light-medium bodied, aqueous, light carbonation, and medium finish. Overall, very unique – one of the odder IPA’s I’ve tried. It’s varied nature almost justifies the weak body.

355mL can from the El cee Beeoh. Pours a nice bright gold with a medium white head. Aroma is awesome, just like I remember the previous version with delicious pineapple and citrus hops on top of decent pale malts. Flavour is pretty much what I recall from the old version, same awesome hop character and bite, with a nice ’crisp’ malt body supporting it. Quite sharp yet drinkable. Body is light, spritzy, and definitely refreshing during hot summer days. This is one of my favourite session IPA’s, and session beers in general. It’s simple but that’s what I like about it, the simplicity is pulled off expertly and it’s delicious.

Can from LCBO.  Pours clear amber with a white head.  Big grapefruit and citrus fruits aroma, with a slight hint of malt.  The taste... there’s an underlying good taste, but overall it’s too watery.  I’m also getting some salty and metallic notes.  The taste hiding in there is hoppy and moderately bitter.  Body also feels thin and watery.  Drinkable, but disappointing nonetheless.

The beer pours a light golden colour, a little bit hazy. At nose very strong hoppiness with hints of exotic fruits.Taste is dominated by persistent bitterness, but aroma confirms the initial smells. Very huge hints of exotic fruitiness, with pink grapefruit and mango over all. Some traces of pine needles.Very refreshing ale and very easy to drink, but not an unforgettable ipa.

From a can I purchased at the Dundas LCBO. Pour is super active, tons of carbonation, copper colour and huge fluffy white head that leaves tons of clumpy lacing behind. Smell is quite obviously hoppy, and rather sweet like caramel. Tastes hop bitter, but not a tongue numbingly so. Rather light and smooth. This will be my session beer for this summer. God job.
330ml bottle. Amber color. No head flat. Strong pine, flowers, hops, cat piss in aroma. Pine, floral hops dominates body. Slightly sweet juicy ending. Mild bitterness.
Pours amber witgh a white head. Nose of fresh spruce and fruit. Aroma of spruce, citrus, and a fruity sweetness. Very good.

I have just realised I have not rated Punk IPA, I must have drank it 5 or 6 times. Crisp golden, hazy pour with a decent frothy white head and lace. Aromas of grass, hops, grapefruit, lemon, orange, pine and malt. Punk is delicious, slightly bitter, sweet with bags of grapefruit and orange/lemon. You can almost taste the grassy aromas as well as the pine. Another excellent beer from BrewDog. Man I love this brewery.
355ml can from the LCBO. clear golden, white head, lacing. nice expressive hop nose. leanmalt body, lots of hop flavour, on the bitter side of balanced. great session IPA.

The label has lost a little steam on its original 6 per cent’r, hope the beer hasn’t.
Soft pffft when the cap releases. An initial burst of tangy grapefruit is undeniable. Cool and not chilled and into a snifter it goes. Average pour produces a soapy, loose white head that is mostly lasting. The body of beer a deep orange gold and radiant random eddies of fine bubbles.  Aroma is sweet, sticky and tangy and heaving with tropical fruit esters and rose water musk, stinging nettles and fresh hop flowers. There is a light rubbery note and hint of boiled rice underneath that is not too alarming, the malt merely a dried plain cookie in descriptor and well hidden. All hops again in the mouth. Quite shy of the aroma it seems dulled, thinned for flavour. Aggressively piney in back like sucking on sawdust. Rubbery, plasticine-note is undeniable but late in effect. Bitter, grapefruit and blood orange, and floral, rose water notes otherwise fill it out and dominate. Quite creamy in texture, though the body is relatively light. Tangy fruit sweetness builds as it warms. Not quite together to be honest. My last sixer of ’Punk’ was the 6.0% and I dare say the big bro’ to this one. This one just tastes dull by comparison. One for the re-rate pile! (33cL, Batch 017, BB 17/01/13, Dan Murphy’s Currambine)
Golden yellow colour. Fruity and floral notes in the aroma with some faint pine as well. Sweet flavour with some good hop bite. Drying in the finish and slightly more bitter than the flavour
Birra biondo dorata con schiuma bianca. L’aroma e fruttato (arancia,pesca) e erbaceo. Il sapore è caratterizzato dall’amaro del luppolo che rimane ben impresso in bocca

330ml can from the LCBO.  Opened with hardly any hint of carbonation, but decent bubbling on pouring it into the pilsener flute.  Hazy somewhat light gold with a smallish fizzy slighly off-white head.  Smells crisp, grassy, a bit oily and has no alcohol presence at all - just light grass/grain and some slightly acidic herbal bitter character, maybe some resin. Taste - wow, very crisp and dry, nice biting grassy acidity, maybe a touch of lemon zest - nice carbonation, light  mouthfeel, with a very quick grassy, slightly earthy finish.  I like this quite a bit, I will be buying more cans of this.
Pours a golden colour, the aroma is nice, taste is hoppy and grainy, slightly dry with slight citrus on the palate

The best way to describe this beer is as perfectly balanced.  Their are certainly hopper IPAs and more complex beers, but this is really the best balance I have ever had in terms of hops-complexity-sweetness-bitterness-skunkiness-crispness.

4 finger beige head that sinks to 4mm, clear amber body. Nose: Oranges, clementines, butterscotch, star-fruit, lychee and passion-fruit. Aroma: Hay, clementines, oranges, butterscotch, star-fruit, mango, lychee and passion-fruit. Semi-long semi-bitter ending.
The head is ok, the colour orange-brown. The taste is fruity, malty and of course hoppy. Intensiv fruity hoppy. The aftertaste is ok but not that tasty like that before. Good! 11/12/12/11/11/12.

5/30//12- Pours a golden honey with an off white 1f head. Aromas of resinous, citrusy, and slightly skunky hops along with dry biscuity malts. Starts light with sparkling carbonation that scraps the palate clean for bitter and resinous hops. Finishes clean, with some nice sweetness at the very end, before a lingering bitterness. This is my first BrewDog and it's a good start. Interesting package and I would have it again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

floral, citrus, pale, clear, frothy, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium body, average carbonation, bitter, long finish. Great hoppy IPA, even if the ABV is rather low for beeing an IPA. But 5.6 is perfectly ok for me...

(330mL can from LCBO) Poured cool, a pale gold with a 2cm white head that dissipated quickly with lacing left behind. Aroma initially strongly of grapefruit juice and rind, but balanced out later with peach, light malt and a hint of pine. Flavour initially somewhat sweet, grapefruit and peach again, some red berries, crackers from the malt, becoming more bitter and a little acidic with grapefruit juice, flowery, very little pine, finish dry with grapefruit pith flavour. Body quite light, carbonation medium-high. This is thirst-quenching, a good but not mind-blowing IPA priced higher than domestic alternatives.
Bottle. Pours mostly clear golden with a medium white head. The aroma is citrus and peaches. The flavour is peaches, fresh fruit, caramel and light mango. Nice balance.
Starker Maracujaduft. Beginnt mit intensivem Maracujageschmack, der mittig an Bitterkeit zulegt, aber noch moderat wirkt. Der Abgang verstärkt die Bitternote und bietet trockene Zitrusnoten. Gefällt.

Pours blond with a frothy head. Leaves god tracing. Smells fruity, hoppy. floral. Tastes has hoppy bitters and some straw like field aftertaste that starts to shine about halfway through the beer. There’s a bit of an unpleasant sourness that gathers in my throat after a while, however. Kind of pasty, astringent. If it wasn’t for that I would have enjoyed this a lot more. Can from the lcbo.

From the can bought at LCBO, pours a clear gold with a big wispy white head. Aroma is weedy, citrusy towards grapefruit and pineapple. Bitter, very carbonated quick clean finish. Glad to see it on the shelves. Keep them coming LCBO!

impossibile cominciare dall’analisi visiva perche’ gia’ mentre si versa il profumo e’ davvero imponente e inebriante!
Il colore in ogni caso e’ giallo limpido e la schiuma praticamente assente.
Profumo come detto molto pungente, con punte di limone, coriandolo e zenzero appena accennato.
Sapore estremamente secco, come bere una pietra pomice. Una lama amara che trafigge le papille gustative e si apre in un amplesso di aromi e sfumature, una volta ripresi dallo shock iniziale!
Di certo una birra non facile, ma proprio per questo entremamente gratificante.
Solo per gente allenata!

Bottle) Pours clear golden with a creamy white head. The aroma holds grapefruit juice, pine, herbs, pineapples, mango, tangerine, peach, gooseberries and passion fruits up front with undertones of cat litter box, black currant tea, strawberries, grass and grapes.  Malt brings crackers, bread and hay.  Light, juicy and clean on the nose. The flavour is light sweet to dry, light to medium bitter and tiny acidic with notes of citrus, tropical fruits, herbs, pine, tea, touch of berries, crackers, hay and white bread. The mouthfeel is clean, tight and crisp with a medium carbonation. Juicy grapefruit, tart tropical fruits, herbs, pine and slim malt on the finish. Light to medium bodied.

330 ml can from the LCBO.  Deep golden pour with a frothy white head.  The nose is of fresh spicy/fruity hops.  Orange and grapefruit citrus with a touch of something tropical as well.  Nice crackery malts that lend just a touch of sweetness on the back of the palate.  It’s a nice IPA although I think this one has seen fresher days.  Good balance though - glad to see this one at the LCBO for the summer.
CBC. Light hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 110512

Mid golden yellow coloured beer with a frothy white head. Strong hoppy aroma, citrusy, floral and piney. Dry taste. Full hop flavour, piney then floral, elderflowers, then a strong citrus fruit flavour of orange peel and grapefruit. The hoppy flavour lasts right through the finish.

Small bottle. Slightly cloudy golden body, small head. Sweet floral hops in the aroma. Mouthfeel is a bit thin. Taste is mellow (not quite an "explosion") with fruity hops and medium bitterness. Very drinkable and sessionable, but too pricey for doing that here.

Bottle. Golden with a frothy head. Lovely aroma - mango, white grapes, lychee, peach, grapefruit and some pine. Man, I love those American hops! Unfortunately though, the taste does not live up to the aroma and in effect the beer happens to be quite a let-down, given the hype that surrounds it. Light, almost watery body, no substantial maltiness, the hops come across more floral-piney than tropical while drinking, and the bitterness is not really strong for an IPA. This is supposed to be rebelious but comes across rather tame. Good and solid but nothing more.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma if light malt, lots hops, tropical fruit, pine, citrus. Taste is malt, tropical fruit, peach, orange, pine, citrusly hops. Thin body, soft carbonation. 110512

Pours up gold with off white head and spotty lacing. The aroma offers up some roasted malts, earthy black tea notes and sort of a tart green garden salad sensation. The taste is fresh and crisp and delivers a pleasing spicy hoppiness up front followed by some modest malts and slight roasted maltiness. To midway a bit of earthiness mixes with the spicy hops and slight maltiness creating an interesting combination of flavors that works pretty well. All in all I like the taste of this new one more than the original as it seems fresher, crisper and just yummier.

Bottle in the sun @ Cin Cin, Oslo
Easily drinkable IPA.A bit citrus.To little hop for my taste.
Great citrus and floral aromas, with a light sweet and mid bitter flavour. Clear mid gold, with lacy head and a mid body. Good.

Bottled sample. Gold in colour with strong carbonation. Aromas are of pine sap and bark, along with faint tropical fruit and lemon zest. Surprisingly soft in the mouth with rich pale malt and pine sap flavours taking centre stage. There is a hint of mango and cut grass on the finish. Not very bitter for the style. Average at best.
33cl long kneck bottle! My first IPA and I loved it! Appearance: yellow/ orange blond beer, nice white head. Nose: Very hoppy, touch of grapefruits. Taste: Hops, citrus, grapefruit. Very good beer!

Clear amber with a crispy white head. Spectacular aroma that starts with pines and continues with refreshing yet acid fruit (reminds me of grapes and mango). It tastes less intense, but pleasant, malty and hoppy. I'd thought it would be overrated, but i enjoyed it a lot. Nice surprise :)

Bottle:
Small to medium white bead, disappears quick and leaves a frotty white island on top of a clear yellow orange colored beer.
Smell lots of resin, some citrus and pine and some typical hoppy flavours.
Taste is a nice hoppy fruit mix of exotic fruit, citrus, melon, peach, pine apple, some nice soft bitterness, cut grass, some malts/barleys, light fruity bitterness and some crispy herbs.
Aftertaste is a mix of hoppy fruits, hoppy bitter, hoppy herbs and hoppy sweat. Though the aftertaste is a nice mix of this, it is not as strong present as one would think it is.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel, medium to fuller body and a light creamy texture.
The aroma’s are harsher than the taste. Actually the taste is pretty soft and smooth and even a bit watery, but still very nice. Good beer.
Explosion of hops with strong pine notes and citrus, mainly grapefruit notes. Floral taste with spices over a lasting bitterness with a dry finish. Excellent.
Citrus and pine aromas.  Light citrus and pine flavors.  Overall a very good low ABV IPA.

A gold to copper coloured beer with a thin white head that mostly disappeared. Fruity aroma with notes of grape, citrus, kiwi. The taste is bitter with fruity notes, too. The grape from Nelson Sauvin hop is dominant. It’s delicious!

Bottle. Hazy orange beer with a huge white nead. Fruity-sweet aroma of light malts, citrus, lime, mango. Taste: Very sweet malty, very fruity, a little bland. Crisp, medium bitter hop fruity finish. Not as good as the previous 6 pct version. More an apa than an ipa.

Amazing beer. 
Rich citrusy and floral aroma and compatible taste, with just the right bitterness.
Color dorado pálido aroma a frutas tropicales. Perfecta cerveza calidad precio

33cl Can from De Bierkoning, straight from the can. Aroma of pungent hops, grapefruit, musty grapes, citrus, lychee, weed/dung. Flavour is light sweet, light malty, then loads of citrus, grapefruit, grapes come up, ending in a bitter hoppy finish with a little malty sweetness. Light bodied, oily mouthfeel. Great to see they have this in cans, this could make my festival summer a lot more interesting.

Draught at William K Kurvi, Helsinki, Finland.
Slightly cloudy golden colour with small white head.
Fruity hoppy aroma with mild bitterness, maltiness and some oxygen.
Flavour is more bitter with fruity hops, mild resiny notes, malt and mild sour notes. Very drinkable IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330mL bottle, pours a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is very floral hoppy, with some citrus and lightly backed by bready malts. Flavour is very subtle, more like a pale ale with some hop bite, with floral hops, grass, cracker malts, and a semi-sharp dry hop bite to finish. Seems less astringent than the original Punk IPA recipe from memory and weaker overall, despite the lower overall rating for this one. Nothing terribly exciting here.

Aromas interesantes aun que algo tenues. Se deja sentir sus lupulos y levaduras, y dejan también espacio para aromas que recuerdan frutas citricas y tropicales, principalmente mango y piña.
Color amarillo, ambar con cierta opacidad, cuerpo medio y corona ligera, burbujas fias y tenues y muy poca efervecencia.

Al probar, se encuentra una con una cerveza algo plana en pricnipio, con picor agradable en boca, el cual se incrementa intensamente.
Sin embargo, al dar el primer trago hacia la garganta, la majestuosidad de esta deliciosa cerveza aparece... Un intenso amargor hace precencia, sin embargo el sabor es redondo por lo que se degusta de maravilla esta verdadera IPA, no sin antes dejar paso fino a sabores tropicales, redondeando de maravilla el agradable sabor de esta magnifica escocesa.

En general una cerveza con un magnifico final, la cual se disfruta desde el principio, aumentando a cada sorbo el interes por descubrir sus secretos.
Light brown and a thin head. Hoppy and fruity aroma. Medium body. Light on the bitterness. It’s a nice and simple IPA.
peachy aroma. Some oranges, coriander, citrus. Clear yellow. medium bitterness. Nice palate for not such a big IPA. Overall a very good session IPA.

draft @ Moeder Lambic. 
Couleur dorée brumeuse, cop épais beige.
Après avoir essayé la version Hardcore peu avant, cette dernière reste dans les mêmes tons avec toujours ce bouquet très agréable de houblons allant du pin au notes agrumes tropicales. Le tout restant légèrement en dessous de la Hardcore. 
Le palais est toujours aussi somptueux, plein de saveurs houblonnées, fruitées avec juste ce qu’il faut de malt laissant des notes de caramel et de grillé.Avec ce volume, très facile à boire.

330ml bottle. Citric and hoppy aromas.Pours hazy bright golden. Nice white head, consistent and long-lasting. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Tastes so citric, with bitternes well balanced. Medium finish. Quite refreshing and easy to drink. Another nice brew from Brewdo that  won´t let you indifferent.

Apariencia: color naranja intenso con reflejos pajizos, completamente traslúcido, nada turbio, corona blanca, muy prominente al principio, no llega a desvanecerse del todo, pero si se atenúa. El carbónico es de una abundancia media. 
Aroma: bastante intenso, pino, resina y cítricos, sobre todo lima y limón, menos naranja. 
Sabor: intenso, en un primer momento es bastante amarga, pero no llega a ser astringente, al final se nota un puntito dulce, aunque es evidentemente seca. Refrescante, sabores a frutas exóticas, cítricos, zumo, pino, resina. Cuerpo medio, carbónico alto. Alcohol bien integrado.
This Brewdog IPA has a medium bitterness, fruity and grassy hops in my opinion.  Golden in color and okay white head.  Not my favorite IPA.

Bevuta alla spina, colore ambrato con scihuma di grana fine persistente. Al naso si presenta con un gran profumo di agrumi, arancio e pompelmo, in bocca un gran trionfo di agrumi che lasciano subito spazio ad un amaro importante e deciso che si protrae a lungo.
Bottle from Brewdog shop. Amber color, medium white head. Complex taste with caramel, pine, fruits and surprisingly low bitterness for an IPA. Very nice brew that I always keep in my beer stock.

21/11 0.33 l bottle, thanks ogivlado for sharing! It poured hazy orange body with medium sized head. Strange mild and sweetish aroma, caramel and tropical fruits. Flavor is pretty much similar, some hops are shown, but definitely wouldn’t think there are more blends, sugary, biscuity and bready notes are probably meant to balance it out, but they exaggerated a bit too much. Full bodied with long bready finish. Not bad for sure, a fine thing, but nothing you could expect in an IPA. Maybe they wanted to make such a stubborn punk...
33cl bottle - pours bright yellow with golden hints. Light head. Subtle nose of lemongrass, some peach, butterflower. Light body with a lively bitterness which makes is very drinkable.

(Draught at William K Kurvi, 20120422) The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had grapefruit, pine and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, grapefruit, pine, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste had fruitiness, malts, white bread and bitter. The bready finish spoiled the taste a bit but otherwise a very good brew.

33cl can from BrewDog Online Store, now 5.4%
Thin white head.  Slightly hazy blond pour.  Citrus aroma.  Grapefruit bitterness..

Amber orange colour with a bit of foamy white head. The taste and aroma are a showcase of how hops should be. Falls marginally behind the hardcore as the hardcore has a nice syrupy flavour from all the Maris otter grain. This is more refreshing though
The aroma is what I liked more in this beer, floral, citrus, and herbal. lacks body in my opinion, is a beginner IPA. But a good one, you can feel the English yeast and the balanced malt selection.

Grifo. Vaso de Pinta. Saboreada en agt´11. Tiene el color de la miel ambarina, algo velada. Espuma marfil y copiosa y algodonada corona. En nariz: notas florales, de hierba cortada y levadura. Los lúpulos se manifiestan con aromas cítricos y de pino que inundan todos los aromas. Un sabor tartárico de pomelo combinado con intensa malta biscuit proporcionan un complejo pero gentil amargor. Paladar seco. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Algo oleosa en el intermedio. Lúpulos amargos en el retrogusto. Muy Buena asimilación y una refrescante sensación. Maridaje perfecto con pollo frito y especiado. He bebido muchas veces en botella esta bien equilibrada y potente cerveza y la considero una de las buenas. Ahora, de grifo, la puedo llamar cañon pesado.
On-tap. Pint glass. Enjoyed on agt´11. Looks like amberish honey in color, chill haze. Off-white froth, rocky copious crown. Floral notes, cut grass, yeast to the nose. Hops are shown by overwhelm citric & piney aromas. Grapefruit tartiness combined with intense biscuit malts provides a complex but gentle bitter flavor. Dry mouthfeel . Medium body, moderate carbonation. Slightly buttery in the middle. Bitter hops on the aftertaste. Very easy drinkability & refreshing sensation. Perfect pairing with spicy fried chicken. Since I have enjoyed many times this  well balanced huge beer  on bottle I considered it a good one. Now, on-tap, I call her heavy gun.
Great one, Peachey in the nose, or that’s what I got. And after that, not that fruity in the mouth.
bottle - clear golden beer with a nice white head. Amazing citrus hops aroma! Flavour has a grapefruit touch and a heavy bitterness. Medium carbonation. Very nice beer!
Bottle from Brewdog shop. Clear golden colour with big head. Lot of hops in aroma, citrus, spices. Flavour is hops, bitter.
Golden hazy poor.  Aromatic, fruity, bitter and satisfying.  It has a lively, energetic taste I will be buying again
Frisk och fruktig IPA. Grape och tropisk frukt. Tydlig beska som gärna dröjer sig kvar.
Very good, refreashing, medium body IPA. Aroma of citrus and herbs. Nice amber colur with a white head. Quite bitter finish, but not that extreme. Would really recommend this one!

Love the witty labeling and cheeky humor from these fellas. This is a pretty full flavoured IPA, with extreme hop bitterness which although common in North America is a welcome addition to the UK craft brew market... this one is more available now (Waitrose supermarket, some nice bars) although most of the range is usually an online order job. Must get a case delivered.
Pours golden with crisp, sharp flavour. Small white head with a sharp citrus taste and long lasting heavy flavour. Highly enjoyable.
Pours crystal clear, golden blonde. Aromas of banana, pine nuts, orange, taste is orange pith, pine, a touch of dried sage. Not much malt or body behind it.

Opens with a pungent grapefruit & ctirus aroma, pours a not quite clear amber with a quickly reducing head. Taste is a strong citrus grapefruit with a  lingering bitterness. Very good beer, maybe a bit harsh but then it is called Punk.

Pours a light golden colour with a tall frothy white head. Aroma is quite fruity like passionfruit and sweet malt and hops. Taste is also fruity, citrus and grass leading to a (surprising for Brewdog) well balanced finish. Really nice IPA and much better than the old 6% version.

One of the few Brewdog lines commercially available in Australia. It pours a medium amber with a small head. Pine and apple are evident on the nose. The taste is fairly aggressive at first, with resinous hop bitterness dominating. As it goes on however, the astringency gives way to more rounded stone fruit and pine flavours. Very approachable IPA with a touch of elegance.

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours yellow with a small white head that quickly disappears leaving a little bit of lacing. Aroma is very citrusy with plenty of hops. Flavour is more of the same with plenty of citrusy hops and a slightly bitter finish. Body is slightly watery.
golden color with big white head. lots of citrus in the aroma, taste is very hoppy with a bunch of citrus and some exotic frutis, some pineapple. Really refreshing and just really solid IPA.

Bottle at home.
Clear yellow with a white head, nice lacings. Aroma light to medium malty (caramel), almost heavy hoppy (citrus, grape). Flavor light to medium sweet, almost heavy bitter, medium spicy. Medium body, crisp and refreshing.
Golden colour. Hoppy citrus grapefruit aroma and flavour. A bit bitter. A nice ipa

33 cl, bottled. Pours orange-yellow with a white head. Aroma: Malt, grapefruit, spruces, peach, bread. Taste: Medium sweet and bitter. Malty flavours. Hints of alcohol. Palate: Medium body, quite smooth. Pretty low carbonation. Nice one.
Lots of citrus, the extra hops stay with you long after the fruity flavors fade. Simple and pleasant on the nose, a little watery but the color gives you a good idea what you are in for.

Aroma: Fresh cream, fruity  like strawberries. Citrusy like hell.

Body: Medium and a bit creamy.

Taste: Very, very, very citrusy and intensely bitter. Plenty of exotic fruit flavors with a creamy quality.

Finish: Very long, very bitter and dry.

Overall: Absolutely top stuff. Fellow hop lovers, this one is for us.
Tap @ Beer O’Clock, in Bucharest. Pineapple, grapefruit, cranberries, wet wood chips and honey aroma. Medium carbonation and a bitter finish.

Bottled. Pours clear, golden with a with an average sized head. Fair lacings. Nose of grass and citrus. Sweet flavor with grape fruit, lemon, grass and resin notes. Medium bodied. Watery to creamy texture and soft carbonation. Great bitter finish.
Orange with a nice head. Hoppy and fruity aroma with notes of pineapple, citrus and orange. The flavour is nicely balanced - neither too aggresive in bitterness, nor boring. Well done!

Can @ home. Clear yellow to orange colour with a nice white head. Smells great. Hops, bitter, grapefruit, fresh.. Tastes very bitter, nice grapefruit taste, quite sharp, a bit soapy, flowers and refreshing. Even though the taste is quite overwhelming, the beer tastes slightly watery. Carbo is good.

First few sips: Great. A few sips later on it seems to lose taste a bit and gets more watery.. Which is a shame.

This most pedestrian and economical of the BrewDog’s line up has a profound aroma of pine and grapefruit. It packs the nasal punch of west coast double indias. It is bright orange and is the clearest IPA I can remember seeing. While the bitterness unit count may be moderate, I suspect the malt used is so mellow that the hops come across as dominant. It is sweet and floral, and yes, intensely bitter. Unfortunately the body is a little thin, with the weight and thickness of a typical pils...only with far more bite. A real dry out that is sure to induce heartburn.

Clear copper colour with a thin white lace. Rich syrup grapefruit hop and malt aroma. Grapefruit, fruit gum flavour. Bitter finish. Doesn’t quite hold all the way through but a very nice refreshing ale.
2012 - 03 - 19 330 ml bottle. orange golden colour. small white head. floral aroma. bitter taste. not realy my kind of beer...

330ml bottle [batch 489]. Cloudy golden colour with small to medium white head. Nice hop aroma has bitter, citrus and other fruit as well as piney notes. Taste picks up the same notes, nicely balanced on a light but withstanding malt basis. Very drinkable IPA.

clear brew having an amber colour and decent head. Aromas of hops, pine cones, and fruity lemon like aroma. It also has a malted presence and a hint of cedar or something woodsy that I can’t place. medium bodied brew, with more leafy hoppy bitterness and a slightly malted aftertaste. Improved!

330ml bottle from Sainsburys Golden amber with a ring of white head; pineapple aroma; tangy bitter tropical fruit flavour with peach and pasion fruit predominating; warming and sharply bitter finish. Very smooth and mellow, an excellent easy-drinking well-balanced IPA.

The bottle contradicts itself saying its both an IPA and a Pale Ale.  That’s fitting because its a bit of both.  Has the hop taste of an IPA but refresing like a pale ale.  Some nice pine and fruit taste in there too.  Good beer.

A fruity almost exotic aroma, poured from bottle a slightly hazy gold with a light head which persisted although thinned out. Tastes hoppy, pleasant bitterness, floral, with clove-like spicy hints. Presents an attractive contrast between its aroma and its taste. One to try and return to again.

Color oro con riflessi arancio e soffice schiuma bianca. Al naso colpisce inizialmente con forti note di luppolo, immediatamente rimpiazzate da frutti tropicali come ananas e mango, arricchiti da sentori erbacei. Il gusto è esattamente l’opposto: l’abboccato è mediamente dolce ed evolve velocemente verso un campo minato di luppoli amari e asciutti ma docili. Al palato è mediamente corposa e ben bilanciata, il finale astringente persiste a lungo. Gran bella IPA, gustosa e rinfrescante, un piacere per ogni occasione!

In short: A nice semi-dry pale fruity/piney IPA.

How: Bottle 330ml at Finnegans, Bergen Norway

The look: Moderately cloudy pale blonde body topped by a medium white head
 
In long: Pleasant strong hoppy nose showcasing bright notes of fresh clementines, pine tree and some exotic fruits.  Taste is full of doughy mixture of pale malts and yeast, dried fruits, fresh grapefruits, pine tree sawdust.  A bit sandy.  This finish is half-bitter half-dry.  Remains refreshing despite the relatively nourishing body.  Very nice IPA.  And today (march 11) marks my 7th year anniversary on ratebeer!!!  Has anything happened since 2005?  I’ve been kind of busy with this rating beers thing.
Orangish with a white head.  Hoppy, fruity aromas.  Bitter hops, grapefruit and zest favours.Preferred the original.

pours a slightly hazy gold with fruity hops on the nose, flavour isinstantly hops with plenty on stone fruit, and citrus with a nice earthy tone backed up by a strong malt backbone. hands down one of my favourite IPA’s.
skunky, citrus, floral, hay, amber, hazy, minimal head, white foam, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, astringent, bitter,
citrus, amber, cloudy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation,

The 6.0 % version of Punk IPA was one of the first IPAs I tried, and that was a pleasant experience, although it felt a bit thin and the flavour was somewhat one dimensional in its grapefruitness. Can a scaled down version, both in regards of alcohol and IBU, be any better? The body is beautiful hazy orange with a quite large, frothy, off-white head. The head rather quickly reduces to an irregular distribution of patches of foam, filmy remnants and big bubbles clinging to the walls, but at least these remnants are fully lasting. The aroma is absolutely stunning, extremely sweet fruity with peach, pineapple, mango, sweetish grapefruit and hints of strawberries. The taste is light to moderate sweet, and the bitterness is moderate plus, long fruity bitter finish. Perfectly balanced, it’s more mellow and gentle than the 6.0 % version, as far as I can recall. The flavours on the other hand are much more intense in this version: very fruity, again peach, grapefruit, mango and pineapple. Pleasant mouthfeel, smooth texture, medium carbonation and the body feels fuller than the 6.0 % version. All this in a mere 5.6 % ale? That’s clever brewing! 

[33 cl bottle, batch 396, enjoyed 6 months before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]
Nice golden colour with a slight haze. Not overly malted, medium bodied. Sprucy hop finish that grows on you in a hurry.

Bottle 33 cl from Boissons Service - Montagny (CH). Orangy beer with nice cream head, very small crackling, some laces on the glass. Aromas of tropical fruits, mango, pinneapple in syrup, perfumed hops. The taste is superb, fruity malt, apricot, mango and bitter orange, lined acidity. Immediatly followed by the bitter bite of citrus and resin. Dry finish, bitter, lond and pretty good.

Color dorado con cabeza de espuma blanca que desaparece rapido. Aroma citrico con mucho lupulo. Sabor a Mango y Albaricoque con el regusto amargo tipico del estilo. Una cerveza facil de tomar a diario!

Golden colour, firm white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, citrus peels, lively hops. Flavour sweet malty, bitter hop touches. Medium body, soft mouthfeel, hops and citrus in the finish.

(From 33cL bottle @ home)
Bottle. Pours pale orange with decent white head. Distinct hoppy aroma with citrus. Quite bitter flavour, very hoppy but ballanced. Medium body with long a bit dry aftertaste.

Bottle. Hazy medium golden, chalky bubbly head. Aroma is fresh citrus zest, very inviting. Lively fresh pink grapefruit and tangerine citrus hop character carry lightly sweet malts. Bitterness is just right. Mouthfeel is soft. I think I just found a new favourite session IPA....
I make such a mean... badass curry, that although this is a kickass beer it couldn’t quite cope with the cacophony of spices the curry was carrying.

330ml bottle. Pours a lightly hazed dark gold with average off-white head that leaves a little lace. Lots of fresh grapefruit and tangerine on the nose with a nice piny edge. There’s a faint caramel maltiness buried at the bottom. A touch less impressive on the palate with a hint of astringency that throws the bitterness off a little. Still with the grapefruit on the palate and some pine but some of the complexity of the nose is missing. All around a nice improvement over the 6% version.

33cl. Bottle. 

Pours clear yellow with white head. 

Aroma grapefruits, citrus, tropical fruits, hops, pine, resin. 

Taste awesome grapefruit bitter, fruity sweets. 

Mouth-feel thin, dry. 

Awesome beer.

0.33 L bottle from Vinmonopolet. A tall foamy, just off-white head, upon a slightly hazed pale orangey golden body.  Inviting tropical- and citrus fruity hop aroma. Some light floral and resinous tones, too. Taste is crisp and clean malty, with a superb hop profil. Fine citrus fruits for flavoring, tight and and clean hops for bittering. Citrus and tropical linger in a lasting finish. A  no-nonsense, rock solid classical IPA.

33 cl bottle @ Gastropub Praha. Batch #110, BBE 28.1.2011. Rated on 30.04.2011

Aroma has really nice hops with lots of exotic fruits. Flavour goes to the basics of IPA with lots of fruity hops. Grapefruits and some citrus in the finish. Refreshing IPA, much better than the old recipe.

Very weird thing. I like it’s smell, I like it’s first taste, but it leaves a funny but not definetly after taste in my mouth. Like a smell of a refrigator, or whatever. 
It’s very nice altough. You have to test is.

Bottled. Rated this very low after my first taste, but re-rated after enjoying my second bottle so much more a number of months later. Pours a light amber colour with a reasonable, long lasting, white head and a very slight haze. Strong aroma dominated by pine resin plus a little grapefruit. The grapefruit is even more evident in the mouth, and there’s a clean, dry pine finish. Kudos to BrewDog for creating a distinctive, unique pale ale. Serve chilled.

33cl bottle: Deliciously fresh and exotic hop aromas, mango, kiwi, white grapes. Orange-golden colour with a thick white head. Lovely balanced flavour, some muscatel grape and subtle maltiness with a lingering fruity bitterness. Can’t remember enough about the previous 6% version to compare the two, but I remember I liked it a lot too. Great, refreshing and easy-drinking IPA.

I cannot be impartial to this beer, as this is one of the reasons I got into craft beer drinking. This was my first encounter with Nelson Sauvin hops and to this day I smile every time I raise the glass to my mouth. This is a fresh, beautiful, balanced easily drinkable IPA with a great character. The hoppiness is massive, but not overwhelming, so that you can easily enjoy 3-4 pints (although I think the 2/3 pint is a better measure for drinking this).

33cl bottle. Poured golden color with a nice white head, lacing. Aroma is very fruity, with mango and grapefruit as well as citrusy notes. Flavor is pine, mango (tropical fruits) and some caramel. Finish is bitter. Great balance, very nice IPA.
bottled. bright golden with a minimal head; aroma of pine, grapefruit and a trace of green peppercorn; some butterscotch and raw sugar with some zesty bitterness; more good drinking from brewdog

Bottle, from Vinmonopolet. Clear, pale orange color. Nice, slightly fluffy head. Amazing hop aroma with sweet pineapple, peach, mango, caramel. Lots of citrusy hop flavors, pineapple, mango, a hint of nuts. Nice mouthfeel, rather lively carbonation. Slightly on the bitter side of the scale, with some background sweetness to balance it out. Quite wonderful!

Bottle 33 cl. A clear orange colour with a high, creamy, good lacing, off-white head. An aroma of malt, hops and citrus. The taste id heavy sweet and medium bitter. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a medium long duration.
A nice rounded ipa with good bitterness like grapefruit. Light amber in color with a white head.

Punk pours out a bright yellowish orange body with a finger of thick and sticky yellow head. Thick lines of sticky lacing and some carbonation in the body. Amazing nose with tons of tropical fruit notes and a nice grapefruit forward hop aroma. Not much of a malt noticed on the note. I love those Nelson Sauvin fruits. The taste is sweet and has a medium resinous smack. A bunch of tropical fruits and medium honey sweetness in the middle. The finish has a moderately well hopped bitterness and nice resinous. A medium body with a simply beautiful fruity, hoppy taste.

I compared this to the slightly higher ABV and older version of this brew. Lots of the similarities.  Grapefruit and a touch of resin in the aroma. Passion fruit, grassy bitterness, peaches. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Bitter medium-long duration. Slick body and sticky mouthfeel. Nicely bitter, but…. It seems a bit dumbed down. Why was the recipe changed? Are they trying to please the masses?  I think the 6% version was much better and bolder. A good IPA but why mess with a good thing?

Bottle, from my Maudite glass. I just discovered that Googlng "from my Maudite glass" brings up a very large number of my ratings. Turns out I’m generating some serious page views for Ratebeer right there. I can be paid in beer. Pours slightly hazy golden with a thin off-white head, short lived, with poor lacing. Nose is grapefruit and stonefruit, very peachy with some real honeydew/cantelope melon over tones. Some pine/spruce, but it’s beneath all the fruit, very appealing smelling brew.  Flavours are a bit on the watery side, more the mouthfeel of a Blonde Ale than an IPA, but I’m not really complaining - the malt in an IPA is merely the canvas, so the hops have somewhere to hang out.Flavours are again very melon focused - this is STRONGLY reminding me of Alpine’s Melonhead IPA, and considering that Alpine is my favourite brewery (though Melonhead isn’t my favourite of their beers) that bodes well for this. In the end, this is a very nice IPA, which DOES remind me of Melonhead, but Melonhead took all the components of this beer and expressed them better, which makes it a phenomenal IPA. This is a very, very, good IPA, and while it tickles all my fun parts in ALMOST the right way, it ultimately falls short. A very good IPA, just on the cusp of being great.

330ml brown bottle. Dark golden pour with a little haze. Cramy white cap with lots of sticky lacing. Nose has grapefruit, orange peel and other sweet citrus notes. Taste has upfront mix of citrus hops, grapefruit standing out the most, but some orange peels as well. A hint of pine, a bit of sweetness/malt richness. Good finishing bitterness. Citrusy aftertaste, pine and grapefruit linger, also a bit of fruitiness (Nelsons?). Medium bodied, decent carbonation. Nice blend of hops, great drinkability. Still a fan of this IPA.

Poured picture perfect clear amber with a nice two finger head. Impressive retention and spotty lacing. Aroma is appetizing citrus and pine. I get grapefruit and tangerine. Taste is supported by a nice malt base that adequately balances the hops. Speaking of hops they are the real star here. More grapefruit, tangerine and pine. A bit of a floral touch. Tastes superb. A nice bitter finish wraps things up. Glad this was a four pack because I can’t stop drinking this one.
Lata; Color dorado y espuma blanca y esponjosa, carbonatación bien integrada, predomina el lupulo, sabor y aromas muy citricos.
(bottle 09/02-2012) low white head, clear yellow color, good hoppy aroma, soft co2, good bitterness, fit body. BB date 18/12-2012, batch #562.

Keg @ BrewDog Camden. Golden color with a small white head. The nose is grassy, some dirt, light citrus. The taste is mildly bitter, malty sweet finish dominates. Active carbonation. Medium mouthfeel. An OK IPA, but not particularly one to remember.

Bottle from Nisa (formerly Pedmore Wines), Grange Road, Stourbridge. Cloudy, dirty orange - unusual.  Not much of a head but it did refuse to go away.  Smells strongly perfumed with grapefruit and watermelon.  Tastes slightly bitter but the tarte fruitiness dominates ahead of the slight hops.  Perhaps a little watery on the palate but full of character as you would expect from BrewDog.

33cl bottle at Alquitara. Golden beer with a creamy and white head with a moderate duration and nice lacework on the glass. Aroma is strong hoppy and slightly malty. Flavour is malty, fresh, moderate bittery, some frutal hints to citrics and peaches are present. Carbonation is low to medium. Body is medium. Texture is oily.
Doftar typ tropisk multivitamin juice..gott med andra ord. Välgjord bryggd i balans på alla sätt och vis. Slutsats: En förbannat BRA ipa.

pours nice clear golden amber. nice white head sits nice. still apperance with light carbonation bubbles rising. aroma is wonderful., fruity, tropical,banana all coming though, light mango. nice light hoppy mouth, light/medium carbonation brings out the bitter fruity finish.nice straight forward IPA, good abv for drinkability with a tropical twist!. a sure bet for a satisfying beer. will drinks many times again.

Bottle, 33cl.
Pours a clear gold with a white head.
Smells of pineapple, caramel and citrus.
Tastes a medium sweetness with a medium bitter, fruity (pineapple), but well balanced. Texture is oily. Medium bodied. Finishes with a pleasant bitter.

Che sorpresa! Mi sono sempre tenuto lontano dalle IPA che errore! La mia prima IPA e ho scoperto con piacere che l’amaro di questa birra non e’ cosi’ orribile anzi ci sta come sapore e mi piace da morire! Che birra!!! Apeena ne annusi l’odore vieni investito da aroma di pino, ul sapore poi non si presenta subito al palato ma dopo un po’ che la birra e’ scesa nello stomaco, il retrogusto e’ molto equilibrato e rimane una punta d’amaro. Una birra davvero rinrescante, da bere certamente con cibi piccanti! Me ne sono innamorato!!!

Flaske 0,33l fra Vinmonopolet, Tromsø Sentrum	. Batch 396. Lys gylden. Høyt luftig skum som varer lenge. Skummet fester seg til glasset. Sterk & god aroma av sitrus. Veldig innbydende. Myk munnfølelse. Lite kullsyre. Smaken er rimelig bitter med sitruspreg. Blir veldig tørr etterhvert. Godt øl men i bitreste laget.

Bottle. Deep golden color. Grapefruit, pineapple, citrus and mango in the aroma. Oily hops. Citric hopbitter flavor with grapefruit and pineapple. Thin, even a bit watery palate. Still a nice, firmly hopped ale.

Cerveza color ambar claro, con mediana cabeza que presenta regular retencion.

 En el aroma tiene notas citricas de lupulo, tambien se perciben notas de mango y maracuya, las cuales le dan un toque excelente.

Cerveza de cuerpo medio, con nivel medio de malta, nivel medio-alto de lupulo y carbonatacion media.

En cuanto al sabor, es probablemente la mejor IPA que he probado, las notas frutales de mango y maracuya descritas en el aroma se intensifican y forman un gran balance con las notas citricas y las notas de malta.
Absolutely gorgeous IPA, unique fruity flavours (passion fruit/grapefruit), very refreshing and a drink that immediately quenches your thirst

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet Tromsø Sentrum. Frothy white head that stays well. A slight haze to a golden body. Spotty lacework. Classic, inviting hoppy aroma with a good punch of grapefruits. Nectar and grapefruits in flavour supported by a twist of citrus shells and mid-sweet malts. Smooth, dry bitter ending. Well balanced. My overall score for the 6% version was 3.9 (Tromsø, 21.01.2012).
Draught@Berliner Bierböse 201. Had this beer some time ago, transferring data from  database before Januar 2012 I was using to rate beer. As I drink this again I will add a complete review.
Can from the Bierkoning. A baker’s dozen! Nose of citrus and honey. Taste is  lots of hops, some citrus and sweet flavours of pine and hops. Well done. Much smoother and creamier in a can! Respect.

Cloudy, fine bubbles and persistent foam. 
This lovely beer is a fruit basket full of citrus and passion fruit. This thiolic nose is completed by some resin and boxwood notes. The mouth is extra smoothy, lightly bitter, well balanced and refreshing.
This tasty IPA become one of my standards.
Thanks Scottish brewers !
Cheers !

Boom. Opened the bottle, poured the crystal clear golden liquid into the glass and felt the aroma...loads and loads of tropical fruit, some citrus and floral hints in the jam. The taste is bitter, though not strong as I expected, well rounded, with medium to soft carbonation. I could drink this as easily as I breathe. it leaves a nice and long fruity aftertaste. If I had a magic wand, I’d change all those boring Moretti on the supermarket shelves into Punk IPA. This is a good standard beer everyone could appreciate.

Tap. clear golden to orange colour, heavy smooth  head. aroma of heavy floral hops, citrus fruits (orange,grapefruit). taste medium to strong bitter, heavyli hoppy, light sour. Finish bitter, pleasant. Quite drinkable beer, very good one.

330cl bottle. Looks like a lager, all yellow-amber and frothy. Tastes nothing like I expected when I first tried this. This is the ale which dragged me kicking and screaming from the "lager drinkers" into the real world of real ales. For that reason I’ll always be indebted. Floral, grapefruits hops up your nostrils. Grapefruits, peaches and zests on your tongue. It’s bitter, but it doesn’t make your mouth purse - just enough to say "hello - I’m a real drink!".

I could, and have, drink this all session. And still want more. It’s lovely, buttery, moreish and the finish is mild and subtle but delicious.

Ruikt fris en fruitig, met name grapefruitig. Smaakt in het begin even naar grapefruit en dan komt er een droge bitterheid, nasmaak is weer citrusfruit.
Body is wat mager. Wel Ok,maar niet zo goed als de 7e hemel Hopla wat mij betreft.

Really like this one. Hop up front, but not "chew on elastics" bitter. Nice fruity backing... peach, maybe some melon, and also notes of almost butter. Medium creamy in the mouth with light carbonation. Good stuff.

Bottle from Morrisons. Quite clear pale blond colour with white frothy head. Aroma is hoppy, but not in your face. Bit of pine and bit of grass. Some fruit too, orange and peach nectar. Also some cereal maltiness in the background. Taste is subtle, touch of sweet maltiness and with a nice subtle but lasting bitter finish. Much prefer this newer version. Very pleased I can buy this for under £2 in Morrisons! Rerate: This newer version is nowhere near as nice. Won’t be having this again I think. Very twiggy. Can’t get the tropical fruit at all anymore.
