Tap at Mane Liquor. Pours deep orange with little to no head. Aroma is hop dominant - pine and citrus with sweet malts to back it. Taste replicates the aroma with a strong grapefruit finish. Average mouth feel. Don’t really see an improvement from the 5.6% ipa compared with the 6% ipa. Still an average beer at best
Bottle. Light copper colour with a thick white head. Nice hoppy aroma of fruits and citrus. Medium bitter finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Batch 478. BB 21-10-12, sampled on Dec 25, 2011
Clear golden color, medium sized off-white head. Huge, hoppy, fruity, pineapple, citrus scent, also malty sweet. Malty, bitter, hoppy taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.

Had this from a bottle, purchased in Sheffield’s very own dram shop. Vibrant yellow-gold colour with perhaps a slightly too-small and quick head. Quite a vibrant tart aroma, with a flavour that began quite bitter but soon developed into an overwhelmingly pleasant grapefruit. Long-lasting aftertaste, and overall a very pleasant and very drinkable IPA.

Jag har druckit denna vid andra tillfällen tidigare utan att ha recenserat den och jag vill påstå att jag upplevde den bättre då än jag gör nu, tyvärr. Aromen är fullständigt underbar och fruktig, smaken är också hyfsat fruktig men den dör snabbt och upplevs nästan som lite fadd och tunn. Märkligt nog tror jag att den blir lite bättre och framförallt bastantare desto djupare i flaskan jag tittar. Det vör givetvis också tilläggas att efterbeskan är ordentligt bitter och ljuvlig.

Keg at Brewdog. Gold with a white head. Decent hoppy aroma that has a hint of fruit. Flavour is bitter hops but with touches of grapefruit and orange. I think that the bottle version is better than the keg.
Liked the last one, like this one too! Maybe not quite as hoppy. This is my daily drinker.

Desde siempre la preferida, en la inauguraciòn fue el segundo barril a ser pinchado, color amarillo anaranjado de aspecto espeso, increible el contraste de aromas a pomelo del lupolo y a fruta amarilla, en boca es liguermente tostada y fresquisima con sabores iniciales  sobretodo a melocoton maduro y de retrogusto amargo persistente citrico, cuerpo lleno con carbonico medio y un finall largo y aromatico.
la cerveza de todos los dias a todas las horas

In bottiglia al Gradi Plato di Roma. Colore dorato, schiuma bianca persistente, al naso note agrumate, al palato secca e piena, amaro deciso e persistente, molto beverina. Da comprare a confezioni da sei.
Bottle: Balanced aroma, fruitiness, sweetness and hops. Notes of multivitamin juice and passion fruit. Flavor is light sweet (cough candy), fruity, notes of berries and herbal hops.

Can, from Sainsburys, Scunthorpe. Hazy gold, big fluffy sustained white head and good condition. Big hoppy nose with loads of resin, some cherry fruitiness and even a suggestion of Orval-like hopsack notes. Nicely sweet in the mouth but balanced by a building but restrained hop resin bitterness laced with peppery spiciness, and again i’m tempted to compare it to Orval, finish is long and bitter but never too bitter, with hopsack and a gentle sweet maltiness in a delicate balance.

Bottle from Bierzwerg web shop.  Hazy golden color with medium long-lasting white head. aroma of grapefruit, pines, floral hops. Taste, peach, grapefruit, tangerines, mango, pines. Nice long, fruity bitter finish. Nice IPA.

Bottle, possibly from Ogi’s package from the Slovenian Brewdog distributor. Shared with me and heavy obviously. As is every other beer I’ll be rating here today, so I’ll cut it out. Anyway, murky gold body, quite nice, medium thick white head that went away slowly. Kinda "fishy" (but somehow not in a bad way here) herbal/tropical fruit hop nose with a sweetish malty background. Sweetish maltiness balanced out by a nice tropical fruit hopiness, not too bitter (the 45 IBUs don’t surprise me), but nice. Some slightly tangy herbal notes. Actually I’d hoped, but didn’t expect it to be this good. Yay!

A vast improvement over the previous version. It pours a nice golden color with a decent head. Aroma is hoppy with lots of tropical fruit and citrus, and some pine tones. The hops are clearly there although not as present as in some more powerful IPA:s. Taste is very pleasant although not packing as much punch as some of the best out there. It’s very bitter for it’s ABV but obviously quite a distance behind the likes of e.g. Stone Ruination. It’s body is fairly light and in that respect a bit like an APA. I like IPA.s that are fuller bodied so that’s a quality I shouldn’t appreciate, but I actually like how refreshing and light it is. The finish is fairly long and very pleasant. For the price, a very nice IPA.

Pours a slightly hazy golden with medium, white head and lace. Aroma is a herbal hoppy with notes of peach and syrup. Softly carbonated, full bodied, oily texture with a dry finish. Taste is mildly sweet followed by a moderate bitterness. Girlfriend says: "It’s bitter but not too much."

Pours amber medium head
High amount of hops with citrus, bred and grapefruit
Palate starts very good and full. Ending quite good. Medium bitterness.
Taste of fudge, citrus and bread.
una delle mie birre preferite, davvero complimenti agli "scenziati" della brewdog :D

0.33l bottle. A revisit with one of the most legendary IPA’s I know of actually - only this time in a milder and kinder version. It pours a heavy clouded glowing straw-orange body with a nice big lasting and lacing just off-white head. The aroma is really hoppy with pine and also fruity with citrus, peaches, pineapple and some cortex. It has a average to lively carbonation level and a light oily mouthfeel. Flavors are of course hoppy with bitter-y and forrest-y both pine and pineapple with some light caramel. Yeah, could of course just be my imagination (or the fact that I haven’t tasted a punk IPA in almost a half year) but I think this is somewhat more kind and nicer than the "original" stuff. Ends bitterish, fruity and light mouthdrying. A good IPA without being really really great.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest.
Nagyon hasonlít a 6%-os testvéréhez, de az illata sokkal intenzívebb, gyümölcsösebb. Az íze is kicsit gyümölcsösebb, nem annyira intenzíven kesernyés és selymesebb. Nagyon kellemes és könnyen iható IPA, minden nap eltudnám viselni, de sajnos megint nem én nyertem a lottón...

Csak a jó sör, Budapest. Áttetsző halvány arany szín, tetején szép laza fehér habbal, mely egészen kitartó. Illata fantasztikusan intenzív, barack és mangó, és trópusi gyümölcsök illatfelhője tör fel, szinte megérinthető komlóözön. Íze ehhez képest nekem csalódás, jóval kevésbé gyümölcsös, de legalább brutál keserű és száraz, ahogy ezt egy jó IPA-tól már a magyar közönség is elvárja. Utóízében kevés maláta is kivehető. Közepesnél testesebb, élénken szénsavas és nagyon könnyen iható. Tetszett, de típusán belül nem nehéz jobbakra akadni.

changing my review, 5 years later.
Punk IPA tastes nothing like it used to. no hops, no kick. nothing. 
maybe its me, after all these beers i got used to it....maybe its the fact that they care more about their image than their products.

Appearance shows a cloudy orange color and a small white head that leaves a lacing.
Aroma is lively, fruity, moderately hoppy with notes of grapefruit, orange peel, pommegranate.
Flavor is initially bitter with some sweetness in the finish and aftertaste. Crisp, luscious and fruity.
Medium body, lively carbonated. 
A good, very drinkable european IPA only a little expensive for the chilean market.

0,33l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Golden clear colour with minimal white head. Citrus, resin, sweet hoppy aroma. Medium bitter taste. Medium body. Oily slick texture and average carbonation. Long hoppy fruity finish. It’s one of the best siple, not-dry-hopped IPAs I’ve ever drink. I reccomnd it for everybody, who like this style.

0,33 l bottle, Csakajósör, Budapest.

Pale golden beer with a nice froathy-foamy white head. Aroma of grapes and herbs, citrusses and grass, some pine, light malt in the background, some overriped cheese. Easy bodied one, nice light oily consistance, grass and pine, herb and citrusses, light malt. Very good IPA!

330ml bottle from IPB.

Appearance : Blond with small white head.


Aroma : Grapefruits with citrusy notes. Nice malt. Light passion fruits.


Taste : Grapefruit with citrusy and resinous notes. Lots of hops on the finish. Moderate bitterness. Nice malt on finish.


Overall : Nice one, quite drinkable with nice malt. nice hop profile too.

Vrij helder amberkleurig bier met redelijke witte kraag. Geur is sterk hoppig en erg lychee. Smaak is een goede combinatie tussen zoet, bitter en een beetje zuur met sinaasappel en lychee. Geeft het geheel een fijne frisse smaak.

Bouteille de 330 ml obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de mangue avec une pointe d’agrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde orangée voilée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence d’un micne col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de mangue avec une pointe d’ananas et de caramel. Longue durée de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence d’amertume d’houblons en arrière goût. (Rating #3988)
cloudy orange pour from a bottle. nice white head. aroma of citrus, some lemon and grain. tastes of citrus, caramel and malt. a lil malty on the end. good drinking.

After the pour there’s a nice smell of hobs and a bit of citrus. Very fresh. The beer pours from the bottle with a nice very light brown head of small bubbles. The colour is very light golden and clear - very lager-like. The taste starts of with a nice sweetness and the bitterness flushes over everything.- Maybe a slight hint of salt. Light body, fizzy and a nice bitter finish. I like hops and this is just in my  style. A beer I can always have another of and the one I  measure other IPA’s by. Hops for the win.
Trevlig doft - vår husipa - frisk, fruktig smak - lagom balans. Måste provas för de som inte har gjort det. En mycket len men trevlig ipa

cracking ipa full of tropical fruit and with a nice malt backbone very drinkable, damn good beer one of the first uk craft keg and can manufacturers, personally i prefer the cask with its creamy white head , medium body and mouth bursting hoppiness
Not very impressed, probably wouldn’t buy again. There is a big mix of hops that I didn’t find melded particularly well.  Not very bitter, Kinda of a Meh beer.

Thanks Slovaksniper!!! Pour hazy golden orange with white head decent lace. Aroma peaches, stone fruit, citrus fruit, lemon zest, caramel, sweet grain, tangerine. Taste cereal grain, fruity, caramel, citrus, stone fruits, nice bittering hops. MF medium body with nice carb. Good beer with a nice malty profile and well balanced by hops very easy drinking.
Bottle, really enjoyable, clean crisp taste, pleasant balanced aftertaste and great aroma
Draft, decent malt bill, there are some herbal notes going on, bittering hops and not much hop aroma and flavor. I like the herbal notes however.

Bottle. Aroma of floral and fruity hops. Grapefruit, passion fruit and sour apples. Golden colour, white head. Nice hoppy flavour. Again the grapefruit bitterness comes forward in a great way. Awesome IPA by Brewdog!!
bottle from cervezalandia. Golden and cloudy appearance with medium head. Lovely Peach/Passion fruit aroma. High bitterness yet OK!

Clear golden/amber body with a thin white head. No visible carbonation. Patchy lacing. Aroma of floral hops, passionfruit, cheese and peach. Flavour of grapefruit, orange and a minty finish. Thin to medium body with an oily texture. Light fizz. The beer that changed everything for me. It’s not the ultimate IPA I thought it was the first time I tried it, but it’s still a decent ’go to’ beer.
0,33 l can. This beer has a perfect heavy mouthfeel. pale yellow with big off white head. I just love it. Extremely delicious hops! It is near perfection.

lovely.
pours a deeeep gold. with tight white head.  bags of hop aroma in the nose, dominated by grapefruit. plenty of grapefruit in the mouth too, along with a pinch of passion fruit. and a strange sensation of eating the head of a match!  good bitter finish and oily with a soft carbonation



keg at Old Bell, Harrogate
Bel colore dorato nel bicchiere, con schiuma generosa. Al naso soprattutto agrumi e resina. In bocca è una ipa splendida, equilibrata, secca e pulita. Vorrei da bere...
Color dorado claro, bien fitrada y buena espuma, aromas a citricos y pino. Nelson Sauvin muy perceptible.ligera refrescante, una ipa para el dia a dia!
Bottle. Golden with small head. Hops, grass, fruits, citrus. Sustained finish.
Hazy golden ale, lasting white head. Hoppy aroma with notes of pine and some fruity fresh elements. Flavour dominated by hops, some underlying malty sweetness. Fruits?. Lasting bitter finish.
Bottle, pours clear amber with small white head. Aroma is floral, grass, fruity. Taste is medium bitterness. medium body, average carbonation.

Licht troebel amber bier met een flinke witte schuimkraag. Je ruikt eerst tropisch fruit, veel passievrucht, grapefruit, meloen en citrus. De smaak is een beetje zoet, flink bitter met veel passievrucht, citrus en grapefruit. Gekocht bij de AH.

This beer tells you to go balls deep or go home, and it challenges you to taste it, which is nice, I think it’s abrasive look and label and a bit of flavour to proceedings. A nice novelty when you show up to a house party with it and friends might read it, with the label basically slates macro brewing. But to the business. Aroma just burst from the bottle, deep citrus and an almost tropical punch smell, also a fragrant perfumey, flowery smell, maybe the harsher hop coming through. The taste is very, very deep citrus, like you just licked the business side of an orange peel. It’s complemented nicely by a bitterish follow through and after taste, heralding from the whole fact it’s an ale. The body is nice and thick, and shocked me as I expected it to be rather sweet and water upon smelling.
This is sessionable enough, and I strongly advise anyone that might like the citrus notes of a wheat beer and the bitterness of an ale to go out and pick up a bottle or two, a nice drink!
From can. Light amber colour with thin white head. Lots of citrus hop aroma. Quite fizzy with a sweet fruit finish.

33 cl can (5.4% ab).
The aroma and taste on this is just horrible, wet cardboard, barely no hops at all, bland. How could the have descended to these depths.
Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Rating: 7-4-7-4-15=37
Originally rated on 20110811.

Pours clear golden colour with small head. Aroma of hoppy fruits, grass, light malt and citrus. Flavour of crisp fruits, malts, dry hay and some toffee. Very well balanced brew with nice hoppy presence.

5314
Tap. Clowdy gold with a minimimal head. Aroma grass and herbs. Classic brewdog IPA. Not Bad.

Pours high carbonated light amber with a clear frothy head. Lovely aroma of tropical fruits (passion fruit) which carries through nicely into the taste. Probably the nicest aroma Ive ever had in a beer!! Taste is fruity and hoppy, balanced towards bitterness. Fairly clean finish, with a warmth of alcohol, and a nice mouthfeel. Negatives - Bit too bitter for me, and probably too much fizz (really gives your tongue a workout). Would suggest cooling this one down a bit too. Very good beer though.

This is nicer than the original recipe. Much softer, less harsh. A wonderful aroma! There is still a considerable bitterness there but it is what Americans might call ’smooth drinking’.  One of the most flavourful beers that can be found in British supermarkets. And for those unfortunate enough to be impoverished, not too expensive.
Bottle at home. Hazy golden pour, solid white head. Aroma full of floral and pine hops, tropical. Flavor is nice spicy bitter and very fruity hops. Long lingering finish. Nice brew.

Can. Pours golden yellow with a orange tone. Head is creamy white. Aroma is fantastic! Got mango, needle, pineapple, fruits and lots of hops. Flavor is quite bitter. Hopy and flowery. Palate is as first robust and medium big. Lite dry in the finish.

(33 cl, batch 207)  Le liquide a une robe orangée passablement embrouillée.  La tête mousseuse blanche s’évapore rapidement.  Au nez, sous un caramel timide, se cache des houblons fruités et quelques aiguilles de pin.  Les saveurs me rappellent beaucoup les pêches, les abricots et les oranges.  Le malt semble se plaire dans son second rôle.  En bouche, le liquide est moyennement rond avec un pétillement modéré et une texture huileuse.  La finale se fait sur des notes amères justement longues aux notes résineuses et bien fruitées.

Bouteille de 330ml. Batch 207. Bière blonde dorée avec une belle tête de mousse blanche et durable. Le nez est agréable, citronné, elle laisse présagé une belle structure de houblon. La bouche est ferme, la saveurs franches. L’amertume est bien présente en fin de bouche mais ne rend pas cette bière moins digeste. Un produit de qualité. 6/10

Slightly hazy amber with a big white head. Tropical fruit aroma. The taste is passionfruit and  citrus, some hints of malty sweetness, pine and grapefruit bitteness (that teeters on the edge of being harsh) in the finish. Smooth mouthfeel.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on October 6. Pours a rather clear pale amber. Head is fluffy and stays up for quite some time leaving traces on the glass as it disappears. Smell is very fresh and hoppy with grapefruit and lemon zest being the dominant smells. I can also detect some caramel, fresh peaches and resin. Taste is fresh and bitter with lots of pine and resin. there’s some fresh wood and orange zest too. Finish is rather dry, metallic and bitter.

Light amber good white head, stays with lacing, bubbles.
Grassy hop smell, typical IPA.
Crisp, nicely carbonated, medium bodied.
Grassy hops, with slight citrus malts.
Crisp refreshing beer, little lacking on breakthrough flavours.

Stort härligt skum, varifrån det doftar ljuvligt av sommarblommar, grapefrukt och citrus. Smakar aningen bittert, samt en del citrus. Eftersmaken är lång och det är som att ha en bit citronskumsgodis i munnen. Väldigt gott.

Bottle from Tescos. Pours orange/amber with a touch of haze. Nose is very nice fruity citrous, grapefruit and floral. Taste is a bit disappointing. Lacks enough hop kick and malt backbone. Has the citrous hop thing one expects from an American style IPA but feels like it’s lacking body and flavour.
We love this one in the nano keg (ie, cans), Has to be the best beer available in a can in Europe!

Can, bought from Wineways, Harrogate. Appearance - golden honey, very appealing. Pungent flowery, herby aromas leap out of the glass. The palate is satisfyingly "funky!" Again hop, herb and floral flavours. Dry and lingering on the finish. I like this - a lot!

on Tap @La Capsule, Lille, 5.4% alc.
Claque houblonnée, bière à la mousse blanche qui retombe vite, robe blonde/ ambrée, goût de houblon du début à la fin (notes chanvreuses, herbacées et citronnées), amertume puissante. Trés rafraîchissant.

----------

Rerate Juin 2015

L’ère industrielle est passée par là, ce que j’ai bu dernièrement n’a rien à voir avec ce qu’on a connu il y a quelques années, dommage ! En bouteille, c’était "bonbon et plastique". Bonbon pour le côté hyper arômatique du houblon (jusqu’à l’écoeurement, si bien que ça en devient lourd), l’amertume a disparu... Plastique car je lui ai trouvé un côté chimique très désagréable, la texture est vraiment devenue bizarre.
Une bière correcte à emporter en canette 33cl pour les festivals d’été, mais qui a clairement perdu de sa superbe.

Bottle. So BrewDog is scaling down their flagship, Punk IPA? Interesting. Let’s see: it pours a slightly hazy deep orange body with a medium, short-lived white head. Nose is loads of nice fruity hop tones: grapefruit, honey melon, kiwi and grassy hops with hints of pine and spruce. Lovely, classic American IPA notes indeed. Taste is a bit more mellow than the original version, with less aggro hop bitterness and more fruit: grapefruit, oranges, hints of kiwi and - surprisingly - litchi. Different, but not bad. Grassy, sharp hop bitterness manifests after a little while, but not nearly as aggressive as the earlier, stronger version. Lively carbonation on the verge of being too fizzy, but pulling it off just barely. All in all I like the new version a bit better than the old one, as I’m a fan of fruity IPAs more than the devilish bitter ones. A good thing this staple favorite wasn’t diluted beyond recognition; this one will keep going into my shopping basket on a regular basis (also due to its fairly low price; this is a "best buy" as far as IPAs on the Norwegian market goes...).

Hazy copper like with frothy white foam. Citric fruits like pineapple and grapefruit and hops in the aroma, some floral notes too. Medium to heavy bitterness, very light sweetness, light spiced, some malts ther too with the hopy feeeling and very refreshing. Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation and a nice dry bitter finish. Good one.
Not extremely, but very bitter, some tastes of citrus. Very nice on the palate and the finish is long lasting and bitter. Skunky hop aroma. Amber, sort of hazy. Appealing white head. (33 cl bottle)

What’s great: taste and aroma - fantastic hop flavour, soft and tropical. What’s bad : bottle is under carbonated giving it a bit of an oily taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden colored brew. Soft peach and citrus in the aroma. Some sweet maltyness, moderate bitterness, with a decent bitter finish. Tropical fuits in the flavor. Thin and carbonated. Still ok, but can be better.

Tap at Red Squirrel. Big floral hoppy nose and flavour. Not bitter. Quite nice but I preferred it before they changed it to suit mass appeal, Tesco and Sainsbury’s. Ironically, selling out their ideals in the name of big business is the only truly ’punk’ thing that Brewdog have ever done.
chiara buona schiuma buona persitenza naso luppolato fruttato agrumato in boccza corpo medio buona secchezza discreto amaro note luppolate media durata

Bottled. The aroma has peach, veggies. Clear, golden coloured with a white head. The taste has sweetish bitterness, hint of lavendel, veggies, some fruits. Bit watery, bit carbonated. Bit boring. Don’t get the punk part :P Make it more punk! :-)
Clear dark golden color with a average white head. Aroma is sweet,citrus,some peach. Has a fresh, crisp taste of tropical fruits,pine, peach, big bitter hop finish.

330ml bottle (anywhere, Tallinn) (6:3:5:2:10=2.5)

Simple sweet hoppy aroma. Nasty sticky crystal malt taste. Plasticky. Watery. Sticky palate. Generally not so pleasant.

Rerate of: 330ml bottle (Drink Baar, Tallinn) (7:3:7:4:14=3.5) 9/7/2011 

Lovely hoppy aroma, fun and fruity. Positive and uplifting. Fruity and almost perfumey, but not in a whorey way. Smooth palate, crisp carbonation, lovely bitter tingle has a crispening bite. Great balance, malts are nothing but the skeleto for this beer, but it’s a nice rigid one, and the hops hang off it beautifully. Fruity, and again fun. This is so drinkable. It’s definitely sessionable. The good thing about this beer is that it’s not big or clever, it’s just ("India") Pale Ale as it was supposed to be, and shame on the brewers who emasculated the formula. More like this, please, BrewDog.

Keg at Market Porter, London Bridge / Rake, London Bridge and Port Street Beer House, Manchester: Fantastic IPA, my favourite beer at the moment, bought 70 bottles from Tesco.  Great for a bottled beer as well as Keg. Watch out though it is dangerous on Keg.

Can at home, although have had many, many bottles as well and could probably not tell the difference.  Pale golden hazy beer with a moderate head.  Very prominent aroma of grapefruit and hints of caramel.  Fairly balanced taste with caramel malts giving way to lots of fruity and hops.  Absolutely delicious and one of my go-to beers.

330ml Bottle. Really good resinous piney hop aroma. Pale golden appearance, slightly hazy with a thin white head. Flavour is tropical fruit, especially mangoes and lychee, slight sweetness and a lot of citrusy lime. Carbonation is lively and theres a little creaminess in there. Like everyone says its a go to beer if there isn’t a lot of choice on the shelves. Overall its decent stuff.

Bottle. Yellow-gold body. White fluffy head. Citric hops, lemon, grass, juicy pale malt. Bittersweet. Very dry finish. 7 3 7 3 14 Draught: Thin white head. Clear gold body. Lots and lots of citric hops, pine, brown sugar. Bitter. Very dry finish. Excellent beer. 8 4 8 4 14 Bottle. Gold body, White head. Lychee fruit, grapefruit, hoppy, biscuity pale malt. Bitter. Dry, slightly dirty finish. 8 4 8 3 14

Pours rich orange with a light, white head. Great citrus aroma. Pine too. Flavor holds tons of pineapple and some milder malts. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Finish is decent, though the bitterness subsides quickly. Some short-lived resinous pine and tropical citrus. Good overall, but I wish the hops stuck around for a bit longer.

Bottled. A hazy dark golden beer with a huge yellowish head. The aroma has notes of fruits, lots of spices, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, limes, straw, and malt, leading to a bitter finish. Thanks joergen for sharing.

From a 330ml bottle on 29/8/2011. Pours a fairly clear, light golden colour with a big head. The first noticeable difference with its 6% predecessor is that it exhibits a more pronounced and lovely sweet fruity, honeyish aroma. The taste starts out with more sweet fruit - particularly passionfruit and some pineapple and mango - which is set off by a big dose of grapefruit. That said, on the bitterness front, this is noticeably more subdued than the original version (reflected in the lower IBU), but still packs a punch. While this is less full on and perhaps a little less distinctive than its older brother, it’s better balanced and more enjoyable. An improvement on what was already an excellent IPA.
golden with a white head - nice fruity hopyy aroma right away - some malt in the back but the most dominant flavour is of fruity hops and bitterness that goes into a nice lengthy finish - very nice

Cloudy pale. Small head. Nice IPA with a citrus and mineral character. Smooth with enough bitterness to balance a very slight sweetness. Full body but not overly heavy. Mild carbonation. Berry like fruitiness comes out as it warms. Nice, drinkable beer but nothing out of this world.
Nytt recept och dessutom på burk. Stor doft. Färskt trä, kåda, nyklippt gräs. Ganska torr grapig IPA som så här relativt färsk är riktigt bra. Bra beska. Ett bra öl har blivit bättre.
Tap at brewdog. Aroma of Nelson sauvin hops, grapefruit and grapes. Taste is citrus, lemon and grapefruit. Not bad

Bottle @ home. I’m almost positive that I had this late last year, so I’m not sure where my rating went, but oh well. Cloudy, golden yellow appearance with a fluffy, off-white head. Mild citrusy hoppy, toasty malty nose. Toasty, almost carmelized pale malty, earthy, fairly bitter hoppy flavor. Bitter aftertaste.

Absolutely on the mark as regards fruity hoppy aroma and taste, lots of grapefruit for me. The bonus is the creamy, silky mouth feel. Great beer. Don’t over chill, or else you get a slighty, rubbery/ fishy /rotten egg flavour as it warms up in the mouth. I made this mistake so you don’t have to. 23/04/2017: It’s gone from being a beer that needs seeking out, to 12 X 330ml  can fridge packs in Tesco’s: I’m sitting drinking a can now: Still a joy, and something of a "craft" benchmark: Surely approaching "National Treasure" status?
Very good India Pale Ale with a very interesting smell and flavour. Enjoyable.
Can. Pale gold colour with a fluffy white head. Beautiful tropical fruit hop aroma. Smooth, well bodied, malt base with a strong hop presence and medium-bitter finish. Very well balanced IPA.
From a bottle poured a straw color with a good amount of head.  Great citrusy hoppy flavor with a quick finish.

Sensations of citrus and elder. Light golden appearence with a white head. A fresh taste with medium bitterness with a hint of summer breeze. Smooth palate with a long finish. Overall a nice beer best served cold in a summers evening.

An orangey, mango like colour that is very slightly cloudy and settles with a pinky sized head that has good retention & some lacing as well.


A fruity mango aroma with hint of pine although not as strong as that from the bottled version. A very nice and appealing smell, one of the best from a beer so far.


Again very simliar to the smell with a nice mango and blended fruit flavour that is quite sweet. There is a mildy bitter aftertaste that finishes the drink off nicely.


Medium bodied and very smooth, a little creamy too. A nice combination.


Has a lot less bitter, more sweet/fruity flavour than the bottle version with mango being the main taste & smell in this version.



1001 Beers to Try Blog:

Bottle from Systembolaget. Golden beer with white head. Grassy and fruity hops on the nose. Taste is slightly sweet with nice bitterness from hops. Well balanced and much better than previous version.

Sample at the White Horse, Parsons Green, 28th Oct 2010 (Brewdog Abstrakt 04 launch). It was "Prototype Punk" back then and what an introduction it was. Magic nose of peach, pineapple, freshly-opened biscuits and summer flowers. In the mouth, lychee, kiwi, more pineapple and peaches. Tastes amazing. Great palate too. Not every can or bottle I have these days lives up to that initial tasting but this is a beer that should be a regular in any beer-lovers fridge. It is in mine.

Canned.  A darkish gold coloured beer with a chill haze, a white head and some lace.  A hoppy nose with citrus fruits and some farty malt.  A bitter hoppy taste.  Nice tropical fruits.  It’s good but not as bold as the 6% Punk was.  Score 3.6
Subsequent ratings scored 3.7, 3.7, 3.8, 3.8, 3.8, 3.9, 3.7, 3.7, 4.1, 3.9, 3.6, 3.8, 3.8, 4.2, 3.6, 3.8, 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.7 and 3.1. Average becomes 3.7

Bättre än det gamla receptet på 6,0%. Färgen lätt orange med ett vitt flyktigt skum. Doft av både citrus och tallbarr. En riktigt fin mix av olika typer av humlebeskor där ingen tar överhanden gör detta till en IPA som är lättdrucken och trevlig.
From a bottle in Hällefors. golden, frothy, clear, Nice aroma but too bitter for me.

Cask @ Angleterre, Helsinki.

Pours a hazy copper colour with a small, foamy, lacy head. Aroma of floral hops and citrus. Flavour of citrusy hops, pine needles, caramel and clove. Medium bodied with a smooth, fruity, bitter finish. Highly drinkable and an easily approachable IPA.
almost exploded when I opened it. lots of gas. aroma of passionfruit, with good balance of bitterness and sweetness. pale yellow, with white head and lace.pity some of it disappeared onto the floor.
Agradable cerveza de cuerpo medio con aromas de frutas tropicales,interesante combinación de lúpulos.notas de maris otter palida.Mucho mas interesante de barril.La recomiendo!!

Brasil Brau 2011. hop hop hop!!! Pale haz yellow color with a nice foamy head. Aroma is floral hoppy and some citrus hints. taste is bitter and dry, pour hop!! lovelly!! mouthfeel is hop hop hop... I like that!!

Boa cerveja - Brasil Braw 2011. Lúpulo no cheiro e sabor. Boa coloração e boa espuma. Amargor bastante presente no sabor e no retrogosto.

Nova analise no Burger Map - Lúpulo aromático e sabor forte de frutas - manga. Retrogosto amargo.

I’ve drunk a lot of this beer and only just getting around to rating it now. Bottle from Tesco.
Clear golden beer with small white head and fruity aroma of mango and lychee with some pine sap. Bitter with plenty of tropical fruit, like um bungo mixed with beer. Sweet finish.

17/1/12 bottle at home from brewdog online
Much the same as above with a hints of cats urine in the noise (-1aroma) and some lime juice in the taste (+1taste) Fruit salad jack finish
Nice beer citres taste and smell at first then a kinda earthy nettle taste and finishes with a big kick nice but prefer the 77lager
Draught @ Malja, Kuopio. (5,4% ABV version). Originally rated on 3.9.2010. Nice, quite well balanced and tasty IPA with a nice bitter finish.

11.07.16 bottle shared with jf hazy pale small white head. A: citrusy, grapefruit, pinnaple. F : light to med body finish is bitter and long O: nice ipa tottaly unbalanced on the hop side just like we like.
Golden yellow with a nice head. Smells of citrus, melon and peaches. The taste has a distinct citrustouch to it with a nice bitterness in the end. Very refreshing.

This new recipe is far better than the previous one. More fruity, less hoppy and bitter, this new Punk Ipa is a good beer. Freshy and easy drinkable. Aroma of grapefruit. Golden clear with a small white head. Taste of exotic fruit, leave a bit of bitterness in the end

2012-06-08, draught at Pibar, Lausanne, 8-5-7-4-15=39
Cloudy golden color. Nice fruity aroma, citrus fruits, oranges, some manure. Toffee flavor, sweetish and earthy, dirty, with some good fruity hopping; strong bitterness. Rough, but good after a sequence of bad beer that I had tonight.

2011-07-14, bottle, bb 17-05-12 (batch 207), 8-3-7-3-16=37
Blond color, hazy; medium sized head, quite compact. The aroma is pungent as it should be, from the Nelson Sauvin; passion fruit, lemon; and later some smell of Chinese cooking. The body is lean, the mouthfeel very dry; there is light flavor of malt and dry toffee, with a peculiar grass and hay edge; strong bitterness but without fruity components from the hop.
Because of the dryness and relative balance, it’s a great thirst-quencher.

2011-07-09, can, bb 11 Nov 11, 8-3-7-4-15=37
Cloudy deep blond color; generous frothy head. The first aroma impact if fruity, citrusy, tropical fruits; later it becomes more resiny and sweaty; in the end, a bit earthy and yeasty. Dry toffee flavor; the hopping is powerful, very oily and resiny, with a fairly good mix of tropical fruits; but the flavor is also unclean, probably due to the yeast. Long final, thirst quenching.
Very good, but in general the first version impressed me more.

2011-06-10, draught at Plan B, Copenhagen, 7-4-7-4-13=35
Hazy deep blond color; creamy head. The aroma is strong and very fruity but not penetrating like other times; the mouthfeel is soft but also weak, and it seems to terribly lack of malt (toffee) backbone; resiny and fruity hops, with a lot of passion fruit and some jam; chaotic tonight.
2/5 i mörkhet. Luktar väldigt humligt och friskt. Smakar humligt och väldigt besk med en kraftig besk eftersmak.

Bottle (33cl) Pours yellow with a white head. Initially with a nice floral hoppy aroma but then only the bitterness hops come through in the aroma. Body thin and waterish. Flavour is bitterness and for some reason not long lasting. I like IPAs, I like punk but in my opinion this beer is more attitude than inner content. Emperors new clothes so to say

Hazy light yellow/golden with a quite large with head. The new recipe for sure have made it better. A lot more aromatic hops with tonnes of tropical fruits and much sweeter than it’s predecessor. The ending is not as over the top bitter as before giving the beer a better balance. Altogether a massive improvement and a beer I’ll revisit frequently.

Bottle 33cl, a clear golden beer with good head. Nose is very lemony and hopy. The beer is a bit syrupy, full if hops flavors such as grapefruit, lemon, honey, resin, very nice aftertaste with dextrines, malt and long bitterness, very pleasant.

Bottle.Pours a clear, orange-golden with a small white/off-white head.
Hops, fruits and a floral note.
Mouthfeel is medium with a dry longlasting aftertaste.
This is the best IPA for the money (in Denmark never the less).
Great for anytime.

Light clear and orange-golden body. Big white head, as it should be. Fresh, floral hops in the aroma, together with grass, mild yeast and grapefruit. Starts fresh and fruity but quickly much more bitter and dry. Long dry aftertaste. Straightforward and full of bitter goodness. Very well brewed. Being punk is NOT doing something extreme or out of order; it is doing whatever you like yourself and don’t care about others. It’s exactly what this beer is. Love it. (33cl bottle, 2,25 EUR)

Tesco 4 pack 330ml. An all round excellent IPA. Fruity, fresh, pine and grapefruit to the fore. Palate is smooth and full-flavoured , great zesty finish and bursting with life. The go to beer on the Supermarket shelves of the UK....
Nose funky sweet floral slightly citrusy. taste very soft and balanced, creamy due quite low carbonation. Overall very balanced and soft english style IPA. Whats punk about that? Ok

Bottle at home.
Golden clear with a white head. Smells of citrus and cat piss. Body is much more malty than the prequel, also good sweetness.  Alot of hops in the finish. I find this version quite different than the old one.
Una gran IPA i més gran encara si tenim en compte la seva relació qualitat preu. Per beure’n tots els dies.

A beer that I would describe as perfect in terms of balance. Not too bitter or too sweet, not too strong nor too mild. An excellent choice to introduce the uninitiated into the world of "craft beer" or high quality beer.
33 cl bottle from Bert’s Bierhuis. Pours clear gold with a white head. Aroma is citrus and grass. Flavour is bitter with lots of citrus. Loving this one.

Had this is a vertical tasting with the original 6% Punk IPA, both in bottles. The original recipe is definitely my favourite!! This beer is a golden colour, darker than the original, with a thin white head. Lots of tropical fruits, passionfruit, mango on the nose with some hops and sweetness also in there. This beer is thinner but still quite fruity. Not nearly as oily as before. Also has that familiar 5AM Saint-like yeast character that I’m not a huge fan of. Doesn’t linger so much. Overall, still a decent beer but just not Punk IPA IMHO : )

Bottled. Golden coloured. Fluffy beige head. Flowers herbs light caramel spice in the aroma. Caramel flowers grass in the flavour. Medium bodied. S
Light grapy bitter end.
Draught, KØ11. Flowery hop aroma. Clear dark golden colour. Small white head. The flavour is sweetish and very bitter. Clean and rough bitterness. Sweeter than I remember.
Fine head, yellow and cloudy. Nice hoppy nose with fyr and grapefruit. Elegant! Fine body and some length. Taste is lightly bitter with hay, fur and grapefruit. Very easy drunk and yet tasteful.
tropical notes, both in the flavor an in the aroma, make this ipa unike, it reminds me the mexican beaches. Pineaple, Guaba and critrusy notes

Sampled at Texas Beerfest. Pours a cloudy orange gold with a small white head. The aroma is apricot and honey. Thick mouthfeel with a dry hop and yeast flavor with a nice dry finish. A good IPA from Brewdog.

330ml can.
Pours a medium straw, slightly hazy, white head.
Very hoppy aromas, grapefruit peel, spruce, passionfruit, malts, lemon.
Dry, medium bodied, medium bitterness, lively CO2.
Hoppy, floral taste, quite malty, grapefruit, spruce, lime peel, grass, nettles.
This version feels way more balanced and refreshing than the 6,0%. Me likes. (2011-06-10)

Can. Cloudy golden colour with a white head. Mango, pine and citrus, but with a strange lightly funky (almost bretty?) undertone. Less bitter and harsh than the previous version, but still not that good in my book.

Batch 213, bottle, awesome bitter aroma, nice hoppsfloral, grass, citrus, golden, clear, rocky head, frothy, very bitter, medium sweetness, good balanced, full body, slick feel, thick feel, very nice IPA

07/06/2011 330ml can. Pale ale abbastanza torbida, con buona schiuma color panna, abbastanza persistente. Al naso intenso aroma agrumato, fruttato (pesca, ananas) con spiccate note floreali. In bocca si dimostra equilibratissima, fruttata, dolciastra, amara ma morbida, assolutamente non invadente. Rispetto alla prima versione sembra meno "punk" e più equilibrata. Corpo medio, carbonazione corretta. Buonissima IPA, tra le più gradevoli da bere.

Draught@Plan B, Copenhagen. Slightly hazy amber colour with a small white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, caramel, some citrus and mild crisp maltyness. Flavour is very similar in a pleasant balance. Also had it a week after from a bottle from systembolaget, and the bottled one was much more harsh and lacked most of the tropical fruits.

Much better than the old version (which I never really liked). Nice bright yellow, citrusy, hoppy. Quite dry. Refreshing. Quite nicely balanced, but lacking something mind-blowing, I feel. Not that it’s not good, of course it is, but it lacks the sort of ’ta-dah!’ moment that I was expecting. IPA Is Dead Bramling X is still my go-to Brewdog IPA, nicer, crisper, hoppier than Punk.

Bottle. I like this new version of the Punk IPA, its cleaner and more drinkable compared to the first one. The strange aftertaste from the original version is gone. This one is a lot more fruity, with nice notes of mild grape and some lovely goosberries from the Nelson Sauvin. Medium bitterness. Quite "thin" for an IPA, but that makes it more drinkable. Nice summer beer.
clear yellow, smooth white head. bitter hoppy aroma. crisp hopy, flavor, sweet, malts, nice.
Bottled. Hazy deep golden, small head. Peachy grapefruit. Dryish with clean mouthfeel and light-medium body. Lots of salty grapefruit. Long bitterness.

Draught at The Local Taphouse (Sydney, Australia). Now this is my type of IPA. On tap, I could drink it all night. The balance is just right and combination of the US pine and NZ tropical fruit is spot on.

Pours a clear solid deep golden color with a full two finger creamy bright white head that sticks itself to everything on the way down. First pop of the cap I thought I smelled sewage coming from the bottle, but after I poured into my glass I couldn’t find that aroma again thank you jebus. The nose gives off lots of spicy pine, a hint of lemon, light caramel, sweet candied sugary malt with a bit of a grainy edge. The taste is bitter, pine and resinous bitterness consume and conquer every taste bud I can muster. Slightly sweet caramel and malt try their best to balance, but wither under the sword of the almighty Humulus. Relatively dry finish with a lingering resinous bitterness. Light to medium body, resinous, dry mouthfeel, medium level of carbonation. This is a decent IPA, I would have loved some more aroma hops personally as I think the aroma is bit lacking. No shortage of bitter hops in this brew.

Can. Hazy gold, large white head. Aroma is tropical, with strawberry bubblegum, gooseberry, grapefruit, grass clippings, cat’s piss. A little thin and lacking much malt presence let alone character but lacks the sweetness of the old version - an OK swap. Bitter finish is quite brief and after a while there is a touch of sweetness. Pretty good.

Can. Vibrant fruit aromas, no cat, some peach, pale malt is nice but barely registers. Maybe overclean, but refreshing and lively. Would like just a little more bitterness. [3.5]

Reliably good in cans. No great character from the malt side of things but vibrant hops and a fair bit lower in alcohol than more or less agreeable alternatives.

Can.

Golden orange with a large, fluffy white head. Fruity aroma with some notes of caramel. The taste was not as fruity as expected. Medium body and carbonation. Good but not excellent.

Bottle from SB cons 2011-05-26 Göteborg
AR: tropical  fruits (mango) - a bit rotten, butter, rasp berrizs
 AP: red golden,2 cm frothy, bone white head
F:  fruty, apricots, grape fruite dry finish

Tap, Cerveteca. Huge two fingers of white head; lighter hazy straw yellow. Grapefruity and a bit dank in the aroma.  Passion fruit, grapefruit, and seems much more aggressive than the previous version and definitely leans American. Slick body and softer carbonation, medium overall.  Nicely bitter, and fairly solid fresh.

Can from the Brew Dog Pub in Edinburgh. Pours a beautiful yellow gold with slight orange tone Nose is full of fruity hoppy notes. First sip is nice balance of hoppy bitterness and sweet malt. Finish is bitter but just right lingers nicely. These cans were unbelievably fresh.

330 ml. bottle from Superbrugsen. Golden yellow colour, slightly hazy, with a white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with citrus, grapefruit, grasses and fresh hops. Hoppy taste with notes of citrus, tropical fruits, grapefruits and fresh hops in a refreshing, bitter finish. Medium body and a nice, dry finish. A very drinkable beer, my favorite from Brewdog so far. Good price - taste ratio.

Draft @ Bishops Arms Gustav, Malmö. Pours a pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty peachy grapefruit aroma. Fruity malty grapefruit flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy peachy grapefruit finish.

Bottled:
Orangey amber colour with just a hint of cloudiness. Thick and lacing head. Resiny, citrusy hops on the nose. Flavour is grapefruit, orange peel and resiny hops followed by a long herbal bitterness. Very drinkable.

33 cl bottle, pours golden with a nice big white head, aroma of pine, fruit and caramel, taste follows the nose, smooth and fairly dry finish, very nice bitterness, very refreshing and enjoyable overall

Can. Tested against old 6% version. Dark golden with a large, creamy porous head leaving a lot of lacing. Huge hoppy aroma with peaches and citrus. Taste: fruit juice, peaches, citrus, lower (and more balanced) bitterness than the 6% version, some caramel. Pretty long finish with grapefruit. Really nice, fresh juicy hoppiness, very well balanced. This’ll be a great beer for summer barbecues.

Bottle from Tesco. Aroma is pine resin, little citrus. Golden, hazy appearance, white medium head, minimal lacing on glass. Aggressive resiny pine hops. Bitter and sweet in balance initially, then piney grassy bitterness rises in intensity, fruity piney complex hoppy flavour. Light to medium body, average carbonation (perfect for this beer). Bitter medium-long finish. Pleasant, smoother and far less astringent then the 6% version - this new 5.6% is much better....BTW I’ve had this cask before and it would get around 4.1

Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget, Stockholm. Poured hazy pale copper in colour with foamy white head. Lots of grassy and citrusy hops in aroma. Very fruity aroma over all. Pleasant grassy hops in flavour.
Fra flaske, dufter dejligt af humle....... flot let grumset gylden med hvidt skum.... smager super dejligt IPA! humle..... tør humlet eftersmag.....

Draught@O’Haras, Tampere

Slightly hazy orange color, small white head, lace. Exotic fruity nose with evident Nelson Sauvin. Medium-bodied. Grapefruit, sweetish exotic passion fruit and orange marmalade. Lingering fruity bitterness. Nice session beer.
aroma intenso di frutta tropicale sapore fruttato e resinoso,amaro intenso e resinoso
Bottle from Systembolaget. I have to say they have really improved Punk IPA with this new recipe. Lots of fruity hops and very easy to drink. I will be buying more of this during the summer.

12-MAY-2011, bottle in Fælledparken, From "Kvickly".
Huge almost white head on golden body with a slight orange hue.
Lovely fruity nose with some bitterness, grape fruit and pine.
Really much more fresh and fruity in taste than the earlier version.
I like this.

Can. Strange. Nose is a lovely tropical fruit salad. Passionfruit, Mango and Citrus fruits. It starts that way in the mouth with a soild body, but finishes with this funky cat piss taste. Now I don’t know what cat piss tastes like, but I imagine it’s similar to this. Otherwise would be my regular go to IPA here in Australia. Solid.

Pours pale amber with a small head.
Nose shows lots of hops with big piney, resinous, fruity and floral notes. Malt is not forgotten, with a huge caramel character.
Same story with the flavours, lots of piney, resinous hops and plenty of sweet malt.
Carbonation could be higher.

Can at Papsø.
Hazy golden coloured with a huge white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus peel and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, citrus peel and pine needleswith notes of grape fruits.
Dry hoppy fnish,

Can 33 cl. Courtesy of joergen. Pours a cloudy yellow with a huge and frothy white head leaving quite some lacework - amazing retention. Very citrusy and even herbal hop aroma. Medium body, low carbonation, sweet fruitiness with dusty and dry hops - almost astringent. A little late sweetness. 100511

Slightly unclear golden honey colored beer with a big fluffy head. Looks very inviting! Fantastic, fresh aromas of lychee, lemon curd, currants, pear and raw hops. Some cookieish malts are backing it all up. Bitterness is medium and it’s just amazingly drinkable, almost too drinkable actually.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Deep golden with a large, white head.
Loads of tropical fruits in the aroma; pine-apple and apricots mostly.
Piny citrus in the flavour. Fruity with grapes and pine-apple.
Medium bitterness.
Very intense aroma: resine, pine. Heavy bitter, but still fresh and quite malty.
Birra strepitosa! Più bilanciata della precedente e con una luppolatura più elegante. Birra meno alcolica di prima ma molto più ricca e complessa. Da bere a secchiate!!

Can 33 cl tasted @ Karhisma Birroteca (Piedimonte Matese, Caserta - Italy). Optimally smelling aroma, in which you could recognize surely Nelson and Simcoe hops: mango, pineapple, pink grapefruit, leaf, an amazing intense bouquet. Golden cloudy color with moderately well frothy white foam. Drinkability is almost at the top, malt are balanced and has no watery character. Fizzy but not annoying. Bitter citrus and floral finish, especially grapefruit. Very good IPA, a step upon other UK IPAs.

Bottle. Pale golden color with a nice white head. Fruity grassy aroma, pine apple, grapes, grass and some perfume notes. Hoppy flavor, metal, pine apples, grapes, grass and some perfume. Nice fruity and hoppy finish.

Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. So, this is the new version of one of my favourite IPA:s. Slightly shady deep golden, medium fluffy white head. Clear fresh tropical fruit hop aroma with oranges, gooseberries, apricots and pineapples. Light to medium bodied. Dry with moderate bitterness. So, the hop aroma is a bit fresher and pronounced, but I really miss the bitterness bit in the old punk. This is a (very good) APA in my book.

Bottle. Pours clear gold with white head. Aroma is immediately hoppy. Mainly catty with some tropical fruit (passionfruit, mango and peach) and somewhat herbal. Maybe a hint of onion peel too. Flavor is instantly hoppy, but more in the palate than in bitterness. The bitterness and flavor disappears briefly, then come back with som citric bitterness and light malt. Overall, it’s instantly hoppier than the previous version, but the catty onion aroma is off-putting. The flavor is simple and light-weight, not really true to stile. Well executed but simple.

Gloden coloured and a bit hazy. Has a white head, mostly to fully lasting. Heavy hoppy aroma, spicy, citrus, some sweet cerials too. Flavor is both sweet and bitter, not fully harmonic, but still nice. Dry, creamy texture. Soft carbonation.
nice hoppy aroma,golden, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Pale amber, white foam, a bit dirty/unfiltered.
Taste of hops, disappears into a tad to much bitterness.

Medium body, soft carbonation, medium finish. Stays a while in the back of the roof of the mouth though.

I want more flavour a longer finish from IPAs than this one.

Hazy light amber with a huge white head. Amazing hop aroma with peach, grass, orange, pine and simply fresh green hops. Fruity hop flavour with plenty of bitterness on a sweet, but light malty background. A bit chalky mouthfeel, probably from the bitterness

Bottle poured into a tulip glass.  Pours a light golden color with a thick white head.  Aromas of cities and bitter hops.  Body is medium with good carbonation.  Taste is citrus, lemon and a bit of malt to balance.  Overall a solid effort.
On tap at Patricks. Golden colour with an off-white head. aroma is sweet, fruit, grapefruit, apricot. Flavour is sweet, fruit, grapefruit, apricot, malt. Medium to full body. Nice beer.
Bottle. Slightly hazy golden with medium white head. Flavour is malt, citrus, floral, peach, hops and bitter.

Bottle, 33cl. Clear golden/amber with a creamy offwhite head. Sharp floral aroma with a zingy fruitiness: strong notes of pine and citrus zest, with hints of grapefruit, caramel and licorice. Medium bodied and creamy, with moderate carbonation. Lets the hop character overwhelm the malt base but not too much. Just a touch of a metallic aftertase. Very drinkable, but nothing special.
Bottle from Brugsen. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, citrus, peach, grapefruit and caramel.
(625ml bottle ) Had it canned too many times . Quality hoppy beer . Very dry ,bitter , aromatic , and just straight up good shit !

Can from Systembolaget.
Pours pale yellow with a creamy white head.
Sweet smoot and hoppy IPA, not as sharp as I remember the original punk.

Hop juice! Burst of tropical fruits, black currants, mango, passionfruit, citric, ripe oranges, sweet malts. Amber colour, medium creamy white head, lacing. Good bitterness, lots of tropical fruitsand black currants and lots of burnt rubber.. it’s subtle but after you have noticed it it is all you can think of.. 
mouthfeel is average. 
If it wouldn’t have been for the retro nasal action of burnt rubber this would have been great, but it completely spoils it for me, I prefer the original Punk.

Bottle 330ml.

Clear medium to dark yellow orange color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, dusty grass, orange - citrus, overripped orange - mandarin. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110413]
On Tap at Market Porter, London. Very aromatic with loads of fruity hops. Clear golden color. Some malt backbone with lots of hops, dry bitterness and very fruity from the hops.

Bottle 33 cl. amber with a big fluffy white head of good length. Aroma of hops, malt, grapefruit, with notes of exotic frugt.Smagen is refreshingly bitter hops with a taste of grapefruit. Aftertaste nice bitter, with a good long finish. All in all a nice refreshing IPA

330ml Can - Amber with a foamy head. Pine, passion fruit and grapefruit in the aroma. The taste is hoppy and crisp with notes of tangy grapefruit, pineapple and passion fruit. An impressive canned beer.
on tap al serpente.   decisamente migliore della prima versione.meno amara e piu equilibrata.

33 cl can from Systembolaget. Hazy golden body with amber hue and medium, frothy off-white head. Smells of fresh hops, citrus, grapefruit, soap, pine, tropical fruit (mango/lichee) and some light caramel malt. Huge improvement from the old version, this one smells wonderful! Taste is dry with medium bitterness. A bit to light bitterness for an IPA in my opinion. Medium bodied with aftertaste that lingers for a while and nice carbonation. Really an improvement from the old one, but not perfect... More bitterness, please!
Rating #2500. Cask @ Bon Accord, 5,4%. Dark golden-orange colour, off-white head. Aroma is hoppy, flowery, tropical fruits. Flavour is lpine hops, pineapple, creamy and juicy. Excellent.
The canned version. Really bright lemon taste to me. The Bitterness is medium but distinctive. Pours a light orange color. Nice carbonation level. Good session IPA.

Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Grapefruit notes. Heavy bitter very nice flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Excellent beer especially considering price. (apr. 2 euro).

Can@Home

Apperance: Golden orange witha huge, airy, head and lots of sticky lacing.

Aroma: Caramel, Citric notes, Tropical fruits, Hint of pine and malt.

Taste: Tropical fruits, Hint of marmalade, Peach, Hint of malt, Pine.

Palate: Clean, crisp and dry with a medium bitterness at the end. More balanced than the old recepie.

A very drinkable APA/IPA and pretty good one at that. I’d prefer a bit more agressive hopping but this will do nicely as a lighter hopfix during the warmer months.

CAN (!) from Systembolaget. The first can I have tried in quite a while, and fun that it is a Brewdog beer, one of my favourites. Aroma has a lot of citrus and grass, very hoppy. It pours a nice golden colour with a thick white foam. Taste is balanced, some sweet malt and a lot of bitterness in the aftertaste but not as aggressive as the previous edition. I miss the bitterness overload but this beer is indeed more balanced as most of the reviewers have stated. Mouthfeel is excellent, I will continue to buy this beer as a standard brew despite the new recipe. I love it.

1) 2x4 packs that were supposed to be my month’s supply, drank over the weekend, all out of the can. BrewDog bastards. Lowering the ABV and bitterness whilst upping the hop joy has makes this a devilishly sessionable little beast. I’ve even got my Dad on it. Smells of 1) geraniums, and 2) lychee-flavoured pop. I’ve been having sleepless nights for months worrying that the new Punk wouldn’t measure up to the old- if it ain’t broke, etc. Within the first second of having cracked the ringpull I’m not worried anymore; it’s a rasping, hop-sodden sack of lychee, lemon zest, strawberry chew and grapefruit swaying unsteadily over a fragile biscuit base. And it’s best out of the can, where the aroma is channelled into a mind-altering snort of multicoloured beauty. I don’t need to look at this beer or even taste it for it to make me happy. The hop freshness is extraordinary- you’ll laugh, but rub one of my homegrown Fuggles between your fingers and it conjures up the same lurid palate of pineapple, jellied orange, strawberry Chewit, green stems, blackcurrant....exactly like this beer does on the burp. There’s also something discreetly sexual, which I won’t elaborate on. Revolutionary stuff. 
2) 660ml bottle from Sainsbury’s. Lager gold capped with fine honeycombing white. Big aroma mingling all manner of guava, dragonfruit and earthy perfumed citrus. Fine, distinctly Transatlantic English taste with a surprisingly soft shortbread biscuit underbelly spread with mango jam and sprinkled with dried curry leaves. Really beautiful- scored it exactly right last time.

Tap at Cardinal. Creamy tanned film on cloudy golden body. Fruity, apricot, malty and sweaty on the nose. Sweet and bitter with notes of wood, malts and grass. Dry mouth. Medium body. Lively carbonation.
Bottle @ Kvickly, Odense. Pours dark unclear golden with a lasting creamy white head. Nose is fresh hops. Peach and grapefruit. Crisp, dry and hoppy flavor. Medium bodied. Ends dry and bitter. Nice
Bottle at home. Clear amber - big white head. Fruity, nice hoppy nose, bitterness, zesty, medium malty, dryness, citrus, abricot, grassy, piney, grape fruits. Nice.

Bottle, bought @ Kvickly, Vejle.

Hazy golden with a lovely, staying, creamy, white head. Lovely, elegant hoppy aroma. Pine, apricot, peach, resiny and some plant sap. Good crispy malty base. Highish carbonation, light creamy and lovely dry mouthfeel. Flavour has good fruity hops, peach and apricot. Some pine, good resin. Good, lingering, bitter finish. Classic, elegant IPÀ.

Bottle. Pours a clear yellow-lightorange with small head. Aromas of fresh hops, grass, and a bit fruity, I get some pineapple. Taste is slightly bitter, mild grapefruit, lemon, biscuits. Very nice mild IPA that is fully sessionable.

330ml can & bottles from Brewdog Online Store & Tesco. . Hazy light amber brown colour with a good head. Strong hoppy pine aroma. Dry hop flavour with a hint of biscuit. Quite sharp with a bitter aftertaste. Pretty good for a tin, bottle is even better. This beer is much better than the retired 6% version which I was fortunate to do a direct comparison with.

On tap @ Cardinal, Stavanger. RIP real Punk, hello Pop/Rock IPA. Loads of hops on the nose, but not as prominent on the palate. Pours golden with good white head. Loads of citrus taste, but not much bitterness. A refreshing brew but lacks the hop kick. As a hop head I long for more. The new recipe has been scaled down to underwhelming 45 IBUs. It’s still a good beer but more of a Pale Ale in my book.

Rating #505, bottle from Kvickly 
 


A golden beer as expected for an IPA, and a quite standard head. 
The aroma is very delicious with elderflower, strawberries and a lot of other mixed fruits and berries from these (cascade?) hops.  The only factor I miss to make this a perfect IPA-aroma is some tobacco-like notes that I have experienced in the real high IBU IPA’s. Taste is great and leans towards the aroma with fruits, berries, and especially because this a the same time is a rather sweet IPA, a candy drop-like taste from the hops. The finish has of course a nice bitterness, and I would have thought this contained more than 45 IBU. What really is the achilles heel of this beer is the palate. Not that it is directly bad, but I would have wished it much thicker or creamier. Nice carbonation, though.

3 Jan 2021, can. 
hop aroma smells and tastes unusual. kind of like hop oil? meh. 

21 March 2011 bottle.
pale yellow, slightly hazy, no bubbles.
great nose! notes of floral and grassy hops. big but not harsh. 
thin/med body and slightly fizzy. a bit too thin. 
nice taste. quite floral and soft vine fruity. hops are big and citrusy but not harsh. not quite as "punk" as the original but still a great beer.

330ml Bomber – Gravity Beer Market – Olympia, WA 

Amber in color with a thin head.  Good floral hops in the aroma.  The malt and hops where tasty grapefruit with a light tang in the finish.  Dry this was a very nice IPA.

330ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden orange body with a mostly lasting, creamy off-white head leaving a soapy lace. Resinous, herbal, NS aroma and juicy lychee aroma beneath. Dominated again on the tongue by herbal, NS hop flavours with some grapefruit and citrus finished by a resiny bitterness. Light to medium body, medium carbonation, relatively dry body with a decent length to the finish. Could have done with more malt body as it seemed a touch empty in the middle on the palate.
Bevuta in cask all’O Connor di Genova Quarto; si sente tantissimo il Nelson Sauvin, è diversa dalla versione precedente, meno amara e più bevibile, gran birra ma preferivo l’altra a essere sincero

On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, passion fruit and pine. Taste is nice bitter, citrus and those fruity additions. Ends really quick. Medium to full body. Smooth mouthfeel. A very refreshing beer, got that moreish feeling, a nice session beer.

Golden-yellow clear. Very pleasant nut-floral aroma. Well balanced light-sweet bitter hops. Broad bitter finish. One of the better low-alcoholic brewdog’s. Love the strong aromahops. Would Like to know the hops used in this fine brew.

(Draught at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, 9 March 2011) Golden yellow colour, slightly hazy, with frothy, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with citrus, grapefruit, grass and fresh hops. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of citrus, tropical fruit (lychée, pineapple), grapefruit and fresh hops in a refreshing, bitter finish. Medium body, fairly dry. Rather light malt character, mainly overshadowed by a generous hop presence. Very drinkable and very nice.

On gravity at the Three Tuns, Bristol 4/03/2011. Deep gold in colour with a slight white head. Pineapple and grapefruit aroma with some sweet malts. Flavour had more of the same with a dryish finish. Enjoyable, if lacking the depth of character found in some of the other beers tried on the same day.

Tap at Patricks, Kristiansand. Pours hazy copper with white head. aromas is citrus, grass brown sugar, caramel. Taste is light sweet, medium to very bitter. Medium body, thin to oily, soft carbonation. 23022011

On tap @ Patricks. Hazy orange body with a medium, stable off-white head. Fine and rather mild aroma of peaches, grapefruit and pine with just a hint of malt. Flavor is mild and soft malty, citric fruity, slightly spicy and moderate bitter. Medium body and medium bitter aftertaste. A refreshing beer with relatively moderate bitterness, soft malt feeling and moderate carbonating. Well made thirst-quencher.
The Punk IPA is a great beer to have while playing StarCraft. It is a good IPA, but I am not the biggest fan of the hopping of this one, leaving it more on the harsh side.

A - Pours a Clear golden brown, the color of a really dark piss. Great head that was soft and lasted the entire beer, leaving excellent lacing.

S - Very clear difference to the old Punk here. Bursting with fresh citrus, pine needles and hop flowers. Really a beautiful aroma.

T - Well hopped but not as much as the original, a nice bitter bite but not overly complex like the aroma would have indicated. All the elliments from the aroma but muted.

M/D - Incredibly smooth and light on the palette. the carbonation is perfect and I am not sure if this is from the can or the new recipe. Either way it’s excellent and I could keep drinking this all nice as the lack of bitterness keeps the palette clean.

Although I miss the heavier hop preseence in the older version, there is no denying that all other aspects of this beer are greatly improved now.

Draught @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand

Pours hazy amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt grape and pinny hops. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with a very wekk rounded finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

A solid, interesting beer, Punk IPA comes across as excellent homebrew, on account of the intense "new world" hop aroma, flavor, and bitterness, coupled with a surprisingly low gravity and ABV. This beer may come from Britain, but it is no British beer - the approach is 100% San Diego.

On tap at Patricks. A clear, dark golden beer with a small, diminishing off-white head leaving lacings. Citrus peel, pine cones, some cat pee and a nice peachyness in the aroma. Not much maltyness. The flavor has a nice bitterness in addition to the same citrus, pine cones and peach found in the aroma. Rather short finish, bitter, with peaches and pine cones. Medium body, smooth and nicely carbonated. A nice one indeed, refreshing and quenching. A beer one easily downs more than two glasses of. 110224
